name: Elk Store Winery and Distillery
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We went here both nights when visiting Fredericksburg for the weekend. It was the perfect spot to end our nights. The old fashions are TO DIE FOR!!!! My husband and I both left thinking they were the best we've ever had.   They have comfy couches, delicious cocktails, classy yet low key ambiance and incredible live music on the weekends. We will make sure we come by every time we are in town in the future. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: Hands down... my favorite place in Fredericksburg.  I'm not the biggest wine drinker so craft cocktails is a WINNER in my book.  Talented bartenders use their own distilled alcohol to make the most creative, unique and delicious drinks.

reviews.author: Analyssa S.
reviews.description: I came to this establishment for the first time yesterday, and I can't say I could have had a better time! The staff is very open and friendly. The environment is amazing. During the day, it's very chill with soothing jazz music, and very fun in the nighttime! A bartender named Cynthia was very lovely with everyone. She did her best to facilitate a good and fun environment while making sure everyone's needs were met, no matter how busy it was! The rest of the staff was also very lovely and helpful! Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a great time :-) Their pecan pie moonshine is also to die for!

reviews.author: Quel S.
reviews.description: Fun crowd! A lot of action! Very fun atmosphere and bar games. They have. Patio in the back

reviews.author: Fred G.
reviews.description: Very Rude and hateful staff. Was treated  like I was less than the dirt on their shoes. WILL NEVER SET FOOT IN THERE AGAIN.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Wow- such a unique place.  Fabulous craft cocktails - try the smoked old fashion.  Super service and live music!

reviews.author: Erica L.
reviews.description: Great little bar right on Main Street. Cool building and ambiance. The bartenders are super knowledgeable and friendly and can make anything you want if you tell them the types of things you like. Didn't eat here but the edibles menu looks great too.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: I'll start with the bad. The flavor of the alcohol in the cocktails is just off. There was a flavor I can't pinpoint. Husband said that they use the shine as the base in all their spirits then just flavor it to taste like rum, whiskey, gin, etc. I had a Diet Coke and whiskey to start which had the off flavor then switched to the shine and diet. Same weird flavor. Husband had the famed smoked old fashioned. He loves them normally but due to the off flavor, he didn't even finish it. The strange flavor reminded me of an old piece of charred wood. Not really what I wanted or liked in my whiskey or shine. Strange.  The good. The charcuterie was amazing! Amazing selection of meats and cheeses and a sprinkling of olives and almonds. ReAlly perfect for 2 for a light dinner. We also had the bread and olive oil plate which was to die for! Loved the herbs and such in the oil.  The place was packed! It was a Friday night and it was raining so to be expected though. We got in early enough to snag a nice seat on a sofa. Zero Covid precautions which didn't bother us. We are adults. We know the risk and assume any and all risks when we leave the house. But the off flavor in the spirits made this place a no go for us on future visits. Such a shame.

reviews.author: Taci M.
reviews.description: Going here for a wine tasting was good but DO NOT sign up for their wine club as it has been nothing but issues since. Was charged in Dec and never received the package, charged and quickly refunded in Jan for an unknown reason, and finally charged and actually received the shipment in Feb. Getting the guy who does memberships on the phone to discuss anything is nearly impossible and after speaking to him, I still never received the missing package. Every other wine club I joined while in town was a lot easier to deal with and I've had no issues. Save yourself the hassle and skip this one!  UPDATE: They still won't return my phone calls and I haven't been reimbursed or sent the missing package

reviews.author: Oscar S.
reviews.description: The best place in Fredericksburg Tx!!! Hands down the best !!! If you haven't been, you better.....tell them Oscar sent you...

reviews.author: Jason W.
reviews.description: The worst bar in Fredericksburg. DO NOT GO HERE. Rude staff, rude management.  I've owned a BandB here for 15 years and I don't want you to experience this place.  Never have I been so disrespected.

reviews.author: Brent W.
reviews.description: Ducked in for a quick drink. They have a peach and a pecan pie moonshine. The peach shine was the better of the two neat although the pecan pie was surprisingly amazing when mixed with lemonade. The place is busy but the bartenders turned orders pretty quickly. Only call out is that the drinks were very sugary; if you or your head are sensitive to that.

reviews.author: Sofia K.
reviews.description: Bad vibes all around. Came here for a glass of wine and felt very uncomfortable. Gentlemen at the bar helping me was very rude. Other reviewers have mentioned they felt discriminated against and I would believe that to be true. A previous reviewer mentioned they were called "wetbacks" when asked why they couldn't be served 45 mins before closing. As an Asian American I can't help but wonder if I would have been treated this way had I been white. Very unfortunate considering everyone else in town is super friendly and welcoming. Also this place has no precautions against Covid. My partner and I were told to take off our masks because "we don't wear those around here". Let's face it no one really likes wearing masks but that kind of attitude is uncalled for.

reviews.author: Dalton K.
reviews.description: This place had trash ass drinks they can't mix worth a shit. The place was cool had good music but the drinks make it so bad!

reviews.author: Caui M.
reviews.description: It was a good time. Jimena was very kind and knowledgeable. She gave some great wine recommendations as well as things to do around town! Will be going back.

reviews.author: Marlo K.
reviews.description: Really awesome atmosphere. Cool drinks and concepts! My lemonade drink was amazing! Definitely expensive though.

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: This is our favorite watering hole in Fredericksburg, an establishment we visit each time we are in town.  Our latest was for New Years Eve, a welcome refuge from the wet cold weather that prevailed.  There are actually two bar areas, the first seems to offer wines, and a second toward the rear which features their own distillery whiskies and such.  The atmosphere is definitely inviting, with muted lighting, with seating at the bars or at table with comfortable barrel chairs.  This time of the year, the mood was festive, with everyone of good holiday cheer.   Be prepared to strike up a conversation with locals or visitors, many of the latter bearing their recently purchased Main Street treasures.  The first time we visited, we met the owner of The Christmas Store, a Fredericksburg landmark, and passed the time listening to his history of this wonderful little town.  Notice, upon passing the first bar, a diminutive version of the famous "A Christmas Story" leg lamp..always a great conversation piece!   If you enjoy a good whiskey, these Elk Store offerings are quite remarkable.  My favorites are the Blended Whiskey, and the Charter:  both smooth on the palate, never harsh, and both aged in oak. To add a special treat, the ElK Store has one of the most talented mixologists/bartenders/distillers we have encountered.  This gentleman, Travis,  brings learned skill as well as pleasing theater while he prepares your drink.  To the point, one drink that has disappointed in my past experience, has been the Old Fashioned.  He challenged me to find fault with his version:  everyone at the bar watched while he flamed a citrus peel over his mix, then allowed this liquid gold to finish in a smoke chamber.  Well, he was correct:  his version was to die for.  Even so, he further wowed my girlfriend with his version of  Irish Coffee.  His people skills are exceptional, and it is no wonder many patrons prefer to sit at his bar during their visit.  All said, this is a terrific place to pass time, comforted in a cozy environment, thirsts slaked with satisfying libations.  We will definitely return.  Enjoy!!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Ask for Jett when you come in and tell him Jay sent you!  This is the best place in Fredericksburg to go after hours.  They have a muckin fits that's awesome but to be honest, the pecan tree is the best drink ever.   Jett makes the  best drinks and the food is also  very good.  When you are in fredericksburg, stop I'm and have a drink heree,  you will not be disappointing

reviews.author: Raechel T.
reviews.description: Finally!!!! I followed this place on Instagram for over a year and had been DYING to go.  I loved it and can't wait to go back.  Nia behind the bar was entertaining and made some dang good drinks.  We had the Nuckin Futz with espresso, Smoked Old Fashioned and the Lemonade with Pecan Pie Moonshine.  Sooooo good! We bought a candle and pecan pie moonshine.  I liked how it was darker inside and was a really great place to hang out.  There's a patio out back and a separate room for a larger group.

reviews.author: Carrie L.
reviews.description: The hospitality is out of this world!  Bartender (Travis) is fantastic and takes great pride in his work.  The smokey old fashioned is absolutely amazing!  Two bottles of whiskey to go and it makes for a great Wednesday afternoon.  Highly recommend a visit.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that. Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Highly, highly, highly recommend!  Planning to visit four wineries on a Sunday afternoon, I hired Vintage Car Service so we wouldn't have to worry about becoming safety hazards on the road. Prior to our visit, Josh offered advice on where to go. Lezli picked us up at our BandB right on schedule. We were impressed with her knowledge of the area and its wineries. She helped us rearrange our schedule a bit when our visit at one winery went longer than planned (that's on me - I tried to cram too much into an afternoon).  THIS is the way to do a wine tour. We will be regular customers when we return to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Jo Y.
reviews.description: Lezli and Josh gave the best service! Communication is great - prompt responses. This was our first time uses a car service in Fredericksburg and we had an amazing experience. They had suggested stops prior to the day and got an idea of our plans but they were totally flexible too, even offering to call ahead to a winery to see how busy they were in the moment. We had 6 people and we had plenty of room in a comfy and spotless car. Josh was johnny on the spot, carrying all our wine bags and more. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Susan M F.
reviews.description: Josh was a great tour guide, picture taker, wine enthusiast and all around nice guy.  We thoroughly enjoyed our day with him and the places we visited.  They can work with just about anything you may want to do and that's nice to know.  It's worth every penny to not have to stare at a GPS while trying to take in the sights and if you are doing the wine/distillery tasting, which we did. We will use them every time we go to Fredricksburg.

reviews.author: Holley M.
reviews.description: My mom and I went to Fredericksburg for a fall getaway. I was going to hire a shuttle tour of wineries. I discovered Vintage on Yelp. I'm so glad I did.   1) personalized service. Josh took us to 4 wineries personalized to our tastes. Your tour is likely going to be nothing like ours. If you want a distillery tour they can do that too.   2) new, clean vehicle.  My mom has mobility issues. Getting in and out of a shuttle isn't the easiest. We could relax in this SUV and she had no issues getting out of it.   3) private service. Josh was our photographer, tour guide and even purse holder for the day. He knows a lot about wine! At the end of our tour he brought in all of our wine! We could do things at our own puce.   4) the price was comparable to other services. The price does not include tastings but that is ok. Sometimes you just want a glass or two.   Overall, I would highly recommend this service!

reviews.author: Alyssa S.
reviews.description: This was the perfect service for a weekend get away with the girls! A safe alternative to driving around to wineries and our driver knew the best kept secrets of Fredericksburg. They were on time, polite, fun, and knew how to make a day of wine tasting feel like a 5 star experience!

reviews.author: Rachel V.
reviews.description: Great value, great service! The driver was so friendly and helpful, with water, coolers, good tips on wineries, and keeping us on schedule!

reviews.author: Elise L.
reviews.description: We had an absolutely amazing experience with Vintage Car Service. Lezli helped us arrange tastings at amazing wineries (Signor and French Connection), and Dena, our driver, made sure our entire day was seamless and super fun! She even gave outstanding recommendations for things to do the next day at our trip. We could not recommend this company enough and encourage you to book with them when your in town!

reviews.author: Jen V.
reviews.description: Josh and Vintage Car were absolutely the best way to tour wineries in Fredericksburg! Josh is polite, knowledgeable about the area and wines, prompt, and super easy to get along with. The car he drove was really nice and clean. He took some great pics of us during the tour, both staged and candid. Plus it was raining when we started, and he had umbrellas and did all he could to make it comfortable for us. I couldn't recommend this service enough. We'll def hire him again and rec to everyone. Thanks, Josh!!

reviews.author: Mitra C.
reviews.description: This was the best decision I could have made for a wine tour.  Lezli was so helpful and gave me tons of ideas for our itinerary.  Josh was the best driver.  So kind and personable.  He kept my mom and I on our schedule but never made it feel like we were being rushed.  Also, if we were enjoying more time at one place, he called to rearrange our other tasting times.  He had snack and water in the car.  The best part is we didn't have to worry about anything, which was a huge relief when you're suppose to drive from place to place AFTER drinking wine.  I'm going to plan another trip in a couple months with my husband and I will definitely call them again.

reviews.author: Aly A.
reviews.description: Highly recommend Vintage Car Service. Josh is very knowledgeable about wine and the best places to enjoy a good time in Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We didn't want to drive ourselves to the wineries, and didn't want to take the bus with a strict itinerary. Glad we heard about this new service. The driver took us to the few wineries we wanted to try but also suggested a couple of wineries we weren't aware of that were awesome! Very clean, new SUV, knowledgeable and friendly driver. Would use then again.

reviews.author: Matt N.
reviews.description: Had a spectacular time! This team was Great! Beautiful vehicles, impeccably clean, and friendly drivers got our group safely from winery to winery (and even provided night time transportation to Luckenbach). The drivers were flexible with our group and provided some custom solutions for a safe and fun weekend!   Awesome and friend drivers. Would definitely use again and recommend to others!

reviews.author: Nick A.
reviews.description: My wife and I celebrated our "mini-moon" in Fredericksburg.  We were lucky enough to have Vintage Car Service gifted to us by a family member.  Vintage Car Service made our mini-moon such a special experience.  We had enough time to explore four Vineyards, three of which were recommended by Josh.  Josh was a great driver, knowledgeable of Texas wine, and was a pleasure meeting.  The Volkswagen Atlas was very comfortable and a great ride.  We highly recommend Vintage Car Service if you are in Fredericksburg for any occasion and want to explore some new Vineyards without worrying about driving.

reviews.author: Lindsay F.
reviews.description: THIS IS A MUST WHEN WINE'ING IN FREDERICKSBURG!!! Everything from our amazing chauffeur, Josh, to the spacious and clean car, to the hidden gem wineries he shared with us, and the beyond polite and gentleman service of carrying our purchases to the car. This made our trip and we are already planning to use these services in the near future. Thank you so much for everything. Even the added professional photos which were a bonus surprise! Made us feel Famous in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Sonia N Casey G.
reviews.description: What a great day today with Josh!!  Thanks for making our day memorable and easy going.  We will definitely call you again!!!

reviews.author: Dan T.
reviews.description: Josh provided:  Great customer service.  Excellent knowledge of the wine country.  Feeling of comfort and confidence in driving skill and safety.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: My wife and I used Vintage Car Service for my wife's birthday.  We had Josh as our driver and we had an absolute blast. We were picked up on time and the car was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Josh met all of our demands and had some awesome suggestions of vineyards to try based on our tastes.  We ended up changing our schedule to fit in one of his suggestions and had an amazing time.  Overall, the experience was well worth the price and was great.  We will definitely be booking Vintage Car Service in the future, it is the best way to enjoy the wineries and not worry about drinking and driving.

reviews.author: Ziara H.
reviews.description: We had the best time on our wine tour with Josh! It was super easy to make a reservation, we told Josh a few of the places we wanted to stop and he made reservations for us in advance. Josh picked us up on time from our Airbnb, the car was spotless and we made a few adjustments to our itinerary along the way which Josh was super helpful with! Snacks and waters were provided in the car, which came in very handy between the wine stops! Josh took pictures for us and even mailed us the most amazing large postcard with our pictures from the trip. Great attention to detail from start to end! Will definitely make a reservation with Vintage Car Service next time we're in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Jorge U.
reviews.description: We had an awesome experience with Vintage Car Service! After a quick call to plan the trip out, Vintage took care of everything for us. They picked out some great tasting spots to suit the different tastes of everyone in our group. They called ahead and made reservations where needed and offered us lots of great tips along the way. Even with a little rain shower, our entire group had the best time and we felt like VIPs everywhere we went! Comfortable. Professional. Affordable. Worry-free. We can't wait to book our next Texas wine adventure with Vintage!

reviews.author: Brandon M.
reviews.description: We sent the kids with Grandma and headed out for some fun. Josh was our driver and he was awesome. Good people, great service, nice ride....I highly recommend !!

reviews.author: Alma B.
reviews.description: A friend recently was asking recommendations for wine tours in frederisksburg, which made me realize I forgot to post a review for our AMAZING tour during a girls trip April 2017. The service we received was beyond expectations. All the wineries we went we had quick service, we decided when we wanted to go to the next winery, they gave us each goodie bags filled with snacks and waters, annnd they recommended a delicious place to eat dinner afterwards and even dropped us off there.

reviews.author: Paige D.
reviews.description: Loved this tour.  My husband and I did a group tour.  My choices for the type of tour were many.  The guide was really great.  Organized.  Very attentive.  Great personality.  I felt really taken care of.  The special extras made the day!!  Next time I will add on one of the photo packages.

reviews.author: Alexia P.
reviews.description: Planned a surprise Bachelorette weekend for my close friend this past November.  Throwing a surprise weekend is stressful enough but Woody was SUPER accommodating especially for being so last minute.  There were many tours that I could've chosen to stick with but Woody was so authentic about his services and was a person of integrity when it came to what he offered.  He personally picked us up from our little hotel we were staying at and drove us to all three of our tours. His tour bus was super clean and we all had a blast! He even offered to pick up some cheese and snacks at the HEB close by to have on the bus if we wanted! I really appreciated Woody taking the time to answer my numerous phone calls with questions I had as this is my first Bachelorette party I threw.  I HIGHLY recommend using Woody if anyone wants to have a great time and looking for someone to trust. I will be booking with you again Woody, thank you so much for everything!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Woody was great, our party had a wonderful time touring Fredericksburg wineries with him and he was very knowledgable about the area and the vineyards.  He has deep contacts at each location and was able to get a very large group into locations that have restrictions due to COVID.  We would all use Woody again when we go back to visit the Texas wine country.  Book with Woody you won't regret it.  Thanks Woody!!!

reviews.author: Christy S.
reviews.description: Blake was our driver; amazing sweet considerate young man! Go to narrow path and arrowhead wineries

reviews.author: Colleen F.
reviews.description: Wow! There are so many choices for wine tours in Fredericksburg that it can be a bit overwhelming. If you come across Fredericksburg Uncorked Wine Tours, stop your search and make the booking.   Organizing a wine tour for 18 girls as part of a bachelorette party was a breeze with Woody, the owner/operator of Uncorked. He gave great advice, offered competitive pricing (especially for the expectant mothers/non-drinkers in our group), and was easy to communicate with. Woody was incredibly patient during the lead up to our tour, and then was a funny, gracious, and attentive guide during our wine tasting experience.   Our tour was fantastic from start to finish, and I can't recommend Woody and the rest of the Fredericksburg Uncorked team highly enough. All (18) of us had the greatest time!

reviews.author: Meggan G.
reviews.description: We had the perfect day with Woody on the Texas 2 Step tour. He kept in touch with us from our booking up until the morning of the tour. He was very friendly, informative and kept us entertained. We learned so much about the area, got recommendations on places to go and heard some great stories along the way! He also made sure to take plenty of photos for everyone in the group. I highly recommend using his services for a great tour of wine country!

reviews.author: Geno C.
reviews.description: Great tour. Great customer service. Will love to go again and stay away from the routine from work.

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: Woody is amazing! Best driver and tour guide we've ever had.  Super friendly and personable.  Makes sure everyone is having the best experience.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Woody was the best winery your host!! He took our group of 18 for a bachelorette party to three wineries and lunch was included. He took our pictures at each winery and also was very entertaining and extremely nice! He went out of his way to make sure we had a great time.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg twice on big girls trip, and woody was our guide both times - we won't ever go anywhere else! Book your tour, he picks you up and it's literally that easy!  Woody is very nice and knows Fredericksburg and the wineries so well. Don't go anywhere else!!

reviews.author: Julianne D.
reviews.description: Woody is the best guide ever! So accommodating, so nice, and very gracious. Such a great experience- he took such good care of us- I couldn't say enough great things!

reviews.author: Amy U.
reviews.description: This was an AMAZING experience!!! My husband and I are not about organized tours all that much, but this tour was not an organized group of people like a lot of tours are. He went out of his way to text us even before the tour and recommend places for us to go. We loved him so much we even hung out with him after the tour. He is an awesome tour guide and a blast to hangout with and knows anyone and everyone! Can't recommend this tour enough!

reviews.author: TC R.
reviews.description: Had an awesome day with my family and friends. Woody hit all the best spots and we got lit Woody is the man!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: I can't wait to get back to Fredricksburg and have Woody show me around! We had a large group of ladies and Woody took such great care of us. I would highly recommend his services to anyone heading to Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Woody was absolutely amazing , my boyfriend and I came into town Thursday 3/17/16 and I really wanted to find a tour for Friday . I called him Friday morning at 8:50 hoping I'd get a call back before the 10 am tour and I did ten min later and I was able to get on his first tour . I honestly called three or 4 more tours throughout the week and left messages and he is the only one that called me back. Not only did woody come through, he came through at the last minute when I thought We weren't going to make a tour.  He was funny , knowledgeable and overall a great guide. He even recommended a few things that weren't apart of the tour (Alamo Springs Cafe) which we ended up going to and was delicious.  Lunch was not included but the place we went to was pretty great for a sandwich . I'd hang out and grab a beer with woody any night !  Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday a good one !!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Woody was lovely and quickly became part of our group. He gave helpful insight into each winery and took so many pictures (patiently!) I wanted to dub him the class historian  Cannot recommend his services enough!

reviews.author: Sue F.
reviews.description: Woody is a funny,helpful, kind and an amazing guy. We were able to book one day in advance. He responded to my call right away and set us up with a 4 person private tour plus lunch. We all had a great time with lots of funny narratives. If you want to see a different side of Texas wineries, just call Woody. He will definitely hook you up.  What a great day with no worries.

reviews.author: Nelcy R.
reviews.description: Woody was nice at the beginning but there was miscommunication about lunch and he decided to take it upon himself to charge my credit card without my permission. I was upset and apparently he was too so he threw customer service out the window. I never agreed to Woody keeping my credit card information on file after he charged the wine tour for 11 girls (almost $1,300).   The driver Tommy was nice but he did nothing special and didn't know the basics of Woody's business. Had he known even a little bit about Uncorked Tours, there wouldn't have been confusion about lunch.   As far as the wine tour: William Chris and Lost Draw were my favorite wineries. Hye Market pretended we weren't there half of the time. Pontotoc was greedy with their pours.   Woody was very unprofessional and difficult to work with at the end. I would not recommend him. Book early to get the highest rated wine tours (2-3 months prior)!

reviews.author: Shannon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our wine tour with Bill! He was very knowledgeable and easy to talk to since the other half of our tour cancelled, so it was like a private tour for my boyfriend and I.  We really enjoyed the entire time and highly recommend booking a wine tour through Uncorked!

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time with Woody! We were on a bachelorette trip with 15 ladies, and had plenty of room. He picked up our sandwich platters at H-E-B that morning, and set up a little outdoor picnic for us at the second winery. The bus was top of the line, he was a lot of fun, and we would definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Natalie A.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour with Woody a few Sundays ago, and it was great! I tried to book for Saturday but the tour was full. I called the number provided on the website and had a great conversation with Woody. He set up the perfect private winery tour for me and my friends on Sunday, since Saturday was full. It was a really great and memorable experience and I would definitely consider doing it again! We had our own spacious limo that we could sip on wine we brought with us, as well as some we purchased at the wineries we visited, while driving from one vineyard to the next (drive time between each location was max. 15 minutes). Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour ‍

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: Awesome experience. D'ann was very helpful and recommend the best wineries in town. JP was a great tour guide. They both went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. Highly recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: So first....let me say that our group totally dropped the ball on planning.  We reached out to Carla 3-4 weeks before but did not confirm until the week of the wine tour.   By the grace of the "wine" Gods, Carla could fit us in her schedule!  She is completely open to letting you choose your places or you can follow her lead!   She picked us up at our accommodations which were several miles outside of Fredricksburg.  We did introductions and she laid out the things that were already scheduled for the day.  On our way to the first winery, we decided to "reroute" the tour to hit some lesser known spots.  TBH, we were excited for Carla's recommendations.    Our first stop was Six Shooter because of their variety of dry wines, sweet wines and meads.  You have to try the Jalapeno shooter!!!  SO GOOD!   Second, we made our tour time at Real Ale and did a beer tasting. Third, she realized the majority of our groups like Whiskey, so we stopped at Andalusia Whiskey in Blanco!  This place met the needs of our entire group (even the non-whiskey drinker) and was by far the most unique stop of their day!  If you go here, try the Cherry Cola cocktail!   We stopped for lunch at Pecan Street Brewing in Johnson City, where we drank lots of water and had really great food.   Our last stop of the tour was Zero815 Winery which had a cool mix of wines and friendly staff.   At the end of the day, Carla made sure that we made it back to our accommodations safe and sound.  We had the very best time and she knows some of the coolest places that you might miss without her expertise.  She was extremely professional and very down to earth.  She was always around to help with recommendations or just to snap photos of the group!     We highly recommend doing a tour with Carla and Texas Wine and Spirit Tours!   You won't be disappointed!   We'll be booking with her again the next time we are in the area!

reviews.author: Alejandra R.
reviews.description: I scheduled 2 group tours with Texan wine tours with more than 6 weeks in advance. The first tour was CANCELLED THE VERY SAME DAY we were supposed to go to the wineries. I traveled with a group of friends from Houston just to go visit the wineries  They also cancelled the second tour that was scheduled 2 weeks later. Our  weekend plan got ruined thanks to their lack of professionalism.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I forgot to review this! But we did our tour with Carla in October and she was fantastic! Highly recommend.  Sending some people your way!

reviews.author: Haley H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Carla and her touring company. Some girl friends and I came to Fredericksburg for a long weekend and did two back-to-back tours with her. The first tour on Friday was with another group and they had already decided to do wine so we were able to join in with them and had a blast touring the local wineries. She also took us to a local watering hole afterwards when we decided we all wanted to stay out for a bit longer. She was amazingly accommodating and super fun!! On Saturday we wanted to tour some distilleries and breweries and she helped us decide which ones were more along the atmosphere we were looking for. Carla is amazing and I can't recommend her enough!!

reviews.author: Stacey G.
reviews.description: I planned a bachelorette party for my best friend a few weeks ago. Leslee was amazing in setting up the perfect day for our group! She was always prompt in returning my emails and adjusting our itinerary to meet our needs. The weather wasn't the best the weekend of the tour, but Leslee made sure that we still had a fantastic time! I highly recommend D'vine Tours for a wonderful Hill Country experience!

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: We had a blast! Leslee, the tour guide, is great. She knows the town and the people. The van is the nicest I've been in.

reviews.author: Megan B.
reviews.description: My best friend and sister planned a weekend bachelorette party for me complete with a wine and art tour. The weather was pretty bad that morning, so we started a little late, but the van that they have is really, really nice, clean, and spacious. She even has a little stool in case you need help getting into the van, and she helps everyone get in and get out. We went to three places around the Johnson City area. The first one was a quick tasting, the second one we learned A LOT about wine and got a lesson in how to properly drink wine, and at the third winery we got the most interesting history lesson about President Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson from the winemaker himself. Leslee personally knows the places and owners and was just the best tour guide. One of the places on the tour where we were supposed to also eat dinner at cancelled due to the weather, but Leslee was quick to find a different place for us to go to. She took us to a cute cafe in downtown Johnson City where we ate a ridiculously good dinner. We even went to Leslee and her husband's bar at the end of the day for one last drink and got a chance to meet her sweet daughter as well. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Leslee and highly recommend D'Vine Tours!

reviews.author: Reine B.
reviews.description: My Husband and I had a wonderful day with Hartmann Wine Tours. We called very last minute and luckily, they were able to take us out on tour the  next day. Dennis planned the route and called and made reservations so that when we arrived to each winery a table was ready for us. Mid-tour we requested to stop at an additional winery, which Hartmann's gladly complied. They also picked us up from where we were staying and dropped us off there at the end of the tour.   We really enjoyed this tour because it was individualized and accommodating. We will definitely be using this business in the future and recommending them to our friends.  Our favorite vineyard was Narrow Path. Check it out!

reviews.author: Taylor G.
reviews.description: We have been to Fredericksburg many times and this was by far the best tour we have been on! Very accommodating and flexible to our needs, and knowledgeable about the town itself. I 100% recommend this company to everyone who wants to tour Fredericksburg! Will for sure book again in the future.

reviews.author: Uma R.
reviews.description: I was able to work with Dennis' company to hire a private driver. She was professional, flexible, and on time. Their price was very doable to have a private car who allowed my little dog to hang out with if he got tired. Definitely recommend using especially with covid!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: Dennis planned our tours and made reservations at the wineries.  We had wonderful seating with great views at exquisite wineries.  His wife Shelly did a wonderful job of driving us around and making us feel comfortable.  They went over and beyond what was expected of them and we will definitely be using them on future trips to Fredericksburg.  They did an amazing job for a great price.

reviews.author: Carolina B.
reviews.description: Great experience in Fredericksburg! Dennis helped plan the pre process to organize and prep our wine trip. He made reservations and got us a few discounts. Was nice to have the flexibility to do full tasing or a glass of wine. His wife was super nice and had great recommendations for wineries to go to. Thanks for a great weekend!

reviews.author: Tony L.
reviews.description: Shelly was an amazing tour guide and Dennis was very courteous, professional and made our 1st experience an amazing Friday. Shelly picked us up in her personal SUV and took us to 3 amazing wineries with gorgeous view of the country. I highly recommend to call them. Such an amazing 1st time experience!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: 5 stars across the board! I highly recommend riding this shuttle to visit different wineries on 290. The staff and drivers were so friendly and welcoming. The shuttles run consistently throughout the day. I don't think we ever waited longer than 5 minutes (if that ) for the shuttles. It is super easy to hop and off to your destination of choice. They make it so easy to store any merchandise You buy along the way. That wasn't my first time and it won't be our last! Thanks to all of the workers for making it a great experience.

reviews.author: Allyson A.
reviews.description: The pick up location is conveniently located and all the drivers were friendly. This is a good option if you are going to be drinking all day and have a large group. We came with a group of girls for a birthday party and it was helpful to have someone driving us from winery to winery. The shuttle goes to every stop so expect it to take awhile to get places. When decided to end the day at 4.0 which is on the far side of town. Being tired, it was a long and bumpy ride back with a full shuttle and having to stop at all the locations to see if anyone wanted to get off or see if anyone wanted on. We usually go by ourselves and drive our own car and are just responsible about making sure we are good to drive before leaving anywhere.

reviews.author: Fiona X.
reviews.description: It could have been a fantastic experience if there is no concerns for Covid-19. DON't BOOK the bus if you expect reasonable measures enforced to keep passengers safe. We were extremely uncomfortable the whole time while riding the bus.   First, the bus was operating at 100% capacity, there was no social distancing at all. We were asked to wear face masks when we boarded the bus but this rule was not enforced. Secondly, on the way back from the wineries, half of the people on the bus was not wearing face masks and the driver turned a blind eye. There was no reminder of wearing face mask or any attempt from the driver.   We were very disappointed at the almost nonexistent safety measures. We made a complaint to the staff after we returned, however the staff/owner didn't seem to care nor show interests in addressing our concerns. He told us they did the best they could and gave us a partial refund ( refunded $60 and we paid $89) which felt like he just wanted us to leave. They claim on the website that they follow social distancing guideline and require passengers to wear mask, which was false. Don't book this if you are cautious and don't want to put your and your family's health at risk!!!

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: I was impressed with how smoothly everything ran. When they said a shuttle will get you every 10 minutes, I didn't believe them. Surely there would be more of a wait, but no, no wait. There was almost always a shuttle. Everyone on the shuttle was very nice, and there's even a way to put packages on the shuttle and pick them up later. It was all very organized.

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: The shuttle was so easy, they drop off and pick up at all the wineries and ask the drivers are so friendly!

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Highly recommended! What a great way to visit multiple vineyards in and around Fredericksburg without having to worry about a thing! They offer two different routes and have shuttles running all day. For $30 a person, you can enjoy a carefree day of sipping and tasting, and not having to worry about driving. It's a hop on and off shuttle and shuttles arrive about every 10-15 min. at every stop along the route, all day, from 10am to 6pm on Saturdays. Great value! Great idea!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: We were so impressed by the friendly drivers and how accommodating they were. Since the morning was not very crowded, the drivers were willing/able to drop us off wherever we wanted on the route. Keep in mind that this shuttle only goes to a specific list of wineries, and therefore you will miss some of the other really great places along 290. And it's Saturdays only. But we knew that, and therefore used Friday to visit some other places on our own. Due to covid reopen rules, many wineries required reservations (book at least a week in advance!) and had limited capacity. By the late afternoon, each shuttle got pretty full. But we never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for a shuttle.

reviews.author: Sara C.
reviews.description: Great experience! They had a tent set up at the pick up point so you were sheltered if you had to wait a few minutes. We did not as there was a bus there when we walked up. Check-in was under a minute because we booked ahead.They keep all your purchases with tags for easy pickup at the end.  Drivers were friendly. We even had a flat tire on one of the buses, but none of us even knew it until we had pulled into the next stop and the driver informed us that he had a flat but had called for an empty bus that had pulled in behind him at the same stop. So, any of us that were going on, just had to get off and back on the empty shuttle.  Our favorite wineries were Becker (beautiful lawn) and Fat Ass (great live band and dancing area).

reviews.author: Randy M.
reviews.description: Awesome time on this tour!  We didn't hit maybe half of the wineries, but loved the service of having the bus waiting for us or within a few minutes of us being done at several wineries.  They have a great selection of wineries and some great wines at many of them.  Do not miss the chance to do this and at a great price.

reviews.author: Jessica S.
reviews.description: I'm confused why this has such good reviews, perhaps because the expectations are low. The shuttle does not come consistently at all, which makes this difficult. If not enough people are getting off at the winery you are at and want to be picked up from, you will not be able to get on if the shuttle is full.   The largest complaint, though, is that they let people pack on the shuttle when there are no seats near the end of the dat. Our shuttle home had about 6 drunk women standing in the middle of the aisle and they were falling all over everyone the entire time... not exactly a safe riding scenario. In addition, Stephanie was incredibly rude and inconsiderate upon our arrival home for the pickup of goods. If you care about customer service and reviews I would recommend reconsidering her employment.

reviews.author: Sabrina F.
reviews.description: 290 Wine Shuttle is really a no brainer for your trip to Fredericksburg. It's easy, convenient, and affordable.   For $30, enjoy a marathon wine-athon. True to their word, 290 shuttle stops by for pick-ups every 15 minutes. We never waited long, and even if some buses were full, another one was right behind it. They also offer a wine bottle check. Leave a labeled bottle with your driver, and it's available for pickup at the end of your day.   This was a girl's trip, but we plan to visit with boyfriends again this summer. We will definitely look into 290's private tours.   ***shoutout to our driver(s) for remaining pleasant, despite driving a bus full of wine-drunk women***

reviews.author: J J.
reviews.description: Had such a good time and met some grest people. Best part didnt have to worry about a dwi There was always a  bus when we were ready to leave a vineyard. Tips Barons Creek had one of the best wines Sweetbriar Rose is not a vineyard and the food is very basic (sandwiches) employees were very nice Fat Ass Winery had some of the worse wines I've ever tasted in my life - by this point you might be too drunk to think otherwise

reviews.author: Joseph L.
reviews.description: This is probably one of the best things to ever happen to wine country. I thought this was going to be a small, 7 bus fleet, but no, they have 24 buses and they transport around 700 people every Saturday. I had the best experience with the driver and I will never get around Fredericksburg any other way.  I left my phone in my seat when I was getting off the bus to go to Fiesta, and the driver walked the isles and made it a point to hold my phone for me. He even described me to the manager to ensure I was the right person picking up the phone.   If you're thinking about getting a ticket, stop thinking and swipe that card! 100% worth it.

reviews.author: Lynn N.
reviews.description: The 290 shuttle service was extremely convenient to use. The shuttles are spacious and clean and the drivers were all very sweet. My only qualm is the price - could be a little cheaper since the wineries are so close!   They pick you up right in front of the Pacific Museum on Main Street and then take you down 290, making a stop at selected wineries. They stop at most wineries on the route. There are several busses constantly running, so we never waited longer than 15 minute. Good if you anticipate on getting a little tipsy and don't want to deal with the hassle of driving and parking! They also have complimentary bottle service - you can check in wines that you have purchased and pick them up at the end of the day so you don't have to carry it around.   The only negative thing I have to say about this service is that they don't turn around. If you want to go to a winery that you've passed up or go back to a winery, you have to ride the complete route around.

reviews.author: Cody K.
reviews.description: If you are visiting the wineries in Fredericksburg, the only option is to take the 290 Wine Shuttle. The service picks up downtown and drops you back off at the end of the day. There is no reason to drive or take Uber because this is a great value.   The staff is outstanding and customer focused. The check in people made sure we fully understood the route, winery expectations, and the town. Our original shuttle driver got to know us, told us about his journey to Fredericksburg, and gave us recommendations on where to visit.   For $29.99 I would recommend booking a ticket because not only is it convenient but a fun experience. The shuttles pick up every 10 minutes and no need to worry about parking.

reviews.author: Kimbrea B.
reviews.description: Had a friend tell me she went to Wine Country and got a DUI. So we made SURE to be safe and hop on the shuttle and it was such a great decision. Easy to navigate, and hop on and off.

reviews.author: Ginger W.
reviews.description: My cousins and I did this as a day trip when we were in the area for a family reunion. The 290 Wine shuttle was great! The shuttles arrived at the winery very often so you can leave whenever you want and not be stuck at one place. Around 5:45 when they were doing their final pickup there was a line of people waiting but no big deal! Definitely will use them again!

reviews.author: Meg W.
reviews.description: What a great idea!! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to take a trip to Fredericksburg.  The drivers were all so incredibly kind!

reviews.author: Nicole S.
reviews.description: 5 stars for sure. Booked a shuttle for our friends bachelorette party to visit the local wineries. Our driver Pete was AMAZING. He was on time, very courteous, and over all a great driver. He provided water, helped us out of the shuttle at every stop. We had a really poor experience at one of the wineries due to a rude waitress staff, when we told Pete we wanted to leave, he quickly brought us over to Messina where we spent the rest of the afternoon.  5/5 stars for sure, if you book with the company, request Pete!

reviews.author: Lea B.
reviews.description: Last minute we were looking for an easy way to tour the winery's in Fredericksburg / Johnson City and luckily stumbled across 290 Wine Shuttle from a blog post.  The shuttle was perfectly located to downtown and we started off on our venture. I think the longest we waited in between wineries was 10 minutes. They take you to each winery and it is hop on / hop off for the entire times the wineries are open. They assured us they take count to make sure no one is left behind!  For the value and service I would highly recommend 290 Wine Shuttle!

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing day with Clint. While we only reserved the private transportation, he walked us into each winter and made sure we were greeted and that we were part of his group. Everyone knew him!   He had so many tips and was so kind. I will be using his company again, hopefully have him as our driver for another girls weekend. I cannot say enough good things.   Leading up to this weekend I was researching several private transportation companies. One of them had hidden costs. Cellar Rat was very quick to answer my questions and seemed very straightforward with their pricing. That is why I booked with them and I'm really glad I made that choice.

reviews.author: Charles P.
reviews.description: We had a phenomenal time on the tour for our family trip (6 people). Cadye was really helpful getting everything all set up on the front end; Clint's phenomenal positive energy, incredible industry knowledge, and evident rapport with all of of the wineries/vintners made the trip incredibly enjoyable.  Can't imagine doing a wine tour with anyone else.

reviews.author: Megan W.
reviews.description: Just went on this wine tour for my first time in Fredericksburg this past weekend. 10/10! The service, the tour guide, the locations/ connections they have! Amazing! Would not pick any other wine tour!! Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Alison H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Clint and Cayde and Rat Cellar Wine tours! If you're looking for options during the pandemic, contact them! Cayde was very informative, professional, and has been staying up-to-date with all the current laws with the changing issues in the pandemic. But the moment your tour starts, Clint takes away all your worries and concerns, and created a fun atmosphere filled with lots of knowledge and wine tasting! If you're looking for a sommelier who knows his stuff, Clint is your guy! If you want your sommelier to not be pretentious, again, Clint is your guy! I would highly recommend them to anyone who does not know Fredericksburg, and anyone from novice level to expert level of wine expertise. We made awesome memories thanks to Rat Cellar, and would use them again in a heartbeat!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THEM! From the beginning Cayde was a great help with booking and recommending different places and atmospheres. We were looking for a mixture of red and white wines as well as making a stop at a brewery. As this trip was taken to relax a bit we opted to go a more relaxing atmosephere. The three stops that we made were great and weren't typical touristy places which made it even better. Chris was our tour guide and he was awesome!! He gave us recommendations of where to eat, information about the areas, and overall was very personable! We couldn't have asked for a better tour guide, he took all of our bags back to the car, he mentioned that he had umbrellas just in case, and was great about letting us know that he was on his way and that there was a little delay. This company isn't like others, they listen to what you are looking for in the experience and there were no problems! Chris even found our airbnb that was a bit off the beaten path. I would book with them again!

reviews.author: Kate I.
reviews.description: Updated Review: We just celebrated our 2nd Anniversary and our 2nd trip out to Fredericksburg with Cellar Rat Wine Tours hosting our tastings. We love these guys more than ever after going out with Clem for a tour of William Chris, Pecan St Brewery, Hye Rum, and Pedernales.   Clem was a fantastic host for the day! With several years in the Industry and a passion for wine making, we received the red carpet experience! We once again had a great time touring and learning from an expert. They will tell you as much, or as little, as you want to know - but make no mistake, these guys know what they're talking about!  Book your wine tours with Cellar Rat, you'll be in great hands!

reviews.author: Danielle B.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience! We highly recommend booking with Cellar Rat for any of your wine tours. Clint, our guide, was a blast. He was so accommodating and knowledgeable. We will definitely use them again. Thank you Cellar Rat for making my birthday awesome!

reviews.author: Rhonda D.
reviews.description: Cellar Rat went above and beyond our expectations during our tour of Texas Wine Country. You want the best money can buy...then here it is. Clint's knowledge of wine-Texas wine in particular is mind boggling! The entire experience was perfect...booking, picked us up in time, the perfect wineries, lunch....everything! Cellar Rat will not disappoint and I can say that with confidence!

reviews.author: Hannah M.
reviews.description: Chris was AMAZING! He went above and beyond to make sure our bride to be had the best day. Incredibly knowledgeable and so fun!

reviews.author: Angela C.
reviews.description: A group of girlfriends and I came to Fredericksburg for a bachelorette party and chose to do wine tours with Cellar Rat... BEST decision! Clem was our guide and we can't say enough good things about him! It was such a fun, convenient way to see multiple wineries without having to think about anything. Clem was so knowledgeable and awesome! Truly had a blast and all the wine and food we had were delicious! Couldn't recommend this company more!

reviews.author: Karis J.
reviews.description: I had my bachelorette party this weekend with Chris from Cellar Rat Wine Tours and we had an amazing time. He is very very knowledgeable and accommodating. You will be in very good hands with him as your tour guide. This is my second time using Cellar Rat and will only use them from now on. Do yourself a favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Jerry Y.
reviews.description: Booked a tour with Cellar Rat during the first day of our trip to Fredericksburg since we had never been.  We thought a tour would be a good way to get our bearings.  We stayed just out of town on the west side of 490 so our "wine" tour started with a quick tour of main street which was helpful later when making dining decisions and deciding our our tourist stops.  Clint was very knowledgeable about the town, the wineries, wine in general, and very personable.  He had all our stops planned out and tastings booked.  Definitely relaxing to have all that handled for you so you can enjoy your vacation.  The tours are somewhat determined by the agenda/goal of the people on the tour meaning you stops might be different.  I was told some tours are based on the best views, best wines, and possibly distillery tours if that is of interest.  We wanted an idea of what the area had to offer which took us to Kuhlman, William Chris, and Astris.  We also had some samples during lunch at Hye Market which was a great stop as well.   Several stops included a tour of the grounds and a behind the scene look at the production side of wine making.  We ended the trip that day with about a dozen bottles of wine, a mix of reds and white, which is a testament to the quality of the stops and wines the area has to offer as we primarily drink dry red wines; typically pinot noirs.  Would definitely recommend Rat Cellar and look forward to touring with them again next trip.

reviews.author: Sabrina S.
reviews.description: We had a great time with Cellar Rat Wine Tours!   Everything went smoothly from booking to the actual tour. Cadye provided a quick and thoughtful response to our initial inquiry and walked us through creating the best tour for our group. She was patient while I got consensus with the group of which wineries we wanted to visit.   On the day of the tour, Chris picked us up on time and gave us an overview of what we could expect throughout the day. We had a lot of questions and he answered them well.   Our group stopped at Kuhlman Cellars, William Chris and Pedernales. Having worked in the industry, Chris was able to get us some "behind the scenes" looks at the wineries. He also was patient when we wanted to have another glass at certain wineries. Not to mention, he was always willing to help us document the trip with a picture!  I can't forget to mention we also had lunch at Hye Market where we got to taste some of the Cellar Rat wines! They were great! The restaurant itself is in a post office that is still operating and looks like it did back when it opened decades ago. Chris was also sure to make sure we had snacks and water throughout our trip!  I would highly suggest booking Cellar Rat Wine Tour to learn more about Texas wine culture and the area.

reviews.author: Edith M.
reviews.description: We attended a wine tour/tasting and were extremely pleased with the entire experience.  From the start when I reached out to book it until we got dropped off.  Chris, our guide was excellent and went out of his way to accommodate us.  He is also knowledgeable regarding the wine, spots, and was extremely profesional and nice.  They made accommodations to pick up and drop us off where we were staying.  He kept the van cool for us and our wine during this hot weather.  He also kept us hydrated by having plenty of cold water bottles handy.  Highly recommend booking a tour with Cellar rat wine tours.  You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: We toured with Cellar Rat Wine Tours for the second time today and we had an absolute blast. You are treated to such a fun experience with delicious wines (and not to mention, plenty of learning), good food, and a great travel buddy and conversationalist to boot. Some may argue the company is pricey considering the available wine shuttles, but it is SO worth it. You get plenty of attentiveness, the day is laid-back with ZERO planning on your part, and you get home at the end of the day feeling great and hopefully, with some delicious wine.  I love Cellar Rat Wine Tours and would highly recommend to anyone hoping to check out the wine scene around the Fredericksburg area.

reviews.author: Lana B.
