reviews.description: We had a girls weekend, Clem made our wine tour so much fun. He was accommodating, knowledgeable, and very patient with us 8 ladies. Thanks Clem. We had fun.

reviews.author: E A.
reviews.description: My sister and I had a blast! Chris, our guide was knowledgeable, professional and prompt! He was also really nice about rounding up our group to leave to the next winery....we weren't always good listeners regarding the leaving part!! Lol!!! Great memories were made and our group even became friends and met out later! Even calling the place to set up was simple. The company was very helpful in setting up where we should go...ex- I said my sister and I only liked dry wines. Out of 19 samples...only ONE wine was sweet! Perfect trip!--we visited William Chris, Kuhlman and Pedernales. Our fave---WILLIAM CHRIS! They were all nice though!!!

reviews.author: Royce D.
reviews.description: Excellent from start to finish. Our guide was not only knowledgeable and forthcoming with honest assessments of establishments around town, he coordinated the day perfectly. We were no where too long nor did we feel at all rushed.

reviews.author: Savannah S.
reviews.description: Toured with Clem and Rat Cellar Wine Tour over the weekend for a girl friend's bachelorette weekend.   We had a 11 people with us for the tour so were in their largest tour van, and even with the large number of people Clem was able to keep the tour feeling small and intimate.   2 of the 11 people were very interested in the actual wine making process and Clem to the extra time to discuss more in depth the process as well as show the group the actual wine cellar where the wine was stored.   Lunch was provided in the cost and this made this tour group even more attractive to us, as all the other tour groups we looked at did not provide that.   If you're looking for more of a personalized tour from an experienced professional, this tour is definity with the price of admission.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Cellar Rat Wine Tours is hand down the best! We went on a tour for my birthday this year and it was such a blast!! Clem was our guide and in one word he was amazing!! He was very informative and had everything you could need during a day of wine tasting on board! We enjoyed every winery we went to and our itinerary was diverse. If you are planning a trip to fredericksburg soon and are considering a tour, you need to book with cellar rat!! Thank you guys for such a fun day!!

reviews.author: Jannat C.
reviews.description: With the help of Visit San Antonio, we used San Antonio Detours for a photo tour around San Antonio for Expo! Expo! attendees. This was the first time we had incorporated a photo tour of the host city in our packed schedule, but it turned out way better than expected!  Melvin was an amazing tour guide! He had all the right facts to share with our group of 20+ event organizers and event suppliers. We saw The Alamo, RIverwalk and so much more within an hour.   Thank you so much for an amazing photo tour. We've heard nothing but positive feedback from our attendees on the photo walk!

reviews.author: Meghan R.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to San Antonio we were able to check out the Pearl Brunch Tour. Even with the awful weather (it rained ALL weekend), the tour was amazing. Our tour guide was so friendly and knowledgeable about the Pearl Brewery area and all the places we stopped. We went to Local Coffee, Southerleigh Brewing, Nao, and Lick.   The tour included so much amazing food - you will not leave hungry. San Antonio Detours offers other public tours weekly and I will definitely be checking those out the next time I'm in town. If you want a way to try out some amazing food and get a taste (ha ha) of REAL San Antonio, definitely check them out!

reviews.author: Kendra H.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time on the tour with Michael. Would highly recommend if you're in town. Tip: take the tour early in your stay so you know where to go for the rest of your trip.

reviews.author: Jeffrey H.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a 2-hour historical tour with Michael. He was knowledgeable, friendly, and funny. I would recommend this tour to S.A. first-timers or residents who'd like to learn about the rich history of the city!

reviews.author: Lynn R.
reviews.description: This is the perfect tour if you want an experience of a lifetime!  Michael is the most knowledgeable guide we have had in the area!  This tour of the historic Missions was the personal trip we were hoping for to learn the history but he added to the dialogue to make it entertaining as well.  I would recommend this specific tour to everyone.  The van is comfortable and Michael makes sure you enjoy the adventure!

reviews.author: Chuck R.
reviews.description: We took the Historic Mission Tour with Michael today, visiting the San Juan, San Jose, Espada, and Concepcion missions south of San Antonio.  Michael did a great job, providing enough history of each mission without droning on to the point of boredom.  He kept our group of 10 on schedule which provided ample time at each stop.  See the Alamo first, then take this trip to see what the Alamo can strive to be after the current restoration project.

reviews.author: Rosita T.
reviews.description: Highly recommend his tour if you're a foodie! We hosted a surprise bachelor party and the tour guide played along by not revealing what the tour was until we were underway. The bachelor lives in San Antonio and the tour took us to spots he'd never even heard of before! (And he's a self-proclaimed foodie) The tour guide was extremely accommodating, fun, and knowledgeable. We had the best time. Thanks San Antonio Detours!

reviews.author: Guido P.
reviews.description: Had a great tour of the city with Mel. She was fabulous. Tour was very informative. Only nine people made it feel very private.

reviews.author: D B.
reviews.description: We very much enjoyed our three-hour San Antonio mission tour led by Michael. You learn not only history but much insider info about the city and what to do here. Thanks Michael!

reviews.author: tony i.
reviews.description: Really fun tour that was well paced, fun, comfortable (in TX heat;). Michael was a fantastic guide with a good knowledge base and witty banter that made it a fun trip! Recommend the Real San Antonio tour because you truly see all the cool stuff in the city that you otherwise would miss by just staying in downtown.

reviews.author: Glenn B.
reviews.description: We took a Mission Tour in San Antonio and our hosts were Michael and Melissa and they were simply AWESOME!! They did such a great job with the history, sharing great detailed stories, were incredibly funny and they really helped make for an amazing and interesting morning. They were so caring too when one of our guests fell and they were so attentive to make sure they were okay. Thank you all for such a great tour!! Glenn and John

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: Fantastic and easy to work with!  We had a group of about 30 people take a bus to go Axe Throwing.  Everything  was  taken care of for us from the transportation, actual event, food and drinks.  Mel was our on site contact and she was great!  Super friendly and gave us some fun trivia about San Antonio on our ride.  Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Kit S.
reviews.description: I signed up for "The Real San Antonio" city overview tour, not knowing what to expect. Melvin did a fantastic job sharing information about both the history of the city as well as taking us to some interesting San Antonio locations that I hadn't seen before. I liked his conversational style, and he was able to answer everyone's questions. The tour bus was very well-kept and clean, and I was impressed that the tour started and ended exactly on time.   There was not quite as much walking as I expected, since it was billed as a "walking tour." However, I'm not surprised because we did visit so many locations (a mission, the King William district, and drove through the Pearl) that we had to drive between. Melvin packed a lot of sightseeing and history into two hours! I learned a lot about the areas of San Antonio that I visit frequently, so I am very happy with the tour. I would love to try more San Antonio Detours in the future, especially with Melvin. Two big thumbs up!

reviews.author: Layne H.
reviews.description: AMAZING tour. We signed up a group of 30 women from out of town to get an insider's look at San Antonio. The motorcoach they provided was clean and comfortable, and our tour guide Melvin could not have been more enthusiastic, knowledgeable or sweet. The women were actually wondering if he had been a historian since he knew so much about the city!  I could not recommend this business more highly. A perfect introduction to the city, or a supplement to the trivia you already thought you knew!

reviews.author: Henry H.
reviews.description: We had an great guide on our tour who brought us to many places we never would have discovered on our own.  The food was awesome and overall we had a great experience.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Went in a group of 4 for a food tour. It was great! We really enjoy Biga on the Banks appetizers. Michael was our tour guide and he was super friendly andhospitable!

reviews.author: Vanessa B.
reviews.description: Had an amazing time on the Missions tour. Melvin did a fantastic job of bringing to life the rich history of the land and its people. Booked this tour as a birthday surprise for my history and photography loving partner and was not disappointed. Plenty of history and photograpic opportunities. We both would highly recommend taking the tour and seeing this unique piece of Texas and San Antonio history.

reviews.author: M M.
reviews.description: Melissa, our tour guide was so sweet! Our tour was very educational. I loved learning about the history of San Antonio.

reviews.author: Katherine V.
reviews.description: Michael was very witty!! Made the tour entertaining and informative at the same time. Would recommend to anyone visiting!

reviews.author: Kathy K.
reviews.description: Michael was fantastic!  Very engaged! Kept us on track while providing great information on the history of the missions along with a little information on current day San Antonio.  Highly recommend.

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Polly M.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. Katie and Jaston are beyond accommodating to make the trip great. They have access to great vineyards, distilleries, and breweries. Will definitely be using them again in the future!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: This was our first time exploring wineries and our driver and guide Jaston was the absolute best! He was very knowledgeable about the areas and wineries. The places he chose for us were top notch and we will definitely use Winding Road again!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! My girlfriends and I booked a wine tour for my birthday. The owner, Katie, is beyond sweet! She made sure everything was perfect for us and we got the experience we were looking for. She even went out of her way to give me a list of fun things to do in the area since we aren't local. Jaston, our driver, was awesome! He was our photographer, server, driver, anything we needed he made sure we got it. We definitely will be using Winding Road Wine Tours in the future!

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: Wow, What an  incredible time my wife and I spent last Saturday touring the Texas wine country with the help of Katie from Winding Road Wine Tours. Her knowledge of the area was impressive.  We are already planning our next trip. Thanks Katie!

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: J A.
reviews.description: We had an awesome time with Jaston! He was very knowledgeable, accommodating and explained all aspects of of the tour. The bus was comfortable and super clean. We highly recommend this tour! Thanks Jaston!!

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fiancé and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

reviews.author: Linsay B.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Moon's Vineyard Voyages to anyone looking for a good time in Fredericksburg! Ginger was the absolute best driver and guide!! We had a group of 6 ladies on our trip and it was easy to communicate and book our tour with Moon's Voyages. We did the half-moon tour on a Saturday morning/afternoon. Ginger arrived at our Airbnb with the bus on time and after picking up other people at their various locations, we reached 4.0 Cellars for our first tasting. Our second tasting was at Hye Meadow Winery followed by lunch at Hye Market, where our lunches were ready on the table for us! We finished the day at Fat Ass Ranch and Winery before all being taken back to our respective locations. All 3 tastings were amazing! We never felt rushed or that we were on any type of time crunch. We were able to enjoy every glass and had no worries about who would have to be the designated driver. Ginger was so much fun and the absolute sweetest! She made our tour a blast by keeping us safe and making us laugh!

reviews.author: Cherry M.
reviews.description: If you're staying In Fredericksburg and want to do a wine tour, be sure to call up Brandon at Moon's Vineyard Voyage. My boyfriend surprised me with this during our weekend getaway. Brandon was super friendly and knowledgeable of the area and the different things to do in Fredericksburg. He picked everyone up from where they were staying, which was awesome. The first place he took us was to was Fiesta Winery. This place was my absolute favorite! We were allowed to pick 6 wines to try and we got to keep our tasting glasses. I got lucky and liked all 6 of mine! The next stop was the Garrison Brothers Distillery. Bourbon on a wine tour?! Super unique. This consisted of a tour of the distillery and we learned how bourbon was made. We got to try it every stage of the process. And they also taught us how to enjoy a glass of bourbon. It wasn't my cup of tea, however it was a cool experience and my boyfriend loved it! For lunch, we had some awesome sandwiches at the Hye Market. Super yummy! Our last stop was the Hye Meadow Winery. Also a cute winery. We had such a great time on this tour. Brandon gave us his card and told us to call him directly if we ever want to do it again, that way we don't do the same tour twice. We live up the road in Austin, so we definitely will be coming back very soon!  Pro tip, eat before you go on this tour! You will be drinking a lot!

reviews.author: Rachel B.
reviews.description: Haley picked us up at our hotel and made sure the whole process was so fun and easy for all of us! She kept us up to date on how much longer we had at each winery so we could time our experience appropriately. She also made sure everyone got free water if they wanted it. Anything that was purchased was also taken to the van for us and stored safely! I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great way to experience the wineries in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Macy P.
reviews.description: This guy is amazing and he is the best tour guide ever!! You will love him! He is courteous and friendly and very chatty!!! He's amazeballs

reviews.author: Kelli H.
reviews.description: 10/10 recommend Moon's Vinyard Voyages! Brandon was extremely patient with a large group of 11 loud, intoxicated women on a Bachelorette party. He picked us up at our hotel and took a ton of pictures for us at each stop. Immediately after one of us purchased something, he wrote our names on it and stored it safely on the bus. He allowed us to hook up our bluetooth in the bus so we can have our own choice of music. We never once felt rushed to get to the next winery, either! Among the things already mentioned, he provided bottled water, opened all the doors for us, and gave us great Fredericksburg recommendations!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: I was in Fredricksburg recently on a girls trip and Brandon was amazing! He was very accommodating and attentive but not over whelming. None of us had been on a wine tour and we all want to go back!

reviews.author: Diane H.
reviews.description: What a great tour  We arrived in Fredericksburg Tx on a Wed night  The next day we searched for a wine tour on Yelp  Moon vineyard tours looked good and had good reviews  We called and got a call back right away Soon our tour driver/ guide Rex called and made arrangements when to pick us up  We  were picked up at our lodging location and we taken to 3 tasting rooms  Rex was great  Very professional It was raining and he made sure to drop us off at the front door at each place He would take our purchases to the bus for us and kept up with us  After 3 tasting rooms (included in the tour) the other couple we were with wanted to go to one more tasting room  It was right next to the one we were at at Rex accommodated us  He waited for us to finish and then brought us back to our room  He was great  We look forward to to coming back for another tour

reviews.author: Parker S.
reviews.description: Brandon with Moon's Vineyard Voyages went above and beyond for us. His choices in wineries and lunch were great! And his service exceeded expectations. There are so many tours out there we didn't know which to pick... Hopefully this review helps someone make the right choice! We highly recommend Moon's and will use them again. Thanks Brandon!

reviews.author: Madeline b.
reviews.description: We had a great time touring wineries and a brewery with Woody at Moon's Vineyard Voyage! My husband and I were taking a few days off after our wedding and this was a great activity. We tried great wine and beers and everything was already setup for us when we arrived at each place. They all had a heads up about our recent nuptials too apparently, and made sure to take care of us :)   We ended up in a private limo which was a lot of fun but sounds like a great options for groups too! I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jessica T.
reviews.description: Had such a great experience!! Brandon was awesome and definitely made the experience worth it!! Highly recommend and will return for future tours!!

reviews.author: Richard S.
reviews.description: Brandon of Moon's Vineyard Voyage couldn't have been nicer. My fiance and I wanted a nice getaway Labor Day weekend. We were the only ones who showed up--others cancelled due to gas situation after Hurricane Harvey. He was kind enough to drive us to Luckenbach just so we could have our picture taken. Hen was knowledgable, affable, and gracious even though this wasn't a very profitable day for him. He gave us a great selection of wineries based on our preferences and we had a nice sandwich lunch at Hye Market. He even carried the boxes of wine/beer to our hotel room.

reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: Fantastic intimate wine tour with awesome host, Matthew! Highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Kai C.
reviews.description: Brandy was the best tour guide! My husband and I booked a tour/tasting for my birthday. Masks are worn and there is a plastic divider inside of the van.  The gentleman at Sister Creek who served our wine did great. Brandy was very knowledgeable, personable, professional and kind. She is a walking wealth of wine/vineyard information. If you're looking to book a tour, short or long, I highly recommend this company! We were given the option for her to provide a little info and just let us vibe or provide us with everything. I love all things wine so I went for it all! I wasn't disappointed. (Btw she took magnificent pictures for us as well).

reviews.author: Monica A.
reviews.description: What a great wine tour. Our guide Matt is personable, knowledgeable, funny, friendly and professional. Our group was small. The wineries were great! All cute , the fun one was last; FAT ASS !!! Matt chose wineries based on our taste and personalities. Yes yes you have to do yourself a favor and book a tour. No regrets. They also pick you up at your hotel !

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: First wine tour of the Texas Hill Country and Cottonwood did not disappoint. Our driver/guide Diane was AMAZING! She was super friendly, knowledgeable, and gave great insight into the wines and even hooked us up with a great BBQ joint in Fredericksburg. This was a wonderful experience and we are looking forward to exploring more wines with Cottonwood.

reviews.author: Jen O.
reviews.description: Matt and Brandy were so wonderful! Brandy helped guide us to the best wineries! Matt was our driver and he was very kind, a wealth of knowledge, and a great guide. I would highly recommend working with them for your next wine tour. The pick up and drop off at home were well worth it. Thank you guys for a great time!

reviews.author: Teresa W.
reviews.description: Such a great tour... We did the Guadalupe River Wine tour. It was a surprise for the husbands of the group! Matt was our guide and he was so knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. A group member left something in the bus and Matt was kind enough to bring it back on his day off. We will definitely tour again!

reviews.author: Manuela F.
reviews.description: A few of us from Houston wanted to do a wine tour birthday party for a friend.  Brandy was super accommodating in the reservation process and her husband Matt picked us up the day of at the hotel we were staying at in San Antonio.  He assured us it would be a very different tour from what we're accustomed do and he was right!  He was so knowledgeable that we really enjoyed the tour.    We had shopping time in Fredericksburg and we never felt rushed.  Excellent recovery on their part too when there was a slight hiccup in our reservation and with what was available to tour, he didn't skip a beat.  He  made other arrangements and we continued our tour.  Additionally, I left my iPhone charger in the van and they had it delivered the same day.  One of my girlfriend's left her sunglasses at the Sisters Creek Vineyards and Matt was able to recover the sunglasses and had them mailed the same day.  That's true service!  We would most definitely enjoy doing another tour with Cottonwood Wine Tours in the future and we plan to do so soon.

reviews.author: Kristie W.
reviews.description: What a great tour!  Diane picked our group of six up at our hotel and the adventure began!  We had our first stop at the Saint Tryphon winery, which was the cutest place with an amazingly knowledgeable and friendly staff!! Tres  presented our tastings and was great to talk and listen to.  Our group of six bought several bottles of wine.  We then journeyed to another gorgeous winery with a little less on the customer service.  We gave our feedback immediately to Diane, who said that she would have a discussion with that winery and I believe she will!  Diane then took us into Fredericksburg and pointed out many local establishments.  Throughout the day, Diane provided many facts and tons of information about the area.  She even managed a quick detour to drive by Luckenbach for us!  We chose this company because it is a small business and were very pleased with the personal touches, snack bags, and intimacy of this tour.  We would highly recommend this company for your wine tour adventures!

reviews.author: James O.
reviews.description: I met my mom and sister in San Antonio for my mom's 65th birthday.  They came by way of Chicago and I came in from Portland, Oregon.  My sister did all of the research for the trip and found Cottonwood wine tours so we could get out of the city and into the hill country of Texas.  It was a Friday and my mom's actual birthday when Matthew picked us up at the hotel.  Right off the bat he was really cool and laid back.  He had a lot of fun facts about San Antonio as he is from there and the drive out to Sister Creek winery seemed like we were just hanging out with a friend.  Coming from the Willamette valley I have seen plenty of winery's but nothing like this one. It is an old cotton mill turned into a small winery that produces some great Bordeaux varietal blends and even a Pinot Noir!  Matthew was very knowledgeable on the topic of wine and wine making.  After the wine tasting we headed to Luckenbach for some beer and a little live country music. There is a lot of history to this place and we had been there 33 years prior when my sister and I were toddlers.  He told us no rush and let us enjoy this little country music Mecca, he even had the famous song loaded up on his phone when we got back to the car.  We had him take a picture of us that emulated the one that had been taken so many years before.  Next stop was some Texas bbq, like real bbq, he said we couldn't expect any city bbq to be better and I would say he was right!  All in all this tour was awesome, I would have loved to take other tours with Matthew, like the Alamo or some of the other missions but I don't think he offers those yet, maybe an idea?  He was very personable, knowledgeable and friendly.  The type of person you want to be around and I know my mom had a very special birthday because of this tour/guide.  I highly recommend Cottonwood wine tours for any tour they offer in San Antonio, it is run by Matthew, his wife and his mother in-law and I look forward to returning here to see their success!

reviews.author: Tam T.
reviews.description: A group of us did the Taste of Fredericksburg tour. We had a great time with Mrs. Diane! She was  friendly, knowledgeable, and had great energy! We visited two wine vineyards and were able to spend the last hour of the tour walking around Fredericksburg. Overall, the tour was amazing! It was put together well and worth the price! I highly recommend doing this tour if you're in town visiting or live in San Antonio. They also give military discounts

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Great day. Matt was very knowledgeable in history and wine making! He designed tour to group's taste.  Thoroughly enjoyed the hill country and Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Kat O.
reviews.description: Matt was an amazing tour guide!!  I was down in San Antonio for a work trip and happily stumbled upon this tour company in an ad--they even pick you up from your hotel!  Great opportunity to visit beautiful Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Isabella P.
reviews.description: I found Cottonwood Wine Tours while looking for things to do in San Antonio. We had a great time with our driver Diana. We did the 4 winery tour plus free time in Fredricksburg tour, and we had a fun time. Diana is very friendly, and gave us many good suggestions to places to eat in Fredricksburg and San Antonio. I am so glad we found this wine tour company. They are a small operation with Diana, her daughter and son in law.

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I decided to take a trip to the Texas Hill country and do some wine tasting.  We noticed there were over 40 wineries listed and did not know which ones to choose.  So, we looked on the internet and chose Cottonwood Wine Tours.  Our guide was amazing. We learned so much and he chose some wonderful site.  We recommend them highly.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: I'm visiting my friend in San Antonio who's here for work and she booked this wine tour for us. Matt picked us up and was super friendly and gave us a lot of information about San Antonio, the winery we were headed to, and was just overall really nice and friendly.  At the first winery at Sister Creek, we switched out with Brandy because she was doing the actual tour we booked, Matt was just doing our pick up. Brandy was super fun and every bit as good as Matt. She took us to another winery, let us walk around Fredericksburg (after some great advice on where to eat), then at the end decided she'd take us by a small local liquor distillery that makes some really cool stuff like jalapeno moonshine!  From start to finish, it was amazing. These two are friendly as can be, very knowledgeable, and nothing felt cookie cutter. They make it feel like a personal experience. I definitely recommend giving Cottonwood Wine Tours a try!

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: I took 5 ladies today and couldn't have asked for better. Relaxed and fun. Educational and joyful. Perfect.  Wouldnt use anyone else. I cant recommend enough.

reviews.author: Andreea G.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the A taste of Fredericksburg tour and we had a great time. When they say that you get a knowledgeable tour guide on hand they really mean it. The experience was great and although I am 8 months pregnant we still had a good time and got to purchase some wine to try for after the baby comes. Also they didn't charge me for the wine fee so that was a plus since I didn't get to do any of the wine tastings.

reviews.author: Shirley F.
reviews.description: One word: love. My group took a Sunday tour, and since we were the only ones signed up that day, Matt came to my apartment to pick us all up. He was so polite and interesting, genuinely knowledgeable when it came to wine and the Hill Country. After our first winery, we got back into the car to find goody bags with water and snacks waiting for us. He had extra chocolate if we needed it!    I really liked having time to eat and shop in Fredericksburg between drinking. He pointed out suggestions for places to eat or to drink more on Main Street before dropping us off. He even took us to a bonus winery not on the schedule since we were doing so well on time.   I highly recommend Cottonwood. Matt was easy to contact and professional throughout, even when we were all a bit tipsy. He was a very safe driver. Great job.

reviews.author: Gabrielle M.
reviews.description: I did a private tour of the Guadalupe River Valley area and it was INCREDIBLE. We did a private tour with just 3 and it was completely affordable, which was my biggest concern off the bat. Communication was impeccable from the get-go and our tour guide Matt was such a blast. We hit up 3 wineries and a distillery that made moonshine. Each one was small and unique where we were really able to  converse with the staff and talk about the wines. Due to us having a small group we never felt rushed and when we asked for an extra few minutes, Matt easily obliged. I will definitely be going back for another tour!!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: If you are living in or visiting in the San Antonio area, you should definitely go on this wine tour!   We did the tour that consisted of two wineries and lunch in Fredricksburg. It was great!  Brandy and Matt think of everything! We were picked up in a clean van right at our hotel, so don't worry if you don't have a car! Matt even bring out a step stool so you don't have strain to get into the car. I didn't need it necessarily, but I did enjoy that extra touch. They gave us goodie bags while we drove to the country side. Matt is very knowledgeable and is a great guide of the area. He is full of little facts about the area!   The wineries we went to were very cool! Sister Creek was in an old cotton gin and more personal. Becker's was more upscale and large. we ended up getting 6 bottles of wine altogether. I was so surprised by the amount of good wine grown in Texas! Who knew?!!  Pros:  Brandy and Matt think of everything!  Don't worry about paying anything at the wineries- they take care of that! Transportation Good wine Great tour of the area Brandy and Matt are friendly and great at conversation They really know their stuff and love to explain anything about wine!  Cons:  I had a hankering for some cheese! But that's all I can think of!

reviews.author: Jonathan James R.
reviews.description: The night could not have gone any better. Vehicle was clean, music was perfect, and the service provided by the team was top notch. Any request that was made throughout the night was delivered on. I actually wish I could give 6 stars for a perfect evening.

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: George was amazing! We took went out to the Willam Chris Winery for the day and had the very best time going there and coming home with George. He is literally the best, nicest, and most fun driver we've had and will only use his services when we do trips like this. Thanks George!

reviews.author: Prithi D.
reviews.description: Rick was our driver...on time, kept us on schedule but we didn't feel rushed at all.  In advance, we were able to give some input about which wineries we wanted to visit and ended up going to 2 out of the 3 on our list.  They were very prompt with replying to emails/inquiries.  We went on a Friday and it came to around $170/person, tastings and tip/tax included.  Tour lasted from about 1 pm - 5:30 pm and we visited 3 wineries.  Rick did a great job of taking care of our purchases and labeling our bags.  Plenty of complimentary water and snacks on board.  Our bus held 12 people but we were all comfortable.  We all went home with complimentary wine glasses - great to remember trip by!  Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Casey G.
reviews.description: Fabulous time! Lee was our guide and did everything in his power to make sure we where having a good time but also keeping us on schedule which has gotta be hard to do with a large group! He was super knowledgeable in all things wine and about the area. Snacks, LOTS of water and take home wine cups where all much appreciated. Loved the 3 wineries we went to, favorite being TWC where we also got to hang out with the owner of TX Wine Tours, just as nice as Lee! Easy pick-up, communication and drop-off. Must try this company out!

reviews.author: Brian H.
reviews.description: Yep. This one. Stop searching for better reviews. So much fun. Our driver Chris was great!

reviews.author: Jackie C.
reviews.description: We had such a great experience with this company! It was beyond my expectations and Steve our driver/host was such a great guy! He made sure our wine bottles made it back to the incredible and comfy van provided along with any other purchases. Steve made sure we were taken care of at each winery and the lunch provided was so yummy! We got so lucky to have such a great group and can't wait to do it again in the future!

reviews.author: Dawn C.
reviews.description: We had the best time with Lee at Texas Wine Tours!! Our tour included visiting 3 wineries: Hilmy Cellars, Untamed, and Ron Yates all along the 290 corridor- all excellent btw and we finished with dinner at Bryan's 290 in Johnson City - outstanding! Lee thought of every detail to make our experience special from roses for the ladies to snacks, water and some special bottles of wine. He couldn't have been more attentive or enjoyable. Thank you Lee and Texas Wine Tours!!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: I cannot recommend this company enough!  They did such as amazing job taking us to all the places we wanted to go and handling our group.  Bob is super friendly and accommodating.  They made it such an great experience that I can't wait to go back and use them again!  The owner met us at the last place and made sure we were happy.  It was a fantastic day thanks to these guys!!!

reviews.author: Wendy Y.
reviews.description: We booked our wine tour during spring break and had such a great time. Our driver Bruce was so great, he showed up at our house exactly on time, he was so attentive to our group and was super friendly. Along the way, as we toured and shopped he was right there to take our purchase to the bus and took care of everything for us.  We visited four wineries, and had lunch, and while we had a great time thanks to Bruce and the other couples on our tour, I wasn't all that impressed with the "wineries". I've never liked Texas wine and still don't. First of all, these aren't "wineries", they're all tasting rooms. The grapes aren't even grown in this area. They all seemed to just want to get through the tasting, and sell you wines by the bottle. One "winery" had our group of 8 set up in their "library" which was nice and private, but our host kept running in and out because they were short handed and he was helping at the front while also doing our tasting. The other places don't even allow you to sit at the bar while tasting, you had to stand the entire time which wasn't good for my cousin who was recovering from a back injury.  Overall, my review of Texas Wine Tours is 5 stars because they really took care of us. I wasn't impressed the the fake wineries and their push to sell wines and not really educate. Maybe they can't educate much on their wines because they aren't actually making them there. I would still recommend the tour in Fredericksburg if you are looking for something fun to do with a group. It was great to have someone else to drive and worry about the schedule and let us just relax and enjoy our time.

reviews.author: Morgan W.
reviews.description: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!   **Texas wine tours in Fredericksburg **  Please share since they keep deleting all the reviews.   Also, if you know me.... you know that I NEVER blast a business like this. EVER. This owner was SO disgusting and disrespectful to me.   I really hate to post this... but the owner of this place was completely disrespectful and out of line with me when I called (the second time, because the first time they were ok with everything). More than half of the girls scheduled to take the wine tour, came down with covid and or was exposed to it and was told we must quarantine for 2 weeks. We never ever ever planned on canceling, but once the all time high hit texas (2nd wave) , especially Houston, where we ALL live, AND almost every single girl was exposed or now tested positive, we sadly needed to cancel and would re-schedule at a later date. The owner proceeded to tell me that he would give me a gift card and that they will not give me my money back. I told him I would be more than happy to still pay the driver their tip, but we have no idea when this covid stuff will get everything back to any type of normal. I told him that I did not want a almost $3,000 gift card, I would like my money back because I am unsure of a future date and if every girl could make that date. We still plan on going, but just not knowing when or how many girls will be able to attend. He screamed at me and told me that he will not give me any money back so I then proceeded to tell him that we will all come and still attend if that's how he wants to do business-- he would be selfishly putting his driver, the other people there, and all the wineries in danger. Of course, we would NEVER do that, because we are respectful and honorable humans. After I said that to him, he then says "I'm not dealing with this today, you can call tomorrow" AND HUNG UP ON ME!!! We are all moms of young children and were told by our family doctors and or a testing site to lock away for 2 weeks. I understand that they have to make money, but also, COVID is KILLING people, shutting down businesses, canceling weddings, etc etc and I have yet to find a vendor type of place that did not give people that literally tested POSITIVE and or was exposed and not showing symptoms just yet, their money back for a "STATE WIDE DISASTER". On top of that, we paid for a lunch for that day, all the wine tastings... which they will not lose money on because WE ARE NOT USING ANY OF THAT, therefore, they DO NOT HAVE TO BUY IT!  Our house host refunded us back 100% and has since checked on myself and the other girls. This guy, yelled at me, is willing to put OTHERS AT RISK, and hung up on me.   That's almost $3000 that I'm out for y'all doing absolutely NOTHING. Even offered to still give the driver his $350 tip still! (I'm in the wrong business apparently! I need to be a wine tour driver)   They have also deleted other negative reviews and blocked people on here.   We have a lawyer that is now handling this for us (one of the girls husbands), I have also let our host know to NEVER recommend these people, I'm posting in EVERY bridal page about y'all, sending the knot a review, ALSO, calling every winery y'all are linked up with and letting them know how y'all do business and how unprofessional he was.   Like I said, we would have 100% rebooked at a later date once covid calms down and all the girls are in the clear.... THEN having to find another later date that every girl that paid, can attend.   Sadly, they lost our business all together

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour in April for my daughter's Bachlorette Party.  My oh my, were we impressed and pleased.  Randy, the owner visited our air bnb this morning.  He wanted to congratulate The Bride, thank us for choosing Texas Wine Tours and brought her a very nice bottle of wine.  They took us to 3 Wineries and each one was very different.   We all fell in love with Santa Maria!!  Wonderful boutique winery!! SantaMaria and The Club at BaronsCreek Side were our favorites!!  Jerry, our Guide was over the top wonderful!!  Kept us on track and answered all our questions.  We had such a grand time and I would put both of these wineries on your 'must visit' list!!  I can not wait to visit again and to purchase more wines from these wineries.

reviews.author: Ericka M.
reviews.description: This company did an absolutely amazing job. I came with a small group (4 of us total) and it was our first wine tour ever. That being said, they made everything easy. They were very accommodating to our needs (date change, pick up, etc.), granted we did do a weekday in January. If you're worried about Covid (which we definitely are), I'd recommend going during the week. We went on a Thursday and there was little to no people at the wineries and we were able to have the van to ourselves! It made it a more comfortable experience for sure. Our driver was Steve and he was awesome. Looking forward to coming back in the summer/fall when everything is in full bloom. 10/10 would book again and ask for Steve!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Don't even bother looking at other wine tours. Texas Wine Tours is beyond amazing! We booked for my bachelorette party, and the entire process from booking to the end of the tour was phenomenal. Our driver, Cheryl, stopped by our house the day before our tour to give me a flower and the maid of honor a jam as a thank you. She told us she left plenty of time to take group pictures at the house for us in the morning when she picked us up. Then the morning of the tour, the owner showed up and gave me his well wishes and a bottle of wine! Before even starting the tour, we were blown away by their level of service!   Pick up went super smooth in the morning, and they picked 4 great wineries for our stops. Cheryl came into every winery with us, and spent the entire time making sure everyone was happy and had everything they needed. She would fill our waters, coordinate meals/snacks, and she did it all without anyone having to ask her. If we bought anything at the wineries, she would write our name on the bag, and take it back to the bus and handle the storage. At the end of the tour, she loaded it all up and brought it into our house!   I was so unbelievably impressed with the service provided by Texas Wine Tours and can't wait to have another excuse to go to Fredericksburg and book with them again!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: Texas Wine Tours is the best in the business! They are extremely friendly and will go out of their way to make sure you have a great trip. We've used them 4 different times and they get better each time. There's no better way to experience Fredricksburg. Randy couldn't be a nicer guy and did everything he could to make sure we had a great time.  We are already planning our next trip.

reviews.author: Erika G.
reviews.description: Texas Wine Tours was absolutely amazing! Our host/driver, Mike, messaged us the day before to confirm our reservation. He picked us up, a few minutes early, from our AirBnB. Mike was the absolute friendliest! He prepared snacks for all of us on the tour, provided water, and made sure everyone was comfortable in the bus. (The bus was very clean and spacious!) At each winery(3 different ones) Mike constantly was refilling our water and kept track of all our purchases. The cherry on top was when Randy, the owner of TWT, made an appearance and gifted a bottle of wine for my husband and I since we were on our honeymoon. It was a wonderful experience and would HIGHLY recommend to anyone!

reviews.author: Sarah P.
reviews.description: We did the 4 winery tour with lunch and it was such a delight! Our driver, Lee was amazing. He took such good care of us, providing water throughout the day and storing our purchased bottles for us. This was a 40th birthday celebration for my twin sister and I and we just enjoyed every minute! We met a great group of people on the tour that helped us celebrate. Lee went above and beyond. I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Adriana C.
reviews.description: This is such a fun thing to do if you're in Texas! We did a four winery tour and I had a great day. The flexibility they offer just makes such a big difference. You can pick the wineries you want to visit even if you tell them beforehand, or they will offer recommendations. You can drink any bottles you buy on the bus, too!    Wineries definitely vary though. Some let you keep your tasting glass, some don't. Some gave two ounce pours, some barely gave one ounce. Do some research beforehand and make it worth it.  Our tour guide was an older gentlemen and was great!  He had bags for stuff we bought/were given and always loaded everything in the bus in between wineries. We invited him to join us for grilling at our Air bnb that night (wine goes straight our heads) and he said he was busy laying in his recliner and enjoying retirement. Hahahaha definitely the oldest man to have ever rejected us

reviews.author: Heather S.
reviews.description: The owner randy cane by our rented house before the tour to congratulate my sister, the bride-to-be, and gift her a beautiful bottle of Bellisimo red wine! Our tour guide Jerry was fantastic, very attentive and beyond hospitable!! I cannot give this company enough stars!! JUST BOOK YOUR TOUR with them and dont stress!!!

reviews.author: Jenni A.
reviews.description: Booked a last minute wine tour (day of) to celebrate two of my sisters 50th birthdays.  This was a GREAT way to explore Fredericksburg wineries for the first time.  Our guide, Darryl, truly made our experience one we will never forget!  He was very  knowledgeable, HYSTERICAL and just the perfect person to help us celebrate!!!  Would HIGHLY recommend this tour but you must ask for Darryl!

reviews.author: Taylor R.
reviews.description: HIGHLY RECOMMEND Texas Wine Tours! Sheryl was our bus driver and amazing tour guide for each stop. She was hands down a highlight of my bachelorette weekend. The service was above and beyond. I cannot wait to come back again!

reviews.author: Ariana M.
reviews.description: We took our first wine tour yesterday and it was so great! Our driver was Darrell, and he was so informative and nice. He even bought us kolaches and donut holes for breakfast. Picked us up very promptly from our Airbnb in the morning @10, and we were on our way. We did the 4 winery tour which included lunch. We visited SantaMaria, 4.0 cellars, Hilmy, and Safari Winery. Each winery included 5-6 tastings of different wines, and you could pick what type of wines you wanted to try. We loved all the wineries and even bought bottles at all of them, which Darrell stored for us in the bus until the end of the day. The owner, Randy, stopped by at our lunch at 4.0 to introduce himself to us and gift us a bottle of wine for our upcoming wedding! We plan on doing this tour again with more friends next time! Thanks for a great time Darrell and Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Mimi L.
reviews.description: I had an amazing time on my wine tour!!! Paul was our driver, and he was so great! He was friendly, cordial, and picked really outstanding wineries, better than if I had tried to pick on my own. I would strongly suggest Texas Wine Tours. The shuttle was very comfortable, and we had adequate time at each stop to learn about the wines. A++ I've been raving to all my Austin friends to go.  1851 and William Chris were the best two wineries.

name: A - B Wine Tours and Transportation

reviews.author: Sam R.
reviews.description: We used Keidel for our bachelorette party wine tour. Jeff with Keidel was great! He was professional, responsive, and took care of everything. Cody was our driver and he was amazing!!! He was so kind and gave us a white glove service the whole day. They truly made the experience enjoyable!

reviews.author: Celina P.
reviews.description: The Kirchmans were soo great! It was so nice to be able to plan my own trip and go wherever we wanted to go without any worries! They took great care of us from start to finish! Wish them nothing but the best on a great business!!

reviews.author: Kay W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful tour of wineries with George! Four of us enjoyed 3 excellent stops that he recommended. Nice to have a private tour with a friendly and professional driver. Beautiful new vehicle. Loads of fun!

reviews.author: Bryan L.
reviews.description: I booked Kirchman's because they were the most responsive when I reached out. We were so happy that we did because they were so professional and informative. Our guide, George, was amazing. He knew so many of the local places it was staggering. His knowledge and history in the area is unrivaled. George has a passion for this and it shows and is appreciated. I personally enjoyed being able to ride in their brand new car with seating fit for a king and space to tote all of our collections along the way. If we ever find ourselves back in the area, this will be our first call!

reviews.author: Elizabeth E.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! We had George for my bachelorette girls weekend and he was fantastic! Beautiful car and they even took pics of us hanging out and of the vineyards we were at! Kirchman's will be my nee Fredericksburg transportation of choice!

reviews.author: Nick S.
reviews.description: Looking for excellent private tour? Hire Kirchman's private tours! George was an excellent communicator, prompt and had great recommendations! We had some time in-between tours and he dropped us off a a winery that wasn't in our list and still made to our next destination on time! Thank you for making my wife's birthday weekend special. We will be using kirchman's private tours every time we're in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Stella G.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time in George's care during a special birthday weekend. We were comfortable during the ride and in conversation with George. We received lots of great information and laughs along the way. As a thoughtful bonus, George graciously took photos to ensure memories of our group and surprised us with lovely photos of the places we visited to capture the ambiance as well. The service and professionalism was above what we've experienced in Napa and the Willamette. We will look forward to our next opportunity to enjoy George and Kirschman's service and company.

reviews.author: Ylencia F.
reviews.description: If you are looking for private transportation to experience all of what Fredericksburg has to offer, do not look any further than Kirchman's! They are absolutely fantastic. This company is top notch and I highly recommend them. I just came back from visiting the area with my sisters and niece. We booked a 4hr reservation with Kirchman's, so that we could visit 3 wineries for tastings. George, our driver, was so kind and accommodating. He even took photos of us at each winery and texted them all to me. The vehicle used for transporting us was nice and clean. He offered us bottled water and kept our wine purchases safe at our various stops. Whenever we were ready to head to the next location, all I had to do was text him that we were walking out and he rolled right on up in the car. Convenient and awesome customer service! I will definitely use them again next time I visit the area.

reviews.author: Lauren N.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great experience! My husband and I had a wonderful time going wine tasting using Kirchman's transports! He was early for pick up and has a lot of great recommendations for wineries and food! We plan on coming back and using him again. What a nice beautiful day, we will be back!  The vehicle was clean and he wore a mask the whole time - we felt super safe and comfortable (he gave us the option of mask versus no mask - we all chose masked). He also gave us great insight on the area and the sights. We loved it!

reviews.author: Carolyn Clare H.
reviews.description: George was wonderful. I appreciate his knowledge, accessibility, and flexibility on a wine tour.   We were able to pick which wineries and when we wanted to go and leave! George was our "Uber" that we could rely on and will recommend him to everyone. Thank you!

reviews.author: Molly M.
reviews.description: We used Kirchman's for a girls trip recently and had the absolute best time! Great staff, professional, affordable and they made sure we were taken care of the day of. You can't go wrong with these guys!!!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: To be honest, I was a bit nervous when I booked this. The Ruby Tour includes three wineries - you don't find out where you're going until they pick you up. That's what made me nervous.  Alas, fear not! We had a great time. The wineries they selected for us (Slate Mill Collective, Kalasi Winery, and Baron's Creek Winery) offered very different experiences, each of which we enjoyed. We were not rushed at any of the wineries, and our driver was very knowledgeable about each of our stops.  I would book this tour again - highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jasmin S.
reviews.description: My best friend and I spent a weekend in Fredericksburg and we booked the Diamond package through this tour company. They picked up/dropped off right at our Airbnb, but you can also get picked up from their office on Main Street. I did wish we were able to pick which wineries we got to visit, but the 4 we got to visit were great. Leland was a fantastic tour guide! He's so personable and really made our day memorable. The restaurant we had lunch in was next door to their office. It wasn't super amazing, but it fine for the price that was included in our package. We were also provided with a charcuterie box in the evening, which hit the spot. This was the most cost-friendly tour in Fredericksburg, and we both really enjoyed our time here!

reviews.author: Lori B.
reviews.description: On August 25, 2021, I booked a private tour for 5 on Saturday Oct 2. It included 4 winery stops, with lunch and tastings. We were flying in from San Francisco, Chicago and Omaha. Having never been to Fredericksburg, we looked for guidance on favorite stops. Whomever answers the phone for this company is unhelpful, rude, short  and clearly hates  her job. She offered no helpful advice and was put out with all of my questions.  I kept the booking, we decided on our own stops, emailed as directed and received NO response as to whether they were able to book our winery selections. I NEVER did get them to respond to an email nor did they phone calls.  7 days prior to arrival, I left 4 voicemails and still no return call.  THREE DAYS prior to arrival  I received a call from this same b*tchy lady now telling me our drivers wife had Covid and we had 2 options...cancel or join a group tour of 18-20 (but she could not tell me which wineries we would visit). She finally confirmed we had reservations at our chosen wineries but we could NOT USE THEM and she was canceling them no matter we decided.   (whaaat???)When I tried to negotiate to keep them if we found our own driver... SHE SAID 'I'M CANCELING YOUR TOUR' and she HUNG UP ON ME!  That left us with nothing 3 days prior to arrival during Fredericksburg's busiest Oktoberfest weekend.  Fast forward a few hours of scrambling to call wineries and drivers explaining this horrible Majesty Tours actions....We ended up at the same wineries with a very pleasant privately hired van driver and here is the best part.....Majesty's price was $1843 and we spent $897 DOING IT OURSELVES ( and this is an apples to apples comparison)!  DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. They are a huge rip off and are so rude and unprofessional.  I could never get a hold of the owners but Fredericksburg people talk and I know they are sisters KK and Kayla.  I hope you two read this and I wish you'd call me.

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: Booked this for my mom and I. Our bus driver Guido was great. He was very accommodating, professional and helpful and kept us on schedule. He contacted me prior to picking us up. He was on time and clearly communicated with us. The wineries we went to were good. would highly recommend Majestic for anyone wanting to do a wine tour in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Kasi S.
reviews.description: Rough experience this weekend with majesty. They never notified us that one of our requested wineries was unavailable, took us to a cheesy bar place with TERRIBLE wine instead - rather than letting us chose something more fitting. Then we had lunch at their restaurant- buyer be ware of the menu. It's written well but the food was cold, overcooked, and bland. Finally as we were ending our tour, the driver kept talking about how he needed to 'GO' and rushing us out the door. He also appeared very annoyed at any music choices, had no cold water and said he didn't have any ice. The vehicle was a bare van, not any limo style transportation like advertised. For $1600/6 people this was $1000 overpriced. I've tried to get ahold of the company to discuss the experience and they aren't answering.

reviews.author: Morgan A.
reviews.description: I would not recommend this wine tour. I booked Majesty Tours for my sister's bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg. I booked Majesty because they had the option for a private tour, none drinkers, and the $140 price for lunch and three wineries was reasonable. I was very disappointed. The tour company advertised a lunch at a local restaurant. The lunch was dry disappointing. Another reviewer described it as a cafeteria for the wine tours with this company; they were right. The tour company's store front is next door to the restaurant and I wouldn't be surprised if they owned it. I expected a cute lunch since there were so many adorable spots to eat. Not the case.  Of the three wineries, only one provided an enjoyable experience. Lunch was terrible.  1. Augusta Vin was the first winery--we really enjoyed it! The patio was amazing and the wine was great. We were only supposed to stay for 45 minutes, but the wine was a little slow to come out so we were there for about an hour and a half. We didn't mind waiting since we had good conversation and the weather was perfect.   2. Arrowhead Creek Wineries--this place was a health and safety hazard. We were horrified. I'll keep it short and leave a review with the winery itself, but basically there was no professional service or health and safety precautions. To start, the outdoor tasting area was where we were out since the indoor one was full. I was sitting by the bar and got to see the kitchen area. It was a mess. There were cracker boxes, empty wine glass, staff purses and cell phones, empty wine bottles, trash etc all over the back counter. When another customer ordered a hummus board, we all watched in horror as the server grabbed the charcuterie board out of the sink water, rinse it and dab it dry it with a batter towel and then put the food straight on it without gloves. She then put gloves on to finish the board. It general it was very chaotic and unprofessional. We left ASAP.  3. RockBox Theater--you read that right, theater. The last winery was NOT a winery.
