It was the lobby of a concert venue. We were promised three wineries with good ambiance. This was a dark room with 4 high top tables and wines from the grocery store. They paired the wines with food, which I thought would be cool. But we realized the food was not being refrigerated. We arrived at 3:30 and the food was on the counter. The next group came at 5:00 and the food was not refrigerated during that time at all. The food involved tuna tartare and carpaccio which must be refrigerated. It was all look warm so we assume it had been out for a while. Between fasting, our server was cleaning the other tables with a rag. She would pause the cleaning, pour us wine, and then go back to cleaning without washing her hands. Next to the food for the next party we're the dirty wine glasses from the last group. Not appetizing.   Would not recommended majesty tours.

reviews.author: Molly C.
reviews.description: Mike Lang was an amazing tour guide. We went for a bachelorette party. Can not recommend enough. We were treated with respect and had an amazing experience. Slate mills winery is amazing as well!  Please use this tour group and ask for Mike.

reviews.author: Sierra H.
reviews.description: We went on this wine tour last week and we had a great time. We went to 3 different wineries. Texas heritage, Texas wine collective, and Bingham winery. They were all very good. The only downside we had was our tour guide. His name was Guido. He was not very friendly and didn't really do much guiding. He basically stayed silent the whole time. Didn't offer to take photos or anything like that. And would have liked more information about the wineries we were visiting.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: Have to get tour guide Guido! So nice and informative, but not too in your business! Very impressed with his driving and info about the vineyards. Also played good throwbacks in the van. Best you could pay $ for.

reviews.author: Sara C.
reviews.description: So, I want to start this with we had booked the tour ahead of time but the day before Gov. Abbott announced some restrictions due to COVID. Majesty immediately communicated they were figuring things out and would be in touch. So their communication about that was great.  However we were disappointed to learn there were 24 people in our tour and we were on a 55 person bus. Not the safest to be around that many people in a small space. Folks started off wearing masks but by the second stop no one was wearing a mask and it was not enforced by our guide, he didn't wear one either.  The first stop we had to sit with strangers without masks and pour our own wine from bottles. And none of the wines were from Texas, just imported from Africa. Then we bussed back into town to eat lunch at a cafe. It was ok but spent a lot of time going back and forth.  Then we were told we were going to sample cider and drove 30 minutes. We signed up for wine tour not cider tour and we all hate cider. The guy stood on a table and yelled things about each cider while we sat at picnic tables. The final stop was a large tasting room and was a more traditional type where you chose a flight and they walked you through each wine. This was more of what were were expecting and it was at least wine grown from Texas grapes, though not in the hill country. We bought some wine.  The whole tour was almost 7 hours long and there was just a lot of time waiting around.  I hate writing less than stellar reviews but we were so disappointed in the whole experience that I just can't recommend them.

reviews.author: Penny G.
reviews.description: Leland provided a great tour experience even through Covid19. The trip was well worth every location. He listened to our wants and needs to give great tourist advice. THANK YOU!

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: If you want a company that cares more about their convenience than your experience as a customer, this is the tour company for you. They cancelled our bachelorette party 2 weeks out because  we complained about how rude and difficult they were being when girls were calling to book. We had to call multiple times to get our confirmation email. Prices were misquoted. They have no sense of customer service. So unless you're willing to risk them cancelling your big event 3 weeks out and want to be treated super rudely on the phone, book at one of the dozens of other wine tour companies.

reviews.author: Gena K.
reviews.description: We will definitely book with this tour company again. We did not have to worry about making reservations as everything was already planned. Larry our guide was amazing and definitely made our day! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: I had a great experience on the Spirit Tour! Will definitely book again in the future. Our tour guide, Neva, was very kind and knowledgeable. I thought the tour was very unique, it started with a very passionate distillery and crew, a great brewery, and a winery with the most beautiful scenery. I loved being able to experience each location and felt like we received excellent portions for the price. I felt safe while traveling and appreciated my tour guide's attention to detail at each location. Can not wait to book again!

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Great tour! We went with Paul and he absolutely made the trip with his fun personality and attention to customer service! We went to three tastings and had more than enough wine.

reviews.author: Melissa T.
reviews.description: Had a great time on the Majesty wine tour. Cowboy Ron was fun. The two wineries they took us too were nice with a good selection of wines. Only downside was the bus was hot which made it uncomfortable.

reviews.author: Ad D.
reviews.description: Watch your bill!!! I DO NOT recommend Majesty Tours. I went to Fredericksburg with 5 friends to celebrate my birthday. I called the day of and the lady on the phone was nice enough to book for that same day at 1130. Our driver, can't remember his name was AMAZING! However when I saw my credit card statement I noticed they had overcharged me $1027.92 was the total, I called them directly today. The charge should have been $714 ($119 per person). The lady that answered the phone was  BEYOND RUDE, she definitely should not be working in customer service. She went off on me and told me I was lying that the representative "pretty much always" disclose all charges and that the fees are more on Sunday's. The representative did not disclose the taxes and gratuity included which was $313!!!!! She advised me I got an email with the confirmation, which I just checked my email and did not get. She raised her voice multiple times and told me I could not prove that that was not discussed. I advised her that I would contact my bank about the difference and she said this conversation is over and hung up on me. I hope all conversations are recorded so that someone can go back and listen to it. I will post this review on Google, Yelp, Trip Avisor and any other avenue I can to warn people of this terrible business practice. Not discussing ALL fees is not ok. I will also contact the Better Business Bureau to file a complaint. I hope this helps someone else, if you book with them do it in person, get a receipt (which I did not get) and check your online banking or credit card statement.

reviews.author: Amanda F.
reviews.description: We had a great time for a bachelorette party. Larry was so amazing and was always there to take pictures. It was very organized and we went to some great winery's! Thanks again!

reviews.author: Celeste G.
reviews.description: I booked the wine tour about a month in advance. Love their options for tours. Great packages and decent prices.   Our tour guide was Tom, the cowboy. He was so kind and took care of my sister's bachelorette team. Them winos and all!!! Lol! My other pregnant sister and I did not drink (me for diet reasons).   We chose the Ruby package and our favorite was the Fat Ass Ranch and Winery!!! Keep that on your list MWT!!!   I will indeed use them again!! Kelley and Kay Kay were so helpful! They're sisters who run this tour place.   Kudos ladies!!! We had a wonderful time!!!

reviews.author: Andreas H.
reviews.description: I called Majesty Tours about 2 weeks before a friend's birthday event, and they lady I spoke with on the phone was incredibly helpful. I quickly signed us all up for the "ruby" package (includes water and a snack, plus 3 vineyard stops).   Where the service started to stand out was when I had to call and change the reservation - TWICE. Not only were they completely understanding, they were also absolutely friendly and didn't bat an eyelash.   Fast forward to the day of our tour...  The Great: + Garrett, our driver. He was friendly, on time, helpful, knowledgeable, and was all about making sure we were having the best time possible. He was also very aware of the times, and managed our stops extremely well. He carried our items, provided the water and snacks on the van, and was simply great. + Our stops. Our group liked wines on the dry side so Majesty Tours made some suggestions based on our tastes. These were spot on and we loved out stops.  The OK: o The snacks on the bus was a plastic container filled with a sleeve of crackers, a sealed bag of cheddar cheese, and a sealed bag of pepperoni. The presentation could have been better, or maybe a little higher quality food would have been in order, but hey, it did the job.  Overall I was pleased with the tour and the service that Majesty Tours provided. I would recommend them if you are considering any time of tour in the hill country or need a driving service while in the area. Top notch!!

reviews.author: Terri P.
reviews.description: Clint was a total professional and a wonderful driver.  At our first stop he ordered a different vehicle so everyone felt more comfortable.  What a surprise when he told us!  Didn't see that coming.  Three great tastings with good friends.  Discovered some very nice 2015 Texas wines.  The grapes have matured immensely since 2008 and glad to finally enjoy some good Texas wines.   Can't recommend this company any lower than *****!  Thank you Discovery Wine Tours for a memorable afternoon.

reviews.author: Carlin L.
reviews.description: Used Discover Texas Wine Tours for a 30th birthday. John, our driver, was wonderful. He called me a couple of days before to introduce himself and to confirm the pickup details. He also called me the day of and was on time. He made sure we were settled at each location and made it a great experience. Felt very safe - John wore a mask the whole time. Also, Kathie helped plan the itinerary. She's familiar with the wineries and distilleries in the area, and was very friendly. Couldn't recommend them more!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: A.wonderdul time, from reservation phone call to driving away from the limo.once the 6.5 hour tour ended.  John was our driver...we knew from the get-go we were in good hands.  Discover Wine chose the wineries for us and all were unique, fun and obviously tasty (as was the restaurant they selected).  We'll be back!

reviews.author: Lynlee S.
reviews.description: Our driver John was amazing!!! Very sweet and professional. Gave excellent service and ensured my group of 2 had a great time at each location we choose. Booking with the owner Kathy was easy and she ensured the whole private tour experience was exactly what we wanted. Could not have had a better time!!! John the drive wore a mask the whole time and gave us a detailed tour of town while he drove! Excellent and safe driver. Perfect perfect perfect! Thank you!! If you want an intimate experience with lots of sights and great food and drink, chose this company to take you!!!!!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: I was so impressed with this tour the first time we booked that I had to book it for another party! Well, this time it wasn't as impressive. I don't know if the business has just gotten bigger than the owners can handle but communication was subpar. It took several calls and emails to get answers sometimes.   At our first tour, Kathie took tons of photos and would pose us at the wineries. This tour, we had to prompt her. It was a cloudy day so not the best for outdoor pics but I was disappointed we took most of them ourselves or had to ask her to take the pictures.   Our tour was April 11, it is now almost 2 mths later I haven't received the few pictures we took. I emailed twice and have finally heard back that the SD is apparently not working. I'm not sure why I had to email to find this out, seems like this info should have been divulged as soon as the problem presented itself.   I hate to downgrade the star review but my second time with this company just wasn't as epic as the initial tour I took with them. The wineries all seem to love this company though.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: I would recommend you take your money elsewhere. The owner Cathy is the rudest person to deal with  and doesn't know manners or customer service. She is unprofessional and just straight out rude. Highly suggest on another place to go to.

reviews.author: Barbara H.
reviews.description: We had a small group of three, but did it right with a Discover Texas Wine Tour limousine. DTWT was very accommodating, scheduled the wineries we wanted to see, ordered the lunches, and then confirmed our selections a couple of days prior to our tour. At the last minute after visiting with a couple in our third stop, we changed our fourth stop to a different winery. Jason (our driver) was happy to accomodate us. My only regret is that we didn't choose a few wineries a little further out of town, so we could spend more time in the limo listening to our Willie Nelson songs. Jason was awesome, and I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Vicki C.
reviews.description: We started researching half-day wine tours for my BFF's bachelorette party several months in advance and chose this company because of its good reviews and cancellation policy (full refund up to 7 days in advance).   First, the bad news. The booking process is way more arduous than it should be. My initial discussion about the tour plans happened over the phone, so I asked for a written, e-mail confirmation of what we had discussed - specifically how the deposit and refund policies work. It took me more than three weeks to get that first e-mail confirmation of our booking and deposit payment. I then went back and forth, back and forth, back and forth with the company, hammering out the details, like setting a pickup location and our choices for the winery stops. Many times, three weeks would pass and I'd have to make multiple attempts before I would get a response to my e-mails. Sometimes, the responses would be incomplete and we'd repeat the process of trying to get information confirmed. Seriously a pain for an experience that costs $129 per person.   Now, the good news. The online payment portal for each attendee was a breeze to use and eliminated the need to handle money all through one person. As for the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, Bobby, was on time and wonderful on the day of the tour. He was funny and polite and had good knowledge of the area. Also, very importantly, he was a good and safe driver! The Mercedes bus we took was very clean and spacious, and they provided water, cups and napkins. They also allowed us to bring our own food onto the bus. The three wineries we visited, Driftwood Estate, Duchman and Fall Creek, were all accommodating and fun. The views were lovely and we never felt rushed and made it back on time. It was raining when we got back to our car, and Bobby was so nice and helped us get our stuff back into our car in the pouring rain.   All in all, despite a wonderful wine tour, I'm not sure I would recommend this company, only because I spent way too much time hounding them throughout the booking process. While the wine was excellent, I NEEDED to drink after dealing with their horrible communication. Discover Texas Wines should strongly consider re-evaluating their communication practices and hire more people to keep up with the demand for their service. It's the only way they will stay competitive in the long-run!

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with Discover Texas Wine. Kathie was wonderful to coordinate with, and took care of all our tour requests. Howard was a great driver and had fun music. Lunches were very tasty. Would definitely recommend for any bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Abby S.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today on a wine tour for a bachelorette!! "Magic Mike" was the best driver and so much fun. Very reasonable price for the amount of time we spent, and an awesome car. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Dripping Springs for my bachelorette party. It was so great! Our driver, Roy, is what made it all so wonderful! I would highly recommend him!! He took lots of photos for us and kept us cool with cups of water.  We went to Driftwood Estate (beautiful views and grounds), Duchman family winery (beautiful Tuscan architecture), and Driftwood (had the best wines!). We did a half day and it was the perfect amount of time.   Couldn't have been any better! Thanks Roy!!!

reviews.author: Cyn H.
reviews.description: Had a great time on my stretch limo wine tour.  Hawk's Shadow was the favorite of the wineries we visited.  Bobby was our driver. Polite and helpful and knew to not be too chatty. Made our wine tour effortless and fun. An event to remember!

reviews.author: Carly J.
reviews.description: Wonderful private winery tour with Amanda.  So much fun!  Amanda was awesome and knowledgeable.  We had a great time!

reviews.author: Calley N.
reviews.description: We used this company for  a bachelorette weekend the company was extremely hard to work with. Communication with the company was extremely difficult. However, Mike (magic mike) completely turned a ruined weekend around. He was so nice and fun he sang to us and played guitar. I have never met a more generous and kind person. It might take you sending 3 emails to get responses from the company but definitely use Mike for your tour!

reviews.author: Kate E.
reviews.description: First off our driver, Roy, was the absolute best! He picked us up on time, was incredibly friendly, and funny even though we were a bachelorette party and knowing the possibility of it getting crazy with 7 girls. Seriously, request Roy. He made the trip a blast. There was cold water for us in the bus. Oh did I mention it's a Mercedes bus? Super nice! An AUX cable was available to play our own music too. The selection of wineries was amazing, perfect mixture between red and whites/dry and sweet, so every one of us could have something tasty. The drive was beautiful and not too far out of Austin. Overall, I am very impressed with this tour and the wonderful employees. Would definitely go again.

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I booked a Discover Texas Wine Tour last weekend for a Bachelorette Party. It was amazing! We had such a great time despite the somewhat unpleasant weather. Noel was so great and answered any questions we had before the tour. He was so accommodating and recommended some great wineries to us! I would definitely book with them again and recommend them to friends!!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Held an event with Discover Texas Wine Tour for my business and wanted to thank them again for a wonderful day. We booked this as part of a fundraiser/auction and it was such a success. The bus was wonderful, the driver was great and everything was timed perfectly. Highly recommend Discover Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Dominique S.
reviews.description: Absolutely do not recommend using this company. I made the reservation back in January, gave my card for deposit and was told I'd be emailed a link for everyone to pay. Over the next two months I called and emailed asking about the link so my friends could pay their part and I was repeatedly told they were having issues. Okay fine, no big deal- I also emailed again saying we can just pay the day of if the link wasnt working and never received a response. The day before our tour, as I was driving from Dallas to Fredericksburg I get a call from Some guy at the company and he seemed very annoyed with me saying no one had paid yet. Um.. I'm sorry I didn't realize you finally sent it after months of my asking. (He had sent it the day before calling me to tell me no one had paid) The vehicle I requested was not the one that showed up. The driver Julia was late bc she did not write the address down correctly. We also had 3 girls cancel last minute, so we were down to 5 instead of 8. Considering there minimum is 5 I wasn't expecting that to be a problem but Julia felt the need to bring it up multiple Times as if it caused some inconvenience for her. Rude people, horrible communication.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our full day tour! None of our group had been to the Texas wine trail, and our Driver Roy was absolutely spot on picking our 4 stops. Roy was a true gentleman and really took good care of our group all day long, making this a truly great experience. Noel was very helpful in booking us, even with a last minute addition to our party. I will be using these guys again in the future, and would recommend anyone who is looking for a first time trip to do the same.

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: What a fantastic time! Organizing a full day wine tour for 50 people in the Texas Hill Country may not sound like an easy task, but Noel at Discover Texas Wine Tours made it smooth and most importantly, unforgettable. His main goal is to make sure everyone is comfortable and has a good time! Most companies were not able to host a group this size, but Noel made it happen. He made sure our bus was the best he could find, worked to have a lunch catered for us at one of the stops, set up private tastings with many of the wineries to accommodate a group our size, even stopped to let one of the guys who didn't drink wine buy some beer. I can't say enough good things about Noel and how hard he worked for our group. I highly recommend him and look forward to another tour with him soon!!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Had a fantastic time visiting the Fredericksburg wine country with Valet for a Day. We had 6 adults, but our bus would have easily held double that (I didn't count the seats).  Rick was our main point of contact for inquiries, as well as our driver for the day. He was super easy to work with and helped us figure out what we really wanted to do. We had to get picked up from the Horseshoe Bay Resort (which is about an hour from Fredericksburg). So, we were able to visit two wineries (Becker and Bingham) and one distillery (Garrison Brothers). Garrison Brothers was the favorite by far and we ended up eating lunch there, too. Garrison also has tours starting at 10 while most wineries don't start until 11. Rick helped me work out a feasible schedule and then I had to book the tours themselves (which was more of a challenge than I thought because you're trying to coordinate specific times for specific places and one site will time out before you finalize, etc). So, by the time those were booked, we ended up having to alter our schedule and Rick was great about it. He showed up on time. The bus itself was fabulous. He had custom coffee orders ready for us, plus sodas and water onboard, as well as snacks (bags of chips, crackers, Snackens, etc). We were on time for every tour and never felt rushed. We were also back on time, which was important to me since we had to pick up our kids from the kids club. We paid a deposit up front and the balance a few days before our tour. Then, we paid tips in cash on the day of. I would absolutely recommend them and would use them again.

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: Rick was wonderful! He was very responsive from the first time I reached out to inquire all the way through dropping us off. He was very thorough making sure he knew times and where to pick us up. I never once had to follow up with him while planning, or even day of, because he was always very proactive in checking in on our details. He and his wife renovated the bus, and it has an awesome, comfortable, yet trendy vibe. He had waters and cokes for us on the bus, and his wife made homemade cookies for my husband's birthday! And he took coffee orders to have ready for everyone after a fun day at the wineries! It was a very custom experience, and he made it easy and enjoyable. We will definitely be calling him when we come for our next trip!

reviews.author: Emil V.
reviews.description: My family had an excellent experience here. It was a Friday night but we were still seated immediately. Our waitress was prompt with our drinks. We ordered a beer flight. I love being able to try all the different beers on tap. There were two beers that were not available but she was able to replace those two with some seasonal beers. She did fail to mention that it was an up charge for the holiday beer but it was just a few dollars so we didn't fuss.   My wife and I split the ale burger. We got it on the jalapeño cheddar bun. It was VERY good. We we're presently surprised. We weren't too hungry, which is why we split the burger. It was still enough to fill us up. We also ordered an extra side of fries. We LOVED their fries. Didn't have to add salt or ketchup. They are great.   We really enjoy this place!

reviews.author: Kristin C.
reviews.description: We were seated pretty quick. It's got a great atmosphere.  Like many restaurants they're under staffed . I know our waitress did her best, and she was new. It took her a little while to get to our table. When it was time to order our food, I was looking to get pizza. However, when asked what we'd like to order, she said there's no pizza. I had to quickly make a decision on something else. It would have been good to know when we were seated. We did ask to sit down in the benches, but they told us that it was only open on Saturdays and Sunday's and only apps were served (we went on a Sunday). When we received our food, my friends sandwiches and I were good, but my moms schnitzel was over cooked so we had to send it back . The second one came out fine and pretty quick though.  Overall it was fine, but I probably wouldn't go back.

reviews.author: Mark N. T.
reviews.description: I wanted some German-style beer and food. I asked Google and Yelp. It was hard to pick up one. I walked around Main street. I checked a couple of the restaurants. Fredericksburg brewing looked like the most friendly.  I entered the inside. The servers escorted me to a table. I got beer. It was so good. I ordered a schnitzel. The schnitzel resembled Texas chicken steak. Probably, the chicken steak is some variant of schnitzel. Anyway, It was good.  The server asked me for one more beer. I ordered it. I was drunk. I was walking to my hotel. I found some street signs that said " Pearl Harbor Memorial Highway". The name was a hangover medicine to a Japanese guy. I became sober.LOL.  If you are looking for some German food, please check this restaurant.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: Been Many, many, many moons since we have visited Fredericksburg Brewing....The town has A lot to offer when it comes to food, but this trip....after tackling Enchanted Rock, we had beer on the brain. They Offer a great Flight of 8 2oz beers....a little bit of everything. I mean if you order beer, you have to order a soft pretzel...its a must for us.....Sooooo Good!!....Main course....I went with the Wurst Sandwich Loaded with a Knackwurst, sauerkraut and fries on the side....Boy do I miss sauerkraut in my life, and the whole sandwich paired great with the Beerz...Wife had the Cheddar Ale Soup served in a bread bowl. Everything was just about perfect...including the service!!

reviews.author: Graham E.
reviews.description: Possibly some of the worst customer service I have ever come across in this town. My wife and I have tried to go multiple times and every time we are met with nothing short of complete disdain. Don't waste your time. There are much better options in town.

reviews.author: Elizabeth A.
reviews.description: This is a great stop for a beer. The first night here, Gaelyn was working at the bar and she was really nice. We came in 30 minutes prior to close but she didn't rush us at all and welcomed us to stay for a couple drinks. We saw the host guy trying to turn away a couple that came in for dinner and Gaelyn rushed over to welcome them in and she sat them at a table. The next night she was busy with the tables and kitchen; she seems to be a manager or owner, or a rare, hard worker.  The bartender the second night was also nice and helpful. We had the wings; they were different but good. Their beers were great and we'll definitely be back in on our next visit.

reviews.author: Sandy C.
reviews.description: So, we happened to try this place for the first time. All I can say is Wow! The food was so great. We also tried the Pretzel. I must say, it's the most delicious Pretzel I have ever had!!! And, I've had many throughout my life. Oh so Fresh, warm, right out the oven.  Not hanging on a rotisserie all day.  Man, I can't wait to come back next time I visit. The beers were really good! I tried the beer ( El Jefe) and it was my favorite. The lager was good, and others. You can even try samplers if you are not sure.  But, I must say, our waitress gets 10 points out of 10. She deserves a raise. I recommend Bianca.  Friendly, attentive, and the best attitude.  Because of all of the above, I am coming back!

reviews.author: Crystal C.
reviews.description: We really just come here for the beer flights! But I will say they do have some delicious pizza as well

reviews.author: Paul T.
reviews.description: Two words: TOURIST TRAP  The sign "oldest brewery in Fredericksburg" caught my eye and drew me in. After ordering a dark porter and their pretzels, I was In deep trouble.   The beer is okay, not too terrible. But what got me the most was the pretzel... it's just like the other reviews say.. it's like a microwaved / airfryer pretzel. Nothing spectacular about it. The 3 sauces were not authentic or original at all. Would not recommend coming back

reviews.author: Richard J.
reviews.description: My first visit to Fredericksburg Brewing, for dinner and also to stay the night.  The beer was good, and I enjoyed sitting at the bar.  Service was good, and the reuben, with fries, was satisfying.  I like the friendly, casual atmosphere.  I stayed on a Monday night, and I was the only one there, so it was very quiet.  I was in the Hill Country Lodge room, which faces Main Street.  The room was neat and clean, with cool themed decoration.  I'll definitely stay again to further explore the menu and try a safari-themed room.

reviews.author: Kausik S.
reviews.description: One of the two breweries in Fredericksburg, beers are OK, nothing to be excited or to rave about. Touristy and food is mediocre, overpriced.

reviews.author: Lorie S.
reviews.description: I ordered the roast beef sliders and beer battered fries. The roast beef was chewy. The fries were NOT BATTERED. They were the plain cheap fries.  I even mentioned it, the waitress said they weren't traditional beer batter fries.   Up side-the porter was tasty.  Stick to beer at this establishment

reviews.author: Kate M.
reviews.description: I ordered from here after calling around a few places and they one of a few doing take out.  The beers looked like they had a good selection but I did not try any.  The food was better then I was expecting given the reviews.  We ordered a pretzel, schinken schnitzel and sausage sampler, salads, regular and sweet potato fries.  I was disappointed there wasn't a more basic wiener schnitzel or spaetzle on the menu, those are German favorites.  The schnitzel and pretzel were good.  The sausage sample was great, all three were delicious.    I was so glad I got it to go, the COVID precautions were nonexistent, backed indoor dining and barely anyone with masks including bartenders and severs.  Thank goodness at least the hostesses were wearing masks, but I was uncomfortable being in the front door.

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Beer - what they still had on tap, anyway, as my first two choices they were out of - was OK. Food was not. Chicken fried steak was fatty. Pretzel was meh. Pizza oven was broken. Spicy green beans were pretty good, though.   So - yeah. If you like green beans, check it out. Otherwise, save some dough and hit up a liquor store and Whattaburger on 87.

reviews.author: John T.
reviews.description: Super fun atmosphere and great service! Easy access to Main Street and plenty of nearby parking.  Unfortunately the schnitzel is kind of chewy not the most appetizing.  The big pretzel was good, though!

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: First off, people keep writing the reviews like this is some kind of authentic German restaurant.... NO!  It's a BREWPUB.  It's a brewery with great beer and some good foodies.  Don't expect more.  If you want authentic German food, don't pick a brewpub!   This is a place to drink some really good beer, unwind, visit, drink ..  have a little grub. I've never had anything bad here. I know it's in one of the busiest parts of Fredericksburg so I expect to wait.  I expect, busy.   You can't beat a simple chicken club.

reviews.author: Gr V.
reviews.description: My wife and I have eaten here 3 times and every time we leave saying why did we go there? This last time was the most horrible. We went for the lights on a Wednesday and figured we would get a bite first. Well Wednesday we found out most the restaurants are closed so we reluctantly ate here again - Took 1 hour to get food - Food was cold and stale - Salmon was rock hard and needed a steak knife to cut -Service was horrible - Once waitress new her tip was lost I had to go to counter to get out of the place  Sorry 3 strikes and this place is out. Overprice and totally underperformed.

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Fellow Vegetarians, please get the Portabella sandwich!!!! Holy cow! The mushroom was cooked to perfection. Tender and accompanied by grilled tomato, meaty swiss, and a side of your choice (I got the recommendation: mashed potatoes).   The Del Mar watermelon wine seltzer is PHENOMENAL! Perfect for a spring lunch.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Small limited menu. No mixed drinks. No frozen drinks. Very slow service. They're craft beer served on tap was good but not extraordinary...so other than the cool copper tanks I'm not sure what else to say about this place.   There's usually a line/wait to get inside. TIP: look at the menu and make sure you wanna to wait. We didn't think it was worth the 24 minutes to get seated.

reviews.author: Bill A.
reviews.description: Beer is very good, food is "OK".  We've been to F'burg Brewing Company many times over the past 10+ years during our regular trips to F"burg; probably hit FBC 2-3 times a year.  Nothing seems to have changed since our first visit in 2006.  Very good beers with a good variety of beers on draft from the inhouse brewery.  Never tried their wine or cocktails, after all it's BREWERY!!  Their menu has lots of options with a small focus on Germany food, but also offers pizza, sandwiches, salads, burgers and central texas offerings.  In Houston, we have VERY limited options for Germany food, so I always opt for the German entrees.  This visit I had the  Schinken Schnitzel, which is nothing but the German take on the Italian Milanesa right down to the thin slice of swiss cheese and ham.  The BIG difference was the sauce, which I had served "on the side". and glad I did, it really took away from the flavor of the Schnitzel.  Nice piece of pork cutlet, but the breading wasn't nice and crispy as most.  Ordered Red Cabbage and Onion Rings for my two sides, both were served lukewarm (as were my wife's Onion Rings), but we missed lunch during the day and were too hungry to send it back.  My wife had the Ale Burger, nice burger but nothing standout about it; thick patty done medium well with cheddar cheese and the "salads".    Good meal, but nothing really notable about it.  FBC was our second choice for the evening and they are a good "backup plan" or "fallback" if others restaurants have a wait.

reviews.author: Adelina R.
reviews.description: If you are lucky enough to meet Jesse you will have the best time! He knew everything about the different brews and was very helpful in helping us decide on an entree! I was surprised to know he has only been with the brewery for 3-4 months. Very impressive to be so educated on the menu items and being so helpful in our selection. Thank you Jesse!!!

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: I heard the Scripps no longer own Altstadt.   The touristy vibe now makes all the sense!  Such a shame too because this place was an establishment that was old world meets high class .... WAS ...

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: We had heard how great the Restaurant was.....It was pricey but we don't mind that if the food was as awesome as we had heard.  They have limited menu....they didn't have some bar and menu items available which we didn't find out till we ordered.   We ordered and appetizer...Sausage that came with 3 Grilled Sausage a tiny pile of Sauerkraut a couple of types of mustards....tasty.  I ordered the German potato/onion soup.  It was a bowl of plane cream soup.  We ordered the hamburger that came Fries....nothing special,  Flavorless.  There fries were warm, dry thin....served in a small bowl.  The server recommended the bread pudding....again we were hoping for something awesome.  It was a slice of a loaf of bread pudding on a plate of Carmel....warmed but still cold in the middle. The dark beer and wine were good.  We lost our server mid service.... After we got our bar order....we witnessed the Bar tender picking his nose  and digging at something in his teeth.....we brought that to the shift managers attention.  Our meal was $68.00....not including tip. Kinda steep for A Burger, Soup, Appetizer, Beer , Wine  and desert mediocre quality.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: 2 stars bc the beer was excellent, and our waitress was so great.  Other than that, until they can get their staffing issues under way, I would not waste your time.  It took us 2 hours to get our food and when we got it it was cold and terrible ... I had such high hopes for this place ...  Our poor waitress was working her but off and was so apologetic... this was not her fault ... the manager came over and comped our entire meal and gave us gift cards for our troubles.  They did right by their mistakes and for that I was thankful ... I really hope they get their staffing issues under control, because the venue is awesome!

reviews.author: Haleigh P.
reviews.description: Such a large brewery! Beautiful grounds and the inside is just stunning! They have beautiful grounds and an outdoor garden to enjoy. They have the pouring station upstairs, but there is also a pouring bar downstairs with comfy seating, bar seating, and a large TV. Low lighting so definitely a cool mood downstairs vs upstairs. We stumbled into a part that looks like they host events like possibly weddings, which would be amazing! -- came here on a whim so they guys we were with could have some beer since they weren't much of wine drinkers. They had a good amount of beers to choose from and they offer flights, all of which were good that we had!   I wish I took more pictures because it was Like a castle!

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: Worth a visit if you are in Fredericksburg! They have a beautiful outdoor patio (one in back for drinks only and then another in front that connects to a full service restaurant). I'm not a beer drinker but decided to give it a try just for the views!   They have some good wines to choose from- don't be discouraged to visit here if you are not a beer drinker. Also, their restaurant has some cool options for German fare. Almost everyone in my family tried the chicken schnitzel which I would absolutely recommend.    I give 3 stars because they do not have full service (nor can you order off the food menu) in the rear patio. It's such a beautiful space- would definitely make the place more attractive if this change was made.

reviews.author: Jamyal L.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden gem! Stopped in for a unplanned Saturday lunch. Amber brew was amazing and followed by a great meal. Recommend the chicken schnitzel/green beans/mashed potatoes. Comparable to the ones I've had In Europe. The customer service was amazing and the manager (Lara from LSU) was excellent. No issues at all. Will visit again soon!

reviews.author: Jeff H.
reviews.description: This was our second visit and we really enjoyed a nice relaxing, mid-week lunch with a couple beers on the outdoor patio.    Our first visit was earlier last year on a holiday weekend and it was bit more stressful in terms of crowds and COVID concerns.  The staff all were all masked, but almost none of the patrons wore masks entering or inside the restaurant.    Recommend a week day visit instead of the busier weekends.   Beers were very tasty.  They have one of the better Pils in Central Texas and after living 20+ years in Germany, I think I am qualified to make this statement.   On the food side it's not German, but better described as pub grub.  Everyone was happy with their burger, spicy chicken sandwich, fish and chips, the Reuben and the Jäger Schnitzel made with chicken.    It wasn't gourmet, but it's a great place for a family gathering.   Oh, our server Karolina was excellent; she provided just the right amount of contact.    Ein Prosit!

reviews.author: Dianna N.
reviews.description: Very good, very nice, I like it. Huge place but not really a brewery. You can't even explore in here. Only worth going if you want to try the German food, which was fantastic! The beer flight was nice, smooth like butter. Sandwich was huge, the roast beef was delicious. I really like the potato soup, simply but hearty. The chicken with  mashed potatoes was my favorite.  Reminds me of Switzerland

reviews.author: Tanya B.
reviews.description: What a beautiful venue! We loved the scenery and the live music!  We had a larger party so I was excited they were able to accommodate all of us. The waitress was a hustler and for being short staffed she really did hustle. Thankfully they had food runners to help.  I ordered the potato soup and the sausage platter and we shared the meat and cheese charcuterie board.   The soup was perfect! It was warm and smooth and had a really great flavor!  The sausage platter came with three different types they were all good and it was a good complement to the soup. Honestly I could have shared both dishes and still been full it was a lot of food!  The charcuterie board was good, only tried a few pieces since I had so much food already... the goat cheese with the spiced pears was a great combo!  I tried just a bite of the spicy chicken sandwich... I thought it had a good flavor, but looked like pressed chicken.  My daughter got mac n cheese which she didn't care for.. I'm pretty sure they use a beer cheese which as a beer drinker I loved but she was not as big fan.   The flight of beer was definitely worth the price! I really enjoyed it.   My only true gripe was the chicken strips they brought my nephew- they were beyond burnt. I mean I was shocked when the waitress put them on the table.. my nephew ate a bite tried a second bite covered in ranch and was not going for it. I couldn't blame him. That was disappointing the cooks should never have platted them those belonged in the trash.

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: I would recommend this place however, I do have some reservations about Altstadt.  In today's climate, I try not to negatively review a place for its slow service. That being said, the service was particularly slow. Our server was nice but it took far too long for a group of four who just got drinks and two appetizers.  I unfortunately will probably never come back again as I was visiting. But I would give it another try as the beer and appetizers were delicious.  I was just disappointed in the wait and hope they improve. Atmosphere was cool given the building and would recommend simply for the feel of it.

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: I don't have enough nice stuff to say about Altstadt. It's a must see if you're ever in Fredericksburg. Beautiful location and grounds. Good food menu, lots of beers to try, wine on the menu, a speakeasy style downstairs bar, live music. It had everything. We went twice on the same two day trip.

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a late 3pm lunch on a beautiful and busy Spring Saturday in April. Seated on the outside patio with no wait.  The Festbier was crisp and refreshing, but my second choice; the Schwarzbier (stout) is still my favorite here- it's smooth, creamy, with low bitterness (for a dark beer).  Their burger was fairly flavorful but a little overcooked. The added bacon was above average. A solid burger but probably not worth the $18 price tag (~3.5/5). Fries were thin and slightly crispy and warm.   For dessert I tried their homemade brownie with vanilla ice cream, raspberry jam, and chocolate syrup. Excellent! Needed a bigger scoop of ice cream though...  Great service. A solid 4.0/5 stars Uggg he still...

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: BEAUTIFUL brewery. Absolutely stunning building inside and out. Staff was very friendly and helpful! The wheat aroma outside can be overwhelming but it just means they're inside working hard making great beer!

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to visit here. I wasn't disappointed. The food was great and was truly cooked to perfection. The array of beer selections was satisfying. The Oktoberfest was truly my favorite, but all the beer I chose were great. I love the Hefe, but here it was so much better! Great chill spot to relax outside!

reviews.author: Katherine R.
reviews.description: Waited to be seated for 10 minutes with no greeter. Then we were seated and waited 10 more minutes with multiple servers passing us and not acknowledging our existence. Would not recommend. We left and the greeter did not even say a word or try to fix the terrible service.

reviews.author: Kausik S.
reviews.description: This is the second brewery in Fredericksburg area located 5 miles outside downtown Fredericksburg, other one being the oldest Fredericksburg brewing Co which is in downtown. The brewery has a taproom where they serve their house beers, most of which you can also get at Total Wine or Specs. Main building has the restaurant, while extensive, their menu was not that impressive and is overpriced. Due to COVID protocols, no more brewery tours. There's another overflow area called Tractor Museum if the main restaurant/building is at capacity where they serve the same beers, but no food. They are not pet friendly!

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Altstadt Brewery is like a little piece of Bavaria in Texas!   It was the esposo's birthday last weekend and we decided to visit Altstadt for Sunday brunch. This was our first time visiting the brewery and we didn't know we had to make reservations (woops!). The wait time was about an hour, but they have outdoor open seating where you can grab a beer and wait until your table is ready.   Pro tip: If you are waiting for your table. Don't buy beer at the bar by the entrance, which is super crowded. They have another bar by the music hall which was empty.   Once our table was ready we decided to sit outside and enjoy of the fall weather. I order the JÄGERSCHNITZEL and it was amazing! The dish comes with hunter sauce, mashed potatoes, braised red cabbage and seasonal vegetables. I would definitely come back to Altstadt just for their jagerschnitzel. Our waitress was amazing and she made we never ran out of beer or food.   Due to covid, they are not offering tour of the brewery. But if you visit don't forget to walk around their beautiful beer garden.

reviews.author: Crystal C.
reviews.description: If you're with a large group like we were, you're bound to have some people that wanna skip the wine and go straight to beer. This is the place! The flights were awesome and the staff was very helpful :)

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: Maybe this review is a sham, because I personally did not order or drink anything except water, but wow the atmosphere is absolutely stunning. There is automatically a wedding vibe when you walk in. My fiancé ordered a flight which he enjoyed tasting and his dad enjoyed his drink too. There's a really classy but yet chill vibe as you relax and look out at the scenery. I still cannot get over how beautiful the architecture was though. Lovely atmosphere for drinking.

reviews.author: Julie V.
reviews.description: This place! We just accidentally found it! I'll try to explain, but you have to see it for yourself.  It's 5 star food. It's off the beaten path, but close to everything downtown. It's also a beautiful resort style lodging. Very romantic . It's a small intimate venue, live music, 5 star service, such great ambience. You can have conversation and fun and wow, the wine. Just go. (Even though I said it's 5 star food , it's very good prices.)

reviews.author: Brad N.
reviews.description: This is an interesting place. I have to admit, when I first heard "club with live music" from my girlfriend, I expected something inside, loud, fancy etc. Instead, The Club at Barons CreekSide is an open, outdoors-y place that, at least on our visit, was being entertained by a solo keyboardist/singer doing standards and covers, and doing them pretty well! We arrived, unknowingly, close to kitchen closing, but our host (one of the owners, as it turns out), seated us at a nice table with an umbrella, and said we could feel free to order food if we did so soon.   The drink menu is basically beer and wine, but there are good selections of each. We settled into a glass of wine each and pondered food. I chose the Cajun gumbo, and my girlfriend asked for the sweet and salty panini. My gumbo was a surprisingly rich and delicious bowl, with a good dark roux and blackened chicken and sausage, with a generous portion of rice. It was very nice. The panini paired raspberry chipotle jam and Dijon mustard with ham and turkey to make a very delightful and complex flavor package, and the bread was properly toasted and pressed. Again, a nice dish.   It was a beautiful early fall evening, the lighting was modest and right, the crowd was light but very into the music, and it was just a wonderful time to spend outdoors with a glass of wine and some food. Personally, I'd like to see a more broad wine list and maybe some cocktails, but really, it's pretty darned good just the way it is. Definitely check out this off the beaten path place if you're in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Leslie J.
reviews.description: Come for the sunset and a drink in the patio seating area (but near a busy road). Then depart.  Food more like "bar fare" and priced like nice dining establishment. Shout out for Pleasant service and super casual vibe, just not very good selection and price point not aligned with quality.

reviews.author: Chris V.
reviews.description: Wow! Just wow. Close but off the beaten path, this place is AWESOME! Great service. Great atmosphere. Great food. Intimate relaxed atmosphere. Live music while I was there.

reviews.author: Ms C.
reviews.description: We had a great time. The staff was welcoming. The wine was delicious. The food was good. Everyone seemed happy to be there. From the employees to the customers. Did I mention the sunset??  We recently had dinner at Bryan's on 290 in Johnson city. The food was delicious, but the owner was surly and the waitstaff seemed hostile. The Club is what Bryan's on 290 should be. They should take lessons. Tonight was all in all a lovely experience. We will be back.

reviews.author: Maria C.
reviews.description: My husband and I spent a weekend in Fredericksburg and on our last night we had dinner at The Club at Barons Creek. The patio , the views and the Ambience were amazing . The host and service were very friendly. The live music was excellent, it was Justin Macfarland and his wife playing that night! They were so good we stayed for 3 hours just drinking some wine and enjoying the food and music . We had the charcuterie board which was nice , the paninis were delicious and their cheesecake decadent. It was a chilly night but they had heaters and blankets :)Definitely recommend and can't wait to come back :)

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: I looove this place.  There's something just so unique about it.  The foodies they have are excellent.  Drink selection is fabulous.  Music is good.  It's funky seating and parking so I suggest going early.    I really want to spend more time here, but it's off the beaten path so I forget about it all the time.    Go!  Enjoy yourself and have a cheers to me.   As a local it's one of my faves.

reviews.author: Patricia A.
reviews.description: Service was very friendly. Food was good but very limited menu, possibly due to Covid. Wine selection was good. Live music was very soothing. Best part was probably the overlook for the photo opportunities.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: We came here for Thanksgiving and the food was amazing and the service was even better! The atmosphere was great and we loved Simon!!

reviews.author: Johnny A.
reviews.description: Came to the Club to drink some wine, eat dinner and listen to music.  They are dog friendly, so we brought Sam the Pug.  The Baron Cuvée Rouge wine was great.  We shared the cheese platter and the wife had the turkey panini and I had the shrimp tacos.  Everything was great.  We had a great time

reviews.author: Erica L.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly and helpful. The patio is beautiful. Wish we would have been seated on it instead of at a table that is basically in the parking lot but we were still able to have a great view of the gorgeous property. Food was decent. I had the Caribbean tacos, the shrimp and veggies on them were great but it was on store bought tortillas and the rice and beans served with it were very bland. Husband had the gumbo which he says was decent but not super flavorful either. Wine was delicious. I had the Rouge. Live piano music was a great addition. Didn't stay as long as we'd have liked because the table with a large party right next to us was a bit loud and obnoxious but would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Shana B.
reviews.description: We started our weekend here and was overwhelmed with how nice people were ! The music , the wine , the people , the food = top notch and they definitely have a repeat customer in us ! Thanks for such a wonderful evening !

reviews.author: John Z.
reviews.description: The first thing you notice is the view! great location and good selection of wines and food to watch the sunset! The owners were super friendly and eager to chat with us! Definitely a regular stop now on our visit to Fredericksburg!!

reviews.author: H V.
reviews.description: Great place, laid back, good food, good drinks. Very relaxing.  Menu is small but good. Had live music, awesome. Polite, courteous staff. Make a reservation.

reviews.author: Danielle B.
reviews.description: Called ahead and they saved a table for us. Walked in about 45 minutes before sunset and got comfortable outside with some tasty wine and good German beer for the boyfriend. The live music was just the right speed and volume for our little romantic getaway. We had the gumbo and lasagna both with a rather good and fresh Caesar salads.   We took our drinks and went up to the watertower in time to watch the sun disappear into the horizon. Came back to some delicious peach cobbler a la mode and then listened to more live music. No one rushed us and the service was excellent from start to finish. Thank you, Daniel for an evening we will not soon forget.

reviews.author: Krista J.
reviews.description: Daniel and his team provided a great night, full of good food, music, drinks and laughs. They went above and beyond to assure our group had a memorable experience. Truly cares about their visitors. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Zabdi G.
reviews.description: Call to make reservations. That's a must!  I called the same day, opens at 5, and was able to get a table.   Excellent customer service. Hailey was very attentive and we did not go without water, wine refills or anything we needed. This is definitely one of their strengths.   Heaters are available and servers are very responsive to your needs.   Live music is great. If you like Elvis, the band playing on Saturdays are for you.   We ordered the cheese platter and it was more than enough for two people. There's so many combinations that this paired with your wine will suffice.   The chicken panini was shared and it was ok. Chicken was a bit dry but the rest of the night made up for it.   We went with the Conundrum by Caymus and it's absolutely clean and crisp for a white wine.   Overall a great experience and would recommend.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: We arrived without a reservation around 830 on a Thursday night. We were sat quickly at a high top located on the patio. The patio had a lot of decorative lighting and a small fireplace. The one man band played acoustic guitar and sang chill songs. The wine list by the glass was pretty large including red and white. I love Hill Country because appreciation of wine is apparent everywhere you travel. The server allowed me to taste one white before ordering a full glass and I appreciated the extra effort on her part. The two dinner entrees passed, but nothing stood out compared to our other Texas eats. I had a dinner portion Cobb Salad, typical ingredients and pretty fresh. My cousin ordered a taco trio and she was not jazzed by the rice and bean sides. The only thing that bothered the two of us was constant cigarette smoke. A table of four people near the corner of the building was chain smoking. Yea its outside but not the most desirable scent during a dinner experience!

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: We drove up to this place with our personal driver (we're visiting from Dallas) for a Bachelorette party. There are 7 of us - we just had dinner at Granite Lodge and we just wanted to grab more drinks from a local place! When we got out of the car the owner (unsure if she was the owner or manager) asked us if we had reservations. We did NOT, but she said she could seat us at a table outside. Totally great, we were excited! Before we sat down, she said VERBATIM: "we will seat you only if you won't split checks and only if you're nice to our staff. We don't want anyone drunk here". This lady insinuated that our money wasn't good enough and that we were going to be rude to her staff. We didn't even bat an eye and we left. The profiling that this lady did for her potential customers from Dallas was absolutely ridiculous. I will tell every single person about this experience. You'd think with such a hard year with COVID-19 this place would entertain customers willing to spend a hefty amount of money here! Guess not! All good though, enough being a horrible establishment

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: It was our first time to this restaurant and we were very pleasantly surprised by the wonderful intimate atmosphere of the outdoor patio and great live musicians. The menu is small but don't let that deter you, this place is definitely worth the stop if you like jazz/blues, a casual but romantic atmosphere, reasonably priced wine, and friendly service. Shrimp tacos were added to the menu, which were pretty good. The salad was tasty -- added shrimp to it. They had blankets on the backs of chairs in case it got cold outside.

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: When Marjan and I visit Fredericksburg, this is one of our usual haunts.  Sitting on Main, this is fashioned as a restaurant known for its "everyman" German food.  Nothing fancy here, casual environs, plenty of seating left and right of entry, with a large seating area in the rear, festooned with Germanic flags, flags of sporting teams, picnic table type seating in that area.  Immediately left of the entry is a bar seating perhaps 15 or so patrons.  The queue can be lengthy on any given day, witness the popularity of the establishment.      First a disclaimer.  Traditional German food of this style can be heavy, fried, sometimes greasy, but if this is your wont, go for it!  There are no salady, delicate dishes here.  But given that, properly prepared, the offerings can be quite tasty.  So, here are our thoughts.      First item.  When you visit Auslander, DO NOT ask for a table.  Request a seat at the bar!  Why, the dear reader may ask?  The wait will be much shorter, but most importantly, one gets to sit at the best seat in the house.  Face to face with engaging, entertaining bartenders, TV screens fore and aft, and sitting elbow to elbow with locals that are more than willing to share local wisdom...and erstwhile philosophy...at the drop of a hat!        Second, the bartenders will send your food order directly to the kitchen, shortening by a significant margin, your wait for their menu items.        Third, watching over the bar area, is Bevo, a beloved icon for us, parents of UT Austin grads!  Now that is what we call atmosphere!!  LOL!!!      Of the foodstuffs.  We have enjoyed their sausage sampler and their Reuben sandwich, sided with sauerkraut and potato salad in the former, and fries in the latter.  We considered these offerings very satisfying.  Marjan particularly enjoyed the Reuben!  But friends, nothing is a better companion to German foods than BEER!!  Our choice is always Chimay....Chimay Grande Reserve Blue!        There are iconic establishments in Fredericksburg.  We think Auslander makes the short list!  Drop in for a brew and a sausage!  We think you will enjoy...and sit at the bar!!   Be well!!

reviews.author: Rachel P.
reviews.description: We started with the fried pickles which were fantastic, but how can anyone mess up fried pickles?  I had the chickenschnitzel which I felt was just okay. It was very large portion and definitely got a lot of volume for my dollar, but the chicken was slightly dry and not flavorful, even with the gravy. The mashed potatoes and sauerkraut were solid sides but nothing remarkable. The bread is sweet and delicious.  My friend had the jagerschnitzel and said it was okay but lacked flavor.  The service was fantastic and the server was very attentive. We were seated quickly and the food came out fast.

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Monday dinner in Fredericksburg! Wanted to try German food after a long day of hiking. We were seated immediately. Restaurant decor is lots of fun clocks and murals.  We started with fried pickles and ranch. Portion was huge and ranch was delicious. They were well seasoned and very crispy.  I got the Jagerschnitzel with mashed potatoes and buttered corn. The schnitzel was crispy and covered in wine gravy and mushrooms. Flavor was savory and portion was large. Sides were ok, nothing to rave about but the meal was filling. My friend got the chickenschnitzel, which is topped with gravy. Also crispy and savory.   Good service, decent food, large portions.

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: My friends and I came here on our weekend trip to Fredericksburg and although the food was good, the staff wasn't as great. We put our name down on the waitlist and were told we'd have 10 minutes from the time we were texted to get our table. Since the estimated wait time was 45-60 mins, we decided to check out a few shops in the area. Once we received our text, it took us approx. 4 minutes to get back to the restaurant, only to find out that our table was given away due to us arriving past the 10 minute window. I completely understand that it was busy and they want to get people in/out as quickly as possible, but I did not appreciate the hostess lying to us about arriving 10 mins after they texted us. We could clearly see that we received the text 4 mins ago, so why not come up with a better reason for giving our table away?  Anyways, we were eventually seated and I ordered the Käsewurst. I was not a fan of the hot German potato salad or red cabbage, but the sausage was incredible! I was surprised by how large it was and it certainly filled me up!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: The lines were long on a Tuesday night, but I guess it is during the holiday season week (12/28). We waited 50 minutes, but we walked around Fredericksburg town.    Fried Mushrooms - life-changing! the outside was super crispy and the inside was super juicy! highly recommend trying this out    German Snack - this was decent, we wanted to try the german sausage    Jager Schnitzel - this was super crispy - but the sides were just okay.     Apple Strudel - super duper yummy dessert

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Casual German restaurant with good German bar food. The ambiance is kinda sport bar-ish when you walk in. It had traditional German decorations and a Biergarten in the back.   Kudos to them for being open on a Tuesday! We were on an off day in Fredericksburg and a lot of places were closed. It is a little touristy, but most of Fredericksburg is.   The Kasewurst was spicy and had cheese in it. It was also cooked just right and came with sauerkraut and your choice of side (I had potato salad, pictured below).   Overall, got what I expected which was decent, casual German food at a cheap price. I would stop by again but am curious to try other similar german food in the area.

reviews.author: Rick L.
reviews.description: Freindly bartender, cold beer and a great selection of German beers. All I tried were very good.   The food looked good as well but I didn't eat.

reviews.author: Brian L.
reviews.description: Spicy Texas schnitzel CRISP  Potato soup SALTY Salad NO! Spicy sausage SNAPPY   Fried pickles SOGGY  Beer battered mushrooms CRISP

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: Stop by Auslander for authentic German food when you're in Fredericksburg! The service is fast and prompt.   I highly recommend the Rinderbraten - I'm usually not a fan of pot roast but the whole sandwich was amazing - the gravy and fried onions really take it to another level.   My friends ordered the bratwurst and Jagerschitzel with all the sides. Very delicious.   Will definitely come again!

reviews.author: Elijah F.
reviews.description: I'm giving this place five stars because the service was phenomenal and they don't deserve the one star review the food does. I've never eaten a meal I could describe as absolutely mediocre. Not a single dish was bad but not a single dish could be describe as good either. I had the German snack appetizer, jaegersnitzel, the German meat balls, the Rueben, and the chicken fried chicken. And my kids got chicken strips and fries. And even the fries tasted of mediocrity. As of they were defrosted and re frozen and then fried. They tasted stale. The Rueben had the cheapest sandwich meat I've ever seen almost like tofu meat vegans eat. The German snack appetizer tasted like cheap sausage that was over boiled and then served with burger toppings . The snitzel had no seasoning and the gravy was bland. The German potato salad was just boiled potatoes. The meatballs looked like they were once frozen. I feel this place once was great or the location is just that amazing but if I lived here I would never eat here again. It's like someone opened a restaurant with the concept of making every dish taste like a microwave dinner.

reviews.author: Bert M.
reviews.description: Never have I eaten at a German restaurant before. This place is definitely a stop and experience. It seems to be "authentic". While we had to wait about 20 minutes, but we were here on a Saturday, so we expected to wait. Definitely try the Kielbasa. I had the one that had jalapeños and pepper Jack cheese. This was incredible. However, what would've gotten this restaurant 5 stars, would be if they made the portions bigger (instead of one link, make it 2). One just wasn't enough. The wait staff was prompt and attentive. Our overall experience was great. I recommend this place.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Our first dinner stop during this visit to Fredericksburg, and the Auslander did not disappoint! When I saw Rouladen on the menu, my search was over. Packed with flavor, Rouladen is thinly sliced or pounded beef covered in German mustard, bacon, onions and pickles, then rolled up and simmered in a rich brown gravy. If you've never had it, you must try it. You can thank me later. Here, they serve it over spaetzel, making for a hearty and very tasty dish.  Auslander has been around for many years, and is a true Fredericksburg stalwart. Pay them a visit when you come to town. And order the Rouladen.

reviews.author: Lydia N.
reviews.description: Weekend road trip to Fredericksburg and some German food is definitely in order, right? Stopped at the Auslander on a last minute whim. Seated us (2) right away and our server was a doll. Checked on us and always made sure we had water. Food came out pretty quickly too.  We ordered the fried mushrooms as an appetizer. Lots of greasy breading and served with ranch, which was interesting. I ate about 3 and decided I was beginning to feel gross. BF ended up removing the breading and just eating the mushrooms.   For entrees, I ordered the Jägerschnitzel and BF ordered the käswurst. My jägerschnitzel was cooked well and had a nice crunch, but the gravy tasted like a cheap powder package brown gravy from the store, not the red wine gravy I was promised. The mushrooms also tasted canned. The cabbage and mashed potatoes were good though and the dinner roll was sweet and pillowy. BF said the sausage tasted like the ones you get from the gas station, so all around not too impressed.   After leaving, the food kind of dropped in our stomachs like a ton of bricks. We definitely had to walk around for a minute. We probably won't be back, but not sure if it's the restaurant or maybe this type of food just isn't for us.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: This place is pretty packed in the main bar area as it was time for college football, but the servers are fast, and you feel some pressure to leave so they can turn the table. They have a great selection of draft beer in the traditional German mugs, and I do recommend the sausage plate as an appetizer (choose the spicy version) - nice sausage, fresh dark bread and excellent sauerkraut. We probably would have stayed for another draft beer (there were three couples) but getting the strong vibe they wanted to turn the table we ended up going across the street for another cold one and more appetizers.

reviews.author: Lesley J.
reviews.description: First time for my husband and myself, the food is so tasty, and amazing, the waitress was so nice. really nice atmosphere. We will definitely come back to taste the other dishes. There is a lot on the menu to choose from, and the drinks are delicious! I definitely recommend this place :)

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: Fun! I don't know if I've ever been in a German restaurant before, despite taking German in high school for a few years. The atmosphere is real cute and refreshing since we were able to eat outside.   My fiancé and his dad really enjoyed the beer there. The glasses are so cute! I was also intrigued by the red cabbage since so many Yelpers seem to enjoy it so I ordered that as my side. I personally thought it was a bit too sour for me, but my fiancé loved it. It's definitely packed with flavor though.   I also ordered the spätzle which I have heard mixed reviews about, but I personally enjoyed it. If we ever return, I'm interested in trying the bratwurst.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: We sat in the back patio that is open and plenty of ceiling fans.  Staff are friendly and helpful. I got the pork schnitzel and it was tasty and improved with his mustard.  It was crunchy and flavorful and the mashed potatoes and green beans hit the spot. Music was county and sometimes pop. Good selection of beer on top. The frozen sangria was a little tart for my taste.  Overall, good experience and recommended with reasonable pricing.

reviews.author: Don J.
reviews.description: This place on the main drag offers a great beer menu, including several classic German beers on tap, and offers a pleasant place to hang out. Outdoor patio is apparently heated in cold weather, although we decided not to brave it.   Food and service were just OK.  I got the German meatballs with spaetzle. Generously sized meatballs sit atop a pile of spaetzle that I thought were a little too soft. No kraut or veggie comes with this plate, which was pretty bland. My companion got the potato soup, which was really thin with no chunks of potatoes.  Even though the restaurant wasn't busy, we didn't see our server for long stretches, and once had to flag down a different server to get something.   We'll give this place another try, as the German sausage plates sounded good. If you're just looking for German beer and snacks, there's a bar area that's probably just right for you.

reviews.author: Helen R.
reviews.description: First time trying German cuisine and it did not disappoint. Both the food and our waiter were so nice! I had the frozen sangria and it was very delicious. Highly recommend all the dishes in our pictures. But the appetizer was the best!!

reviews.author: Quel S.
reviews.description: Delicious! Stopped in for a quick bite to share before heading to a wine tasting and loved it! Wish we were able to spend more time and try more dishes but we are heading back to Fredericksburg and our 1st stop is going back just for the Rueben and to found out what else we will enjoy!

reviews.author: Grizm B.
reviews.description: Great laidback outside venue nice tables and fire pits  great wine best sangria and light charcuterie board great music and great service nice comfy spot in very busy little town

reviews.author: Wendy S.
reviews.description: Simply amazing!! First time in town, found this on Yelp and WOW!  Like another review said - just go!!!

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: Wow! I really want to be "nice" and give this location 5 stars but what brought me to this place was the 5 star reviews on Yelp. I wish someone had just been more honest.  What I'd give 5 stars is the owners explanation and story about how he started his wine and bought the buildings in the small town that inspired him to start this vineyard. He truly loves it and that was conveyed to us.  However, the rest of the experience was def not 5 stars. We did 2 flights of the wine and 2 glasses of the Sangria. 3 of us drank and one of us just requested a Sprite or Coke. (Thank you to our designated driver.) We received our wine and sangria within about 10-15 mins but after 20-30 mins I had to get up and ask for the sprite. The server came over w a can of H‑E‑B twist and asked if this is what we wanted. Umm... we were fine w anything. He just requested a drink without alcohol but she left to ask the owner if that was what she was supposed to give our friend. ‍ He finally got his drink. Yay.  Ok... on to the wine flight. The way it was served was kind of unique. You get one wine glass w 4 very small mason jars of wine. (Definitely a taste)  You get one dry white and 3 dry reds. I like dry wine but these wines just tasted watered down. That's the only way I can describe them. The white tasted sour/bitter. We had been at Vintners Hideaway earlier and the wine tasting was an entirely different experience. We tasted 6 different glasses of wine and were given information on how to best smell, aerate and experience the wine. We were told about the flavors and what wines went best w different foods. It was a fun and interactive experience. Here, we got our tray w our wine samples and one glass and were told what order to drink them in. The end.  I'd give the wine tasting experience 1 star.  Now, the courtyard area is lovely. It's open and there are plenty of tables and chairs. There are 2 fire pits and there is a one room cellar you can walk down into w one table. We liked the ambiance. Maybe that is what everyone loves about this place?

reviews.author: Darrell G.
reviews.description: Excellent place!! Get the picnic basket and some Sangria for lunch and you will be very happy! The food is great.  The owners are super friendly.  The outdoor seating is nice and shaded.  Great experience!!

reviews.author: Amber M.
reviews.description: Wow! Just an amazing experience all around. The courtyard is so cute and well decorated. The staff, Chase in particular, was so friendly and knowledgeable. Not just about the wines but about the whole town. All the staff was so friendly and welcoming. I didn't feel pressured to purchase bottled like at some of the other vineyards. I will definitely be back.     Make sure to get some Sangria to go!

reviews.author: Arielle M.
reviews.description: Pontotoc not only had great tasting Sangria and wine, the area and customer service was great! We ordered a picnic basket, wine flight, and sangria. The homemade fixings in the picnic basket were tasty. The owner was very welcoming and accommodating not to mention interested in getting to know his customers. Highly recommend and would love to go back

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came here on the 14th with another party. We only ordered two beverages to include a Sangria and glass of vino.   The service here was excellent (the owners are very hospitable). The atmosphere outside was quaint. I noticed the establishment had a small wine cellar with a table and chair set up. It reminded me of the one we had when I was a child. The nostalgia of that aspect alone made coming here a great experience for me.  My guest had the Sangria which was nicely done. I had the glass of white and was not impressed with the body of the wine.  In general, this was a neat little spot to stop in and enjoy the moment.  #supportlocal #supportveteranowned

reviews.author: Katrina S.
reviews.description: We were in town for the weekend and wanted somewhere with an nice outdoor area. I would definitely recommend it here, it's a little bit further down from the main shops so wasn't as crazy. We were able to get a table in the shade which was very nice.   I would totally recommend getting the picnic basket to snack on. There were four of us and it seemed enough for a little something. The pimento was very good as was the cookie.   They had water sitting outside with glasses which is always appreciated when it's hot and you're drinking.   I would say they had a decent wine selection. Most of the group got the sangria and really liked it!

reviews.author: Andrew K.
