reviews.description: You don't need to read my review. Just go here!  Best sangria I've ever had, the wine flight was fabulous and the picnic basket was to die for. Perfect pimento cheese, hands down some of my favorite pecans, awesome sour dough and chocolate chip cookies with a sprinkle of salt.

reviews.author: Lisa G.
reviews.description: If you are visiting Fredericksburg or surrounding areas, PLEASE add this to your list of places to visit.  My husband and I celebrated our one year anniversary  visiting Fredericksburg. We made no plans of places to visit, we kind of just played it by ear BUT we're so glad we came across this place after enjoying a nice lunch.  When we walked in. We were immediately greeted by Frances, which we had no idea was one of the owners until towards the end of our visit. She was absolutely the sweetest with the most bubbly personality!  She told us a bit about the history of the vineyard while we enjoyed a glass of her delicious Sangria! It was so delicious and refreshing that I could not leave without taking a bottle. I regret not grabbing two more to bring back home but will definitely be stopping by again on our next visit to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: The owner greeted us upon arrival and gave us a brief history of the vineyard. He was so welcoming and educating and really made us feel like home and comfortable. We had the dry red and white along with the picnics basket that his wife makes and everything just tasted delicious! We can't wait to return.   We also had a sangria to go that also tasted amazing.

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: Our favorite place and is a staple when we visit Fredericksburg! Excellent sangria, food and wine flights!

reviews.author: Raechel T.
reviews.description: Absolutely adorable and a hidden gem.  I've been to Fredericksburg dozens of times and probably drove by without seeing the sign.   The outdoor seating is great and you don't really realize you're off of main street.  I loved the Sangria and the Tempranillo.  There's only a few people taking care of the tables, so the service is a little slower but they are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable.  It was cold the day we were there and they had a couple fires going.  The pimento cheese in the picnic basket was really, really good.  You can even take one of the picnic baskets to go. I highly recommend a stop here when you need a break from shopping.  There are picnic tables so you're good if you have more than 4 people.

reviews.author: Jill J.
reviews.description: OUTSTANDING wine, service, historical information.  HIGHLY recommend the San Fernando Academy (mostly Petite Sirah) and theory sangria! Will absolutely  be back!

reviews.author: Vincent G.
reviews.description: A must if you are in Fredericksburg!  Lovely family.  It was chilly out so they made a fire and kept it going for us.  Family owned business Sangria was amazing  Vibe was amazing  Lots of seating

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: This is such a nice change of pace compared to some of the other wineries in Fredericksburg! It's on Main Street so you're still close to everything in town, but they've got this sort of hidden patio out front that has a high fence and plenty of trees so that you feel like you're out in the country. They're always playing great music, and the staff are very quick and knowledgeable about their wines. Pontotoc is actually known for being one of the first vineyards to plant the Tempranillo grape, and their wine definitely shows that they know what they're doing. Their sangria is also delicious on a hot Texas day!

reviews.author: Catheryn G.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place in Fredericksburg. Their Sangria is amazing. It's not sweet, but it's still so refreshing. They have picnic baskets you can order with tons of yummy snacks and bread. They also make some amazing wines. Try the Tempranillo! They have plenty of outdoor seating and it's a great place to go with a group. Kids and pets are welcome.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: A very hidden gem in Fredericksburg.  A small, but excellent selection of wine.  My wife and I both had the Sangria along with their picnic lunch, which consisted of green olives, raspberries, an orange, homemade pimento cheese and brownies, candid Pecans, sour dough bread and summer sausage.  Everything was very delicious and hit the spot.  Outside seating only, a very relaxed atmosphere and a family business.  We found it by accident and were happy that we did

reviews.author: Kimberly H.
reviews.description: Amazing service, great wine and gourmet food!  The service was impeccable with friendly staff and knowledgable waitstaff. The Enchanted Rock white wine was crisp and refreshing.

reviews.author: Bill F.
reviews.description: Lovely wine garden with plenty of seating and shade. Tried the sangria and full picnic basket on the first day. I'm really not a pimento cheese person, but Frances knows what she's doing! Came back the next day for a tasting and ended up spending almost the whole afternoon chatting with the Moneys and buying wine to take home. Don't turn your nose up at their "All Texas Wines" because everything they make is so good. Smoothing Iron Mountain is real easy to drink even on a blistering afternoon. Nice Albariño is hard to find in a lot of places so we stocked up on their 2020.

name: Silver Creek Beer Garden and Grille
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: We were seated promptly. Smiling faces everywhere. Our waiter, Alfredo was so helpful and knew how to help without being overbearing. Very professional  The food was excellent- we all got something different(party of 4) and each tried a new cocktail. So so good. We were camping in the area and Came on the recommendation of a family friend and we will be back. Thanks for a wonderful evening

reviews.author: Sophia S.
reviews.description: My family and I came here on vacay in pursuit of some ~authentic~ German food. Since I've never had German food before, I have no clue what that means, but we did leave full and satisfied.  All of us pretty much ordered one of two Schnitzel dishes, virtually identical besides the accompanying sauce. We also got the German Sausage Plate to share, which was probably the tastiest and most interesting of the dishes. As a big fan of pickled vegetables, I did enjoy the side of Sauerkraut, but even that wasn't enough to cut the heaviness of the Schnitzel. In conclusion, not somewhere I would routinely visit, but it does have that comfort junk food appeal (with a German twist).

reviews.author: Susan P.
reviews.description: There's a lot of places to eat in Fredericksburg, tourism is their business but none beat Silver Creek's ambiance and setting.  Right on Main Street, they feature an outdoor dining area shaded by a magnificent tree.  Our lunch was accompanied by live music that was just the right volume.  And the food?   Well that's outstanding as well.  We started with warm German pretzel rolls and added a queso dip.  They disappeared quickly.  Our table had entrees ranging from a salad to fish and chips to brats and a Reuben.  All were good and featured authentic German sides. A lovely lunch.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a nice lunch here before our Saturday afternoon winery tour. The weather was perfect, so we sat outside and enjoyed the live music.  My bratwurst sandwich topped with saurkraut really hit the spot. I chose a side of German potato salad which did not disappoint. Accompanied by a cold Spatzel Lager, I was a happy camper.  My wife ordered a cheeseburger and fries. The burger was more than she could eat, and quite tasty.  Staff was friendly and attentive. Food was quite tasty. Atmosphere was fun. And they're dog friendly. How cool is that?

reviews.author: Hannah L.
reviews.description: I'd recommend stopping into Silver Creek Beer Garden and Grille for their Fried Brie appetizer and drink (or two) on their outdoor patio. The atmosphere is fantastic! It's, also, a great place to go if half your party wants German (Schnitzel, etc.) but the other half wants something else (Steak, Salmon, etc.).

reviews.author: Josh R.
reviews.description: They made us wait away before we were seated even though there were spare tables available. I ordered the "Our Famous Burger," and it hit the spot after hiking Enchanted Rock. It was a lot of food and tasted great. Even the bun was good. It was served with fries. We ordered bread pudding for dessert. The bread pudding wasn't my favorite, but it didn't taste bad. Just a FYI, the bread pudding  has nuts in it.

reviews.author: Joann G.
reviews.description: Dinner, drinks and live band tonight were great! Loved the atmosphere esp the big tree on the patio. The host and our waiter Brittany were superb! Love that it's dog friendly too. The shrimp scampi and cheeseburger were delicious! Def the place to be tonight. Thank you Silver Creek for a wonderful evening experience! Would recommend to anyone visiting.

reviews.author: Jason E.
reviews.description: I wish I could give this zero stars. I ordered the fish and chips, which for some reason is listed under "sandwiches", that should have been a clue!!  The fish was cooked to within an inch of its life. Fish is supposed to be flakey  and batter is supposed to be crispy. The batter was as hard as nails, way beyond crispy, and the fish wouldn't flake, even when attacked with a knife and fork!!   I'm English, been eating fish and chips all my life, it's our national dish. If there's one thing I know about it's fish and chips - and this was bldy awful. Only positive was they had malt vinegar!

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: We stopped here for a Black Friday dinner with another couple and were seated on the patio after a 30 minute wait. Slowwwww  service but a decent patio vibe with some nice CandW music playing.   Our Loaded Brisket Fries had good flavor but were served lukewarm and were far from "Texas sized." We were wanting a decent steak, but their 12oz Ribeye was average tasting but above average priced. The best part of the steak meal was their heavenly, creamy mashed potatoes. Wanted to like this place more....

reviews.author: Janet G.
reviews.description: The lowest rating I've ever given. Ever  The good. Andy at the front host stand was polite friendly and professional. He told us our party of 2 wouldn't be too long of wait for patio seating.  But patrons were not leaving and enjoying music after their dinner. For a long time. Okay. No biggie and out of the restaurants control. We actually saw some People sitting for several hours, as we had walked by the place earlier in the day.  About 30 minutes for a table we were seated.  We sat at a dirty table for more than 15 minutes. The dishes had been removed but it had not been wiped down. Not Good during this pandemic.  We waited and waited and waited. No server ever came by. At all.  So we left.  Very disappointing service.  I don't think we've ever left a restaurant like this.  Very disappointing and a waste of time.  Skip this place.

reviews.author: Taylor F.
reviews.description: Came up to Fredericksburg for a spontaneous day trip and had a blast! We stumbled upon this gem toward the night and the staff was incredibly welcoming. They had great recommendations for beers on tap.. shoutout to Gabriel and Chris who elevated the experience!

reviews.author: Rhonda T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times in past visits. I'm not sure what happened but out last visit 2 days ago was awful!! We waited to be seated while they were next to empty. We asked to eat inside we were seated and handed menus then for the next ten minutes we were totally ignored other patrons were brought food and drinks around us tick tock... waiter  went back and forth the place wasn't even full I kept wanting to give benefit of the doubt we still were not greeted water or anything then a family was seated right next to us and before they even opened their menu the waiter was bringing water to their table .......at that point we walked out. Won't ever return here.

reviews.author: Diane D.
reviews.description: Silver Creek never disappoints! Food, drinks and atmosphere are a big win for us.  That sausage plate really hits home, its so delicious!

reviews.author: Denver C.
reviews.description: Average food in tourist trap Main Street historic district. We stopped in hopping for some good German food. I had the Jaeger schnitzel plate, it was nothing to write home about.

reviews.author: Jamila C.
reviews.description: The food was delicious. However, the service and manager's attitude were horrible. There was a table of 11 of us and one of my friends didn't get her food until all the rest of us had started eating. The wait staff stated they were out of a necessary ingredient for her food and apologized for the delay. However, she ordered a second drink and they never brought that out either. We were all charged 20% gratuity and the manager was very confrontational with my friend. We will NEVER come back here and recommend that you don't either as long as this establishment treats their customers this way.  I asked for a manager and the server stated he was the manger. Absolutely unacceptable!

reviews.author: Adriana P.
reviews.description: Great sandwiches and music very busy for a Monday night friendly service! I recommend!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Showed up just in time on sunday. The rain had just stopped and this place has a beautiful outdoor seating right in front of the restaurant. Good crowd. Awesome drinks. All around good vibe from patrons to staff. It was a great experience.

reviews.author: Sherri M.
reviews.description: We had a great time with some amazing food. It was a great time and we truly enjoyed it. Mgr: Chris! Front door: Leo!!!! They both made our experience amazing!! Thank you foe making our time so rememberable!

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: We were a little hesitant to eat here based on the mediocre rating but we are so glad we gave it a chance! Outstanding service! Our waitress April never missed a beat! Our food was phenomenal! The brats were the best I've had, even including Switzerland! Fish and chips was delicious and the brisket fries were to die for! Beer was ice cold and the atmosphere was top notch! Will definitely be back! DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE!!

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: Truly was fabulous weather and food was great under the great tree on the patio  Host and wait staff wore masks and made effort to stay socially distant, also provided hand sanitizer as you entered Felt secure and confident about removing our masks while we enjoyed the food and live music at lunch. This helped us relax which was the whole point of our 2day trip.

name: Hondo's
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Gordon V.
reviews.description: Good place to get dinner in downtown Fredericksburg, and open longer than many restaurants. Outdoor dining area is pleasant even when hot, and the live music is nice.  The food is decent but not spectacular. Burgers are pretty good. First time I came, I ordered the green chile enchiladas but they come in a bowl and it's almost like eating soup... not what I expected!  Others have mentioned it but it's still worth noting that they basically have counter service now. That's hardly a problem, BUT it's easy to get confused because they'll seat you like you're in a full-service restaurant and not say a word about ordering at the bar. Then, even at the bar you can barely see the whole area by the kitchen with the drinks and other stuff.  I imagine we'll be back to Hondo's, but considering Fredericksburg is a major tourist town, it's not reasonable to expect visitors to sort all that out the first time without some ruffled feathers. But it all works out in the end.

reviews.author: Elies S.
reviews.description: Burgers were decent. That part didn't disappoint. They have those thin curly fries and I was excited because those are some of my favorite. We went on a cold night but definitely wished it would have been warmer to sit outside because that area looks cool.   We wanted to like this place more but the set up is what threw us off the most. You wait in line to put your name on a waitlist to sit. Then you get seated only to get up and wait in line to order at the bar. Only other negative thing I would say was service, we definitely got treated like we weren't locals. My husband asked if they had draft beer and the bartender was most definitely offended by the question, then did the "tapping the finger" thing while he looked at the bottled beer choices. oh But a guy and his wife walked up both bartenders demeanor changed. Happy, friendly, got drinks right away for them. Also...just threw us off.

reviews.author: Kirsten B.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like Hondo's more. It seemed like the perfect lunch spot after a morning of roaming Fredericksburg with our dog in tow. My husband sat on the patio with our dog while I went inside to order. This place is set up like a Panera, where you order your food then go pick it up from the kitchen when your buzzer goes off. The line to order was super long, but expected in a tourist district on a busy weekend.   The chicken sandwich was huge and juicy but was a little bland. The smoked turkey on a croissant was dry. My husband did enjoy his poblano chicken sandwich.   Overall, good atmosphere, really nice patio space, and so-so food.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: Decent, not spectacular food and service.  Seating/ordering is very strange. You check in, and you're shunted off to a back porch to be called up and seated. Then you have to order food and drinks at the bar, and pick up the food at a window when called. Not bad, but seems overly complex especially for the drop-in tourist.  The food's fine, but nothing to write home about. Decent hamburger, decent nachos, and decent chicken-fried steak. Kudos for a flavorful gravy and some cool Western decor, but that's about it. This place will work in a pinch for a group, but there are other options out there if you have the time and inclination.  This place scores a 3 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK having a nosh here with Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Lanee T.
reviews.description: Go for the atmosphere and drinks. Don't count on good food.  Still a fun place to people watch.

reviews.author: Steph M.
reviews.description: The burgers were delicious. We also ordered the queso and matchsticks and both were good. I tried the pineapple margarita and it just tasted like a cheap margarita. No pineapple flavor. Burgers were definitely a hit. Bathrooms are tiny and awkward. No wait staff. You order food and drinks from the bar.

reviews.author: Kari M.
reviews.description: We decided to come to Fredericksburg for a day trip and we're so happy we had lunch here! The wait wasn't awful and it was nice to be able to order drinks while we waited. Everything from the loaded waffle fries to the stacked green chili chx enchiladas were to DIE FOR!! Like my mouth is watering right now thinking about those wonderful enchiladas... I know my picture is shit but that's because we were too busy scarfing down our meals before I remembered to take a picture. I can't express how crucial it is for you to order everything photographed.  Can't wait to come back and eat here again!!

reviews.author: Amber M.
reviews.description: I really want to like this place. The food is decent but with all the restaurants around I refuse to wait in like for food, then have to pick up the food and then order a drink. The place is nice but the most of the staff is rude, service is slow and I was overcharged ok drinks because I was a tourist.  I've been here a few times and after 3 awful experiences I had to write a review. Go elsewhere !!!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: I was worried about stopping here on our brief Fredericksburg trip after reading some bad reviews, but I'm so glad we did stop!! This place is awesome. Margaritas are strong and cheap and the food was awesome!! I had the Rueben and it was soooooooooooooooo good! The husband had the enchiladas and he said the sauce was great. He wished it had defined enchiladas, but it tasted so good he didn't care. I strongly recommend for lunch on the patio!!

reviews.author: Traci U.
reviews.description: The food and atmosphere at Hondo's was amazing! They had live music on Friday night and we got there just in time... when we left the line was out the door to get in! We sat outside and the area was a fun, eclectic mix of tables, chairs, and rustic decor! The food was absolutely delicious! We ordered several items to share! Unfortunately, the food was so good, we forgot to get pics! Check out the menu though! You can't go wrong no matter what you order!

reviews.author: Edmarie L.
reviews.description: After watching Elder Eats and finally making a trip to a Fredericksburg we were happy to check out Hondo. The enchiladas were so tasty. They were gooey, tasty, and topped with big chunks of fajita steak. I did not originally think 5oz was going to be sufficient was I was gladly mistaken. My husband loved the Ruben, eating it so fast I never got a bite to taste. We also shared the trio of fries, chips, and onion straws. Each of the sauces served with appetizer were very good and I'm not normally a save person. We had to wait about 30 minutes, but didn't feel that was terrible given the time of day on a weekend we visited. The only tip would be to have the host explain the process when you check in, I was a little confused on ordering and had to ask around. We figured it out quickly, but would be helpful to other first timers.

reviews.author: Maria C.
reviews.description: A group of 11 of us visited this place off of a recommendation. It was pouring down rain on 5/22/21 and we were soaking wet as we entered the patio. So my review is based ONLY on the lack of customer service we experienced because we didn't even make to tables to eat.   The hostess had a very nasty attitude towards my party of 11. We all felt she had a very condescending tone in her voice. Upon entering out of the rain I asked how do we order and if we can. And her very nasty response led us to believe she did not want our business.   We found the bar with two men who again felt the need for some reason to just get us out and not care to share their menu so we just frantically found the simplest drink to order. I made it easy too ... paid for my party on one tab instead of having them ring up each drink and pay individually. Yes the margaritas were good and worth the $8 but geeze this place was brutal and honestly prejudiced towards us.   To the owners - please know that you have these types of people treating innocent customers upon entering the building this way. It's definitely a turn off and will hurt your business reputation.

reviews.author: Andrea D.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch.  We had Ruben sandwiches, Parmesan chips and the match sticks (Crunchy, breaded and fried jalapeño slivers). I got a jalapeño margarita. Felt the bread was way too toasted for the sandwich. Matchsticks and chips were great. So was the margarita.

reviews.author: Carissa C.
reviews.description: My friend and I had the Mahi Mahi Sandwich and the Blue Ribbon BBQ Bacon Burger as well as the sweet potato fries.  The BBQ Burger was better and we liked the onion strings. There wasn't anything special honestly about the Mahi Mahi Burger. Also one star down for the fries, as they didn't seem fresh and were cold.  We did enjoy the outdoor seating, however, and the staff was friendly.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Live country music on a Saturday night at Hondo's in Fredericksburg with a cold drink in hand is where it's at!   The live music from Billie Jo lured us in as we walked by. We only wanted drinks so the hostess directed us to the outdoor bar. Service is fast and the bartender makes a proper stiff drink! I was pleasantly surprised by the cost of 6 drinks (~ $40!).   It's casual and easy and great.   Since it was around 8:30 p.m., we couldn't sit at a table yet since they were still serving food. But after 9 p.m., we were able to take over a table.   If you're looking for a great place to round out your night, this is it!

reviews.author: David J.
reviews.description: Kind of disorganized, got there at 6:40pm, and was told the kitchen was closing soon.  We walked down the street to Western Edge and got right in, plus live music.  PS this was on a Friday night.

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Great spot in Fredericksburg's Main Street for good food and live music. The vibe here is super casual and fun, even during Covid-19. Modest pricing.  My fiancé and I walked in and got lucky... we got seated at the best table in the house! Directly from the stage and tucked away under trees with sparkling string lights. Live music started at 7pm and definitely set the mood.  We had a lovely, down-to-earth server that told us all the specials. We ended up starting off with the Stuffed and Roasted Jalapeños... sooo good. Creamy, cheesy. Wrapped with bacon. And the heat definitely kicks in when you're eating it. German beers. And then followed with the off-the-menu special Brisket Mac and Cheese with Cilantro and the Green Chili and Pulled Pork Quesadilla. Both also pretty good. Classic home dishes with a twist.. and full of flavor. Meat was well-seasoned and well-cooked, not dry. We ended the night with tequila shots! Our server was cheering us on :)  We recommend this place if you're coming through Fredericksburg and are feelin' a cool, casual vibe with live music. Not all of the tables are great, although the outdoor/patio seating is definitely a better choice than indoor (indoor seemed cramp and stuffy)! Good food and not pricey like their neighboring restaurants. Keep it up Hondo's!

reviews.author: Catheryn G.
reviews.description: We love Hondos! We have been several times and I love the atmosphere and live music. They typically have live music every night, but be sure to check their schedule on the website. Sit outside for the best atmosphere! They don't take reservations and the wait is typically long, so be prepared for that. During peak times, the wait can be 1-2 hours. If you go for lunch, it will be much easier to get in. Right now, they don't have servers, so you just go up and order your food and drinks at the bar. I think it works well and the food comes out in a timely manner. The drinks are amazing (and strong). The food is good and they have mostly bar food. I love the green chile enchiladas!!

reviews.author: Kausik S.
reviews.description: Good food, huge portions and good drinks. Service is non-existent and pay no attention to the rude hostess. Go inside, get your drinks and place your order for food; you will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Mrs. T.
reviews.description: We come to Fredrickburg at least twice a year maybe more. We always make it a point to visit Hondos. The first time we came we love the service and food but it hasn't been the greatest ever since. We continue to come because we hope we can once again get that same kind of experience.

reviews.author: Nichole R.
reviews.description: The young lady at the store in town made it fun while taste testing.  When I come back to Fredericksburg I will definitely go the the actual winery. She peaked my interest and made it seem very welcoming.

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: Neat place to visit if you are in town. There are several other wineries nearby that have better wines, however, Fat Ass definitely has a unique brand that's worth checking out.   They have a tasting where you get to keep your glasses as souvenirs. Depending on the day, they change the theme of the wines included. When I visited, the theme was sweet wines. Nothing super exciting but I did enjoy the peach variety.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Before I comment on the wine, I don't want to take away from the staff. The customer service here was so great! All staff members were very friendly and attentive. If I was rating just based on customer service, they would have 5 stars. However, the wine is the main attraction. It is a cute spot to watch live music and hang with friends. If you are not a sweet wine drinker (and my sweet, I mean SWEET) then I don't recommend this place. They are catering to a certain clientele. The wines are very syrupy in my opinion. However, if you want good photo ops..stop in! They are also apart of the 290 bus tour. I would suggest to try it at least once to see if you like it.

reviews.author: Tiffany W.
reviews.description: This place ....I am so impressed. Dale was our "host" and it was my birthday, Wednesday during the day get away ( we have four kids, it's our only time, lol) something different for us . Dale is amazing, I wanna say customer service, but we weren't really treated like customers, just like some normal best friends, and our friend Dale has wines!! He explained all the wines, to a "T". We are not "wine people" I like sweet wines because I'm just not   a wine person.....but these wines, OMG! Hands down we will be back. Love love love it! Days to come he said are Friday, Saturday and even Sunday....looking forward to the next time.  We did the wine tasting for $10 and got a free souvenir cup. Bought two bottles...I could've bought every one I tasted...I loved them all, so weird for me bc like I said we aren't wine people.

reviews.author: Trish J.
reviews.description: This place is a kick, fun atmosphere! The lady pouring the wine had great stories and spun a great Experience for everyone. However, just buy the T-shirt forget the wine, and skip the frozen slushie thing.  They were only serving sweet wines ("tourist blends") and we couldn't try any of their other wines. Wasn't real impressed with what they served.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: This place is great- if you like sweet wines! The atmosphere is super fun, and the staff are all very engaging and friendly. It's a bit rowdier than most of the other wineries you'll find in Fredericksburg, but it's a good place to go to nonetheless. If you're looking for something that works fast, I would definitely recommend the can of Whuup-Ass as it has a 12.5 ABV! Their frozen sangria is also a great choice, especially for those lovely hot summer days. They also have some funkier flavored wines such as chocolate, watermelon, and prickly pear jalapeño that are super fun to try. Even if you're not in to sweet wines, this is somewhere you just have to go and experience.

reviews.author: Onisa T.
reviews.description: I love this place. Stop here every time I am in town. I really like the WhoopAss in a can. I should just commit and join the wine club.....

reviews.author: Kimberly D.
reviews.description: Worst wine on the planet! Just plain horrible. $20 tasting was only for stuff that tasted like Boonesfarm. Would have been nice if we had been told what wines we were going to get to try before they took our $$

reviews.author: Tara N.
reviews.description: Fat Ass is not trying to pretend it's something that it's not: it's about the atmosphere, not the wine. The place seemed fun and had good vibes. My favorite part was, by far, the donkey on site. His name is Frito and he's perfect.  The wine was, well, bad. We did the tasting and my husband found one that was tolerable and inquired about buying it more as a courtesy but it was $28 - way overpriced for the quality. We'll easily drop $50 on a good bottle but this one was worth no more than $12.  If you're a wine snob, stay far away. If you're looking to kick back and have some fun, Fat Ass is a good choice.

reviews.author: Jenna H.
reviews.description: A fun winery with Frito the Donkey! This wine is more on the low budget side... think Boones Farm. Very sweet wine with cute labels on the bottle... would be great to give as a gag gift. Not a luxurious bottle of wine, but Fat Ass Winery is a fun place to visit with a cute theme! Would go back just for souvenirs and to see Frito.

reviews.author: Brett H.
reviews.description: Would love to tell you anything about this place , however we stood there for nearly 15 minutes waiting while the person behind the counter was on the phone ( i think with law enforcement ) but she did not even turn around or motion to us  to let us know she would be with us.  Had hoped to sample a couple and take home a half case of something bc i loved the logo and name , but i was ignored ~ along with another group of 2 that walked in at the same time as us ~

reviews.author: Tony M.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great humor with their name on all the T-shirts and wine glasses. Great wines and amazing tasting session.  Best of all, the tasting price includes the wine glass.  I'm not a highfalutin wine connoisseur so I need it to be simple and easy to follow and that's the way they do it at Fat Ass.

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: Fun and reasonably priced experience. Our server didn't know a lot about wine, but that's OK- she was fun and we had a great time. Most of their wines were on the sweet side and were tasty. Got a great momento Fat Ass shotglass. Not the classiest of the 3 wine tasting rooms we tried in town, but the funnest...

reviews.author: Celeste S.
reviews.description: We came here for my birthday and we're amateurs in wine knowledge. But that didn't stop us from having a great time! They had a live band and $30 a person for 2 wine tastings, a frozen smoothie and "small" tour and car show tour! The wines were very sweet here but at the neighboring winery it was dry. We decided to finish up here and have a swirl of the black cherry and peach wine frozen! It was delicious!

reviews.author: Marty B.
reviews.description: Walked in excited to try things. Walked out due to lake of enthusiasm from the worker. Of you've come this far, walk down the road a little further for a better time.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: I would of given more stars but due to the service of one of the servicers, which is an older white women who decided to complete ignore the fact that me and my partner  were standing there is why. Not sure if it was bc we were 2 black women i dont know, but being that it is primarily white town it made me feel unwelcome. There was another young lady that was very busy running back and forth who took the time to acknowledge us and manage to get someone to take care of us. If this is the type of busy that you all are going to run I will be sure to spread the word of what to expect. Because its no secret that bc of the pandemic more and more black ppl are started to explore things to do in Texas. An if yall are in the business of missing out on money then so be it. I shouldn't hv to feel like I can't visit establishments bc the color of my skin or who I choose to date. Which I feel it had more to do with the color of my skin. Oh I have a picture of the women as well.

reviews.author: Jordan R.
reviews.description: If you want a party atmosphere, like bachelorettes dancing on tables, and you aren't much of a wine drinker, then yes, this is for you. If you want quality wine, move along. The wine was as sweet as candy. A couple of them literally tasted like candy, tootsie rolls and runts to be specific. The tasting person described them as "diabetic". I drank them like a shot, which was fun, but not my thing. Same with the place next door the Wine Garage. I was with a group, so I was just along for the ride.

reviews.author: Anne B.
reviews.description: Hardly worth the stop. Funky atmosphere but only had sweet wines for tasting. Meh. Not my choice unless you like sweet wines

reviews.author: Spike S.
reviews.description: Reviewed October 31, 2018  The Store / Tasting room in down town Fredericksburg. It just wasn't that great. Many of the wines are sweet and the remaining varieties are limited. The service was average at best. Better wine and service is not hard to find in town. Note: This review was originally posted on Tripadvisor by Spike S.

reviews.author: Lizette A.
reviews.description: This was a fun winery, the wines they had for tasting weren't my usual preference but if a wine tastes like a tootsie roll you have to at least try it, right?

name: Sozial Haus
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Hank H.
reviews.description: It's been a long time coming (that's what the Christians™ said). But I am back. Decided to brave the C****D and take a trip to Fredericksburg, aka Wine Country.   As "wine country" you'd expect it to be a blood of Christ kind of place with fine Christian™ folk.  But I'll tell you the devil must have poisoned the grapes and took possession of my insides. I have never expelled so many demons before.   Sozial Haus  was a great place to experience the rapture that emptied me of the sins that were within my body and allowed me to experience the rebirth of his lord and savior Jesus Christ™

reviews.author: Taryn M.
reviews.description: I was hopeful because of all of the good reviews, but once we got our food, I went to put pepper on my pizza and noticed some mold. When we brought it to the servers attention it was just "oh, well, guess we will throw that one away" without any acknowledgement. I feel like this was an opportunity to check all of the salt and pepper shakers that was missed. I hope the other guest present did not have the same experience.   If your choose to eat here: check the pepper before you put it on your pizza.

reviews.author: Bill B.
reviews.description: Don't bother coming to Sozial Haus.  Worst waitress in five counties.  This place is nothing special.  Go to any other restaurant in town but this one.  Food was ok.

reviews.author: Hannah F.
reviews.description: Came here with a big group of about 9 which I understand is hard to handle but the waiter forgot to enter the orders for half of our table. We waited for close to 40 minutes and only half of our group got food. While waiting, no one even stopped by to refill waters or offer more drinks. The waiter never came to ask the guests who were sitting on the end of the table who didn't receive food if they were ok. When the manager came out to speak with us she was unapologetic. I ended up leaving without them even bringing food out. Will not be back.

reviews.author: Dan C.
reviews.description: Visited this place as I was traveling in Texas. Service was friendly but the pizza was the vest! We had the BBQ chicken pizza and we were really blown away by how good it was. Definitely recommend this place.

reviews.author: Shelby A.
reviews.description: Only giving three stars because the jalapeño popper dip was BOMB.   Our waiter seemed like he spent a little too much time at the CBD shop prior to coming to work that day. Had to ask for straws, utensils, etc. Slow as molasses.   Kids grilled cheese was so dry it should have been a crouton, cheese was cold by the time we got it so the whole sandwich was stuck together completely and lopsided. My two year old wouldn't eat it (says a lot)  My daughter ordered chili - just chili, with no sour cream or pico, and shredded cheese on the side. She got a frito pie (if that's what you'd call it) with barely ANY chili on it, had to ask for more, and queso. Everyone loves queso - but we asked for chili with shredded cheese. When I asked waiter he shrugged and said "that's what I typed in so I guess that's what the chili is" ???? Really?   Husband ordered supreme pizza, all toppings were basically in the very middle of the pizza. Half of crust was wasted because the toppings weren't spread out. Tasted fine.  I got the fiesta salad. Waiter forgot my dressing, by the time I finally got it I had eaten the chicken out of it. Some of the spinach was already wilted/old. My chicken didn't taste like a fiesta dish, really didn't have much flavoring. Not much more to comment on that.   The only thing that saved the experience was the dip. The chips suck but the dip is good, so if you go, at least get that. We won't be back.

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Just off the Main Street in Fredericksburg, there is off-street parking across the street.  During our stay we ordered here twice to go from the bar counter.   The soups are made from scratch and the spicy pizza (do not recall the name) but it had diced peperoncini was quite tasty.  The first time we were there on a Saturday night and it was quite packed, nevertheless food came out in relatively quick order.   In a tourist Mecca like this especially on a weekend things can be quite hit or miss, but Sozial Haus delivered.

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: Ok I have a theory. I was super hungover and we arrived in Fredericksburg and I was feeling pretty low. I ordered a dry rose (hair of the dog and all that), and the pickle soup. After I had my lunch there, I was probably 75% better. I think this soup has healing properties. It's like a potato soup with carrots and add pickles. It's different and so good. Ryan got the chicken salad sandwich. They add avocado and pesto to the sandwich and it's such a treat. Their main thing is pizza which looked delicious, next time i will give it a shot, I just needed a soup today.

reviews.author: Ralph W.
reviews.description: Rude aggressive waitress made the registered service dog in our group very nervous.  She insisted on not taking our food order even though we had been waiting 20 minutes already looking at the menu. When she returned in 10 more minutes, she went out of her way to sneak up on the dog from behind, which really set him off. She yelled "that is not a service dog, you guys need top leave MY restaurant."  No idea what the food and drinks were like since we never got that far.

reviews.author: Carrie G.
reviews.description: Ever wonder what it would be like if the Three Stooges ran a restaurant? If you're ever curious, Sozial Haus is for you. The laid back atmosphere is great until you don't get service or the service is so chaotic all you can do is laugh.   The restaurant is seat yourself so we went to the patio area- we watched two other tables show up on the patio and get waited on before our table of 4 did. We waited over 15 minutes to get menus- we tried ordering two appetizers- which again took forever. It started to pour down rain so we came inside to a table right by the door- so our 3rd (yes 3rd!) server looked at our table then walked by and started panicking on the patio thinking we walked out ‍  We wave at him through the window and he realizes we are inside. So he takes our order and my friend orders a beer. We watch servers wandering around, running to the wrong tables, fighting with each other, watched a female server drop a credit card and just stare at it for a good 30 seconds before slowly bending down to pick it up. Our server starts wondering around from table to table asking if they ordered the beer finally my friend waves him over to tell him it's hers.   The appetizers arrive- queso and jalapeño popper dip- both tasted great! When our pizzas arrive they are ok and kind of bland. When it's time to leave he says so we don't do individual checks only a split check equally- which we didn't mind but it would've been nice to see that on the menu or told beforehand.. we asked for a to go box 6 times before finally giving up and just paying for the food and leaving.   In the future I'd just skip it and try somewhere else where the staff actually wants customers.

reviews.author: Lora L.
reviews.description: We had a sweet waitress.   The pizza we ordered was absolutely horrid.  Soaked in black olive juice.  It took hours to get the flavor off of our palette.  It had little cheese and was ice cold.  But the sign inside ....  Said something like.  No complaints and your three star review is bullshit.     So we smiled and waved  (paid)~

reviews.author: Vedette V.
reviews.description: We stopped here during our Girls Trip. My mom ordered chicken noodle soup and a grilled cheese sandwich. She really liked it. She also got some little corn muffins that were delicious. My sis and I shared the Reuben sandwich and pasta salad and both were very good. We brought home a yummy dessert to share. The service was good. The restaurant has a simple interior. We sat by a window. There were a lot of dead flies on the windowsill-hence the 4 star review. Dead flies seriously affect the ambiance of a place!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Stopped by here for a late lunch with MIL and SIL.  Place was quite busy given it was a Friday afternoon.  It was seat yourself, so we choose a table in the backroom and then we waited, and waited and waited some more.  MIL finally got up and asked for service and then we waited and waited and waited some more.  Meanwhile SIL found a used paper menu on a nearby chair so we perused it while we waited and waited some more.  (If it were just me and the hubby, we would've left by now).  Finally, a waitress without wearing her mask properly comes over and asked if we were ready to order.  Umm...yeah, thanks to the lonely, dirty menu we had found.  We ordered 2 Turkey BLT's and a gyro, neither of which is worth writing about, wait, I take it back the bread was pretty darn tasty and fresh, wish the turkey would've been evenly distributed on it, but it wasn't.  The chips were bland and almost stale.   Yeah, we won't be coming back here for sure, even when COVID is over.

reviews.author: Niki T.
reviews.description: Pretty good pizza and salad. My only warning: be prepared for a leisurely meal. Nothing happens fast at Sozial Hauz. I think our server may have been a little 'elevated' as he forgot multiple parts of our order more than once. They also don't seem to have any table assignments for the staff so no one ever knows who has been taken care of. Like I said once you get your order it pretty tasty, but you will need to be patient ;)

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: Been wanting to try this place out for years and it is always busy! We got in for an early dinner and sat outside. Our waiter (I'm sorry, I forget his name) was wonderful and friendly. We had a tough time deciding on what to order- many choices and they all sounded good at the time because I was hungry for anything. Ended up going with their spinach salad which was very tasty, after loading up on chips and queso at first. I also ordered the frozen peach bellini TWICE since that was so yummy and refreshing in the sun. Their pizza looked good and apparently they're known for it but we just weren't in the mood for pizza. Will be back to try that!

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Worst experience in memory. We were seated for more than 15 minutes before I got up to get menus, as none of the employees had checked on us. The employee by the table with the paper menus said there were menus on the table. I told him there weren't. He said they were. I told him there weren't. iTools the menus back to the table and he came by to say he'd notify our waiter and pointed to the QR code on the table saying that was the menu.  The word menu wasn't on it at all.  We thought it led to their social media.    No one came to take our order. 5-10 minutes later he stopped to ask if anyone had come by. Nope.  We ordered 2 sandwiches. It took more than 20-30 minutes for them to arrive. I had the chicken artichoke melt, which was pretty good, but the chicken was dry. I added sugar to my tea, but alas, I didn't have any silverware to stir it in. The table next to us ordered after us, and was served a good 10 minutes before us.    Some staff were wearing masks, some weren't. Some were wearing them covering their mouth only. I'll attach the photo of the sign posted about wearing masks. Basically: whatever reason you have for not wearing one is good enough for us, and we'll cite laws that don't apply to explain why we aren't going to enforce mask mandates to protect our customers.    I'll never go back again.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: We stopped by to have a few beers and pizza. We had a pepperoni pizza that was really tasty, but if you don't like greasy pizza, I wouldn't order it, I love it so I was very satisfied. They have a nice selection of local beers and mead which is definitely worth checking out. Our waitress wasn't wearing a mask so be aware.

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: When this place first opened, oh my gosh it was amazing but it's changed hands at least once to my knowledge and I quit going after that because it's not the same.   It's very barish and not something that'd make me wanna go back over and over.   It's a shame too because it was really special.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Yummy pizza. I don't even have to say more. We ordered to go and the pizza was ready quickly. The pizza was thin crust. The crust was perfectly crispy. We ordered a Mediterranean and a pepperoni. The Mediterranean pizza was a hit. Everyone loved the topping combination.   I would definitely return for dine in

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Dear Ms. Embrey When picking up my pizza, less than 40% of your employees were NOT wearing face coverings, including the bartender (who handles and breathes on patrons drinks, payments, pens, etc.), servers and even cooks.  I know because I was there for 10 minutes waiting just outside the crowded bar seeing through the pane windows. In fact, one guy, Patrick walked within 1 foot of me with his buff around his neck. These actions tells patrons you don't care about their health.  I cannot see how this is acceptable when ya'll are essential workers handling food with responsiblility for the health of both patrons and staff during the height of the pandemic in a super busy tourist town.  Please coach them to do better, and we might return. Be safe in 2021.  Lee Mc

reviews.author: Jadie P.
reviews.description: Great restaurant with friendly staff and a quaint atmosphere. I had never had German food before and this place left a great impression of German cuisine!

reviews.author: Byron H.
reviews.description: Stopped by for lunch and had to wait a extra 30 min . But it was worth it . Even though they were short handed the service was great. I had the 3 sausage plate with German potato salad and the sausage was excellent they had a great snap on all three and the spices and flavors  made each one a pleasure to eat. The German potato  salad  was good maybe a little sweet for me but it was good. My girlfriend had the potato soup and it was outstanding I was lucky she got full and I was able to finish it. We also got the bread basket and I was shocked it was almost a whole loaf.  A great place to eat.

reviews.author: Timothy L.
reviews.description: Having lived in Germany and currently living in a town with an excellent German restaurant, I can say with some authority, it was not good German food. They advertised German potato salad but served mashed potatoes with a sweet taste. They had no Spätzle instead offering cold egg noodles that spent too long under a heating lamp, making them dry and hard (and given the temperature of the noodles  the heating, the lamp might have needed the coils checked and replaced; it was obviously not working properly). Fortunately the gravy left a very bad taste so it helped cover the taste of the rest of the meal. The service was just ok. Our waitress stopped once to see if we were ok.  I would strongly recommend against dining here. Das Abendessen was ganz schrecklich!!'

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Very touristy and food was just ok. Didn't even bother to take pictures after the fried pickles. We ordered the schnitzel and it was ok breading felt somewhat soggy and the corn was slapped on the try like when it's cafeteria food line. Beers were ok also. It was convenient as it was open on a Sunday for late lunch hence our reason to go there but would not return on a repeat visit to Fredericksburg. Server was very nice though hence the 3 stars.

reviews.author: Lanee T.
reviews.description: Rude. Ignored us. Finally sat us, no menus. Ignoring us again and finally showed up with a menu as we're walking out. We were 1 of three parties that walked out or left after waiting.

reviews.author: Sandra S.
reviews.description: Heard they had the best German food but I would have to disagree.  It was not what we expected.  Although German food is not my favorite, I've eaten it all my life and even been to Germany, so I've had some pretty amazing experiences.  This was not one of them.  Good portions, food was hot and good atmosphere, and place was packed. Still I didn't really like anything we had and would not go back.

reviews.author: Lydia N.
reviews.description: When one is in Fredericksburg, one must have German foods! So we ended up here because the wait was bearable and they were able to seat our somewhat large party. This restaurant is quaint and adorable, complete with laminated checkered tablecloths and a bud vase with fresh flowers.   Our server was great and took care of us, giving helpful suggestions. While the menu seemed overwhelming at first, with so many unfamiliar terms, it really boiled down to variations of sausage/bratwurst, schnitzel, and sides.  Complimentary marbled rye bread was a much appreciated gesture. (I was starving).  I ended up getting bratwurst plate, which came with sides of potato salad and sauerkraut. The potato salad was more like a sweet potato-salad-flavored mashed potato. Great balance to the salty bratwurst that I also ate with more bread.  Altogether, it's a little pricey but a fun experience.

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: I had very high hopes and expectations for this place after 2 prior local German venue dining experiences that rocked my foodie world. I heard this was a very popular place as well and in fact the oldest German restaurant in the county. Perhaps I let hype get out ahead of me but nonetheless.   The place is smaller inside but nice and quite, mellow, relaxed. The staff are kind and friendly. The service is fast and accurate. The menu has all the traditional German fair dishes you could ask for. I went with the Kasseler Rippchen plate expecting a normal thick pork chop with my plate. Instead I got 2 small thin pieces of hamsteak I'd expect for a breakfast dish. They were good yet no doubt! As was the picked red cabbage and saurkraut sides. All good! Just danty on the meat portion which never happens with German dishes I've had. Big portions is part of what makes the plates so unique is it not?   I simply felt I paid a dinner price for a breakfast entree is all. Beyond that, it's a good place to go and perhaps the other dishes are a better testament to what they really offer here.  I'd likely go to one of the other 2 spots I'd been to before if German fare was my dinner intent.

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Probably the best snitzel we had during our two day stay at Fredericksburg. Family tried different types snitzel and all were good, the hunter and cheese type ranked high. Friendly staff and good service.

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: Authentic ... real... German ... menu. This is it folks! This is an owner from Germany.  It's simple, good, solid German food.  Us Americans like huge fat people portions and you won't get that here.   The building is a little tight but it's pleasing atmosphere.  Just really like this.  The smoked pork chop was solid.   Relax and be patient because it's not fast food!

reviews.author: Gladys L.
reviews.description: I am German, and I liked the place. Yes, it's bot tons of food as one is used to in the US but it is enough food. It's tasty and well prepared. Staff is super friendly and the please is clean and neat. Was not a big fan of the Sauerkraut but that could be just me.

reviews.author: Emma S.
reviews.description: I came to Der Lindenbaum for Oktoberfest and I have to say that it's extremely mediocre. The restaurant was kinda cute but the cutlery was dull and the cups and plates were made of plastic despite the food being over 20 dollars. The food I had, the paprika schnitzel, was very bland tasting and wasn't very good. The schnitzel it's self was chewy and dusty. The potatoes were VERY sweet and no one I went with liked it.               Unlike me, my party did like most of the food, so take my opinion of the food with a grain of salt. Over all, I was unimpressed by the grandma-esc decor and bland food. Especially for the amount that it cost.

reviews.author: Maitina M.
reviews.description: As mentioned by many, this is a cute restaurant in the heart of Main Street. Only a few tables were taken when we entered so we decided to try it out due to COVID capacity concerns (50% for inside sitting). We ordered the schnitzel and the bratwurst plates (photos attached).  Our food got to our table fairly quickly. The troubling part about this is that the restaurant started filling up just as quickly. Every single table (except for one by the door) was taken by the time we started eating our meals. I was disappointed given the 50% ordinance that clearly was not adhered to. In hind sight, I should have picked a restaurant with outside seating.  The food was good. I enjoyed the German Potato Salad and the schnitzel tasted better when topped with the pickled cabbage. My daughter enjoyed her bratwurst and I must say that I actually liked the sauerkraut. It's not something I typically enjoy but the one served here did not have the strong fermented taste to it.   All together, we enjoyed our dining experience. I just wish they would have enforced the restaurant capacity that's currently in place.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: I remember this being a different restaurant at the same location several years ago so we were hesitant to try it. It was called Bavarian Bistro or something like that.  We are glad we did! The service was good. We stopped for a late lunch on Saturday and had no wait. We chose the Goulash which was very hearty and short on the meat (maybe 2-3 oz) but meat was tender and tasty. We are split a plate of jaegerschnitzel (a breaded and fried pork steak with a rich mushroom gravy.) served with sweet red cabbage and home made German potato salad. They charge I believe either $2.95 or $3.95 for bread but we lucked out with what we ordered and got two pieces. It was excellent. It was a generous portion! Also had a large draft German beer draft. So this place is a bit pricey $54 for lunch plus a tip but we wanted some authentic German food for a change and they did not disappoint! We enclosed a pic so you can see a little ambiance and what was left of the food! Lol. We finished it all!

reviews.author: Crystal S.
reviews.description: German is not my favorite, but it is my friend's! So we tried this place for her birthday lunch and were not disappointed. Hers was delicious, mine was delicious. I loved the potato salad. It's on the sweeter side. The "Balkan" schnitzel had depth to it, in a surprisingly balance and delicious sauce. I loved this little place!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: This is THE place for authentic German food. We each had a different schnitzel dish and all were amazing. Be sure to get the carrot cake, even if you have to get it to go, but don't miss out on that goodness. It was so good we were back the next day for more Ask for Barbara

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: The food was fantastic, not very many tables, but worth selecting from all the choices in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: The jager schnitzel with cabbage and potato salad was very good.  Wife's pork chops with potato salad and sauerkraut was also very good.   The restaurant is very nice and the service is outstanding.

reviews.author: Sherille S.
reviews.description: It's not that big inside, so we were lucky to go when it wasn't too crowded. Even though there was no wait,  it did take a while for the food to come. The food was really good, but it's just something to keep in mind if you have small hungry kids with you. Also, wish they had more options for kids. The spaghetti bolognese that they did share was a good portion. I didn't know what to expect since I've never had real German food. I was super impressed though. Tried the Jager schnitzel which came with a fried pork cutlet and mushrooms. The schnitzel was cooked perfectly. The gravy that accompanied it was flavorful and the sides balanced everything out perfectly. Although the red cabbage and mashed potato were a little on the sweet side, it all made sense somehow. Definitely go when it's not too crowded and you'll love the food.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: Very authentic atmosphere. Outstanding beer on tap. Had fabulous cheese potato soup and salad. Nice hostess.

name: Cultures Grill and Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Elizabeth A.
reviews.description: This was a great spot to hang out after checking out the tourist areas. We came in twice on a 3-night stay and sat at the bar. Rodrigo was such a great bartender, you'd think he owns the place. They had a great selection of German and American beers. The only thing we ate was a cheese plate and it was pretty good. Will definitely be back on our next visit.

reviews.author: Amber P.
reviews.description: I have to start by saying our server was polite and very nice! Also that the quail that normally comes with rice and green beans, I was allowed to sub mashed potato's and mixed veg, that comes with other entrees.  When I got my quail, it was OVERLY and overwhelming SALTY!!! So terribly salty! And the 'vegetables', onion, peppers mostly with about 3 pieces of broccoli, raw carrot and yellow squash were barely cooked, so hard you couldn't eat them...but the mash was very good! They attempted to cook the veg a second time but it came out covered in grease and just as Rick hard!  My husband ordered the bratwurst plate and his potatoes were fried to oblivion (why don't they put mash with sausage! Not fried potato chunks), and his brat was so DRY and OVERCOOKED, it literally had no moisture in it and he couldn't cut it with his knife.  Horrible food, badly prepared and of course we paid full price for the disgusting stuff!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: I went here a few years ago and it was amazing. But after visiting tonight I can guarantee that at I won't come again.   The main issue is the wait staff. Very rude, don't pay attention to customers, when they do the service is bad at best. I had a party of 7 and we only had our waiter come to our group 2 times in 90 minutes.  I get it's a bar and maybe we came on an off night but I'll gladly take my business somewhere else that isn't like dirty 6th street in service and the crowd.  Get your act together. Until then I'll not come back.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: I'm giving them a 4 star because I've gone here for years. The food has shifted in the time span from then to now. I feel like they mainly focus on alcohol, which makes sense because Fredericksburg Main Street! The nachos used to be super bomb, but they unfortunately don't taste the same anymore and I keep forgetting that. So definitely be cautious on food options, I mean unless you're plastered....then what does it matter!! They do have 44 beers on tap so that is pretty awesome. Outdoor seating and sometimes live music, check them out!!

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: Good draft beer list with some interesting mixed house draft blends that I almost tried. Slow table service.  Ordered a Dunkel on draft which was tasty and very malty.  Saw a couple of tables order the Cheddarwurst and it looked worthy of an order next trip.

reviews.author: Briar W.
reviews.description: Club sandwiche was good and the fries are fire! Pretty good beer selection. They are right on main.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: A cool Vibe for outdoor seating with a live music performer.   None of the food was particularly good however. We ordered the burger, fish and chips, and chicken Caesar wrap. Meh

reviews.author: Tramaine W.
reviews.description: Wonderful place, different cultured servers, nice atmosphere. Place had a very cozy theme. Customer Service was something interesting, could have been better at time. Food was of Great Taste. The beer was on key though

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: If a solid sports bar for a big game is your objective in FBG, then look no further. This is your spot. I asked 3-4 locals where to go to catch the packers vs rams game and all of them said Cultures was the best place as their very first suggestion. I see why now. Great staff, tons of beer (heavy on the German varieties), wine list, apps, and a full menu of grubs. I went with a 12 oz strip steak with double vegetables for my sides. At $22 it was not a bad deal and the dish was on point as well. The hefeweizen I got was OK but not amazing, most German beer does not impress me mind you. The bartender I had was really cool and very tentative. The place got busy fast during the game but I like a busy sports bar. More so when over half of them were on my side rooting for the packers!

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Cultures is a fabulous place for breakfast after a long day (and night) of "day drinking." The food is really good and it comes out quick so you can get fueled up for next day of day drinking.  They also have TVs so we came back Sunday night to watch football and have dinner. Everyone, including the staff, is friendly without being annoying and there were always seats at the bar. My husband had the michalada (beer and tomato juice( and he really liked it.  They have lots of beers on tap and a decent wine selection.  It's not fancy so if that's your jam, keep walking down Main St but if you like good food, music, beer and wine, this will fit the bill.  Prices are also very reasonable.

reviews.author: Stacy J.
reviews.description: They come a long way.   They upped their staff considerably. The beer, tv's, and more beer and tv is pretty good.  They stepped up!

reviews.author: Sanchez S.
reviews.description: Nice stop at the end of town to sit for a drink. Their large glass of beer is REALLY LARGE. Friendly staff. Was not overly crowded. Nice atmosphere to sit, talk and have a drink.

reviews.author: Jasmine W.
reviews.description: Good food, it's always wonderful service. The first time we went the food was great this time is was a little less than okay. The fried pickles came out cold and the chicken nuggets seemed microwaved. We asked for A1 sauce and the bottle had two drops in it. The staff is great and so is the music . Not all the staff wears a mask which is a concern. It's a little loud inside but a great bad atmosphere. The outside is a bit more romantic and quite more for families and less rowdy. You can get a great dining experience either way.

reviews.author: Melissa R.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere and had dinner with my husband last night.  We have lived in Germany and were looking forward to some good German Schnitzel.  I have to admit that I was disappointed in the Jagerschnitzel as it tasted gamey and did not taste like the authentic German food we tasted over 8 years in Germany.    Gave it 3 stars as the atmosphere was nice but the food not so authentic to my palette. The beer-battered mushrooms and purple cabbage were very good.  Potato soup was a little too salty.

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: Excellent breakfast! Fast great service! Mimosas on point. Eggs Benedict were amazing and the best thick cut bacon at reasonable prices. When in the Burg check this place out for breakfast!

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: It looked fun from the outside and was oddly one of the only restaurants open (at 4:30pm on a Sunday - wtf Fredericksburg restaurants??), so we went in. We sat outside in the sun and there was some live music down the other end of the alleyway, playing at a perfect volume. The drink selection was decent and frozen drinks were pretty good. In ordering, our waiter did not know what I meant by "feta" (leaving it off my salad) and I was not mumbling any of the four times I repeated the word. Brush up on your menu items if you're a waiter. Just a thought. One meal came out wrong but it was her second choice (not stated) so she just ate it anyway, a bit worried the waiter wouldn't understand that either and mess up again. The food (salads) were very fresh and delicious. I'd recommend renewing the staff. The hostess looked like a high school kid at their first part-time job; slumped in a chair at the door, on her phone, feet up, and wearing a hoodie and jeans like she was lounging around her house. Her attitude was nice enough, but appeared so lazy. I noticed the rest of the staff didn't seem to have the same uniforms/shirts on. Then of course there was our low-brain-cell waiter. It's not enough to be friendly/nice - competence is more important and inspires more confidence in a good time at a restaurant.

reviews.author: Leeann L.
reviews.description: Great environment and friendly place to sit and enjoy some good food and a beer. They have german food, of course, but a good variety of options on the menu. The sausage sampler was really good, recommend it. Jaime was our server and he was great!!

reviews.author: Zabdi G.
reviews.description: Promptly greeted and seated when we came in. Fernando, our server, was fairly attentive and checked on us several times. Host also checked in on us.   We chose this place to have a light lunch so we only ordered from the appetizer menu.   *chicken tortilla soup was surprisingly delicious. It looked very creamy and almost like a queso dip with chips, but it was very flavorful and not too rich. The green bell peppers and chicken give the soup a good flavor. I'm not usually a creamy soup type of person, but this was quite good.   *the fried mushrooms looked heavily battered and scary fried when they first came out. We thought "oh no, it's a heart attack waiting to happen!", but WOW, the batter is so crispy and light and you can really enjoy a very good size mushroom every time. They were not heavily fried at all. The Mexican in me wanted a little kick so I asked for Valentina sauce and mixed it with the ranch. Delish!   *the beef and chicken potato skins were not a favorite. The potato with meat and cheese makes it too dense and very dry. We only one one each. They didn't have a decent amount of chicane beef, though.   Overall, I had a very experience and would come back. 3.7

reviews.author: Mac M.
reviews.description: Had never seen this place before, so we decided to stop in for lunch. Pleasantly surprised!  Looks like they had lots of beers and wines to choose from, but we're not drinkers. The Wienerschnitzel and the Opa's sausage plates were both really good, with great flavor and plenty of food. Entrées were between $15 and $17, our total bill for two with Iced tea was right at $40+tip. Great service from Peter and the rest of the crew. The sausage I ate was just regular Opa's sausage (which is a favorite to begin with), but the skin lightly sliced open and just barely crispy, which I found very good. Her Wienerschnitzel was tasty, too.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This place is billed as American, Mexican, and German food.  I admit, I haven't been to Germany, but I have had a lot of German potato salad in the U.S., and Cultures has *THE BEST* German potato salad I have EVER had in Fredericksburg.  It has the perfect balance of vinegary and sweet sugary taste to it.  The potatoes are cooked perfectly tender enough, but not overcooked.  PERFECT is the best way to describe it.  Dinner entrees include two sides AND choice of soup or salad.    The Pepper Schnitzel entree ($16.99) is a breaded pork cutlet, topped with red and green bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, and paprika sauce.  Nothing really out of the ordinary here, but the pork is nice and tender.  The paprika sauce is very flavorful, but too heavy on the salt side for me.  The same goes for the grilled veggies that comes with it - just too salty. The side salad it came with was awesome. Real greens (not plain old iceberg lettuce) and it included tons of chopped tomatoes and was covered with shredded cheese.  Another one of my favorites here is the entree sized Avocado Salad ($10.99) - really good - it comes dressed in lime juice and olive oil, and with a small handful of tortilla chips and salsa on the side. The salsa is REALLY good and flavorful. I recommend breaking up the chips over the salad and spreading the delicious salsa over it.  Fresh, tasty greens, tomatoes, black beans, red onions, and yellow peppers, and a decent amount of avocado.  The only negative is, there could have been more avocado since it was featured in the name of the salad.  They have at least a couple of dozen German, Mexican, and American craft beers on tap.  12 oz beers are $5, .5 liter beers are $7, or you can go with the giant 1 liter Das Boot for $12.  We're in Texas, so go big or home y'all.  Das Boot for the win!

reviews.author: Missy S.
reviews.description: Just as advertised!  Was worth every penny. I'm surprised there isn't more pedal tours in the city!  My only complaint was the communication in the beginning but they eventually got back to us and answered all our questions!  Mac had good recommendations

reviews.author: Jesika J.
reviews.description: Our small bachelorette party had a blast with Eddie on the tour. Some of the bars closed early, but we also started at 9:30 on Friday night. The late night tour was perfect for those of us who worked and we had to drive down late. Even with COVID closing bars early, this was sooo much fun! Highly recommend if you're looking for a fun group activity!

reviews.author: Brendan K.
reviews.description: My friend booked this company and were stood up with no cancelation call or any communication.  Absolutely unprofessional and they still have not received a refund from the company. I do not recommend.

reviews.author: Erynn E.
reviews.description: This company is trying to steal money. DO NOT BOOK with them. We had a tour booked for a bachelorette party on Labor Day weekend and arrived at 6:30 per the email and waited there until 7:30 and no one showed up! It was absurd. They did not call or communicate to us in any way. After multiple phone calls to them, they finally answered and said they cancelled it and failed to let us know. It has been 2.5 weeks and we still have not received a refund despite multiple attempts via phone calls and emails. They do not care about their customers and are extremely rude. Again we DO NOT RECOMMEND. If I could give them zero stars I would do that.

reviews.author: Nisha R.
reviews.description: Fun, fun and more fun! I truly had a great time pedaling around downtown Fredericksburg. Jamming to my own playlist of music. Rick the tour guide is awesome. He is very friendly and charming. He knows some great spots to visit and educates you on the history of Fredericksburg. All of his suggestions for places to wine taste or cocktails were phenomenal. One place had some of the best Sangria I have ever tasted! I would do this pedal pub again. You are completely covered in shade. You don't really have to pedal because it's electric. Sipping and seeing the town this is the way to go!

reviews.author: Patrick L.
reviews.description: This is a copy/paste from my review on google.  We booked a month in advance (paying up front). Jimmy did not pick up the phone nor did they reply to our emails. We showed up at Jimmys uncles bar to meet there and we get a few drinks and then get the news that the pedal tour is cancelled. We tried time and time again to get ahold of jimmy and they would not answer the call. Then we called from a different phone number (from what we booked with) and Cheryl promptly picked up and told us "oh yeah it's cancelled, we're at a polo event right now, we'll refund you the money on Monday." Suffice it to say, we were (still are) upset. The bartender at the Stable bar that we met at was very nice though. She was caught in between a business owner that doesn't like to contact their customers and us.

reviews.author: Meghan K.
reviews.description: We were scheduled for a pedal tour at 7pm on September 5 and got stood up with zero communication . We paid over $400 for this tour for 9 girls for my bachelorette party. We were never given a call or email notifying us that they were not planning on showing up. We called 52 times in a row until someone finally picked up. They were vague and said they would get back to us. Since then we have made repeated attempts to get a hold of this company to ensure a refund. Every time we call the company we are given the run around and met with extremely rude comments from employees. The only apology we received was filled sarcasm. It's been nearly a month and we have not been issued a refund. It's a shame that a company would hold onto people's funds during a pandemic when money is tight for many. Also a shame to know based on some comments this is regular practice for them. Do not book with this company.

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: We were in Fredericksburg for a girls get together and we decided to go on the Pedal Tour!! It was a blast!! Our driver, Joe stopped many places where we got us a drink to go and we also stopped and had lunch and saw so many things and beautiful  places we would not have seen if we had not gone on our pedal tour! Sherry sat in the bank and cranked us up some music of our choice as well!!! Drinks and music and lots of fun!! You should really give it go, YOU WILL LOVE IT

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Matt was great .... all the places we went to were awesome.... definitely recommend ... evening tour 7 or 930 the best .... will be back and do again

reviews.author: Dori H.
reviews.description: Okay, disclosure there were only two of us on an afternoon tour because it was early. Rick was our guide and he was a sweetheart and adaptable to what we wanted to do. We're from Texas and have been to Fredericksburg before but learned about some places we've never tried. We had a long drive back home and he got us back to our car as well. Give it a shot!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: Based on the excellent reviews we read here on Yelp, we made reservations (for two) to do a pedal tour on our recent trip to Fredericksburg. With the weather being so hot, we chose a night time tour on a Monday night. We received an immediate email stating that our request was received but wouldn't be confirmed until we heard back from them with a confirmation. We waited. We called.
