We even went by the address given. It was closed. Finally at 4:30pm on the day we had requested, we received an email saying our tour was declined due to lack of participants. Other people have stated they did the tour with only two people, but they wouldn't honor our reservation for two people. It would have been nice and I would have been more understanding if their communication had been better. At the very least they could have called us and explained or offered us an earlier time slot (if the later time was problematic), but we simply got an email stating our tour was canceled, leaving us scrambling for new plans for the evening. Quite a letdown in what was otherwise a fun trip. A little communication would have gone a long way.

reviews.author: Feleshia G.
reviews.description: So much fun on the pedal party, Rick was great and very accommodating! Rick was awesome, gave us a little history of the buildings we passed during the ride. He took pictures of us so we didn't have to worry about it. I highly recommend this tour, every stop was so much fun!  We will definitely be doing this again! Thank you Rick for being awesome!

reviews.author: Doug W.
reviews.description: Fredericksburg is the crown jewel of the central Texas Hill Country.... The Fredericksburg Pedal Tour is nothing short of epic.   They have great service and will cater to your every need and ensure you have a blast.   Nothing compares to spending the day with your friends pedaling a mobile bar through vintage German streets, not to mention with a stein in your hand!   It allows you to effortlessly visit the most friendly and authentic watering holes in the hill country.   FPT is where danke schoen meets yeehaw and yes ma'am.   I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Rick NJessica K.
reviews.description: We loved this experience.  Made some new friends and had a great time visiting places we would not have.  Not a workout, so don't worry.  Just a lot of fun!!!  Rick, our guide made it interesting and fun.  Try it !

reviews.author: Andy B.
reviews.description: Easily the most fun I had while visiting Fredericksburg was on this tour!  Definitely would recommend to anyone who wants to see the town and have a PHENOMENAL time meeting new people.

reviews.author: Caitlin F.
reviews.description: Such a fun tour! Rick, our tour guide, was very knowledgable and extremely friendly! Don't worry about breaking a sweat, there is a motor on the bike. I would recommend this to friends in the future!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Dropped in for a tasting in a Tuesday! Wasn't busy at all so we were helped quickly. It's $25 per person for 4 wine samples, but they give you a list with descriptions and you choose which ones you want. The sommelier was very friendly and gave us great info on all the wines! I really liked getting to choose which wines I was trying. I even decided to take a bottle home since they do not sell to any major retailers.  Grape Creek has a large vineyard right outside the town on 290 that you can pay to tour but we were walking down Main and decided to pop into this location.

reviews.author: Rachel P.
reviews.description: We went to the tasting room on Main Street in Fredericksburg. They allow you to select 4 of your own wines from a menu. The sommelier did a great job explaining each wine so we could make the best selection. He was also very well informed about everything from the grape growing process to the wine making and aging. He was all very pleasant to interact with and made the experience fantastic. Per the sommelier, the wine menu is very stable and rarely changes, last change being about 8 years ago.

reviews.author: Fiona W.
reviews.description: Came for a tour and tasting! We were late for our tour time but they very kindly put us onto the next one. The wines were very delicious and they allow you to choose a variety to taste. They heavily advertise the membership and make it irresistible to join!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: It was beautiful! Loved it! The food was great! The staff was knowledgeable and friendly!   Photos enclosed

reviews.author: Kaye C.
reviews.description: Loved visiting this tasting room! I really like sweet wine and they had a lot of good ones.  The holiday cheer is my favorite followed closely by the mimosa.  We will be sharing these at thanksgiving.

reviews.author: Tammy V.
reviews.description: We always enjoy our time at Grape Creek! The wait staff is always attentive, the wines are delicious, and the food menu gives you lots of options. We love their salads and flat bread pizzas! Cheeers!

reviews.author: Efrain E.
reviews.description: Worst wine experience ever, Don't come here!  after driving almost 5 hours from Houston, we happily arrive here just to realize they charge $25 for the tasting experience,, ok we will pay , but once on the tasting barn room I asked what was included and that heavenly experience and just like those guys standing  in front on the sharp face lady pouring 1 oz wine on the cup 3 or 5 oz,, that's it,, you got it then leave,, because you won't be able to access the heavenly Patio place if you are not a member,,  what the heck!! no you are not invited to see inside or relax and drink wine or even use your the restroom for my handicapped son on a wheelchair,,, nope you taste your 5 oz of wine standing in the front desk with lady,, you finished, ok leave. Bitter experience, invited to never, ever come back here.  There are plenty of beautiful places around Fredericksburg to enjoy.

reviews.author: Christine F.
reviews.description: Decided to stop on our trip through Fredericksburg. The tasting room was inviting , the staff were friendly and our wait was not long. We tried multiple wines, not all were to our liking but , not everyone likes every wine. However we did find some we enjoyed. The interior was lovely , the murals on the wall are beautiful. Our server was , I believe Mark. He was very  friendly, knowledgeable . Cannot wait to try out the patio.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: Rude service, they only care about you becoming a member. The wine isn't good at all, in fact, I ended up wasting most of it. They were really watered down or super bitter. The sweet wines were either overly sweet (just syrup) or they shouldn't be considered a sweet wine at all.  $25 for a tasting of 3.... ridiculous in my opinion. You do get a fancy glass but $25 for not even an ounce of wine is insane.  The place is really pretty, fancy, we felt special being in there... until we dealt with the workers.  My mom even had an allergic reaction to one of the wines, no one seemed to care and in my opinion, that means they put something sketchy in their wine.  Enter at your own risk, also, don't fall for the membership. It's a hassle to deal with.

reviews.author: Jenna C.
reviews.description: The tasting room and grounds at grape creek are beautiful and the wine was actually good. However, it became very clear early in our tasting that the goal of the person pouring was to get us to join the wine club. She was telling us all about the benefits and the "low cost" to join. I was told it would be between $90-$100.00 per shipment. Excited about the possibility of having a wine that I was not able to purchase in my home state delivered I signed up. I was charged $157.00 without an email or any notification. I called the winery and was told they had the wrong email, although they had the correct phone number. I inquired about the cost and relayed what I had been told in the tasting room. I was told taxes and shipping were the cause of the higher price. I withdrew from the club as they do not let you know ahead of time what the cost will be. Upon receiving the first shipment and opening it, I was disappointed to find just the three bottles of wine, no letter about the wine or instructions to let the wine rest since it had been shipped. As I had received from other wine clubs I was a part of. It seems to me they have a lot to learn!! Overall, I would not recommend joining this wine club.

reviews.author: Benjamin G.
reviews.description: Stay far away from this place! Huge rip off. I got talked into a wine membership, huge mistake. The lady who signed me up bold face lied to my wife and I about the details. She told us $60 for the 3 bottle membership and not to pick them up in person because they would ship them for free.   $134 dollars later for 3 bottles of bad wine, and then shipping was $25.   DO NOT do the membership.   Staff was rude and unwelcoming. This is the most pretentious place we've ever been.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: I wouldn't even give this place one star. We arrived with our registered emotional support dog and they wouldn't let us in unless they were ADA. What about the Veterans who need that emotional support ? Shame on Grape Creek.

reviews.author: Paulina M.
reviews.description: The attention here  is dreadful we came by and as we didn't have the vip membership we couldn't even go in the lady that was at the door was super rude  It's a shame that such a lovely place have this attention

reviews.author: Jeff A.
reviews.description: Not a good experience.  This place is using Covid as a reason to limit availability and push "members only" access.  Wine is good, but the pours are small for $25.  High pressure member club push so the server can get "points".  To top it off, the host was forced by the rent-a-cop to tell us we couldn't take pics by the vineyard.  There are much better options... skip this joint.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: we enjoyed the wine tasting and experience at this beautiful facility.  Eve guided us through two different flights of wine in which she explained the different grapes, where the grapes came from and the associated highlights.  we look forward to enjoying these wines throughout the winter

reviews.author: P B.
reviews.description: We became members. We moved from California and love the wines there. We are now Texans and want to love and support our wine region. It is pricey, $25+ tax per tasting, for 3 wines. You can mix and match. We LOVED the Petite Sirah and the Port. The reds were nice, complex and bold, and the Viognier was dry but both fruit and mineralogy. We can't wait to taste some more of the estate grown wines.

reviews.author: Patrick R.
reviews.description: I just got ripped off... $25 each person, to taste 3 wines (I'm talking about a smidgeon of a taste) and pressure join a "club" and give up a bunch of financial info. Just No! You don't even get a full serving to leave with. Stay away and try the others...

reviews.author: Kimi W.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery! Eve was our tasting ambassador and she was amazing! Truly loved every wine that we tried. You can't go wrong with a stop here. The grounds are beautiful. Great girls trip or trip with your spouse.

reviews.author: Erin M.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favor and go to any other winery in Fredericksburg but this one. They don't allow you to sit down or do anything but a $25 tasting of tiny pours unless you're a member. Too many ridiculous rules, even if you are a member. BEWARE

reviews.author: Dianna M.
reviews.description: We had a great day!  Eve was wonderful.  Started tasting with the tour and wines, became members, then had lunch as a break.  Walked over to the sparkling tasting for an afternoon treat.  Just a great day

reviews.author: Andrew K.
reviews.description: Phenomenal winery off the main strip in Fredericksburg. Every single wine in the tasting was excellent including the rose which can be hit or miss. Highly recommend getting a charcuterie plate as well for the tasty and well curated cheeses and snacks.   They have a beautiful outdoor patio and what looks like one hell of an event space that would be perfect for a wedding, reception or large party

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Came for a tasting with a friend! $20 per person with 5 predetermined wines. The sommelier was very friendly and gave us great information on the vineyards and the wines we were trying. It's a fun experience! Definitely recommend trying this out.

reviews.author: Ritodhi C.
reviews.description: A small, dog-friendly patio dotted with small umbrella-shaded tables with overhanging trees reminiscent of a New Orleans café. The wine was decent, the cheese platter was fantastic, and the service was pleasant. One of the most enjoyable stops during our Hill country travels.

reviews.author: Cassie F.
reviews.description: A fantastic tasting room! All the workers were phenomenal but the lady specifically helping us (Her name might be Leanne, I might be wrong) she was amazing! Very informative and delicious wines. Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Mary N.
reviews.description: I really enjoy their patio. The bottle pricing is good but by the glass get a bit expensive. Good wine and friendly service!

reviews.author: Rachel P.
reviews.description: Went here for a wine tasting and the service was fantastic. The menu is pre-selected for you which is, I think, a plus because it made me taste wines I would not have chosen for myself. I thoroughly enjoyed all 5 wine selections. The sommelier was very well informed and pleasant to interact with which made the experience that much better.  We went at noon on a weekday and there were 2-3 other parties in the tasting room (with their own service). Online reservations can be made ahead of time and is easy to navigate on their website.

reviews.author: Mia C.
reviews.description: Service was slow to start as they were busy when we arrived at our schedule time and I would have appreciated it a little more explanation around the wine tasting. But for a $20 tasting this was a very good deal. 5 +1 complementary tastings. Each was unique and met the brief description we were given. The charcuterie board was devoured by our table and the outdoor seating had plenty of natural shade - a must for Texas.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: My friend and picked here as our first stop on a day full of wineries.  There was no one in there yet, but us and we were able to have real one on one conversations with the staff.  We enjoyed a couple nice whites and reds, with complimentary breads which were a definite nice touch and pairing with the white wine.    After spending some time inside, we sat out on the patio area, where the staff quickly brought us blankets for  the morning chill.  How thoughtful! The grounds are so sweet and worth the stroll.  I especially enjoyed sitting on the dock by the lake.    I DEFNITELY recommend this place.  Just a wonderful relaxing way to spend your day.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: Wish I could give 0 stars. Extremely rude staff!!! Our group of 6 was so turned off by the blonde bartender. Went here on the passport as it was recommended by another bartender at previous place. They wouldn't serve us 30 minutes before closing, not even getting it to go....I understand if you need to start closing things down. That blonde lady was rude and nasty for no reason! We have never been to a place with such rude wait staff. EVER! Save your time and money and go elsewhere!

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: We had a blast! Jolie was so helpful and sweet to us. We can't wait to come back!! I really enjoyed the food pairing ideas she gave us with our mini wine tour

reviews.author: G P.
reviews.description: They were very nice and informative. Enjoyed our wines, not our favorite, but good. Wish they had a larger space to walk around.

reviews.author: Marina R.
reviews.description: Before i say anything, we did not have a reservation.  My spouse and i showed up here around 3 Pm on Saturday. Our first problem was that we didn't have a reservation for a testing. The hostess worked with us and got us a spot for a testing and put in a charcuterie board order. She placed us outside and told us to wait for our server. The weather was about 50 degrees and there wasn't a heater available for us. 10 minutes later, we still didn't have our server. The hostess came out and got us water. We asked for a heater or if we could get the first available table inside, she agreed and went to find our server. 10 minutes later, a server came up to us, apologized for the wait and got us a table inside.  A wine tasting for two took about 2 hours, which was not ideal. We had to ask for our charcuterie board three times with two different servers. We finally got it at the last glass of wine and ended up getting a full glass of wine to compliment the board. All in all, it was great but next time we will have a reservation and will be more vocal about the lack of service.  5 glass tasting was $20 and board was $30.

reviews.author: Abbey K.
reviews.description: Great live music. Charcuterie board was pretty good came with three cheeses meats nuts and dried fruits! Wine was pretty decent and loved being able to sit outdoors

reviews.author: Elaine W.
reviews.description: Cute place with friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Great wines that aren't sweet. Wine tasting was surprising, I don't usually like white or rosé but liked both and ended up buying their rosé. Thank you Chris!

reviews.author: Ryan B.
reviews.description: This place was recommended by other staff members from other wineries. We were so looking forward to it! Unfortunately we ran into some friend and chatted until 4:34pm. When we went inside we were told they where "closed" and to make a reservation on their website. "It was the way locals do it", is what one employee said. Needless to say we were disappointed in their lack of customer focus even after explaining on situation. It seems like the employees are there for a paycheck and not there supporting their vineyard or brand. We were extremely disappointed when we were asked to leave, in a very aggressive manner, after going back to our friends. The wine might be good here (I don't know and never will) but the staff doesn't care either way so don't expect much from them.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: We are making the awful drive from Austin to El Paso and were told to stop in Fredericksburg at check out a winery. Found this little tasting room and had a great experience. We enjoyed each of the wines we tasted, even the whites and we are not white wine drinkers. The gal who served us was super friendly and knowledgeable. A live musician was about to start playing but we had to get back on the road. Super cute place, friendly staff, nice environment! We ended up purchasing a couple of bottles and I hope to be able to find the brand in the future!

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: Loved the setting, outdoors and relaxing. Didn't feel super commercialized and rushed. You can order a charcuterie board and drink and listen to music. Chill and just fun!

reviews.author: Cathrine H.
reviews.description: I made a reservation for 2 for a cheese and wine tasting. We arrived and were greeted and seated promptly. Jolee was amazing! She was very knowledgeable and let us know which cheeses paired best with the wine we were about to taste. We aren't super versed in wine, so she gave us enough information without overwhelming us with chatter. We really enjoyed the ambiance and how every single staff member were wearing their masks properly. They also handled social distancing very well. As we were finishing up with our tasting, we noticed that it was a few minutes left til closing. Jolee didn't rush us out. She offered us a bottle of wine to finish off our tasting and said she would just check up on us. I would definitely recommend coming here!

reviews.author: Catherine N.
reviews.description: Lost Draw has been one of our favorite wineries since we discovered them 3 years ago.  My parents and I came for a late afternoon tasting with a cheese plate. Abigail was our server and not only was she very knowledgeable about the wine but she was personable and friendly as well! She also went a bit "off book" with the tasting to show us a selection that fit with our wine preferences. Overall we had a wonderful afternoon and found some wine we really liked! Our only complaint is that we don't live closer!

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: Lucky me, I got turned around and found this place on mistake!!   If you haven't figured it out by now, you have your pick when it comes to wineries, however this place has some of the nicest people working there and the wine is good as well.   I pulled up and was immediately greeted. I told her I was just looking around and she guided me in and gave me a run down. She let me know that they were offering a 5 flight tasting for $15. I explained that I was meeting a friend for lunch (and got some recommendations of where to go eat) and that we would be back.   We ate lunch (it was delicious) and came back. Chris helped us and he was funny and informative and made sure that we were having a great time. In the process we also got to meet Troy (one of the co-owners) and got to ask him questions as well.   After much sipping, we got a glass and went outside where they was covered seating and live music.   This place wasn't as crowded as some of the places on Main Street, but I loved the experience we had and we will definitely be back!!!

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: We took a quick day trip to Fredericksburg from Austin and it was perfect! It only took about an hour and a half to get there and there were quite a few wineries along the way if you wanted to visit some more (we stopped at one on the way back).  We signed up for the tour, but had a little bit of time to kill before it started, so we had a glass inside. We tried a red and a rose and the pours were very generous. The wine was great and we ended up buying a few bottles.  Of course we picked one of the coldest days out of the year to go, but they were very accommodating and it was mostly inside anyway. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and he has been there since they first opened, so it was really awesome to hear from his experience. During the tour, we got to taste a few different whites and reds and then got to keep the cup.   My only recommendation would be to set up some heaters outside. Even though it was really cold, it was a beautiful sunny day, and it would have been nice to enjoy the beautiful scenery outside. Overall, it was a great experience!

reviews.author: Shaylie B.
reviews.description: Wonderful wine and friendly staff!   We visited during the week (so nice they are open during the week!) so it was slower than it is on the weekend I'm sure, but we received great attention and service from the sweetest host, Sue! Highly recommend asking for Sue for your tasting here. Her great personality and excitement for the wine and the wonderful reds sold us on a membership here.   As for the wine, love that they are all dry. The reds are amazing, every single one! Favorites were the Tannat and Cab!   Great visit first to Augusta Vin, many more to follow I'm sure!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Escape just outside of central Fredericksburg to this BEAUTIFUL vineyard with very impressive wines! The long driveway in from the main road has you entrenched in vines and the vast, expansiveness of the Texas countryside. Once you finally arrive, you stumble upon an exquisitely designed tasting room with surrounding lounge areas and belly-up bars. The tasting room is just half of the experience though, the wines are quite impressive!  My group and I tried the mixed tasting flight and red tasting flight, allowing a chance to try 10 wines. We found ourselves unable to decide which pour was  our favorite because so many were so delicious! If you go with a partner or friend and feeling like trying as many wines as you can, I definitely recommend splitting those two flights! A few of my group members even ended up joining because they were so impressed.   TLDR: A little drive out from the main area of Fredericksburg but so worth it!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: Our first time here and we loved it. The architecture is stunning. You really don't feel like you are in Texas either. It has a Napa kind of feel to it. We will definitely be back to Augusta Vin!

reviews.author: Hannah L.
reviews.description: In terms of taste, this is probably the best winery in Fredericksburg. However, it's also going to be one of the more expensive ones. Cost aside, it'd be hard to not have a lovely afternoon here. The staff is kind and knowledgable, while the atmosphere is aesthetically beautiful and calming.

reviews.author: Jash S.
reviews.description: Love it here. We're members here and at some other vineyards near Fredericksburg. Members perks are decent, scenery is beautiful. Staff friendly. A food menu item that'd do really well here would be a flatbread pizza of some sort.  It'd be awesome if they installed a couple Tesla or EV chargers in the parking lot like some of the other wineries have. But great views, especially from upstairs

reviews.author: Elies S.
reviews.description: The scene, building, people, and the wine! It's all fabulous. Don't know what else to say but excellent!

reviews.author: Ritodhi C.
reviews.description: One of the more beautiful and sprawling estates of the wineries we visited, perfect for a sunset sip outside. The wine is on the pricier side, without necessarily an associated increase in quality relative to our other stops. Nonetheless, we enjoyed the visit and wouldn't mind coming back for a tasting some day.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Napa comes to Texas! Wow what a beautiful place!! Very professional staff, good wine and a relaxed environment.  Make your reservations and relax with a great bottle of wine. Get their early as this place is definitely one that gets super busy with customers.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: We first visited Augusta Vin this past March at the recommendation of a few friends. Their wines are outstanding, especially their reds. They offer ample seating outdoors, and inside their stunning two-story tasting room. We joined their wine club during that first visit, and though not needed, rev Ali dated that decision when we revisited yesterday.  Augusta Vin should be on any wine enthusiast's itinerary when visiting the Fredericksburg area.

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: My sister and I recently toured the winery with Marshall as our tour guide. We really enjoyed getting to see the beautiful vineyard and the production facilities. The wines we got to sample were excellent! Marshall was a great tour guide and very informative.

reviews.author: Larry W.
reviews.description: We had a great experience. It's a beautiful location and building with a lot of vines (not the symbolic few rows of some other wineries in the area).  Our server, Stacey, was warm, fun, informative and such a joy to interact with. The vision of what this winery is seeking to create is elegant. Excited to see how they mature alongside the vines and vintages.

reviews.author: Helen S.
reviews.description: Was very excited to visit this winery. Wanted to have the full experience so we booked a tour that includes a tasting. Called to ensure that we were able to bring our small service dog that fits in a bag for the tour. When we checked in at the front desk, we had our dog with us, we were greeted by the hostess who gave us instructions on where to wait for the tour to start. We patiently waited and once the tour was about to start the guide told us they couldn't let us on the tour with the dog. I understand if that is your policy, however, it would have been helpful if that was clarified when we checked in for the tour instead of making us waste our time. There are plenty of wineries in the area that we could've been at during that time instead. We asked to use the money we had already paid towards our tab and were told that would be an "accounting nightmare" like seriously!? They did refund the part of the tour that we couldn't go on but their customer service and communication definitely needs improvement.  Their website does not include any information in regards to this topic when booking, which is why we called to confirm. Other guests have had similar experiences based on the reviews below.

reviews.author: Abraham E.
reviews.description: #1 vineyard in Fredericksburg! Hands down ! Best wine! Love the Malbec reserve! Staff has always been excellent when I go 3 years now and members! I took my fiancé for our first date here ! Just a month ago proposed to her here! Seriously best experience! The staff even helped me set up with the proposal! This place will forever hold a special place in our hearts !

reviews.author: Victoria J.
reviews.description: Was so excited about this winery for my moms 50th birthday. Her friends came in from out of town and we decided to visit for a few glasses of wine before lunch. When we got here the host was very annoyed that we didn't make reservations and told us to find our own open seats. I told her I was a wine member and it made her even more annoyed. After making us feel uncomfortable she sat us down and told us she could sit us in the members only section for an hour and we had to be out because reservations were made for others. This was our first stop and we didn't mind only having an hour. (Really we just wanted to take pictures) Our server was so sweet and attentive. About 40 minutes in we asked for the checks and our server went to go get them. The host then came up and was staring at us and then told us she needed the chairs. We still had 20 minutes, our waiter was closing us out and there was so many empty tables. She continued to clean around us, pull chairs and make us feel uncomfortable that my face started turning red and i told my party to walk downstairs and I would finish up with the bill. It was beyond embarrassing. Our server apologized so many times and even had me speak to the manager who said they were aware of the problem. Such a shame because it is a beautiful place. Just not the kind of experience I wanted to give to the people I love most.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekday for a tasting. Make sure you reserve online! A res gets you an hour inside, and then you are welcome to relax outside and order by the glass/bottle. We tried the rose/sweet wine tasting, which was a flight of 4 wines. The first was a dry rose, then a less dry rose, a sweet wine, and then a sweet red. The server was very kind and welcoming. The ambiance is gorgeous. They sell bottled water only. Their pours are on the smaller side (1oz) compared to some other places, but it was a wonderful experience overall!

reviews.author: Kalen K.
reviews.description: The aesthetics is 5 stars. The grounds and architecture is high class and has that wine country appeal. Not a big fan of the wine though and the vibe was wannabe rich - lots of 'influencers" taking selfies.

reviews.author: Chandi B.
reviews.description: Out of the many wineries to choose from in Fredericksburg, Augusta Vin was recommended and it stood out to us for a few reasons.  Not being from the area I had a few questions prior to which CEO Scott Felder graciously answered them all promptly via email which was much appreciated.  Once we arrived, the grounds were immaculate, the customer service Superior, and our wine tasting rep/server who I'd like to give a shot out to "CHUCK" was very knowledgable, informative, patient, and oh so personable!  Our visit would not have been the same without him.  Hands down the best winery and customer service in Fredericksburg.  We hope to return someday... and of course ask for Chuck!

reviews.author: Lili M.
reviews.description: Be-a-u-ti-ful place!!!! Hubby and I took the tour. We got to try several wines inside the barrel room. Awesome experience! The tour guide was super personable, polite, and charismatic. I would definitely want to return and take the tour again in late super. We went in early spring, and the vines hadn't really sprouted yet.

reviews.author: Anna S.
reviews.description: We wanted to do a wine tasting/tour in Fredericksburg. There are so many winery it's a bit stressful to choose which one. But I'm happy we decided on this place!   The venue is gorgeous - classy and spacious! You can also book this space for weddings. They have outdoor and indoor seating so if you don't feel comfortable during covid you can sit outside. However if you wanted to do the wine tasting you have to sit indoors and you are free to move outdoors afterwards.   We originally had booked a wine tour but it got cancelled. My recommendations is to call them beforehand to double check your tour bookings. We ended up just doing wine tasting with charcuterie boards + truffle. The reserve wine was really good. I prefer it more than the red wine tasting which my friend had gotten. I think it's worth paying the extra $5.   The place is very busy so service was a bit slow - but our server is so friendly! My friends and I are slow drinkers anyways so it didn't bother us as much. We went on a Saturday and they were fully packed in the afternoon so definitely recommend making a reservation if you plan on doing the tasting. If you're here to just buy a cup/bottle of wine I think you can just drop by for the outdoor seating.   This is a perfect girls mini road trip! We drove from Austin and it was worth the visit. Also very cute photo opportunity :)

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: My family and I went here on our trip to Fredericksburg from Austin, and we loved this place! We got the rose jam, peach jam, strawberry preserves, some peach cider, and the cobbler! The peach jam and strawberry preserves were delicious, and the rose jam was pretty good too! Our favorite has to be the cider though, and it tasted really good with the cobbler! They also had a beautiful outside with a pond, and it was perfect weather when we visited, which made it super nice! The prices are also pretty decent, and definitely worth it for what you get. Also pretty family friendly, so don't worry about bringing your kids here. Can't recommend enough, and we'll definitely come back to this place next time we visit Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Lavenia W.
reviews.description: Going to start off with don't waste your money on the wine tasting. Insanely expensive as this is sampling not a true tasting. I wish I'd read reviews prior to paying $4 per "tasting" that was a joke. It's maybe, maybe an ounce. You go to a machine that you insert a card to that has your credits to it. As I said it's a spit and I'm being kind giving them the ounce it provides.   Views are amazing and the food retail product has some yummy finds. I spent lots of money altogether so hoping my food finds will make up for the joke of a tasting.

reviews.author: Dionne W.
reviews.description: 1 star only because I can't give 0!!!!  The girl selling the tastings was VERY rude, didn't explain very well and looked at me like I was stupid for asking a question.... Not to mention the price! We paid $28 for 6 / 1 ounce tastings for 2 people. They didn't even give us enough to swallow a pill!  Would not recommend at all!

reviews.author: Jeanne B.
reviews.description: We almost drove right by this spot heading into Fredericksburg. Glad we turned around and stopped. It's a beautiful and peaceful place, and they have such tasty items to buy. Jams, honey, sauces...we're going back this week to truly enjoy all the location has to offer.

reviews.author: Chilly P.
reviews.description: this a must when you're in fredericksburg. the employees are helpful and nice. their collection of products is great. the peach wine is so good. but what really blew me away was their outdoor area in the back. they did a great job making it gorgeous and peaceful. they even had a live band playing when i was there sipping on my wine. take me backkk

reviews.author: Natasha N.
reviews.description: This place is gorgeous! Beautiful outdoor seating near a lake and a view of the peach orchard. This place doesn't really have a tasting like most other places in Fredricksburg, rather you can load money to a card and use the card to self serve different amounts of wine from their dispensing system. That ended up being quite expensive as it starts at $4 for a single ounce of wine, but the wines they have are so good. This is the spot if you like sweet and fruity wines. My favorites were the peach wine and the blackberry wine. The star is definitely the peach wine though - make sure you try that one and take home a bottle.   The little shop also has a ton of cool things for sale. One thing I would skip however is the peach cobbler, at $8 its too much for the tiny portion and not all that great. The sauces and jams are great though. The peach cider was also a cool find and quite refreshing for anyone that doesn't drink or anyone that needs a break from alcohol.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This place is so pretty. The scenery, the photo ops, the pond. Everything about this place is stunning. We tried the peach salsa, which instantly became an addiction to us, we left with four jars.  We even bought a jar of their famous raspberry chipotle sauce so I'm excited to try that. Every single one of the staff members talked to us about how great it is.  The only thing I can complain about was the wine. The wine was HORRIBLE. I really REALLY wish I could have gotten my money back for it. We ended up throwing away  3 of them because neither me nor my mom could stomach them.  They all tasted like cough syrup or just pure nastiness, I can't even describe it. Worst wine we've ever tasted in our life.  I would 100% come back for everything else, but skip the wine.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: I have been to Fredericksburg many times and can't believe I've.l never stopped here. They offer many homemade jam, sauce, honey and spreads. They also offer wine tastings and wine by the glass options. The best part is the view of in the back. It's a relaxing environment around the water with a chance to enjoy the landscaping with the pretty trees. They have a good amount of seating and picnic tables to sit and relax. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Jenelle S.
reviews.description: Whenever I am in the area I make a stop at Das Peach Haus. The staff is always friendly, and this time during the pandemic was no different.  I purchased a jar of the Texas Peach Butter, which I haven't seen elsewhere. OMGeee, this stuff is dangerous!!! So So GOOD! We had a charcuterie board for dinner tonight and it paired with Everything. Just a small amount goes a long way for flavor.   I have a recipe which I made cupcakes with apple butter and am planning to sub this Peach butter. I'm betting it will be delicious.

reviews.author: Kevin C.
reviews.description: Very nice and relaxing place. Took the small drive from San Antonio to relax and enjoy some of the best peach cobbler I have ever tasted by the pond  Inside, the store has a wide variety of jams and sauces.  I bought the praline sauce and OMG, I'm ready to drive back out there for another bottle.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Really cute store offering jams, spreads, sauces and more that sits on a pond and is next to a peach orchard. In other words, this place is everything you want from a visit to a small town.   They were really good about enforcing face masks and the use of hand sanitizer in the shop. (My trip to Main Street after I noticed most places didn't care about those things). I may have grabbed a few of the famous chipotle sauce along with some other peach infused goodies.   The Friday that I came here, they were not offering any wines by the glass for enjoying in the outdoor area. I was told that was an option on Saturday and Sunday. You could buy a chilled bottle of wine but I was driving and solo so not an option. None the less, I took a leisurely walk around the pond, enjoying the peace and all of the beautiful views.   Great local business to support while also enjoying their beautiful scenery.

reviews.author: Diego M.
reviews.description: Most magic place out in the San Antonio wine country - Fredericksburg, TX Enjoy live music, maybe enjoy most delicious peach cobbler out of the oven

reviews.author: Kay J.
reviews.description: We were headed to Fredericksburg on Sunday and wanted to stop at Das Peach Haus.  We were with our kids (20's and teen) who looked it up online on the way and got excited about some menu items they saw on the website.  We've never been here and weren't sure what to expect. We thought we'd enjoy some food and wine.  First off, the place is beautiful!  Rustic Texas charm through and through!  There's a gorgeous pond out back with Adirondack chairs, and plenty of spots for relaxing.   When we entered the store, we weren't sure of what to do.  It's a cute open southern vintage store lots of jams, sauces, etc.  There are other rooms branching off the main store and we know they have a culinary school on site.  We didn't see what appeared to be a restaurant (or eating area) so we milled around, waiting for an available employee.  We decided to wander out back and check out the scenery.  It is stunning!  We took a few photos and walked around a bit.  The place is absolutely beautiful. There were a few people relaxing on chairs drinking wine by the pond.   When we came back into the store, the employees were still busy with customers so we looked at items in the store. It didn't seem that anyone was eating food so we were confused about the menu on the website, especially since we were there during the menu hours.  After realizing how chatty the customers were, it seemed an employee would not be available anytime soon so we decided to head out. We'll definitely check it out next time after doing a little more research.

reviews.author: Pat B.
reviews.description: Don't bother... One of the most customer unfriendly places we've been to any of water in quite a while. We don't serve food, but don't you dare bring any in. We really only wanted wine but had food for the kids. Needless to say, we loaded our party of 12 pack on the bus and left!  Headed back east of town to the Ron Yates winery who said of course, come on out!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Really fantastic photo ops and really friendly staff. I wish we could've gotten the whole experience like their usual tastings, but unfortunately due to Covid a lot of that was shut down at the time we went. But we still loved walking around and taking pictures! We will definitely go back next time we are in Fredericksburg and hopefully they will be fully open then

reviews.author: Alberto V.
reviews.description: Very beautiful and amazing experience!! Definitely will be going back again!! Wine was fantastic and the outdoor seating by the water was perfect!!!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: One of the best places to visit in Fredericksburg. We stop by this place every time we are visiting. Very friendly staff, peaceful, and great scenic view in the back. I highly recommend it!!!!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Visited on Saturday 2/6 and it was wonderful as usual. The health/safety steps taken really helped us feel safe. As an immunocompromised person that's been essentially locked up in my house for almost a year, I can't overstate how much I appreciate yall taking the virus seriously.  I'm sipping my Peach Blossom White Tea as I type this!   I love this store and will be back!!

reviews.author: Roxanne A.
reviews.description: We went to Enchanted Rock for the first time ever and spent 4 hours getting ourselves lost in all the beautiful land.   We then stopped at Das Leach Hausa to the most friendliest people that I've ever met. Unfortunately we weren't there in peach season so we sampled their amazing variety of Jams!  This place is definitely someplace I'd travel long house to go and purchase from. Their selection of items is amazing. Super tasty!

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Excellent wine, good pricing, service yourself and beautiful environment. Will be returning!!

reviews.author: Lavenia W.
reviews.description: Stunning Vineyard! Wines were rocking and the gentleman assisting with our tastings was great. Popped in on a Monday as they're closed on Tuesday. Thank goodness I looked as we had planned on going Tuesday. Can't wait to return, sip wine and enjoy the views.

reviews.author: Hannah L.
reviews.description: The type of place where you could just sit and talk for a few hours. Especially, if the weather is kind. We really enjoyed their patio, and array of wines. It was a fun tasting to kick-off our Fredericksburg weekend!

reviews.author: Ritodhi C.
reviews.description: A beautiful long drive through the vineyards leads you to the tasting room, though I think sitting outside is the move if the weather permits. We ordered at the bar and settled underneath a tree in the string light-clad patio past the deck, where a live band was playing some country tunes. The wine we had was, for the most part, light and refreshing and more affordable than at some other wineries in the area. A great choice for a visit to Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Larry W.
reviews.description: beautiful location and relaxed casual vibe.. the patio and views invited us to sit awhile and relax, looking out from the hilltop over the vineyards. We arrived ready for food and planning to "just take a look". They had a food truck Boudreauxs swamp truck with authentic, flavorful cajun cuisine which was outstanding - the best I've had in Texas. The Viognier paired was such a great suggestion. We'll be back when we can linger, esp with our adult sons.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: The BEST winery in Fredericksburg by far! My husband and I have been to this town once on a wine tour. You have to do that once, right?!? On our second trip we wanted something simpler, smaller and better than run of the mill winery. Slate Mill provided just that....the perfect winery. AMAZING customer service. There was no tour online so we just went hoping for a tasting. As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted and graciously offered a production tour. Charlie did a stellar job! We sat down afterwards and enjoyed a charcuterie board with a glass of wine while listening to the perfect live music duo. We will definitely be back! Well done!!!!

reviews.author: Denise L.
reviews.description: I didn't actually drink wine here....frozen wine drinks definitely don't count. That said, the staff was fantastic. Josh (I think that's right and my apologies if it isn't) has a great singing voice, even if I only found that out because he scared the s#*t out of me   The live music really did the trick. David Selbo was on the mic playing his guitar. The covers he was crooning didn't even sound like covers...he made them completely his own and the atmosphere was positively impacted as a result.   It was, all in all, a really awesome venue. I look forward to going back and actually drinking wine.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: My absolute favorite place in Fredericksburg! I am in and out of town for weddings and always stop at Slate Mill for a glass. The owners are the sweetest family you'll ever meet--great wine and people. You have to stop by when you're in town. Oh, and don't forget to ask them to tell you the story about the old pioneer house on the property! Rumor is that it's haunted!

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Went with my mom. Wacky was very nice and explained everything. He was very patient. Great place.

reviews.author: Evans L.
reviews.description: Hands down the BEST vineyard we visited while in Fredericksburg. The wine was absolutely amazing. Angela and Emma were our servers and they were phenomenal. The vintage cars were also a nice touch. A++++

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Elle is AMAZING!!! So knowledgeable about the wines- we walked away with 3 bottles- only because of her- thank you for having such an amazing team!!!

reviews.author: Maia Z.
reviews.description: Great winery with amazing service and awesome wine as well as beautiful surroundings!!!  Really blown away by the service here we really felt like we were part of the family and definitely treated as such. Their outside area is really beautiful with amazing rocking chairs this was an awesome touch that I have never ever seen before! Kudos for originality and thinking outside of the box. The wine tour was also incredibly informative and fun we got to try more wines and were taken to the barrel room at the end of the tour which was a great experience. Really recommend this winery, it has absolutely everything that you would want!

reviews.author: Ashley D.
reviews.description: This is definitely a gem. My group had time between tours and we happened to drive by this place and stopped! Glad we did, this was our most reasonable priced stop for tastings and wine and the vibe was relaxed. They have a great outdoor area and their waitstaff knows their history! Our waitress was very knowledgeable in their winery and was really interactive with us throughout our visit. This is one we will definitely revisit and recommend to friends.

reviews.author: Nicole S.
reviews.description: My new favorite winery in Fredricksburg!! We were on a wine tour and Chase gave us the best tour! We tried some of the best red wines I've had and got a full tour of the winery and all of the inter workings and we were so impressed! Bought a few bottles of wine and we will definitely be back! Will be looking for these wines back in our home town and would 1000% recommend this tour/stop to all of my friends

reviews.author: Matt F.
reviews.description: Mateo was the best server/waiter i've ever had. He was very knowledgeable and educated and really showed passion about all of his wines. Slate Mill was a prime example of not only fantastic wine but awesome service. My favorite place in Fredericksburg by far and I will be recommending Slate Mill to everyone i know.

reviews.author: Christian R.
reviews.description: My wife and I visited Slate Mill Wine Collective for a wine tasting tour. If you decide to book a spot, ask for Wacey!! He was awesome. We really enjoyed having him lead us through the history of Slate Mill as well as his knowledge of the wonderful wines we tasted throughout our time there. The wine is sooooo good. It was so good we left with a membership. We're really looking forward to our future visits and future bottles we'll be drinking. Slate Mill is all about supporting and putting Texas wine at the top. We're proud to support and continue to be customers for years and years to come. Definitely recommend!!!

reviews.author: Ashley W.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, clean, people were spaced out. The vineyard is beautiful, wines were delicious. I went for the Pillow Thoughts and it's a great summer red. It's light, crisp, smooth. Their labels are made by one of their own which is always something I dig. They offered grape stomping. You can also make a shirt as part of the grape stomping! Loved the welcoming, approachable vibe. Looking forward to going back in the future!

reviews.author: Heather P.
reviews.description: It was amazing!! The staff is very friendly and are knowledgeable about their wine. The have a great collection of wines for every tastebud. Their brand of wine is 1851. I took my mom there for her birthday and she had a blast! We will definitely be going back. They also have a food truck that serves Cajun food. The wine tour is definitely a must. They have live music on the weekends.

reviews.author: Maureen O.
reviews.description: I'm not sure what the hype is about. The setting was awesome and the staff were friendly. However, we did a $25 wine tasting (apiece) and was poured five 1-oz samples which is mighty steep coming from Colorado wineries. The wines were ok, not great.

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: Slate Mill has an upscale Texan vibe and is beautiful vineyard. We went to Enchanted Rock in the morning and then came for a wine tasting afterwards. Derek helped us out and had great knowledge of the wines we tasted (the 1851 collection). We had some nice note comparisons and little discussions with him as well. The service was great and they really take care of you.  The wines themselves were delicious and I enjoyed each one tremendously. The Trebbiano and the Cabernet Sauvignon were my two favorites.

reviews.author: Philly L.
reviews.description: This place is awesome and the staff are fantastic. Wacy and Josh took care of us. Very generous wine pours for the tasting menu, good music, gorgeous setting and a great Cajun style food truck on site (order the gumbo). Highly recommend this place for chilling out with a wine tasting and it is very kid friendly. Thanks to Wacy and Josh for the hospitality also they extended closing by an hour because the entire place was having such a great time!

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: I visited Barons Creek during a recent trip to Fredericksburg. The wine here is 10/10 and so is the service. We had a couple different pizzas and a charcuterie board for food- definitely room for improvement here.   I give 5/5 because of the beautiful grounds, delicious wine, and wonderful service. They had live music all afternoon and plenty of tables available for you to sit down and enjoy your wine.   Can't wait to visit Barons Creek again!

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Finding this place was an adventure in itself. Not even overexaggerating, I must have passed at least 16 vineyards before reaching this one. Not to mention that the bartender that took care of me shared how there were gonna be at least 20 - 40 new vineyards being currently built within the next 4 years. For a wine lover like myself that was music to my ears.  One of the main reasons I decided to visit this place while passing a plethora of others was the fact that they stayed opened later than the others. If you want to feel like a baller and classy, this is definitely the place to check out. Not also are the grounds beautiful and the wine delicious, but they also have villas if you wanted to make a true adventure out of it all.  Everyone, from the guest and staff, were very friendly and courteous. A MUST to check out if you're ever in the area.

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: I absolutely enjoyed my wine tasting experience here at Baron's Creek Vineyards. The service was exquisite. Despite having many guests (including a big party), they were very attentive and knowledgeable about each wine we were enjoying. The outdoor pavilion was also quite beautiful. Very picturesque! I wished I made it on a day they had live music... but there's always next time!  Each wine tasting was quite lovely. We did order a charcuterie board and was surprised it came out on a paper plate wrapped with cellophane. I understand this is due to the ongoing COVID-19, but I did wish that the presentation could be a tad bit classier. The cheese + meats + other goodies on the board were delicious and complemented the wines well though! Would love to come back to Baron's Creek Vineyards again.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I honestly only decided to try this place because it is a destination charger for Tesla. I absolutely love this place. You do need a reservation for the tasting, but for the Tesla wall connector you can just plug in. They just ask you don't leave the car all day.   We did a mixed tasting and shared a margarita pizza. The pizza was not that good, but at least the wine was. The wine maker sources most of his grapes from California. It was honestly the best Fredericksburg wine I've had. I ended up joining the 3-bottle a quarter membership. It's a great place to charge my car, they have a members lounge, wine is reasonably priced and comp tastings. There are lawn games in the bag and villas to stay at.

reviews.author: Sophie O.
reviews.description: We came here for a Bachelorette party and Liz took care of us the entire time! She was very accommodative of our large party and made the tasting so much fun. I would definitely come back and try their brick over pizza in the future :)

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: This winery offers a beautiful space. They have a very nice section for members only. They also offer a cozy outdoor area for customers to sit and enjoy their wine. In the back of the property they have the cutest villas for over night stays (this is something I want to try next time). They are one of the stops offered on the 290 bus tour. They have a great selection of wine to taste. Most importantly, the customer service is amazing! Special shout out to Roslyn (sorry if I butchered that) and Matthew for making our experience fun! They were also very knowledgeable about the products. I highly recommend this winery on your list of stops down

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: This is a good winery to go to if you like live music and the outdoors. This winery has several buildings and tasting rooms. Some part of this winery needs reservations, but you are able to come in and grab a table as long as you have a party less than 6 people. If you also want to get away, I believe they also offer bed and breakfast that you can rent. It looks like the property has housing that are within the winery. Wine selection here is great! The only thing that made me give this place a 4/5. Was the charcuterie board, it comes pre-package and so if you are looking for more elegance on the charcuterie board, I'd say there's isn't the most picturesque. However the wine here is really good.   Also, since we are during covid times. It would probably be best if you purchase a couple bottles of wine and find a table outside. Everything is spaced out to adhere to social distancing. Also, one thing that is unique about this winery is that they make pizza here! So you are able to order that if in case you are looking to eat  effort indulging in wine! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: Great service by Larry! Enjoyed my new favorite wine tasted here in Fredericksburg- their Muscat Canelli 2020.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: ERICA is a god send. She's super knowledgeable about wine and gave me a wine 101 course. I loved most of the wine I chose and even bought a membership.   She made the whole experience super enjoyable and will definitely come back! Thank you Erica!

reviews.author: Abigail L.
reviews.description: My friends and I had a wonderful time wine tasting at Baron's Creek a few days ago. Michelle was amazing and really made our experience one to remember. She was friendly, professional, and provided exceptional service! This was our first stop for the day and we were so glad we made the visit. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Ritodhi C.
reviews.description: This is a review of the experience and setting rather than the wine since we actually didn't get around to trying any. We had selected Baron's as a stop on our Hill county wine tour specifically because it was so well reviewed and the estate looked gorgeous. That much is true: the grounds are well manicured, expansive, and the building looks like a fancy villa. But as classy as the exterior looks, I found the atmosphere to be strangely trashy and bar-like. The outdoor space was dominated by what looked like drunk college kids. We ended up going over to the pavilion and sitting at one of the weirdly sterile-looking circular tables to listen to the musician strumming away on a guitar. It felt too much like we were at a wedding or church function, so we ended up just heading back to our car and heading elsewhere. I know they were busy, but our interactions with the staff were also rather cold and unwelcoming, which didn't help our feeling out of place. Maybe Baron's is better suited for large groups rather than couples, but the vibe just wasn't for us.

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: Attended a tasting and enjoyed it. We even became members. If you become a member, you get your tasting complimentary and discounts on food. Not bad at all considering the wines are not sold in stores.   The pizza was also really great.   Though I would like to say that we did not feel welcomed initially. We reserved a private bottle tasting which was located on the right hand side inside. The server was not eager to have us and sent us back to the hostess stand which made it an awkward experience for my fiancé and I, even the hostess.   So we finally got to our 2nd server who was amazing and remedied the awkward feeling. It was cold outside but we felt very warm by the heaters. Looking forward to taking advantage of the member benefits in the future!

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Planned a two night stay in Fredericksburg and made a reservation for a tasting at Barons Creek. I had high expectations with the high-end grounds and build-out but was disappointed. The tasting room was nice but just the standard tasting room. Wine selection was OK and the reds I tried were good but again, disappointing with my high-expectations. We found a couple other vineyards that we like much better.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Been here 2x and tried both their mixed and red wine tastings. Ordered the cheese board both times and been impressed with the selection of cheeses, meats, and their chocolate covered coffee beans (goes well with the vino!). The service is good but they did not explain the wines as much as some of the other wineries did. I love the outdoors area here. It's a wonderful place for pictures!

reviews.author: Gerold G.
reviews.description: Great winery in Fredericksburg with a large selection of wine. We took the wine tasting class which lost of knowledge and fun!!

reviews.author: Brianna M.
reviews.description: Everyone was so sweet. We didnt have a reservation but they sat us for a tasting without any hesitations. Our sever was so sweet and the wines were delicious. we will be coming back! scenery is gorgeous.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine and good service despite a busy Saturday afternoon. Enjoyed the Tempranillo the best. Would recommend to others and come back again.

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Just okay... I took my in-laws here for a tasting. None of the wines were good enough to want to purchase. I ordered the charcuterie and none of it was easily accessible. What I mean was none of the cheese was sliced just so you could grab it but we were not given cutlery to do anything about it. The table was super tiny between the four of us, our glasses and the charcuterie. The place is pretty hit that's about it.

reviews.author: Valerie H.
reviews.description: Beautiful property! Definitely stop here when visiting Fredericksburg. Plenty of space to social distance and still enjoy a wine tasting. You can make a reservation online which was super simple, kudos for that. Their outdoor area is so pretty, we went on a rainy day but they had heaters and a covered area so we were still able to enjoy the space. The food is a little pricey but other than that a really awesome vineyard.

reviews.author: Erica B.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place but I was disappointed by the grounds and the waitstaff that waited on us was incredibly rude. I did really enjoy the one glass of Rosé I had, but I don't think I'll be back.

reviews.author: Ritodhi C.
reviews.description: This was our first stop on a whirlwind our of Hill Country wineries and ended up as our likely favorite. We undoubtedly enjoy drinking wine and do so often but are complete novices when it comes to the art of viniculture. Thankfully, the numerous employees who rotated through and engaged with us during our tasting were friendly and knowledgeable, unpretentious, and clearly loved their jobs. We were seated at the central bar and the tasting room itself was warm and welcoming, with high ceilings and lovely natural light. The Indian twist was really unique, from the auto-rickshaw out front to the wallpaper in the bathroom to the very name of the winery, though I have to say as an Indian-American myself that the savory snacks on the menu are tasty but extremely overpriced. We got to try several varietals that we had never had before (e.g., Roussane, Tannat) that were really delicious and none of them, even the Muscat, were overly saccharine. On top of all this, Kalasi is an advocate and supporter of Texas-grown wines and wineries and engages in sustainable farming practices, partially by employing some on-site sheep and a llama. A really enjoyable way to spend an afternoon that I highly recommend!

reviews.author: Bob C.
reviews.description: Very friendly and helpful. Wines were excellent, grounds were great, our dog enjoyed watching the llama and sheep from a distance. Highly recommend this venue over some of the bigger places that charge more and could care less about your afternoon!

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Some interesting tasting wines and a pleasant host.  This was our first visit to a Texas winery so the $20 price tag for a tasting was a bit steep as it is not credited towards a purchase, that being said this is the real deal and not a fancy faux estate putting on aires of being in Napa or Sonoma.

reviews.author: Holly H.
reviews.description: The wine, the experience, the service - you can't miss this place when visiting Fredericksburg! The tasting room is bright and spacious (great for staying your distance from others). The tasting room employees are friendly and knowledgeable without being pretentious. And the outdoor space is to die for! Picturesque trees with anorak chairs below to take in the surrounding view while sipping on world class wine from Texas! Grapes are grown by the family and care is taken from soil to bottle with each wine. A family affair that you can't get enough of!

reviews.author: Kay L.
reviews.description: Kalasi offered one of the best winery experiences we have had in awhile, especially during COVID. We normally prefer outside but actually felt safe inside here because they had everyone spaced out at the bar, and the tasting room has really high ceilings and felt airy. The service was great... Darryl and the owners were all so kind and took the time to chat and tell us about the winery and offer recommendations for other places in the area. It's pronounced "KAL-ah-see", if I remember correctly, and means "together" since it's a husband and wife who started it.  The wine is great. The tannat and Sangiovese were our favorites, but they were honestly all good... even the whites, which are not normally our favorites. We took some home. But the thing that really topped it all off for us was the food. I've never seen Indian food at a winery and it was absolutely delicious! The samosas and tikka masala pizza actually went really well with the wine. They appeared to be just reheated from frozen (it's not like they have a full restaurant, it's just a light menu they started serving due to COVID rules) but don't let that dissuade you, it was amazing.   The location is kind of in a residential area, so we would never have just passed by (thank you Yelp!) but it is so close to Fredericksburg, and very convenient. Visit, and don't forget to say hi to the sheep and llama!

reviews.author: Christine K.
reviews.description: Just had a second trip to Kalasi and how is it possible that I'm more in love than the first time? The first time we visited back in November, the owners Greg and Nikhila were so welcoming. They shared their story about setting up the new winery and introduced us to all the sheep and their handsome protector, Dalai the llama. The great wine was just a bonus!  I was lucky enough to get away for a weekend HAD to get a reservation at Kalasi. Christi took care of our small group. She was wonderful--introduced me to a few new wines and taught me about the different wine varieties. We ended up leaving with multiple bottles and this will definitely be my first stop the next time I'm in Fredericksburg.  My favorites: Malbec New favorite: Muscat--crisp, refreshing, and not too sweet

reviews.author: Manny G.
reviews.description: Wines are Ok, but nothing complex or special. The tastings are WAY WAY over priced, especially with the very Stingy pours (see pic).  I commented on the size of pour and they brushed off the comment. Bring your own pallet cleanser, they offered me none. Save your money and ask for a glass of Carmenere. It was very well done. Everything else is not worth the cost. I was disappointed to find out that unlike the  practice of most wineries, they don't waive tasting fee if you buy a set number, usually 3, bottles.  Tasting fees are more than a bottle.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn M.
reviews.description: A couple of friends and I randomly came across Kalasi on Google Maps, so we thought we'd check it out. It was our favorite winery our entire trip. Delicious wine, personable owners, very clean. We each did a tasting - $20 for 5 pours l. Planning another trip next month and will be coming back!

reviews.author: Julie W.
reviews.description: My husband and I came here after hearing great things from other family members.  They were right, this should be at the top of your list for wineries to visit.  The tasting room is spacious and comfortable and the owner and employees very nice.  We did not do a tasting as we had recommendations from family, but purchased a bottle of Malbec and drank it outside on their beautiful grounds and enjoyed the scenery.  They have a few friendly sheep and a llama in a nearby field and they are fun to watch.  We did try a few other wines and all were very nice.  So nice, we purchased a few bottles to take home with us.  We will definitely visit here again!

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: The couple that owns this winery is so sweet and welcoming! Kalasi is very close to downtown and has a nice view of the pasture. Make sure to check out the llama and the sheep.  Our go to wine is the Carménère with a side of Indian snacks.

reviews.author: Takao N.
reviews.description: We stopped by this new cellars because of many positive Yelp reviews.  They were right!!!  The place is beautiful and their wine selection is fantastic.  We did the tastings and ended up buying a bottle of Meritage.  Darrell was our guy and he was knowledgeable, friendly and nice to talk to.  We had a great time out there.  We will definitely come back.  COVID conscious, too and we felt very safe.

reviews.author: Vanessa R.
reviews.description: My husband and I enjoyed our anniversary by visiting Fredericksburg. We drove by Kalasi and noticed a large Now Open sign at their entrance. We popped in and couldn't have been more pleased.  We were greeted upon entering and we started with the wine tasting. Every wine was better than the next. My favorite was the Teroldego. We bought 1 bottle to enjoy while sitting outside and snacking on the delicious curry pizza.  I highly recommend Kalasi and wish them the very best. We will be back!!

reviews.author: Melody S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful place to spend an afternoon! I was a little nervous bringing my toddlers to a winery but the staff could not have been more welcoming or accommodating. We started inside and eventually moved outside for the kids to run around. The staff was wonderful, the wine was awesome, and the atmosphere was beautiful. We also ordered their whole menu of snacks and loved everything. We are already looking forward to our next trip there!

reviews.author: Shravan H.
reviews.description: I could give 10 stars to this place if I could. One of the best experiences my group and I had in many years. The hospitality that Darryl, Blair and Patty showed us1 was beyond words could describe. They are the NICEST hosts one couldeq EVER get. They went above and beyond to make us feel way too special. This is a unique place with a beautiful Llama and a flock of sheeps. I'm not sure aa win78q 1 expert but I loved both the reds I tried. You go here for the wonderful experience, love, and amazing hospitality. Kudos to the owners for getting such a loving staff. Made our day.

reviews.author: Gabriela R.
reviews.description: We went on a Wednesday and were able to reserve a time slot to have the whole room to ourselves. As a covid conscious person, this was the first time since March 2019 that I had been in a public setting (other than the grocery store) and I felt safe. Darrell was very knowledgeable, passionate, and a great story teller. This was my very first wine tasting and he did a great job of giving me the rundown on how these things usually go. My mother and I had an awesome time! There were so many new flavors I experienced at this tasting and I am so excited to share my bottle of 2017 Tannat, with the rest of my family  We will be back!   Also: The bathrooms were BEAUTIFUL! Seriously, take a look at that wall paper!

reviews.author: G D.
reviews.description: What a nice little gem here in town! Very friendly and clean! Did the wine tasting and tried out the snacks, tasty! The outside is very relaxing and peaceful. Came on a Sunday evening, and not too busy. We come back again when in town.

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Really interesting wines to try. Great staff that is knowledgeable and friendly. Fun to try some new varietals. Tasting room is pretty cool. We really liked the Malbec and the Carmenet. Highly recommended. Very close to downtown Fredericksburg

reviews.author: Sherry H.
reviews.description: Greg was super nice!   We loved all of the reds and bought bottles!  Hi wife Nikhila informed me on the Texas wine drinker Facebook page that they were open starting this week!  We were excited to get a reservation.  All of the wines were great!!   Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Rebillbula A.
reviews.description: Good wine. The owners were really nice. They just opened a few months ago.  Great building and outside area.

reviews.author: Tricia S.
reviews.description: We visited late on Sunday before they closed.  What a fabulous experience experience we had.  We left with a bottle of Rousanne and Sangiovese. But we could have left with so much more.  All the wines were so good.  We can't wait to go back.  As a wine geek looking to help elevate Texas wines, this place is awesome.  Thank you for a wonderful tasting!

reviews.author: Sumer L.
reviews.description: I LOVED this place. So cozy, clean, and peaceful. I highly recommend if you're in the area. The best place to relax and enjoy nature. The animals (ducks and cats) on premise also are very friendly, I was concerned about an orange cat who was sick. I hope the very nice staff at the lodge will take him to the vet. He hung out by my cabin all night wanting attention. He came right up to me and I noticed he had a bad cough and cuts on his face.

reviews.author: Elle G.
reviews.description: We rented a cabin for 4 days/3 nights.  This place is amazing.  The history behind its origination is beautiful.  We enjoyed it so much that we are looking to come back with our adult kids for a family getaway.  We highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Stephy B.
reviews.description: What super cute places. I luv it here first time and will definitely be back. So peaceful and quite nice views and being in the country. The cabins are so cute and cozy.little farm houses. They allow pets as well.And they have hot tubs in back yard. Very great place to stay and the cost is really good as well.

reviews.author: Chris N.
reviews.description: We are both employees for a major airline (Pilot and Flight Attendant) and have had the opportunity to travel the world over and spend most of our lives staying in some really nice places but from minute one we were both taken aback at the beauty and attention to detail that Daniel and Deborah have given this place.  Staying at Barons Creekside was a last minute decision to escape from our airport life and find some peace and quiet. We found that and more during our 5 day stay.  From the minute we arrived, the simplicity of the check-in process ( Just pick your keys up from the mailbox at The Club ), to having precut firewood available right by the cabin impressed us.  The combination of amazing log cabins, outdoor fire pits and charcoal BBQ's, all nestled together on gently rolling terrain with a subtle but much appreciated hint of privacy,  showed us we had selected the perfect getaway.  The ability to just enjoy a quiet evening on the patio or join in the fun at The Club located on the property was the icing on the cake.  Also, the proximity to downtown Fredericksburg, as well as over 70 Vineyards, Peach Harvesting, and Horseback Riding put the stay over the top.   We had an amazing vineyard tour of Kuhlman's Winery one day and a relaxing 2 hour trail ride at the Blue Moon Ranch the next evening. Highly recommend both of these adventures. We even worked in a quick afternoon trip to Luckenbach TX (home of Texas Country Music).  Evenings brought some amazing live music at The Club as well as some excellent wines right from the vineyard located on the property.  Lastly, the amazing staff that Daniel and Deborah have put together shows what incredible people they are!! Their staff never missed a beat.  Believe us when we say, this is a hidden gem in the Texas Hill Country you will want to come back to again and again. We will !!!!

reviews.author: Juanita G.
reviews.description: Best place to stay!!!! Very romantic, and calm... the wagon is a wonderful adventure!!! Very very clean and I am very picky with that!!!   The cabin was amazing! Fireplace, Jacuzzi... Everything was beyond perfection!   Finally, Deborah is a wonderful person always looking to give the best vacations ever!   Very thankful and for sure I will come back!

reviews.author: Kyle R.
reviews.description: My family and I were absolutely blown away bye our stay at Barons Creekside. The grounds were incredibly well-kept and featured several really cool trails where we would walk after dinner. The owners were very kind and generous and we will definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Pamela W.
reviews.description: Loved our stay while visiting Fredericksburg. Clean, quiet, and such a beautiful landscape.

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: This resort is the PERFECT getaway, especially during the Coronavirus pandemic. The cabins are secluded enough from each other that we rarely even saw anyone else. Check in/Check out was so easy. We stayed in the Mesquite Farmhouse. It was so quaint and expertly appointed. We had every amenity we could possibly need. As a bonus, a family of deer must live nearby as they were often prancing around the back yard throughout our stay.    It's close to downtown Fredericksburg, it's a stone's throw from the main highway, 290 and close enough to the wineries, Luckenbach, and Enchanted Rock State Park.   The only thing we will do differently next time is bring several of our friends  to enjoy it with us.

reviews.author: Dean M.
reviews.description: Spent another long weekend at Barons CreekSide and they always exceed expectations. Daniel and Deborah ensure their guests have a fantastic experience.  Great Swiss cabins with quiet, peaceful and tranquil grounds just a few minutes' drive from downtown and all Fredericksburg has to offer.
