The Club on the property is a great place to chill with drinks and eats and weekend live music just a short walk from  your cabin porch. Lightning bugs were plentiful at dusk which was a real treat.  I love this place.  I'll be back....

reviews.author: Brice C.
reviews.description: Barons Creekside is a peaceful place to get away from it all yet still close to Fredericksburg shopping and dining.  We stayed three nights in the Zug cabin in early April.  This cabin has nice front porch with rocking chairs from where we fed the ducks as they came by for their daily visit.  There is a little creek that runs through property which added to the tranquility.  The cabin is well appointed with coffee and tea provided.   The weather was cool so we used the large fireplace a two nights.  Ample firewood was just a short walk away.  We dined at the on property venue, "The Club" and enjoyed a fine meal and some live music.  The menu was somewhat limited but with interesting options.  The food and service was very good.  We made use of the charcoal grill one evening which is sized just right for a meal for two.  We enjoyed Barons Creekside so much that we plan to make an annual visit there.

reviews.author: Kayla W.
reviews.description: We rented out 3 houses and 5 cabins for our 40th birthday this month!  It was such a wonderful time!!  Everyone loved their cabins/houses. They were all so unique but cozy and clean. We ALL didn't want to leave and will definitely be back!!! Would for sure recommend for groups or even just a couple get away. Not far from downtown but just far enough away to feel like your in the country.

reviews.author: Al B.
reviews.description: We booked last minute and stayed a single night in the Hilltop Sunset Cabin.  It was just perfect.  We loved the style of the cabin, all the amenities and particularly the open air jacuzzi out on the front deck.  We also manage to make a memory when our 4-year old caught his first ever fish down in the creek.  What a lovely place.  Cannot recommend it highly enough.....

reviews.author: Amber G.
reviews.description: Wow! This was an amazing little treasure nestled away in its own little paradise. It seems like your so far away in another world but actually very close to downtown. The sounds and sights were tranquil and pristine. This place was immaculate. I did not see one piece of trash. The attention to detail and artistry of the cabin was so cool! I can't wait to go back! I didn't want to leave but I will be back! I can't say enough good things about the beautiful scenery, birds, people and decor. Everyone was friendly and professional.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I booked a getaway night as a birthday treat for my wife. I had planned some hiking and tours of local wineries but the weather had other plans. As we drove to Fredericksburg, the rain started and the temperature dropped 30 degrees, and it didn't stop there. But the adorable Zug cabin offered a wonderful retreat from the cold, damp outside. We built a roaring log fire, barbequed dinner and opened a bottle of bubbly. The contact-less check-in/check-out was efficient, and the cabin was clean and offered everything we needed. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Courtney J.
reviews.description: I cannot recommend Barons CreekSide enough! This was our first trip to Fredericksburg, and I stumbled across Barons CreekSide online but really didn't know what it would be like in person. After looking at the geotagged pictures on Instagram, we decided to book it. Let me tell you, it wildly exceeded all of our expectations. We stayed in cabin Davos which was lovely and located near the entrance to the property. We enjoyed coffee on the swing behind our cabin each morning while we fed the adorable ducks. The staff was amazing - the owner of the property answers the phones and works in The Club each night, it was great to see him take such pride in his business and really stay involved. The experience was absolutely lovely and we cannot wait to come back! Thank you, Barons CreekSide!

reviews.author: Billy M.
reviews.description: If you want a charming and relaxing place to get away and chill then this is the place. Cozy, beautiful cabins loaded with what you need, comfortable bed, quiet and isolated but yet close enough to town to go there and back easily. Nice little club on site with food and music.

reviews.author: Christopher P.
reviews.description: What can I say about Barons that hasn't already been said. It's a beautiful serene place that I always appreciate. My wife and I honeymooned there and it's our Anniversary spot. When we drive in we will spend a few days hiking at Enchanted Rock and Perdinales Falls or climbing Old Baldy at the Frio River. And when we get back to the cabin we just enjoy the serenity, relax on the porch at the creek or on the couch. There's a great club on the property that opens in the evenings so you can enjoy the great wine selection and not have to drive. Just a beautiful stroll back to your cabin. There's a perch to watch the sunset that we always make sure to catch at least once during our trip. Daniel and the crew are great host and have always been quite friendly. There's history in every cabin out there and it's obvious when you walk in that it's special. There's no way to convey the place in words so I won't try. But everyone who goes will go back.

reviews.author: Abby H.
reviews.description: Stayed here for our honeymoon and it was perfect! The stream they have running through the place is so calming and relaxing. The cabins were the perfect size and full of character. The grounds are beautiful and the owners were super nice. Highly recommend !

reviews.author: Carolyn T.
reviews.description: My husband and I absolutely LOVED our stay at the romantic Barons Creekside cabins.  The decor was beautiful, and the cabins felt so private and secluded.  The owner was very kind and offered a wonderful dinner suggestion the first night we were in town.  We definitely plan to stay at Barons Creekside again when we return to the Texas Hill Country!

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: Bliss!   We first came here the Fall of 2013 and have visited twice since then. We fell in love with our little cabin-the Grindelwald. It was perfect for our small but growing family. Our pups enjoyed it too!  The grounds were perfect and it was incredibly quiet considering how close we were to Main Street. Our daughter has enjoyed the tree climbing and duck feedings. She looks forward to the s'mores and "real fires"!  The stone fireplace is quaint and the rockers on the porch are perfect for reading and relaxing. We always wondered what our "family tradition" would be.  All signs point to Baron's Creekside.  Daniel and Deborah (owners) have made us feel like family. We adore them.   We cannot wait to come back next year.   Note:  there's a bistro on the grounds. Live music, intimate setting and hella good wine. :) If you want some good food, a relaxing atmosphere and to enjoy the walk back to your cabin, this is the place. ;)

name: Becker Vineyards Main Street Tasting Room

reviews.author: Haley D.
reviews.description: This tasting room is at the end of Main Street and is huge! Besides the tasting, there's cute decor for purchase and a patio.   They offer three tastings, red, white and mixed. We tried the mixed tasting. They are more well known for their dry wines and that was well demonstrated on the tasting menu.   The tasting was a little expensive in comparison to other tasting rooms on Main St., about $35 each.

reviews.author: Vanessa Q.
reviews.description: This review is solely for constructive feedback, not to put down a business.  I was truly excited about visiting this winery. The reviews on Trip Advisory had me sold! Even upon entry; I loved the smell of this French-country shop. They had soaps, salts, potpourri, and wonderful things of that nature. Behind all of these beautifully-bagged scents lied the wines. Everything looked clean and organized, and I was ready to sample. I was showed the list of preselected wines Becker offered. I was able to chose between drys, mixed, and whites. I picked mixed so I can try a both reds and whites. It cost $32 to sample 5 wines plus 1 rosé. Normally I have very good hearing, but today, the woman helping me was so soft-spoken, I had a difficult time hearing the description of the wines. I'd understand if it was loud inside, but it was quiet and her disposable mask was thin. I even noticed all of the wines she's poured had spouts that controlled how much wine came out of the bottle. It was about 2oz. Now, I understand everyone's taste buds differ, but the wines were not leave a positive impression on my palette. Beside the description of the taste, she didn't share much knowledge about the origin or history of the  wines. On the other hand, I also appreciated the souvenir wine glass I was able to keep for having sampled the wines. I think my wine tasting experience at Becker's could have been improved by having a more entertaining server, a bit more to sample per glass, and choosing my own samples.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: I loved visiting the tasting room for the first time!  I've been to the winery, but loved the vibe of the tasting room! It is big, clean, and currently only selling wine by the glass or bottle, but they will allow your to try a few sips of wine!  Stop in here if you can!  It will make your experience in Main Street that much better!

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: We only had time to visit one winery and I had never been to any. PERFECT  Wine tasting, by the glass or bottle to enjoy among the beautiful grounds. I'll come back to see the lavender fields next time

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Hey Becker Vineyards! I get it... we got there at 4:10 pm... And we were told they only took "reservations only" or was that a lie? NO ONE was there in the tasting room. NO ONE. We came to Fredericksburg to scout wineries for a major event in June. We live in San Antonio and know Becker Vineyards is a good company and the owners good people... but the guy who turned us away at 4:10 and said "we are winding down for the day , so I will not serve you" was a jerk. The sign outside said last serve was 4:30. If I owned a business I would encourage money in the coffers. I would encourage patronage in my establishment. We only wanted one glass of wine and to take in the atmosphere. To the guy who was too lazy to wait on us, shame on you. We won't be back- and we pass on your vineyard for our event.

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This used to be one of our favorite places to visit in the wine country. We went for Oktoberfest 2021 and we were turned away. Spend your time and money elsewhere, there are plenty of better places to visit around in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Spike S.
reviews.description: Reviewed October 31, 2018  Probably the best in Fredericksburg! We visited the store on Main in Fredericksburg. Very nice store. They have a large selection of wine to try. The service in the store was exceptional as is the wine! If you are going to do wine tasting in town, this is the place. You will not be disappointed. Note: This review was originally posted on Tripadvisor by Spike S.

reviews.author: Nicole E.
reviews.description: Nice spot on Main Street and nice bar or tabletop options for sipping on some wines. Nice long bar to hang with friends or family while sampling wines.  The vineyard and lavender fields are about 15 minutes away and what great fragrance from the soaps, sachets and other products sold. My FIL enjoyed his sweet wines. Charcuterie plate for $24 available is a good accompaniment to the wines.

reviews.author: Chung S.
reviews.description: My husband, Gary, and my adult daughter, Andrea stopped by the tasting room.  We are Becker's Wine Club Members so it's always wonderful to stop by.    As members, we can come with up to 3 of our friends for wine tasting or a glass of wine of our choice.  The staff here are wonderful.  The wine tasting room is in an old Buick building on Main Street.    I usually enjoy a glass of Raven Cabernet Sauvignon but they are sold out.  The Cabernet Fran is pretty delicious.  My husband enjoys the Muscat Canelli and my daughter likes the Clementine, a late harvest Sauvignon Blanc that my daughter LOVES.  The staff here are AWESOME.  And there have a GReAT charcuterie plate!!!   If you don't have time to visit the vineyard in Stonewall, TX, this is the next best thing.  Salut!!

reviews.author: Chrissy P.
reviews.description: This was my favorite wine tasting room in Fredericksburg. It's $20 to try 6 different wines and it includes a souvenir wine glass. They give you tickets so when you're ready to try the next wine of your choice, you just turn in a ticket. This is great because you don't feel rushed at all and you can sit down with each wine and take your time if you want to sip it. There is a lot of seating inside and outside and you can even do some shopping while you sip inside the store. The inside of the shop is beautiful with a fun atmosphere.  I prefer dry red wines and they have plenty of those. All the wines I tried were amazing. They have a charcuterie board that I didn't get to try but I will for sure next time I go!

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: If you are in Fredericksburg, but you can't find time to make it over to the Vineyard, this is the next best thing. They offer tastings and the ambiance is fun and casual with lots on indoor and outdoor seating. Can't beat the convenience! The outdoor patio is dog friendly too!

reviews.author: Al R.
reviews.description: The staff is incredibly rude and tossed a towel at our table, then said clean it up. The it was ice cube, from a glass of water. When I asked to speak to the manager, Tyler refused to come out. I went inside to ask why the staff had been rude to my table, Tyler stated that it was my opinion that the staff had been rude and my opinion that the staff member had thrown a rag. i tried to explain to him the difference between a fact and an opinion and so did the table next to us, but he did not have the mental capacity to understand the difference. Tyler acted aggressive toward my self and my sister, and refused to apologize. This is at the least unprofessional and its my opinion he should no longer be employed. The incident caused us to cancel our membership of 4 years, Tyler did not care.

reviews.author: Caleb M.
reviews.description: Loved the tasting room. They have just about all the wines you would find out at the vineyard (maybe not reserve ones?) and do tastings here that are just the same. It's a lovely space, and the outdoor covered patio is also very nice.   The wine is very good, with the '17 Saigne rose' and the '14 muscat being my favorites.   The charcuterie plate was excellent, with very solid cheeses and meats, and a fig jam that is to die for, though if you're like myself and really NOT a fan of truffles, opt to get it without the truffle honey. At $24, it was significantly more well curated that similar plates at other locations, and could potentially constitute a meal for 2-3 people.  Will look to come back when next in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Deb D.
reviews.description: Nice tasting room on Main Street.  6 tastes of your choice  for $15 includes souvenir glass.  Had some real nice wines and a nice big tasting room and gift shop.

reviews.author: Wendy K.
reviews.description: Visited Becker with my mom on a quiet week day. We went to the location on Main Street in Fredricksburg. Our bartender was sweet, kind and brilliant. Her expertise was clear... she knew her wine and made excellent suggestions, as their menu or selection was robust. We are going back many times this year!

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: This review is in response to Al. R's review written on 3/30/2021 to set the record straight... I was a member of a group sitting on the patio and witnessed everything go down that Al is accusing this establishment of. For once I am happy that being a member of a bachlorette group, we were not the ones causing a scene! We have always loved Becker Vineyards and we were all appalled to see how rude their poor staff was treated by these beyond wasted and rude people in Al's party. First off in my OPINION, children do not belong at a winery, especially when the adults taking care of the children are smashed. The children were loud and rowdy, there was ice being thrown and water was every where. It did not make for a peaceful wine drinking atmosphere at all. The adults' behavior was no better than the children's, and the only ones being aggressive were Al and I guess his sister. The yelling, screaming and cussing were completely outrageous and could be heard from inside and all the way down the street as they left. For the record, there was no towel thrown, a towel was brought out to the table and placed on the corner of the table to clean up the children's mess and the children immediately grabbed the towel and started throwing it at each other. It is obvious that these low life people blew this up into a huge scene to try and get something for free and when the manager did not back down to them and defended his employee it upset them even more causing them to act no better than a child throwing a temper tantrum. I knew to look for this review because they made it very clear while yelling and screaming off the property that they were going to write the worst review on Yelp. Also we heard them talking at their table previous to the big blow up... they had cancelled their wine club membership a long time ago and not that day because they are cheap and weren't happy with the lack of member befits due to covid. The manager, Tyler, came outside and individually apologized to every table for the disturbance this group had caused. Honestly Al and his entire party should be ashamed and embarrassed for how they acted and for the unpleasant scene they caused. Bless you Becker Vineyards and all your staff, we know you are doing an amazing job during these difficult and different times. Don't sweat the ugly people in this world like Al, he can go fly a kite and get drunk with children somewhere else.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great service. Great wines. Great atmosphere.   Their petite syrah is the best!!

reviews.author: Taylor D.
reviews.description: manager and employees are racists!! Do not go here!!! The other night I left with the most disgusting taste in my mouth and I didn't even try the wine. I was helping myself to the free samples of mulled wine when I over heard the older white lady who worked behind the bar tell the older white gentlemen manager that she "thinks those N-words over there are drunk." Substituting the real word for N-word. She said it clear as day and it was meant to be between her and the manager but I was close enough to overhear their conversation.  I then saw the older white manager promptly go and confront the group of younger kids and told them to leave. The group left politely but seemed confused as to why they were being asked to leave. From my vantage point they didn't seem intoxicated but either way I would never use my dollars to support an establishment that employs racists. The owners of Becker should be disgusted and demand accountability for this unacceptable behavior. I also highly suspect this isn't the first time they used the laws of sobriety to deploy racism and segregate their customer base.

reviews.author: James O.
reviews.description: First and foremost I do wanna say that this place does have some fine wine. However we walked in 32 minutes before close and they refused to serve us due to us "looking too intoxicated". Don't get me wrong, I get that if we had been drinking, but we were completely sober. Honestly, it seemed as if they were simply looking for any excuse to close down early. Kind of disappointing since we had driven all of the way from Austin.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: I loved wine tasting at Becker Vineyards!! What a great experience: the staff are so helpful and considerate!! Everyone I talked to was exceptionally helpful and kind. The selection of wines for tasting was extensive too! For $20, you are able to taste 7 (1 is complimentary depending on the day, so technically 6) wines and keep the wine glass as a souvenir. For $24, you can also get a meat and cheese board with prosciutto, smoked ham, salami, Parmesan, manchego, goat cheese, figs, macadamia nuts, artichoke, and apricots. Additionally, the interior design and decorations are industrial yet modern and beautiful!! There's plenty of seating as well as an area to shop for souvenirs and lounge. I'm definitely planning on coming back in the future!

reviews.author: Emily C.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time at Safari! We did a tasting and charcuterie board with the fabulous Debra Ann! She took such great care of us and made us feel so special. The wine is delicious and the vibe is so fun. We are already itching to go back!!

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: Our bridesmaid group had a great time at the Safari Winery! I'm not sure if it's because we came in around 45 mins before closing, but we went through 3 people until we got an official staff member to serve our party. Unfortunately I've forgotten his name, but I'm glad we ended up with him because he was wonderful! He was very good about offering us another drink if we didn't like one we had chosen and making sure we had a great time.   We each did a wine tasting and ordered bread with olive oil and a charcuterie board to share. The charcuterie board had great variety and was exactly what we needed to pair with our wine! It easily fed all 5 of us. I prefer white wine and tend to make a face anytime I drink red wine, but the Sweet Red was certainly my favorite! I honestly don't drink wine often, but if I did, I would have gotten a bottle.  I would definitely recommend stopping by on your wine wine journey in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Pam D.
reviews.description: Save your time and money and skip this winery! There are just too many other beautiful, welcoming places in the area with great wines made on-site in the area- and this is not one of them.   We stopped in without doing any research on the spot, because we were drawn in by the name and signage. I was surprised to find out that part of the "safari" theme is that none of their wines are made with grapes on the property. Instead, the "safari" theme is their creative way of selling wine made elsewhere. As it was explained to me, the owners own a share of the estate where the grapes are grown (or something like that) and technically make their own wines that are then shipped here, but that's a really elaborate story to say that it's not local wine. If tasting wine from the area is what you're here for, you can skip it. The wines I did taste, I didn't really enjoy. The woman pouring our wines kept recommending different ones than I had chosen which is normally welcome, but it's surprising that there are just so many she'd want to steer us away from.   I'm not sure what exactly we were hoping for as far as ambiance- but we were pretending to enjoy our wine while staring at a wide variety of dead animals (or fake mountings, we couldn't tell for sure) displayed with pride around the room.   But what was truly the worst about our experience was the service received. The manager on duty, John, treated our group so poorly from the moment we walked in. He spoke to members of our group in a low, mumbling voice so we could barely hear him and the things he said wasn't making sense. There was also another bartender that seemed to have it out for us, as she made snarky remarks about our group to John in passing that was loud enough for everyone to hear.   I have never been treated this way in any dining or drinking facility so I was shocked! In our small group, we had two members that were not drinking at all and they confirmed this peculiar behavior, so this is not a case of a fuzzy memory. We were ultimately asked to leave (we think- we're not really sure what John was saying or asking us to do). We asked to pay for our tastings which we were only a few tastings into, and John said there was no charge for the tastings ($21/each). We tried to insist on paying so we could tip our server, who was very kind to us, but we were told no. Our group was not loud or rowdy or drunk, we were just...normal. It was almost like they were trying to pick a group to throw out for fun, and zeroed in on us for some reason.   The whole experience was absolutely bewildering. It's too bad since I think the Safari theme is a fun and unique idea. But it is not executed well, and unfortunately the staff is what really made the experience awful.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: This winery is so much fun! They offer a great selection of wine for all pallets. Their selections are from Africa. I have been to Fredericksburg many times and am sad that I waited this long to try this place. This has shot up my list as one of my favorites down 290. Their customer service was amazing. Big shout out to Shelby for being so friendly, patient, gracious and VERY knowledgeable about the product she was sampling to us. She's also a great salesperson, as I am now a member. I was unable to get the names of the hostess's up front but they were very sweet and helpful as well. I highly recommend this winery (don't wait like I did!) they are also apart of the 290 bus route. I can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful winery and the wines are SO GOOD! Def some of our favorite wines here (I'm a cab drinker). The staff is incredible and April is awesome!

reviews.author: Traci U.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places to visit in Fredericksburg!!! The staff were so friendly and knowledgeable! The facility is beautiful and the bathrooms were spotless! The wines were delicious and we bought a few bottles to bring home! Would definitely recommend stopping in!

reviews.author: Jason H.
reviews.description: This is one of the top 2 wineries we've visited in Fredericksburg. We enjoyed every single wine that we tried. Ask for Curt or Bree to do your tastings (we did 1 with each).

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: Place was not welcoming to different races or cultures and is bias . They ignored us and multiple bartender stared at us like we were non existent. We were dressed well and still being ignored all the while . It took me 15+ to ask for assistance  of waiting  we waited an additional 5 mins again no assistance . While everyone else who was Caucasian was being served first coming after us .We had gotten some help from Adam yet still felt un  welcomed and some type of resistance at this establishment.We left and never looked back .

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: We had such a fun time! Frankie was amazing and very informative  The Andean red was our favorite. A must try.  Also the t-shirt are so cute!!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: We had a very pleasant lunch here sitting outside on an expansive, tree-shaded patio enjoying flawless weather. Facility is beautiful and welcoming. I had the Chardonnay and my wife had the Sauvignon blanc. Both were from Chile and both  were crisp and refreshing. Curt and the rest of the staff were courteous, friendly and attentive without being intrusive.

reviews.author: Sofia M.
reviews.description: Love this place..  I recommend getting sweet red wine they are the number one wine they sell if you like sweet wine.,  Greta atmosphere. Great service and fast.  Good place to hangout or celebrate a special day. Live music on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: This place is very nice. We sat at the bar for a wine tasting, then went outside with glasses of wine and ordered some food. The food was good, not amazing but decent. A lot of the wines we picked were rather sweet, but we did find some good red and whites. The patio is very relaxing and pretty. The staff were friendly, and even the owner, I think, was walking around and checking on everyone. It was a nice experience overall.

reviews.author: Katrina W.
reviews.description: I love safari winery. I've been before and during COVID and it's been fabulous both times   Try the malbecs!

reviews.author: Avantika B.
reviews.description: It's a beautiful winery, they do jot offer tours. Wine tasting was decent, if I remember right it was $21 per person and we tasted 5 or 6 wines. They get wines from Africa unlike other wineries in the area have vineyards locally in Fredricksburg. We bought a bottle of wine after tasting and sat in patio and enjoyed our time there. It was a beautiful day in October 2020.

reviews.author: Tracy C.
reviews.description: Im we had a great experience! Curt served us for the wine tasting- he was very pleasant and fun to work with! The wine was not my favorite but the experience was great!

reviews.author: Katrina W.
reviews.description: Tony is awesome. Great time doing a small group tasting with lots of different types of wines.  Safari so good!

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: We had amazing time visiting Safari Winery! Carole was amazing and informative! We will definitely come back!

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: We had a great tasting experience. Very spread out. They're very knowledgeable on theirs wines. They are not Texas wines but are from South Africa and Chilean. A beautiful outside area to hang out. They will be expanding and have big plans for the future. A must stop for tasting if your in the area.

reviews.author: Teresa J.
reviews.description: The wines are just delicious! Wines are from South America and South Africa but don't let that stop you. The winemaking process makes these wines so good.

reviews.author: Tara A.
reviews.description: This place was amazing! I only regret not visiting it sooner. Went down to Fburg with my mom for Mother's Day and this was the first stop on the 290 wine shuttle. It's SO CUTE! We each did a tasting and all of the wines were delicious, but the Andean White was my favorite. I wish I could buy this in stores since I live in Dallas! Truly an unforgettable experience and it pains me that I cannot remember the gentleman who did our tastings but he is in the background of the photo. We hit it off with him and had great conversation to the point we all hugged when we left! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Martin D.
reviews.description: Loved Vaudeville! We were walking around and found this place for lunch. They have outdoor seating, but the bistro is downstairs when you walk in. Great vibe to this place. We ended up splitting our sandwiches in half and sharing with each other because we couldn't decide which sounded best. I was worried it was going to be too fancy for us, but it was very casual.    If stairs are challenging, I would suggest eating outside at street level as restrooms are located on the first floor. I do believe they have an elevator but doesn't take you down to the bistro, but worth asking to be sure.    We were feeling a little too hungover to drink but they have a lot of options here. Wish I could say we tried anything more than water and a diet coke lol. We'll be back next time though!

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: Although we have lunched at Vaudeville  several times over the past few years, this review is a follow-up, from a slightly different perspective. New Years Day, Marjan and I secured a reservation for our first evening dinner at the Bistro.      We were promptly seated at our reserved time, for holiday dinner offered "menu fixe et prix fixe", for four courses.        For the first course, all enjoyed creamy snow crab bisque.  The consensus?   Delicious!  Delicious!      For the second course, Marjan selected their seafood gratin, served in a small bowl, filled with morsels of lump crab, shrimp, leeks and artichokes.  The accompanying french bread was the perfect assist to the spoon for this exceptionally flavored offering.  My choice:  the beef carpacccio.  Razor thin slices of tenderloin, plated in petaloid fashion, topped with delicate vegetables, and surrounded by a syrupy sauce, sweeter and tastier than a balsamic.  Again, delicious.        Next up was the main course. Marjan had eyes...and appetite... for the grilled lamb rack, an entree with which she has significant skill in preparation, honed over the years in her kitchen.  In her opinion, the boned in flesh of the young creature was cooked in textbook fashion.   The sided gratin excellent, while the stewed beans were tasty, though in truth,  not exceptional.  I selected the braised akaushi beef, the celebrated meat of Japan, now more widely available in the States.  Prepared as it should be, the beef literally fell onto the tined fork.  Tender, juicy, perfectly seasoned.  The polenta on the side was creamy delicious, not gritty as one may find.        We finished our meal with shared Vaudeville's version of tiramisu, and their gelato sundae. These were the chef's creative takes on standard sweet stuffs.   What can be said, other than just a perfect end to an exceptional meal!      Friends, we consider Vaudeville the gold standard of restaurants in Fredericksburg.  Our experience is one of consistently excellent customer service, professional staff delivering prompt attention to our needs without being intrusive, and most importantly, outstanding performance by their chef.  Some have considered the restaurant somewhat high priced.  We rather think the dining experience at Vaudeville is well worth the listing.  Marjan and I wholeheartedly recommend our favorite Fredericksburg restaurant:  Vaudeville!  Enjoy!  and Be Safe!!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Fredericksburg is batting poorly so far!!  Good reviews, swanky interior, and  polite staff, but as people started to seat around us ordering their food and receiving it before ours?   HMMMMM?   40 Minutes goes by our drinks are empty and the  waitress has not come by to check on us, so we find her.   "OH NO, IDK what happened?" What happened to checking on people? If wait staff knew good service would prompt a 25%+  tip Im sure they would, no?  I imagine she just forgot to put the order in.  Just paid for our wine and left. Food looked good around us.  No, Duck Confit for me today :(  Weeeee.

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: Honestly, I really wasn't expecting a small hidden restaurant in Fredricksburg to have such amazing food! Everything about our trip here was on point, from the charcuterie, the attentive service, and the black truffle pizza (definitely a highlight of the meal).   I also got the octopus dish here, and honestly, that was probably the only thing I regret getting as the octopus was unpleasantly soft and mushy.  The ambiance here was unmatched by any other place in Fredricksberg. I would definitely recommend coming here for a date night or just to hang out with friends before seeing the holiday lights.

reviews.author: M. E G.
reviews.description: Fabulous old world Speak easy hidden under the Fredericksburg city street ! The food and drinks are exceptional! Whether a stop for a relaxing lunch or going to one of their wine dinners- Vaudeville is destination experience! Do not miss the Butterscotch creme brûlée or the Tiramisu !

reviews.author: Erika L.
reviews.description: So un organized! If you open at 11 am and you see a line starting to form for your restaurant send someone out to start writing down names in the order they arrived. If you don't have staff for that then at least put out a spiral notebook so people can write their own names down. Better yet let smaller parties place reservations.

reviews.author: Veronica Pagán B.
reviews.description: I was a bit concerned that Vaudeville would deliver on flavor but not portion but I was totally wrong! But first, lets talk about the ambiance. Fredericksburg is a beautiful and historic town with historic architecture. This quaint and snug dining establishment is underground, beneath an exquisite and unique boutique that carries rare items for the patron that delights in extremes, to say the least.  To get to the restaurant you need to go down a beautiful stairwell that gives off a modern-marries-vintage vibe. The oversized BISTRO sign is the first thing you see going down the stairs before you get to the hostess stand. The walls are lines with wine bottles and Fischer and Wiser sauces and spreads, and off to the side of that they have all their baked goods in a glass case.  We started off with the burrata which is served with a lovely salad and crusty bread, absolutely perfect. The asparagus were grilled to perfection, not too soft, not too firm, and they had a great flavor!  I wish I could order it as an entire side!  The Reuben was everything you would expect it to be. If you mess up a Reuben, you need to shut your doors or take it off the menu, and Vaudeville did it right!  Filled with pastrami, oozing melted gruyer cheese, and a Brussel sprout kraut, on marbled rye!  The sandwich is huge and even good reheated the next day.  We also had the roasted chicken sandwich which as absolutely devine! I was so impressed by the succulence of the chicken! Super moist and full of flavor. And the grilled mushrooms and fire roasted red peppers truly took it over the top.  For dessert we tried the white chocolate blackberry cashew cookie, which was the least impressive of the whole experience, the flavor was good, just not what I expected, but not enough for me to take away a star. It was very heavy and had more oats than blackberry, white chocolate, or cashew. It was very heavy and dense and I did not find that the ingredients were evenly distributed. The cookie was great when you got a bite of everything in one bite but there were only a few of those considering the size.   We are looking forward to going on a Friday to try the Lump Crab Coconut Curry though, we will definitely be back! And next time I am ordering the pistachio tiramisu for dessert! Overall, absolutely worth the trip.

reviews.author: Annette L.
reviews.description: Spectacular food and atmosphere. We always get an rsvp as way to popular now. Fun wait staff

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: While working in the area, my colleague suggested this was a must try for lunch which I was glad she did as it was a great experience.  Cute setting with a store upfront and the restaurant situated on the lower level. It had a great elegant vibe and I was impressed with the pretty diverse lunch menu !  I went with the Mediterranean plate which was delicious!! Cannellini bean purée, mixed olives , Baba Ganoush, roasted red peppers and a house made ricotta served with toasted bread! It was so delicious and full of flavor! Loved it.  Great food, service and setting! Cannot wait to bring my family here!

reviews.author: Chelsea H.
reviews.description: While in Fredericksburg celebrating our anniversary, my husband and I visited Vaudeville for a late lunch on the recommendation of friends. It was one of the highlights of our trip!   First off, Vaudeville is a super unique concept. It's a three-story establishment with the top floor being a free museum with an awesome second-story porch overlooking Main Street. A high-end gift boutique is at street level. Then the basement is a cozy yet lively little bistro with attentive service and fantastic fare.   Apparently, there is almost always a wait at the restaurant. We waited for about 40 minutes for a table even though it was after the lunch hour, but it went by quickly as we browsed the museum, observed the crowds below from the porch overhang, and shopped in the retail store.   Once seated, we ordered the cheese plate to start, which was life changing! The portions were generous and all the cheeses were spectacular. Each cheese was paired with jam and/or fruit that complemented the flavors. We were each given an assortment of crackers as well. We ate nearly the whole thing! So. Much. Cheese. And truly the best cheese tray we've ever had in terms of quality and selection. I ordered the Reuben and my husband ordered the French Dip. We liked both sandwiches but the Reuben was by far our favorite of the two. The marble rye was thick and crispy and the beef was very lean. The service was wonderful too; attentive and friendly but never smothering.   The only fault I could find with Vaudeville was in their bathrooms, of which there were only two unisex stalls. There was a constant line formed beside the two doors. The bathrooms themselves were not very clean or orderly, which didn't match Vaudeville's luxury brand as a whole. But this was still not enough of an issue to remove a star from an otherwise wonderful experience.   Bottom line: go to Vaudeville, preferably to eat, but don't forget to visit all three levels. And be sure to get that cheese plate!

reviews.author: Michae A.
reviews.description: Yelp never lets me down.   Decided to come here because of the amazing reviews, and the restaurant did not disappoint. I almost wish I could have had a bigger stomach to try more things.   I ordered the rueben, which was amazing and big. I split this with my husband and we were both full/ satisfied when we were done.   FYI for those wanting to come here for the patio seating that was posted on Yelp, apparently that's part of the supper club. It was closed when we came so not sure how it is or when it's open but the pictures looked amazing. Instead we opted for the outside dining at the entrance of the restaurant.   Pro tip: if there is a wait, get on the list and go do a tasting at the cross mountain wine bar. By the time you know it your table will be ready ;)

reviews.author: Steffi H.
reviews.description: Beautiful little bistro/restaurant on Main St. in Fredericksburg with a huge selection of wines. I think the best part of Vaudeville is their atmosphere; it's definitely more of an upscale vibe with dark wood and chic decor. Its located on the lower level of the building, so it can be a bit dark but that just adds to the charm and lets you feel like you have a bit more privacy with your table mates. The staff are very attentive and kind, and there's plenty of seating far apart to maintain social distancing.   As for the food, we came for lunch at around 12:30 on a weekday. We didn't have to wait at all, luckily. The food menu isn't very extensive, but they have some really good sandwich options and daily specials. We got the Tuesday special - crawfish etouffe - and the chicken sandwich. Both were absolutely delicious! The Crawfish Etouffe was a real hefty portion and had just a kick of spice to it; it was flavorful, filling, and hit just the right spot especially on a cold winter day. The Chicken sandwich was also fantastic; it came with chips, a pickle, and salad and is a very large portion, making for a great overall deal. The chicken was so tender, and I loved the olive marinade they used to give it a mediterrean flavor profile.   Overall, beautiful space with great lunch options. A little on the pricier side but worth it for the amtosphere.

reviews.author: David P.
reviews.description: Came here with my family around 1150AM. Hostess informed us that it will be 35-40 minutes. So we wait....an hour. I asked the Hostess how much longer and she tells me 15 minutes.  So,  all right we wait....30 more minutes. So I speak to someone else and I get the same reply (15 minutes and we are next). So we are all hungry (including my toddler son), so I ask again...in 15 minutes...I get the same answer. So I said we will just leave and not wait. The owner tells me "with that attitude, you should leave". So my wife asks how can you treat customers this way? To that,  he responds, "it's my business,  I can do what I want".

reviews.author: Tracy C.
reviews.description: What a delightful experience. Service was amazing and food was so impressive. Started off with the burrata which couldn't have been more perfectly seasoned! No need for salt and pepper on the table; this dish was perfect. The portion was ample and honestly I could've been happy eating just this but also ordered a salad with all of the homemade dips which was also just fantastic. I really loved this restaurant and definitely would recommend; enjoy!

reviews.author: Yvette S.
reviews.description: A Fredericksburg must. I can't stop thinking about their crab curry soup!!  Friends and I came out to visit this highly recommended eatery.  Posh and pricey, but worth every cent and the wait. Hats off to the chef, we had an exceptional time. Sandwiches were presented beautifully and the dish wear was gorgeous!!! This will definitely be a place I bring more friends and family during my visits.

reviews.author: Audrey H.
reviews.description: I love me a good underground restaurant (top floor is an art gallery and ground level is a marketplace). So nutritious and voluminous! I ordered the power bowl and thoroughly enjoyed it. So much food, but it's filled with so much color and quality ingredients. I especially loved the pumpkin and bean purée. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anna M.
reviews.description: Came to visit for the weekend and glad that I found this place! The decor and ambiance was amazing, our waitress was amazing, but unfortunately I had to take a star out because our menus were all sticky and clearly wasn't cleaned. Other times I wouldn't really mind, however during COVID pandemic, I am more conscious about cleanliness.  The food was delicious! I got the duck confit special on a Tuesday and it's a must get!! All of the flavors were delicious and meshed well together. I would definitely recommend this dish. We then got the roasted chicken on 12 grain ciabatta and it was good as well! I would chose the duck confit over it though. Their caramel latte was nice and sweet, for those who like sweet drinks!

reviews.author: Julie S.
reviews.description: What a gem! We stumbled on this place on a busy Saturday night, and were able to get on the waitlist. About an hour wait (but we just went down the street and grabbed a beer) - they texted us when the table was ready. Joseph was a fantastic server and the food was DELICIOUS. We especially loved the seafood gratin, charcuterie, and the chorizo and margarita pizzas. The dark chocolate pot de creme was decadent. Highly recommend if you are looking for a fancy night out in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Wow I cannot believe I haven't reviewed Vaudeville sooner! This is one of our favorite restaurants of all time. The decor is gorgeous. The staff are friendly and wonderful. And most importantly the food is amazing! I would tell you I'm not a fan of pastrami and would never order a Reuben. That was before I had the Reuben here. It's possibly the best sandwich I've ever had in my life! Each bite is perfection! Homemade potato chips and a crispy spring salad compliment it perfectly. The meat and cheese boards are always delicious. And the short bread caramel cookie is heaven!!  On Sundays the fried chicken is available. I'm drooling just thinking of it!  Can't wait fir our next wine club pick up so we have an excuse to go stop here for lunch again!

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: Pricey but good food. The food was cooked perfectly.  Sometimes you do get what you pay for.  The Fried chicken was juicy, and the krispy kale salad with bacon was cooked perfectly (just my personal taste that I don't like kale).  Only downside: Whipped potatoes were whipped too far to the point of being too runny, especially when gravy was added.  When the gravy was added to the potatoes, they didn't have enough consistency to be eaten with a fork.  Slightly firmer whipped potatoes would've made this a home run. The restaurant is in the basement, with a (luxury goods) store on the main level and art gallery on the  top floor.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Betsy!  Thank you for your excellent service.  I learned a great deal about wine and really enjoyed the offerings here. They only offer grapes from outside TX, it seems most of their wines were from France or Italy. We liked that you could make your own tasting selections and that we were able to relax outdoors while the wines were brought out to us. I found the wine to be superior to most of the other wineries in the area. I will say from the street this place is very unassuming, we thought it was private residence and then saw a trailer with their brand and realized we had arrived. Bonus if you drive a Tesla- they do have a free plug and they waved us into driveway so we could charge! I was disappointed that both the cheese plate and the Grand Cru had sold out the night before at a member event. After drinking their other options, I bet their bubs are great!  Cheers AV!  Delicious!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: You've heard the expression of "great things come in small packages", I give you Alexander Vineyards. Depending on what your group's intentions are (tasting or purchasing bottles), you are seated either in the yard (tasting) or on the outskirts (bottles). Just a note: grapes are not grown on the vineyard, as it is imported from Europe, but that just means you can be a world traveler all in the luxury of staying in your seat. There's a nice after-taste to each sip with all the wines I tasted, love love love!

reviews.author: Jeff F.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped by and had a splendid time. Wendy was very informative and patient. She thoroughly explained the wine we were drinking and provided great recommendations. If you are in Fredericksburg this is a must stop.

reviews.author: Sumer L.
reviews.description: Overall I enjoyed my experience at Alexander's. The view is gorgeous. it's a simple and quaint place to relax and enjoy imported wine. However the girl Amelia spoke about each wine like she was reading out of a script. She had an attitude and rolled her eyes at me at a simple request. She wasn't very pleasant or accommodating. The customer service- not so great.

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Windi and Claude were wonderful! Came with my girlfriends for the day and happened upon this hidden gem. Loved it so much that I signed up for the wine club. Their vast selection of old world wines were a very refreshing change from the Texas wine vineyards surrounding it. Looking forward to my next visit.

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: Alright, this place does not look like much. Seriously when we pulled in my hubby was like...uhhh, what? But we were kid free so we went ahead. Thank goodness we did because the wine is GREAT! It's not grown in Texas, or even the USA for that matter. It's from Europe but hand crafted (for the Alexander wine) by the owner and then shipped to the US. They do sell some other vineyards wines too from across Europe. We bought a ton from here and were super duper pleased with our purchases. Will definitely be coming again.

reviews.author: Elaine B.
reviews.description: We stopped by this place for a tasting based on the good yelp reviews. We had a good time, but really nothing special. The wines are not grown there and imported from Europe. That's fine, but if they're going to do that, I would expect them to be a little better. Our waitress even described some of them as "table wines." Overall, just pretty average experience.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: 5 stars, 5 star, 5 stars!!! Not gonna lie , we were kinda skeptical bc the outside impression does not do justice for it. Initially what attracted me was the sign that says "our tasting room may suck but our wine is great ". I couldn't be happier that we stopped!! The owner is super nice and his wine steward Dayna is the bomb dignity! She was so knowledgeable in all the wine they import . In addition I had a great side conversation with her about life in general and she is just a gem! We s been coming to the town for about 2 years and stopping at all the same places ...this one just added to our list of permanent stops. They are just so welcoming and the tasting room is so quaint . Absolute must do while in town .

reviews.author: Julie J.
reviews.description: Loooove this place. It's currently small  and quaint but the service is always great and super friendly. It's a very relaxed and just great place to be. Definitely not like the others which are large and overly commercialized. The wines are the best we have tried in Fredericksburg for sure. I 100% recommend this winery.

reviews.author: Erika A.
reviews.description: Don't let the looks of this place fool you! Decided to give Alexander's a shot after reading all the reviews on Yelp... couldn't agree more. The location is not ideal but their wines are just outstanding. I highly recommend the Tempranillos as well as the dessert wines. They provide a 10% military discount or will discount when buying 12 or more bottles.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Very pleasant location with open fields around you and nice outdoor seating. Tasting room is small, new, and sort of like walking up to a backdoor to a house.   Sold out of any champagne unfortunately. A bit different than other wineries in the area, in that he's partnering with established european wine makers and rebranding wines from various regions. While that made for some nicely done wines, it was a bit off of a Texas wine experience.   It'll still be fun to see what styles of wines they have on future trips, and how they expand into more Texas sourced wine.

reviews.author: Sondra T.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a local wine this is NOT the place. They have wines from France and Spain, this is not a local vineyard The tasting room is in the sunroom of a house and it is a bit warm and small.  If you have pet allergies beware they have two large dogs that are super sweet and will greet you at the door.

reviews.author: Stephanie V.
reviews.description: We came by Alexander Vineyards after receiving multiple recommendations for a boutique winery that did red wines. It's kind of strange at first, because the tasting room is located in a house, but once you open the door, you see a modern tasting room. There are a few different small tasting bars perfect for a party of two to three people. It offers your group some privacy, yet you're never too far away from others who are also indulging in wine. There are two winery dogs that love to be pet. I went to take a picture of one and he gave me this look like "you really just want to take my picture and not pet me?" The dogs are really easy going and usually just find a place to plop down and take a little nap until something exciting catches their eyes.   The day we were there only one champagne was available for tasting, but not even available for purchase. It was kind of a let down since we had really wanted to start our first winery of the day with bubbles. This is the only winery in the area that does not source local grapes. All of the grapes come from France and that is why they can call their champagne, champagne instead of sparkling wine. They also paired a few of our wines with cheese and chocolates. It was a really nice touch. We weren't huge fans of the wines on their owns, but once paired, we were impressed.

reviews.author: Ariana K.
reviews.description: Thank you to the woman who wrote the bad review (one about dogs and smells and it being in a house- honestly it's more of a very nice and welcoming double wide- which is even greater BTW). Read the first two sentences, and decided it was for me. Gizmo and Pinot are some of the sweetest pups I've ever come across, and the wine. Oh boy. It's what grapes are made of. My friend and I loved everything. From the atmosphere, to the service, to the amazing wine. Couldn't have asked for more. Thank you Alexander! We shall be back- cheers!

reviews.author: Kendall K.
reviews.description: The wines I tasted here were by far my favorites of all the vineyards we went to on our trip to Fredericksburg!  The tasting room is quaint and unassuming, but the wine will blow you away.  The tastings were paired with amazing blue cheese, olive oil,  and chocolate and it was just so delightful how well they went together, and really changed or brought up different flavors in the wines.  And the lady who did our tasting, I think her name was Dana? Was insanely knowledgeable about the different wine regions, vines and their ages, and just really taught us so much throughout the tasting.  I highly highly recommend this place!!! And the view outside is gorgeous.  Wonderful visit, so glad we came here!!!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: We honestly had THE BEST wine tasting experience here. Dana treated us to an amazing tasting with wines, cheeses, oils and completely blew us away with her knowledge of wines and champagnes. Everyone in our group thought it was the best wine tasting ever. HIGHLY recommend. We each bought bottles to take with us. The views of the moon rising were incredible, as well

reviews.author: Anders N.
reviews.description: A pleasant surprise during our trip to hill country. We loved the wines that they had available and our wine curator we spoke to was extremely knowledgeable. I would say it makes more sense to be considered a winery instead of a vineyard since everything is imported. I would definitely return in the future!

reviews.author: Vinod G.
reviews.description: Looks are deceiving... small personal tasting room but amazing Bordeaux, Champagne, Rieslings and Spanish Tempranillos. Super personable hosts. Dana was a great teacher! Joined the wine club, we'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: J F.
reviews.description: Departure from the average. Wine tasting was great. Every wine presented was excellent. Don't miss this tasting room. It's small, but the wines are the showcase. The scenery cannot be beat, across the street is a thoroughbred horse farm and fields of wildflowers.  How can you beat that?

reviews.author: Aparna B.
reviews.description: I am so thankful for the fellow yelpers who had reviewed this place, as if not for them, I would  have never known about this hidden gem.  On our trip to the Hill Country, we were looking for places that I hadn't been to already, and the first stop on our list was Alexander Vineyards. We got here around 1pm on a saturday and were welcomed by the most cutest and well-behaved dogs, Gizmo and Pinot. We were the only two people there and had a very personal tasting experience. They offer a variety of wines from all over the world, and the 4 wines we tried were extremely delicious!!  On the whole, this place should be a must-stop if you ever plan to go to the Hill Country and I'm definitely be going back here for their amazing rotation of wines, and Gizmo :)

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Atmosphere |  This a lovely newer winery in Fredericksburg, that's somewhat off the beaten path and thus feels more secluded, particularly during mid-week.  There's a few tables inside and you can enjoy a glass of wine at the bar or take a bottle out to there secondary patio area, if you don't have reservations and they are booked up.  There's a wrap around main patio with various seating options outdoors for reservations.  Although there is a couple resident winery dogs, they no longer allow dogs on the weekends, or children.  | Wine |  They have some lovely wines.  I prefer their whites vs. their reds, but there are good ones for both.  They probably do blends the best, so it's good to do their wine tasting if it's your first visit.  I really like their Marsanne and they make a really nice Rose.  | Food |  The charcuterie plate is one of the best and is chock full of great meats, cheeses, and fruits.  It tastes a good as it looks!

reviews.author: Krista A.
reviews.description: Lovely boutique winery. The staff is so knowledgeable and friendly, and the wines are incredible! It's a small space and definitely worth a stop!

reviews.author: Tom K.
reviews.description: I've been looking forward to checking out narrow path winery for some time and it did not disappoint! Bob, Allison and his team are not only wonderful people but they have a beautiful facility and some great wine!

reviews.author: Renee L.
reviews.description: Note. Tastings are at winery only. We learned the hard way but they were very hospitable and understanding at the store off Main. Can't wait to go to the winery and do a tasting.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: I've been here twice with my girlfriend and it has been a great experience both times. So much so that we have short-listed it as one of the wineries we try to visit and recommend to others. We always buy 2 to 3 bottles, enjoying one on their patio (we just can't help ourselves) overlooking their vineyard and some spectacular views of the Texas hill country. Only drawback is they don't allow you to bring your own snacks. The staff is professional, accommodating, and nice. We generally get a small sample of each wine before we have to commit to a bottle. Overall, great new winery and an awesome stop for your wine tour. Hopefully they never change a thing or a policy because it is working. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: Our favorite winery during our first trip to Fredericksburg. Loved the Viognier. We would return again!

reviews.author: Nicolette C.
reviews.description: A tucked-away little gem of Fredericksburg. We loved the property, the owner's dogs, and the Tempranillo! The employees are kind and the property is absolutely beautiful. Definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Sandi D.
reviews.description: Fresh contemporary setting in the outskirts of Fredericksburg. Let me say that's a plus for feeling like you are enjoying your wine outside the typical wine tour hustle and bustle. Very friendly and attentive staff and owner. I love their wines since we first discovered them 2 years ago. Tempranillo is my favorite!

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: A beautiful view and a trendy atmosphere. The wine is good and really hits nicely with the view.

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: I was referred to this winery and the wine here certainly delivered. My family and I went with the $15 sampler (meant to be for 5 wines but our server let us taste all the wine on the list) Our wine server was extremely friendly and told us a lot of the wine we were drinking. Every wine we had was very delicious! My personal favorites were the Dreamchaser Blanc and Dreamchaser (Merlot), both of which were reasonably sweet but also fragrant and floral. We ended up buying a few bottles (which also allowed us to comp 2 of our samplings!).  Regarding the overall ambience, the winery is beautiful, even in winter when the trees have lost color. While Narrow Path also has a tasting room in downtown Fredericksburg, I would highly suggest going to their actual winery where the tasting room gives you both the comfort of home and the classiness of a lounge. I would love to go when the weather is nicer to take advantage of their plethora of outdoor seating.  I certainly plan on going here again!

reviews.author: Amie N.
reviews.description: This tiny tasting room on Main Street is a must stop for wine enthusiasts. The staff is knowledgeable and caring. The wines are high-quality and continuing to improve every year. The Marsanne is a great white and the Merlot is a must!

reviews.author: Emily R.
reviews.description: We loved Narrow Path! Such kind staff, with great suggestions. Wine was really tasty, we loved the rose, and the food was pretty good too! Nice outdoor seating on the patio with a pretty view. Madi was awesome - thanks everyone for such a great time!

reviews.author: Jenn H.
reviews.description: Great service with wonderful wines. This vineyard has a tasting room off of Main and the vineyard is in Albert 20 miles North of Fredricksburg. They have a great tasting $15 for 5 wines, glass and a glass of wine. Which was nice because we sat outside under one of their Sun Sails looking over the vineyard.  We bought several bottles and will be back!

reviews.author: Stephanie V.
reviews.description: Narrow Path was our second stop for wine on Main Street. For $14 you get the choice of 5 wines and you get to keep the tasting glass. Our server couldn't have been nicer. She explained each of the wines we chose and was very friendly. I tried the sauvignon blanc 2013, the viognier 2014, the malbec 2012, the texas select red 2013, and the syrah 2013. The sauvignon blanc was a bit too crisp for my taste, and the viognier tasted watered down. The malbec was just ok, and my favorite was probably the texas select red. It was very earthy. The syrah was very typical for a syrah, but I'm not really a syrah drinker so perhaps I shouldn't judge. The tasting room is pretty small with three small tables and a tasting bar. However it's still welcoming, but just gets crowded quickly.

reviews.author: Jo Likeaboy B.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure that you and your sister location are owned together. Thought you would like to know your customer service is non existent for a wine club member at your other location.  A 2 star review of Narrow Path Winery and Vineyard by Jo Likeaboy B.: https://www.yelp.com/biz/narrow-path-winery-and-vineyard-stonewall?hrid=KPQhgjLZcOscfrp6kvuqrgandutm_source=ashareandref=yelp-android

reviews.author: Dyana R.
reviews.description: Good winery in Fredericksburg! Beautiful tasting room and large patio. I enjoyed almost every wine we tasted, especially the Syrah!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Narrow Path Winery is owned by the Turbeville family who has been involved in the wine industry since 2002.  They source the grapes for their wine from TX and California.  You can select a choice of 5 wines from their tasting menu for $14, and keep the complimentary glass.  The tasting room itself is quaint.  It is narrow, and small, but they have done nice things with the space. There are one or two tables tucked away in the corners that you can sit at to enjoy a glass of wine.  The bottle prices are in the lower range when compared with the neighboring Texas wineries.  The wines we had were well structured and approachable. They are ready to drink now.  The wine here was decent.  The tasting room associate was interesting. He was knowledgeable about the wine, but his interactions with us were awkward. You could tell that this wasn't his passion in life.  He had some very unique opinions about the Texas wine industry and those in it.

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Ask for John when you go! He was fabulous. The property is gorgeous and there is a lot of amazing seating to enjoy the views. Wine was fabulous as well! We bought a few bottles.

reviews.author: Glen C.
reviews.description: What a great find! You will not be disappointed here. Easy going, uncrowded (on a Thursday) and terrific setting. Their Tempranillo, Viognier and Tap Root Red blend were quite nice. Sat out on their patio with a glass and soaked in the views. Highly recommended visit.

reviews.author: WD S.
reviews.description: Love the tempernillo.  Great glass of wine and a worth taking the time to enjoy. Loved it.

reviews.author: Asia K.
reviews.description: I decided to stop in here based on the good reviews they had and I was not disappointed! Their wine selection was amazing as well as delicious. All of the staff was so friendly towards me and very attentive the entire time regardless of how busy it got. Do not skip out on this place!

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: This was a great tasting experience right in town! I've been to a lot, this was one of the most fun, they let you take your time and enjoy. For $25 you get 5 tastings and a "snack" - the options were a lunchable or a wood fired pizza...how is this even a choice? The pizza is to share with 1 other person but very big and the perfect amount of food to soak up the wine.   The wines. All from Italy and just amazing. There are many whites and reds, sweet, dry, bubbly. The sommelier was lots of fun, knows a ton about the wines and seemingly loves what he does! We had a huge group of 14 ladies and they made accomodations for us. My favorite wines were pretty pricey but there was a range of price points available.

reviews.author: Mason H.
reviews.description: What a super great place! Royal was amazing with his service. Not only did he treat my group with the best respect, but he was so nice and funny! Will definitely come back here.

reviews.author: Christine F.
reviews.description: A nice find on East Main Street, with Italian wines offered. We entered and there are two rooms , the room in back is for wine club members only , private and looked pleasant.  We found two seats at the bar , greeted promptly by an employee.  The flights were explained and we chose the mixed group . Found they were enjoyable , we didn't feel rushed . The store is filled with wines that you can purchase and wine glasses . It's a neat place filled with nice Italian wines.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a leisurely tasting here, followed by a couple glasses of their fine Italian wines. Cross Mountain wines are fully produced and bottled in Italy to the owner's specs and imported here for sale. None of the wines are made from Texas grapes. I tasted a series of reds, which were all of top quality.  As we relaxed with our second glass of wine, people began coming in and ordering wines by the glass. They all clearly knew each other well. I asked our hosts if these were local shop keepers coming in after closing for the day. He said no, these are retirees who go from winery to winery enjoying their complimentary wine club glass of wine. "They come here last because we are open the latest."  Hmmmmm. No that would suit me just fine!

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: I enjoyed a wine tasting recently at Cross Mountain Vineyards.  Each time that I visit beautiful Fredericksburg I stop in here to taste the rich flavors of wine from these old vines.  It's a nice option when the Texas wines all begin to taste similar.  I love Cross Mountains European style wines.  These wines are delicious!  The customer service at this tasting room is outstanding and I appreciate the discount provided to our military service members and veterans.

reviews.author: Josette R.
reviews.description: Love, love love this vineyard. There's plenty of seating for one or 10+.   We indulged in the tasting of Sweets and Sparkling. You get to experience 5 wines of your palate choice.   John was our sommelier. He was not only knowledgeable but funny and personable. We laughed the entire time we were there.   The entire experience was exceptional!  From being greeted as we walk in til the point when we walked out.   Great atmosphere and great time talking and meeting people from everywhere.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg many times to do wine tours and tastings, and this may possibly be my new favorite! All of their wines are Italian, which means that their grapes are grown mountain-side. This gives the wines a different flavor than most of the other wines you can find in Fredericksburg, so it's a nice change from the other vineyards. The tastings are around $25, and you get to try 5! The staff are all very fun and engaging, and they also have great pizza and charcuterie boards to go along with your tastings. I would recommend the Amarone (dry red) and the Fior D'arancio (sweet sparkling). We will definitely be back for more wine soon!

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: For a winery only place in town (no vineyard) this is a solid stop for anyone who loves Italian wine from all over Italy. The rare, the common, the unique, they have it all and know it well. Really cool bar area up front with shop stuff to buy. Seated about 15 or so. The backroom has tables for about 30 more. The wine menu listed every wine they have and they cross off those they are out of so you know what's available before you order. They do flights of 5, by the glass, wine to go, and bottles. Not since I lived in Italy did I have the 5 wines I picked out on my visit. The bar staff are also way fun people let me tell you. Great place to stop and wine taste right in downtown. The Amarone is a must-try Italian red wine!

reviews.author: Rebecca S.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time here with Royal. The wine was delicious, generous pours and such a friendly atmosphere. If you go, ask for Royal. He was so attentive but also let us enjoy our wine at our own pace. We plan on coming back, you can't go wrong here- there's something for everyone!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: This was the only winery we could find that is open past 5:30 on the weekdays and we are so glad we went there! John was a fabulous sommelier and made the tasting so fun! All 5 wines were fantastic but the MamaPeach was the best summer sparking wine! They are also dog friendly!

reviews.author: Cynthia R.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars I would. We  came because of the good reviews and were completely disappointed. If you are a person of color the servers and managers completely ignore you and will not help you. We waited patiently at the bar to be served and they looked right at us and then helped the group behind us. Then did the same thing after we were seated. They asked the group sitting at the next table if they had been helped and brought them wine glasses. Then looked at our group and without a word walked away. Will not give my money to companies like this.

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Excellent spot for a tasting or glass of wine. Royal is amazing!  He's knowledge, personable and funny. They have great tasting options for anybody.  This is a big spot for locals but, they were very welcoming to us. It's a must stop when on Main St.

reviews.author: Sherrell J.
reviews.description: If I could give this place negative stars, I would! We came into town to celebrate my birthday and read great things about this vineyard. We decided, it would be the next stop on our tour. Well it is a great spot if you are not black or Hispanic. We walked in and were never greeted. Finally, when I THOUGHT I had gained the attention of whom I believe was one of the owners, she looked right at me and ignored me as she greeted three white ladies that were behind us. When someone else helped us, she acted as if it was putting her in distress to even talk to me or explain how the seating worked. She actually explained the whole process to ANOTHER group of ladies that were behind us instead of talking to us. When she decided to talk to us again, I mentioned that it was five of us and she says "it's more of yall?" and we were told that  we would be brought the glasses. No one ever came by our table. FINALLY, after sitting there for 10 minutes with no help, a older man came by but not to our table. He walked to a table of other ladies, asking them if they had been helped. He then  looked right at us and left the area without ever asking us if we needed anything OR if we had had been helped already.We decided to leave because it was very clear our kind was not wanted. I would also like to mention that it was NOT busy!

reviews.author: Katy W.
reviews.description: The wine was just ok- but we did not enjoy the atmosphere. Seems like it's a locals only place and any tourists aren't welcome there. I'm skipping it next trip. Drive out 15 minutes and you can get so many better winery's.

reviews.author: Samantha G.
reviews.description: We stopped in as a suggestion from another winery. They said to ask for Royal or John, and let me tell y'all that these two gentlemen are so amazing. We even became wine members! They both made us feel so welcome  and generally loved their jobs and had passion for the wines they were selling. It was our first stop for the day and we hope this trend continues, if not we left with 4 bottles of wine.

reviews.author: Ashlee L.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING. The service was perfect and the atmosphere was just what a group of 7 ladies on vacay needed. The owner is as cute as a button. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: We came here based on a rec from someone at another winery. So glad we did! We loved how they didn't have a set tasting list. You could pick and choose from like 20 different options. Matt was super nice and knowledgeable. He took the time to learn your preferences and would suggest certain wines to try. We ended up joining the wine club since we loved so many of them!

reviews.author: E C.
reviews.description: Great place to hangout! Service was amazing and got to try 5 different wines. Many choices for wine tastings unlike another place near there. Go here you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Marisa R.
reviews.description: We visited the Cross Mountain Vineyards tasting room on Main last week and had a wonderful time. You can choose between a red tasting, a white tasting, or a sparkling (which was delicious) or a mix. The wine was delicious and reasonably priced. My review is going towards Madison who helped us. What a ray of sunshine. She was like a Disney princess floating around making sure everyone was having a good time. We will definitely be coming back for a visit for the good wine and the even better hosting :) thanks Madison!

reviews.author: Ian W.
reviews.description: What an amazing place! So glad we found this spot. The wine was amazing, but William made it even more so. His charm and friendliness made us feel at home immediately, and he explained all the wines in a way no one else could. Don't hesitate coming by!

reviews.author: Lance S.
reviews.description: If you have not been here.....it is amazing! Super friendly staff. We were there on a Saturday and it was busy but not packed. We were able to get a table without having a reservation (but I see where one would be helpful). Our waiter was very knowledgeable on their wine selection. We did a tasting and it was nice because they had the tastings sorted by taste so you just told them what you liked and they had a list already made. We didn't feel rushed or anything and the waiter was very talkative, but in a good way! Constantly making us laugh! Very enjoyable and we will definitely be back! We even bought a couple bottles for later on! There is a boutique style store also for shopping and souvenirs. Beautiful building and grounds and a must for anyone visiting Fredericksburg!! You can't miss it, there's huge flags flying by the road and a mannequin waving a sign!

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: I would definitely make a reservation. Otherwise, they will look at YOU like you are crazy if you come in without one, expecting to be able to try a tasting. I wasn't super excited about how they initially treated us. But, once sat, we did have a nice experience. The wine was enjoyable. The facility is nice. We also really enjoyed the attached store which offered a great shopping experience.

reviews.author: Alexander G.
reviews.description: I would give them 5 stars for appearance.
