Too bad that the line of wines they offer will not support this by a large margin, Inexpensive table wine, the taste will not appeal to you if you are into wines and not wineries.   Place has a nice look, sunny, open, clean, very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Rob B.
reviews.description: Wow what a treat!  Add this place to your list of wineries to visit.  The tasting room is fantastic.  Mary was able to accommodate us on short notice for a tasting.  William was an amazing sommelier with great pairing suggestions.  To top it off, we met Mr. and Mrs. Bingham who just happened to be there that morning.  They were both so kind and friendly.  Oh, and the wines are great!  In particular, the Dugout, Merlot, and Mourvedre.  An excellent experience.  Reservations are highly recommend.

reviews.author: Natalie M.
reviews.description: Bingham is a favorite of mine and I was very excited to bring my friends to try. Hailey took excellent care of us - good service, a great sense of humor, good recommendations too! In hindsight, we probably shouldn't have started there, as we spent the rest of the trip comparing everything to Bingham, but it was definitely a highlight. The different tasting menus available were great, as you can get only reds or whites or sweet wines depending on personal tastes. The charcuterie board had some really nice touches - the honey stick went great with the goat cheese. And the oyster crackers are amazing. They sell them in bags if you, like us, just could not get enough of them. The location is good too, a beautiful tasting room, high ceilings and and a very eye catching chandelier.

reviews.author: Heath H.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful location, fully set up for hosting large events and individual wine tastings. We were happy with the quality of the wine that is available at this location, many have won awards across Texas and even in California. This is the only reason I give this place 3 stars.   The service was lackluster. We had to stand and wait for our appointment, which wouldn't be a worry if the staff actually was preparing for us. After 15 minutes of waiting where they told us to, they only pulled out 2 clean wine glasses and a cup of crackers. Nothing additional was offered. The staff only came by to pour us our next sip of wine, which was never prompt. Minimal interaction or information about the wines and vineyard was given. This of course was very disappointing. Completely lacking of the complete wine tasting experience that is available at dozens of wineries in the area.

reviews.author: Lisa W.
reviews.description: Just don't try to get in on the October wine pass ... sad because we have been there before and liked their wines.

reviews.author: Allyson A.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this winery! Came in the afternoon and were greeted right away. We didn't want to do a tasting, just wanted to buy a couple bottles of wine and sit down. They found us a table inside the main room and were very helpful in what to order. We tried Dugout and absolutely loved it! We took a bottle to go and then I ended up joining the wine club a month later to get more! This is my new favorite stop when visiting Fredericksburg! Make sure to check out the store next door, the prices are reasonable!

reviews.author: Ryanne D.
reviews.description: The inside and out is really cool. There is history to the winery as well which is neat. The tasting room is big and they have plenty of staff on hand. When we first arrived we were the only tasters therefore felt a little overwhelmed w staff. We had one person helping us and he did excellent, but felt as if the manager person was "watching" over our shoulder or standing close. Couldn't tell if he wanted to chat or had something else going on.   Tasting was good and they have water and taste bud sweet cracker balls. Wines were good and different....great club wine deals and options...  Shop next door is really neat and fun to explore!   Would recommend and return.

reviews.author: Elizabeth C.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting and truly have enjoyed both times. The service is impeccable. Extra thank you to Laura who knew all the details and stories on the wine. She also recommended the Dugout which is amazing! The shopping next door is a plus! Who doesn't love to drink wine and shop? We cannot wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anjali P.
reviews.description: Came in part of a tour group - and had the pleasure of Buddy serving us! He was so personable and conversational and made the experience truly a highlight of our wine tour. He gave an excellent recommendation for a sweet wine (which our group turned around and all bought!) and a place to eat off main st which was a great place (Martini's) for dinner and live music. Excellent service! Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: Bingham is certainly no stranger to the Texas wine industry. Having supplied many wineries with their quality grapes, it is not uncommon to see Bingham as the source vineyard on Texas wine labels. This multigenerational family has roots in Texas farming that goes back to the early 1900s. Cotton, peanuts, black-eyed peas, and sesame seeds have and continue to be part of their agricultural heritage. They started the process in the 1990s to be certified organic. In 2003 they planted their first grapevines of Viognier and Gewürztraminer. That has since grown to over 200 acres of 25+ varieties of grapes. About seventy five percent of their grape harvest goes to various wineries throughout Texas. It is interesting to see how different winemakers at wineries make their wine, even with the same source and vintage, ultimately still tasting uniquely their own, which is a nod to the ever-diverse creativity going on among wineries. Bingham Vineyards keeps about 10% of the grape harvest for their own wine production, with the rest going out for sale as bulk wine. Wine production is kept small to craft quality boutique wines. They made their first Bingham bottle in 2014 and in 2015 they opened a tasting room in Grapevine, Texas. In 2018, they opened another tasting room on the eastern outskirts of Fredericksburg. We visited the Fredericksburg location and were quite impressed with both the rustic decor and the wines. A lot of reclaimed wood was used in the building construction and with the high ceilings it gives a more inviting and relaxed feel. So, what about their estate wines? Well, they do have an impressive selection that you can choose from. Pick your favorite flight style and you cannot go wrong. There is literally something for everyone here. For the white wine flight, we started off with the 2019 Trebbiano. The citrus and lemon notes along with light acids really highlighted some of the best flavors of this wine. Roussanne has certainly been making a great strong showing in Texas white wines. Their 2019 vintage has that rich feel and balanced acids that will make you love this sipper. But wait! There is also a 2018 Reserve Roussanne that you must try. With a touch of oak and good vanilla notes combined with that rich, full mouthfeel, we think you might fall in love with this one. Many long time Texas wine fans know how Viognier helped make a strong showing for Texas whites and their 2019 wine is right on the mark. It is a bit softer than some other Texas Viogniers, with a light creaminess. We can see why this 2020 San Francisco Viognier winner stood out. Marsanne is another up and coming white wine in the state and their 2019 release has just the right floral notes combined with the flavors of lemon and pineapple. Texas Roséwines are also seeing increased interest over the last few years and their 2019 Sunset Roséis no exception. Made from Mourvèdre and Carignan, this smooth drinking Roséis a great Texas chiller to refresh your palate with on warm summer days. You will be equally pleased with their reds and the 2018 Turnrow is a great starter. Made with Mourvèdre, Dolcetto, Carignan, and Tempranillo, you might be asking where is that artisan pizza at to pair with it. Like Carignan? They have great 2018 vintage that is both smooth with a hint of spice. Tempranillo is certainly the "big" red grape that helped put Texas on the wine map and their 2018 release is on par with good Texas Temps. It is full bodied with lots of rich plums to envelope your palate. Their 2017 reserve Tempranillio as some earthy undertones, is rich in blackberry fruit and has a great long finish. The single varietal 2018 Dolcettois bold with big intense fruit aromas. They also have a good Bordeaux style blend made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and Petit Verdot. This 2017 Bordeaux style blend called Dugout, named after their family's original homestead heritage, is quite well balanced, has a smooth feel, rich berries, moderate acids, and a good lingering finish. It made a great showing at the 2020 San Francisco as a gold medal winner! For the sweets, do checkout the 2019 Moscato Giallo It has just the right lushness on the nose and that silky, citrus feel that puts the yum in every drop. You should not leave without trying the Fine 'n Dandy sweet red. As a nod to Eddie Bingham, this light red wine has some pecan flavors to it for that added delight. This is a great tasting room to visit. The staff will make you feel warm and welcomed. Additionally, the team in the tasting room are quite knowledgeable and will even have some excellent pairing suggestions. The price points on the wines are quite affordable, so stock up. Visit, stay, and enjoy!

reviews.author: Lav R.
reviews.description: Never been acknowledged. Don't care if we were here. Had a reservation but an hour later haven't even been spoken too.  Don't know if you one is good because they never came by to seat us.

reviews.author: Marilee Y.
reviews.description: This was my favorite stop on our wine tour! The sommelier was very knowledgeable about the wines, the origin, and what they pair well with. We were given wine tasting crackers loved the atmosphere. I participated in the sweet wines line up and it was fabulous. The Gewurztraminer was my absolute favorite! The also wrap up your wine tasting glass to take home as a souvenir. What a nice little touch! Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Debbie M.
reviews.description: My husband and I visited Bingham Family Vineyards a week ago and enjoyed our wine tasting.

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Had such a fabulous experience and left with four different wines. Delicious and fantastic customer service!

reviews.author: Sherry H.
reviews.description: The best reds!  Cooper was great and very knowledgeable!  Both of the gentlemen there were friendly and nice.

reviews.author: Lori H.
reviews.description: Love this little winery. We had a bottle of the Dugout. Very good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Loved their decor.

reviews.author: Torie W.
reviews.description: This service was absolutely unacceptable. The server was disrespectful to half of our group, and when we complained to the manager the service was even WORSE. The manager Steve was very disrespectful and talked down to our group of women. When trying to discuss the issue, Steve accused someone in our party of being a "repeat customer" when she had never been there before, and said very offending comments to her.  I do NOT recommend this establishment.

reviews.author: Brooke D.
reviews.description: This was the first stop we made on the wine tour we took over the weekend and it was by far our favorite stop! Each employee was so nice, struck up a conversation with everyone and knew the wine we were tasting very well. The Malbec was AMAZING! Everyone in our group of 7 went away with a bottle. One of the owners was doing the tasting with us and she was so lovely. She told about how she got into the winery business and what she wants to do with the lovely place she has.   I would absolutely recommend coming here any chance you might get! We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: Amazing staff, amazing wine, and amazing experience. Texas Heritage has such a wonderful ambiance with great views and the fact that their family owned and operated really shows. Jessica, Tyler, and Tim went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience and did a wonderful job of taking care of their other guests as well. Definitely a winery you must check out next time you're in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: Staff was great, but the wines weren't good at all. Would probably never go back. Also, we had to sit outside during our visit. It was cold. No one was inside so you can't blame it on covid.

reviews.author: Amie N.
reviews.description: This 100% Texas winery near Fredericksburg is a must for lovers of fine wines. Texas Heritage Vineyard started planting their vines in 2015 and opened the tasting room on Highway 290 in 2018. As we see with all young wineries across the globe, it takes time to evolve into the style of wines that fit the vision of the winery and the Johnson family has done a great job. Today we spent a little time with daughter Jessica and their winemaker, Tyler, and could really feel the sense of style as we tasted through their current wines. Of particular note is the current Lizzie Rose, which is sporting a lovely new label this vintage. And the Souza was bold but smooth and quite nicely balanced. Their tastings are now hosted outside and we were blessed with a beautiful day that enhanced the tasting. Add these guys to your list the next time you're tasting in the hill country!

reviews.author: Brazos E.
reviews.description: Amazing little gem in the growing hill country. Texas Heritage Vineyard allows you to truly enjoy a glass or tasting without being overly crowded. They make you feel like you belong there and not just the next person to come in and out. Sitting on the back patio with a fire or listening to live music is my favorite too!

reviews.author: Murrisa G.
reviews.description: Nicest people and best venue. They have a little shop with cute T-Shirts and beautiful jewelry! I love the Malvasia Bianca and the other tasting are fantastic. Come with your friends and enjoy a tasting and live music on the back patio,

reviews.author: Cassie W.
reviews.description: Nice view, friendly and knowledgeable staff and delicious wine! We did the wine tasting and really enjoyed learning about their wines.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: My wife and I tried about 10 wines between us, and we ended up buying a bottle each of three different wines. The wines were delicious and they really seem to know what they're doing , despite their being a young winery. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beautiful atmosphere outside overlooking the hill country just outside of Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Lindsey K.
reviews.description: Stopped here last night and everyone in my group LOVED IT! It's a new place but everyone was so nice and informative. The wine was amazing. Comfortable atmosphere. Add this place on your wine stop.

reviews.author: Dana A.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere! The owner and her daughter were such a delight! Wine was really good, well developed Texas grapes. Excited to come back and try the blend after March!  Very dog (brought them inside) and kid friendly!

reviews.author: Carol J.
reviews.description: We visit the Texas wine country every year. We try to find new spots every trip. We stopped in Heritage Thursday. The server was very friendly and the wines were good. The space has a lot of potential. It would have been nice to have had some background music (CandW or jazz) rather than ESPN blaring from the corner of the room. I'm used to seeing that at a sports bar, not a tasting room. The patio was beautiful if you kept you vision straight out- would be nice to somehow screen out the properties on either side.  One last thing- the front faces 290- put blinds on the front windows to block out the constant traffic. This place has so much potential- I hope they succeed!

reviews.author: Logan E.
reviews.description: The people here are so friendly, the wine is so good, and the view from the back patio is out of this world and really what else could you need from a wine tasting! (Definitely try the Malbec!)

reviews.author: Claire V.
reviews.description: Stopped in after reading such great reviews and we were met with 5 star service. Susan was excellent at explaining the wines and the history of the vineyard. We loved the wine and the venue so much we ended up getting a wine club membership! Stuck around for the live music performance on the beautiful patio. HIGHLY recommend stopping in for exceptionally made wine, even better service and a beautiful venue.

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: Downtown Fredericksburg can be a crowded place on weekends with wineries, shops, and food galore.  Just before you get to this "bustling" tourist town, there is a great new winery that's much easier to get in and out of than a parking spot on main street!  The owners, Billy and Susan Johnson, established their dream venture in 2015 with their first vine plantings of Tempranillo and Tannat which has since expanded to Alicante Bouschet, Malbec, Souzao, and Viognier. They opened their tasting room on highway 290 to the public last May.  Since then, they have gotten the fast lesson on what it is like to be a new winery that everyone wants to visit. Being busy is good for business and they have quite a selection of 100% Texas wines to share with thirsty customers.  The inside of their tasting room is quite spacious with a bar and ample seating. However, the real treat is on the back porch where you will get a fabulous view of the rolling hills on the southside terrain that you would never suspect to see.  The vineyard is separate from their tasting room and is located about 10 miles south of there on Grapetown road where wine club pickup events will be held. John Rivenburgh has been helping the Johnsons out with their initial wine production. In addition to their estate vineyard, they also source about 400 tons from Brownfield.  Their current tasting selection consists of a good mix of white and red wines along with a Rose' to round out the lot. The first white we tasted was the 2017 Malvasia Bianca. It is quite floral with a soft finish. The other white to try is the 2017 Roussanne with pronounced pineapple notes and quite a long finish.  The 2017 Lizzie Rose' is a special family treat. Named after Susan's Great-Grandmother, this 85% Grenache Rose' has lingering strawberry notes with moderate acidity. For the reds, the 2016 Malbec is quite fruit forward with a touch of leather.  The 2016 Dolcetto is a low tannin red that is soft and easy to sip. For their 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon, you will detect leather and licorice notes. For the wine that has helped put Texas on the map, their 2016 Tempranillo does justice.  It's full of flavor with a touch of boldness and silky lingering tannins that begs to be paired with a nice Texas ribeye. In the coming months they will be releasing their 2017 Texas Cabernet Sauvignon.  It promises to be a great vintage! This will be followed by a Petite Sirah, Souzao, Trebbiano, and Tannat.  With live music every Saturday and Sunday and a great staff to chat and visit with when you stop in, you'll be a happy camper here every weekend.  Drop on by and check them out, we do not think you will be disappointed. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Tamara G.
reviews.description: Wonderful service. The Lizzie Rose is my favorite. A clean, crisp white.  Perfect for summer cocktails. The patio offers the best sunset views.

reviews.author: Jeremy H.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! This was our first time here and they didn't disappoint. They were friendly to our children and very accommodating. We look forward to coming again. Just a note: if you enjoy sweet wine, this is not the place for you. They have only dry, delicious wines all from Texas.

reviews.author: Mallory E.
reviews.description: The people who work here are very nice and friendly! There is a great view of the hill country on the back patio which is a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere!

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: What a cute wine bar! Offers wine flight tasting and glasses/bottles. A great place to drop by after walking around downtown.

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: We were seated just before final call and the ladies working were beyond Amazing and welcoming.   We were sat in the front room - 2 comfy chairs and a little table for drinks. There was another family of 3 on the large couch but for the close quarters we still couldn't hear each others conversations, which was nice.  We were served promptly and they gave a great explanation of the wines we were sampling and the little snacks they provided to pair them with. They checked back on us as we worked through the flights and enjoyed some small talk. We walked away happy and with a couple of bottles.  We'll save this place as a favorite to stop back the next time we visit Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: Aime Nemec got me set up for this first stop and debut experience. I did not get to meet her but getting a spot was easy working with her. Her two staff members I spoke to during my Texas Red tasting flight were all-stars, Taryh and Shanae, both way cool gals you got to ask for if you come here, trust me on that. This rustic old house/cabin structure is a throwback to a previous era and I loved the vibe it gives off. Mellow, chill, relaxing, comforting, all in one place. I approve of all 3 wines I tried here but the big standout for me was the Hilmy Cellars Cab Sauvignon.

reviews.author: Catheryn G.
reviews.description: Loved our wine tasting experience at Perspective Cellars! The staff are extremely knowledgeable about all things wine. Their tasting walks you through 3 wines of a certain varietal. There is 1 Texas wine and 2 others from a different region. It's so much fun to compare the differences between each region. Very helpful if you want to learn more about wine! Also, their space is beautiful and so cozy. I could have sat there for hours drinking wine. They also offer wines by the glass and bottle. We will definitely be back on a future trip.

reviews.author: Karla C.
reviews.description: These folks are serving incredible wines and providing incredible service. I had two of the most delicious reds I've ever tasted here. Staff was incredibly attentive and informative about the wines. Plus they brought me a fan for outside so I could people watch. :) Great location in a historical building. This should be on your list of places to try!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: I visited over the weekend. Even though they are closed right now on the inside, (due to the pandemic) they still offer a great amount of curbside options. We tried their blood orange mimosa and it was great! I highly recommend dropping by. I look forward to visiting again when the inside is open.

reviews.author: Stine S.
reviews.description: Had a fun wine tasting here. Did the Texas white flight-favorite was the Roussane, a varietal I'd never tasted before. They give you seasoned macadamia bits, white chocolate, and pistachios to taste with the wine. Our server was friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Ryanne D.
reviews.description: Tried coming for two days and planned to come first thing on Sunday before we left town. So worth the trip. The best tasting all weekend...variety, pairing w snacks, atmosphere. Very welcoming and cozy, great wines! Will return

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We ordered a mimosa flight on Sunday and the menu listed the flavors as hibiscus, pomegranate, and blood orange. We were all excited to try them, but what arrived was a very sour lemon elderberry, peach, and a very syrup heavy (like cough syrup) pomegranate. We asked for dry champagne instead of sweet, but all of the drinks were extremely sweet and flat. They either forgot to add the bubbly or it was sitting out all day. We paid $80+ tip for four people to be disappointed. We all agreed they were the worst mimosas we've ever had. We would not go back.

reviews.author: Emily L.
reviews.description: What a great find! My friend an I were walking down a crowded Main Street and found this spot. They were selling to-go wines, but we also saw you could sit inside. We then learned that their tastings are inspired by a type of wine and they give you three of that wine variety from different regions (including Texas!). These tastings also come with a little nibble for each glass. They also offer cheese/charcuterie plates and full glasses. We just thought the tastings were so unique. And the woman who owned the place was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. We ended up going back to back days during our visit!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: The flights here are fantastic! I can compare Texas with France with Califorina all in one sitting. Delicious and high quality. Great experience!

reviews.author: Don S.
reviews.description: Awesome place to taste good wines. We were greeted and taken to sit in a comfortable room. The host asked enough questions to find our likes. She poured a few choices for us to try and we chose our favorites. I highly recommend this business.

reviews.author: Trey B.
reviews.description: This place is amazing!! The staff is extremely knowledgeable, which is hugely important when educating people about different styles of wine from across the globe. Beyond that, they offer a killer selection of wines! This is a MUST stop for any wino who is visiting Fredericksburg. I absolutely love that they pair local wines against international regions. It really helps to demonstrate how far the industry has come.

reviews.author: Laura W.
reviews.description: We had a short wait but so glad we did wait!  This place was by far my favorite in the Historical district!  We ordered the flight and Shanae outdid herself!  So knowledgeable!  We couldn't decide on a bottle so we purchased all thress! We also bought the homemade seasoned almonds too!  We will be back here for sure on the next trip!

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Shanae was so nice and helpful. We can't say enough good things. She was the ONLY one working and still took care of each table in a timely manner and also had a positive attitude the entire time. She was very informative and patient with any questions we had. Give that girl a raise!!!

reviews.author: Hillary R.
reviews.description: The waitress we had wasn't helpful at all. No recommendations, and she was talking to other customers about us in a very condescending way. 0/10 would not recommend.

reviews.author: Amanda E.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by winery owners- and figured we would give it a try. The interior looked really nice and cozy and the concept of trying three different wines from Texas , new world and old world was very intriguing. However we were pretty disappointed. A man doing the tasting had us sit down and explained the options - after we picked the grape varietal we wanted he got up and prepared it with a little tray of "pairings" aka 5 stale almonds/jerky/figs. Then he realized he got us the wrong flight of wines! Making us feel flustered and like we had to accept that one instead of the one we wanted. It was awkward. He then prepared the correct flight and has us taste them while he sat across from us with his laptop and a huge jug of water and his left over whattaburger lunch. The wine was mediocre at best - almost tasted as tho it had been sitting out and "breathing" just a little too long  The kicker on this whole experience was that his friends came in the middle! Walked in and started chatting - and then right in front of us the man goes - oh I accenditely poured the wrong wines why don't you guys take these?!"   Saw this as moderately rude considering the flights were pricey for a tiny taste and the establishment was trying to pull off a classy vibe. Very biazzare. It wasn't our fault he poured the wrong flight but to offer it your buddies right in front us just put an even worse taste in our palates.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Open on Christmas Eve! The owner and staff were accommodating and super friendly! The red texas  flight was wonderful! I'd highly recommend this place to everyone who wants to enjoy a good glass of wine, comfortable environment,  good music and friendly conversation.   I would give it more stars if I could!   **they also offer IPA

reviews.author: Scott P.
reviews.description: What a fun and fantastic concept for a wine tasting room! Pick your varietal and get a taste from Texas, new world and old world plus nibbles to enjoy. We tried Pinot and Tempranillo and throughly enjoyed a relaxing tasting in a comfortable fun place. Had a chance to visit with the owner, so pleasant. If we're ever in this part of Texas again would absolutely do it again.

reviews.author: Allyson A.
reviews.description: We accidentally found this place while walking on Main St. Cute little place that looks like a house with little separate rooms throughout. We sat in the front room with a couch and a few chairs. There were six of us and it was perfect. We all ordered different wines and they bring a small board with different foods to go with the flavors. The wines were explained to us in detail and we were left to enjoy our time with our friends. We got a little rowdy but they were super nice about it and glad we were having a good time. You really need to add it to your stops when you are here to just relax and enjoy some wine and good conversation.

reviews.author: Rhonda S.
reviews.description: I cannot begin to rave more about Paul Taylor, he went above and beyond with his personalized service making our 16th Anniversary Day so Amazing!! He is friendly and informative and he made our reservations for the wineries and even walked us up and checked us in! Did I mention he made our Anniversary dinner reservations for us as well?! Wow talk about a man that loves what he does and we can't thank him enough for the day he planned for us. We will be back and use him again and tell all our friends and family! Thank you again Paul you made friends for life w/us!

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: As it always goes, we go In to pick up our wine shipment and walk out with a case !   Dana is an awesome host and so knowledgeable about their inventory.    Today she packed some ice for a bottle we will enjoy later.  Such service focused on her customer.   Every trip to Fredericksburg ends with a visit here ... that is our happy tradition!

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: I looked at a handful of wineries/tasting rooms on yelp and chose this one for my friends and I to try out.  Excellent choice!!! There is a reason Vintners has 5 stars fr all of the reviews. We walked in and were greeted by Dana. Dana took us on a journey through wine! She was friendly and taught me more about wine in an hourish than I'd learned in years.  I just drank it occasionally.  I'm going to keep this review short and sweet (like some of the wine we tried). We loved this place. We loved the atmosphere, the staff and the wine. Try it out! Cheers!

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: We love this winery. The owners are super nice and take time to visit with you when they can. I have found several wines that I love and their charcuterie board is wonderful. We love the family history and memorabilia placed all around the tasting room. Can't wait to visit with them again next month. Highly recommend this gem.

reviews.author: Doris L.
reviews.description: I was really looking forward to seeing Dana   Last January we were here and we got such an education of wine. T  he et told me she no longer works there.  We were not happy with our server who keep leaving saying she'd be back in a hot second. They would ask what we wanted to but on the list was just names not what blend it was. We ended up not liking anything we tasted and I couldn't wait to leave. Will never come back.

reviews.author: Amie N.
reviews.description: This little gem is a must-visit when you're in downtown Fredericksburg. The small tasting room is made to feel spacious with a high ceiling and comfortable seating. Guests can sit at the bar for a highly interactive tasting with folks who truly love the Texas wine industry. Or, relax at your own table inside or out on the sunny patio. What makes this spot unique is they represent 6 to 8 small boutique wineries that are producing 100% Texas wines in small batches. Some of these winemakers don't even have their own tasting room. The tasting room is owned by a local family, who are also grape growers and know the intimate details of wine in the Hill Country. The menu changes since the wines are limited production, and currently they offer 6 tastings of 1oz pours which you choose from a list of about 16 wines. What a great way to get a nice overview of what's possible in our state! The wine pourers are always helpful and can guide you in what wines you may enjoy most, based on your personal preferences. Plus, nearly every time you come in, there is something new on the list for you to try. It's also a good stop if you want a nice cheese and charcuterie board for lunch or an afternoon snack. Whether your a visitor or a local, this should be on your list when you get out for wine tasting in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Elaine W.
reviews.description: Dana was AMAZING!  We've been to several wine tastings over the years but no one has explained how to appreciate and enjoy wine like she did. They have a great selection of small local wineries that you won't find had you not stopped here. We will definitely go back every time we are in Fredericksburg.  You can't skip this cute place with great, attentive staff and unique wine selections.

reviews.author: Erin R.
reviews.description: Wow! This is a hidden gem and Jim, the owner, is a breath of fresh air in the wine business. He is so knowledgeable about the Texas wine region and regional winemakers. Add Vinters Hideaway when planning your next wine tour!

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: Dana and Gina, played tag team during our visit. They were so fluid how they balanced one another very similar to the wine that we experienced. Wow! Truly amazing experience. The depth and knowledge and even the storytelling about each and every single wine was an amazing ride. Thank you all for a phenomenal outing. Charcuterie board was one of a kind. Paired so well with the wine and company. Thank you again and we will be back soon. 5 stars all day

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: This weekend is my first trip to Fredericksburg and this was one of my favorite spots! Dana was so friendly and knowledgeable it was like catching up with an old friend who was sharing her favorite wine with me. I walked away with some delicious bottles of wine and will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Lindsay M.
reviews.description: We had the absolute ideal experience at Vintners, not only was the wine amazing and the building beautiful and welcoming, the entire staff was so knowledgeable and friendly. Being new to the area the ladies working made sure to tell us all the good places to check out in the area when we left. The wine was amazing and opened me up to some new tastes I never knew I loved. The charcuterie board, which also had the owners wife's homemade wine jelly on it and delectable pecan onion bread made locally, was incredible. This was easily my husband and I's favorite spot the entire visit. We were welcomed from the moment we walked in and felt like we were family. Do yourself a favor, hit this side street hideaway spot, you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: I am just in town for a week and stumbled across this place. The staff are amazing and so friendly. The lady serving the wine was very informative and knew exactly what to give me! Will be back when I'm back in town.

reviews.author: Gary K.
reviews.description: We recently became members.  The wine selections are Great.  What is even Greater is that you get an education learning about each wine from Dana.  You don't get this personal attention at other larger wineries in Fredericksburg.  She has informed us that the first membership club is closed, however she just opened up a second club membership with different perks.  I will probably switch my current membership there to the newer club.  They don't keep a large stock, so you need to get yours while you can, because once it is gone, there are no more of that particular wine.  We love this place and would give it more Stars if we could.  These people know how to make their members feel appreciated.

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: Seriously the best winery I've been too. Dana was so amazing. Felt like we were drinking with family. Love this place so much!!!

reviews.author: Caroline M.
reviews.description: This was such a great tasting room to find during our trip to Fredericksburg. We loved the experience of being able to taste a variety of wines - it wasn't a set tasting order - we were able to pick and choose which ones to taste based on the feedback of the server, and she did such a wonderful job connecting us to the stories behind each wine. We found some really delicious wines and stocked up before heading home! It was such a wonderful experience and a place we hope to visit again on our next trip to Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: Best wine tasting experience in Texas!  Dana treated us like VIPs explaining everything and letting us taste practically everything!  The charcuterie board was super delicious.  A must.

reviews.author: Anthony R.
reviews.description: BEST winery experience in all of Fredericksburg. It's right off of Main Street and the tasting was incredible. Ask for Dana, she is amazing!!!

reviews.author: Indiana J.
reviews.description: This is the best place ever. They are very knowledgeable about wines and will even help novice wine drinkers explore new wines. Dana told us about great restaurants, vineyards, dessert shops in the area and we loved her hospitality. It was definitely the highlight of our trip. We will return to try new wines and just relax with good company. There was also another lady (forgot her name) that bakes and she paired the wines with different cookies/chocolate that enhanced the flavor of the wine and snacks. I can't say enough good things about this place. Just that you will kick yourself if you don't stop by for a tasting and bottle of wine.

reviews.author: Floyd H.
reviews.description: An amazing experience. If you come to Fredericksburg, then you need to stop here. Very knowledgeable about their wine and will take care of you. Love my experience here and want to share with others.

reviews.author: Sheila R.
reviews.description: When in Fredricksburg, this tasting room is a must try! Delightful Diverse Texas wines presented in a lovely casual atmosphere. Best wines we tasted all week. Easy walk from Main-street. Parking on site.

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: Great wine, great interactions, definitely will be back! It truly is a must stop when visiting Fredericksburg. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came to this location a few weekends ago with a friend. We stopped in our way out of this quaint little town.  I walked in and went to the counter and was greeted by a staff member who I ordered a glass of vino to go from. We exchanged witty banter about the fact that we both lived in tourist towns. I also purchased a snapback because er'body who knows me knows I love a good snapback.  The vino was light and freshening and I was pleased with the legs of the vino.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Suzi S.
reviews.description: Delicious winery with impeccable customer service. GayNell was the  server for our visit and we absolutely loved her. She was very welcoming, extremely informative and able to answer all of our questions with ease. GayNell was an absolute pleasure and she made our tasting visit a memorable experience for our entire group. Thanks to Fiesta Winery for a fun experience and a special "Thank you" to GayNell for making our visit so special. I would highly recommend this winery and be sure ask for GayNell if you really want to have a great time!!!

reviews.author: Josh R.
reviews.description: Came here for a wine tasting. My tasting associate, Gay, was amazing!!! The wines are really good, but the Happy Trails peach wine was my favorite! You get a free wine glass when you do a tasting, and they have this great deal where the tasting is free if you end up purchasing 3 or more bottles of wine.

reviews.author: Giemar F.
reviews.description: I have to say I was a little disappointed with the service. The lady seemed rushed, when I tried engaging her to tell me more about the wine she was short. I even asked why they named it FW as usually wineries tend to have a story and so you fall in love with the wine and the roots. She actually said "I don't know", k?!?! I asked for military discount and she said she didn't know and so eventually came back and said no on the tasting. I had a 15% on Yelp for checking in which I asked her to use, again just on the merchandise.  Ugh?!? Okay well fine. Very impersonal, my least favorite wine stop.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this winery we went to the one on 290.  Let's start with the way they greeted you has you entered, It was like they were waiting for you, so off to a wine tasting section we went. Our wine goddess ( what else do you call someone who brings you wine and pours it)  was great and really knew the wines . I am a red wine girl and the hubby prefers dessert and port. Well o tasted a lot , feeling pretty good right now. Hubby did the dessert wines and ended up buying a few has did I. I bought a few bottles myself and got a glass of the rhinestone cowgirl.  Which is a Malbec and pinot Grigio. It was sweet but not overly sweet.  So I went to buy another glass why we sat in the court yard listening to music and ended up says oh well buy the bottle.   I will say the staff made this memorable for me. They had fun with the wine tasting the genuine love of the job showed through.

reviews.author: Reina A.
reviews.description: Emonnie was so great. She was very helpful in assisting us in picking the perfect wine! This place is very clean and cute too.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: It is a cute little tasting room, but they are in desperate need of staff. We went on a weekday when the weather was terrible (40s and rain), so it was definitely "off season," yet the place was crowded. There were two people working, but for a long stretch only the man behind the counter was helping any of the customers. We suspected the woman working didn't have authority to pour, but she ended up pouring for two ladies that came in next to us. They got perfect, attentive service, as she only served them, despite there being roughly 20 people up and down the bar, the other 18 under the care of the single other salesman, who looked visibly overworked and taxed.  He was friendly enough, but it was clear he was just  giving his typical speech before he sped on to someone else. The customer service (or lack thereof) definitely took something away from the experience. I got very little time with the man pouring, so it was hard to ask questions. Then, there were long pauses between pours. All in all, they need to work on their staffing.   The wines range across the board, from dry to sweet, but I noticed that even the "semi-sweet" wine I tried was pretty sweet for a wine. (I can't imagine the far end of the spectrum.) The sauvignon blanc was described to taste like a pina colada, which it kind of did... more like a melted pina colada slushie. I think it was very hit or miss. That said, there was one wine that knocked my socks off - their merlot is incredible! It is a bit on the pricier end, but it is a really delicious merlot with a cherry nose and finish, which was really pleasant to drink.   They offer a free glass with your tasting, which is nice, but contrary to every wine tasting I've done (and I confess to have done a lot in several states and even internationally), they only waive the tasting fee with the purchase of THREE bottles! So, if you want just one bottle and a tasting, that could run you $50 with the tip added in. The merlot maybe deserved that, but not when  combined with everything else going on, unfortunately.   Also, take heed they do not have bathrooms, even for patrons. I know that upset some people.

reviews.author: Kevin T.
reviews.description: Nestled in the heart of Fredericksburg is a quaint little winery that will welcome you as one of their own. Great presentation as well as refreshing Peach Wine.  Get the bottle. $17 as compared to two glasses of $14 total.  Visit the back room. Especially for the ladies.  I'm sure you will find something you will need.

reviews.author: Arrianna S.
reviews.description: GayNell was a super awesome Wine tasting specialist! She was honest and not pushy about joining the wine club, gave us all the information, and left the decision up to us. We still left with 3 bottles of wine though!

reviews.author: Lindsee W.
reviews.description: GayNell and Charles were so sweet. It was pretty busy but they took the time to talk to us. Charles explained the history to us. Very affordable for great wine!

reviews.author: Aaron B.
reviews.description: Wife and I used to be members.  Fiesta would mail wine to our house and we loved the wine.  However, we moved and had a lot going on.  We did have our address changed at the post office and all mail should have been forwarded to the new address.  However, come time I got an email stating our wine had been delivered I called Fiesta winery and they searched for the wine.  Their delivery driver delivered the wine without signature at our old address.  Left alcohol at someone else's house.  In which Fiesta winery said he wasn't supposed to do.  And instead of trying to make it right with us as a member, they said it was on me to locate it and change my address.  It should have been returned to sender and then contact me by email or phone I feel.  Well they lost a member and paying customers.   We loved the wine but is what it is.  Hate it but Plenty of other choices.

reviews.author: Cody K.
reviews.description: If you're looking for an affordable winery with great membership perks, fiesta is the place for you. The wait can be long so put your name down and visit 6 shortest while you wait. Once you are stationed, you will experience a personal experience from one of the staff members.   The wines are great and the atmosphere is friendly to anyone whether you are an amateur or expert. I recommend the back porch sweet red to start off.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Excellent wine tasting room on Fredericksburg's main street.  As of January 2017, it's $12 for a 6-sample tasting flight, and it's a great value when one considers that you also get to keep the glass.  (It's a non-stem glass, but I think those are great for drinkers who may be a little on the tipsy side.)    Service was fast, friendly, and knowledgeable.  Also, I like their setup: they split the wine list into two suggested grouping: white (and generally sweet), as well as red (and generally dry). Sweetness increases as you work from top to bottom.  If you're not sure how sweet you like your wine, pick something from the middle, for example the Roussanne for the white, Cabernet for the red.  Depending on your reaction, work 'up' or 'down' the list from there.  Alas, when we visited the famous 'Lime in the Coconut' was out, but all the whites we tried ran the gamut from 'pretty good' to 'outstanding'.  Of special merit was the 'Happy Trails' Chardonnay, which has such a magnificent peach bouquet that one could practically smell the fuzz!  Definitely worth a visit here if you can't make it to their winery on 290 on the way to F'burg.

reviews.author: Roshanda C.
reviews.description: My girlfriends and I really enjoyed this tasting room. They allow you to taste any 6 wines that they have on their menu as part of the tasting. Taylor, who helped us was very knowledgeable about each and every wine. Also once she understood more of what I liked, her suggestions were perfect.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Quint little wooden building. Gals inside couldn't have been more friendly.  Wine tasting is $10 for 5 pours and includes a cute stemless FWF wine glass.Also, live music every Saturday from 2-5pm.   All of their wines are inherently on the sweet side. I was told it is a direct intention of the husband and wife owners. I have to be honest and say they weren't my favorite. Perhaps they are more suited for people who are just starting to drink wine.   On a side note, Chocolat in Fredericksburg makes special wine filled, sugar coated candies specially for FWF. Sounds a bit strange, but they are amazing! The chocolates pair perfectly with the wineries sweet wines. They can only be purchased at the winery, so be sure to buy a box for yourself and maybe one for a gift...just try not to eat both before you have a chance to give one away. :)  Wine=3 stars. 1 extra star for the fantastic service (some of the best out of all the wineries), live music, chocolates, and all around laid back atmosphere!

reviews.author: Ashley I.
reviews.description: If you like "authentic" winery experiences, this isn't your place. If you want a more laid-back wine tasting experience, this is the place for you. The wines are decent, but the employees made no effort to sit and talk with us about the wine. Instead, the two young employees texted and ate lunch meat out of a ziplock bag the entire time we were there for our tasting. I actually felt like we were inconveniencing them by being there, to tell the truth.

reviews.author: Jeffndonna M.
reviews.description: Brought the wife here for vacation and she enjoyed ! Wine was great along with the atmosphere! 15 dollars for 6 tastings and you get the glass of course. Downside was they were understaffed and had the poor ladies behind the counter running circles but they did their best to keep up with the crowds

reviews.author: Ami P.
reviews.description: Such a fun time! We stood at the bar and got the wine tasting ($20) which includes 6 wines. They have a selection of white wine, reds, red blends, rose, and dessert wines. I liked all of them especially the dessert one that had a caramel taste. I'd recommend this tasting room.

reviews.author: Robin T.
reviews.description: Love the winery and would definitely go back. It's also the last stop on the tour so makes every wine taste amazing. I definitely bought more wines there then any other stop. Plus the atmosphere is laid back and definitely more my style. Would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chad K.
reviews.description: Good time...its just fred prices;) Town aint cheap bit we love it! I would really lile to retire in Fredericksburg but I better hit the lottery

reviews.author: Vee L.
reviews.description: Review for The Edge -    Daughter of CEO Frank Lee for Virus Geeks, I  attended this newly opened winery with my party. The experience was hectic at first with the customer service due to an upcoming wedding they were setting up.   A sommelier named Louis was not shy to jump in and provide us with beyond exceptional service, even after last pour was called. He made our experience comfortable and personal as the group of us were taste testing 5 selected wines; white, rose, and reds. His knowledge on the history of each bottle and the fermentation process was impressive. I can not express enough how grateful I was for his service and how wonderful the atmosphere was.   The owner greeted our table and every other table, which I was pleased with. He helped bus tables which indicated his passion for being a part of his team. He spoke highly of Louis which says a lot about how important his presence meant to him.   A beautiful property with an impressive view, open floor layout, and affordability was good. This is the place to attend for all the locals and out of town guests.   Reserve ahead of time and ask for Louis the next time you are passing through for a wonderful service and a bite to eat.

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: This is for the Edge Tasting Room featuring English Newsome Cellars. We are currently in town celebrating my bachelorette party. The limo service we hired decided to make this a stop for our group.   We were quickly sat as a group of 9 thankfully through that service. The driver had been there enough times already although they've only been open a month to have a connection with one of the employees. Sadly this was not the person taking care of us.   The girl we were placed with sadly took away from our experience at this winery to the point where we had to complain due to her not explaining anything about the wines beyond the first. She would also not get our entire group with each pour.   The management when they became aware of the issue was more than willing to talk with us and wanted to make up for the poor service. They were super friendly.   The back patio was awesome. Beautiful view of the river which is only going to get better. They have a small putting green you are able to use while enjoying a glass. Perfect date vibes.   The food was also pretty good. The nachos were good even with the olives. Plenty of flavor. My ladies loved the bleu cheese dip wanting more of it. I can't say anything about the actual meals since I never got mine.   I realize that my group along with the other bachelorette party we spoke to both had bad experiences with the one employee. However the other portions of the experience were good. The temperitto was my favorite by far.

reviews.author: Morgan T.
reviews.description: Atmosphere was great. Wine was subpar but as a new venue they are a work in progress! Would try again in a few years.

reviews.author: April M.
reviews.description: The Edge tasting room is beautiful and the grounds are gorgeous. Our server, Jordan, was the best! He was very friendly and took the time to explain about the wines we tasted and answer any questions we had. The wine was good, I prefer sweeter. We tried the chicken tacos and brisket tacos which were delicious. The spinach artichoke dip was especially good as well. We would definitely come back again as long as Jordan was our server.

reviews.author: Tactical P.
reviews.description: This review is for The Edge tasting room.  My wife, daughter (9 yrs old), and I came on the grand opening day.  (It should be noted the back is still under construction) While navigating to the business it was difficult to find.  Turns out you have to turn in at the Tiny Houses and go to the back.  The building is beautiful and the grounds are awesome.  A beautiful view of the river from the back.    While relaxing in the back of the resort we ordered food.  The food was great and was pretty fast.  Servers were very attentive and polite.    Wine:  according to my wife who has had wine all over the world it was pretty good.  She ordered a second glass so I believe her.  I personally didn't taste it as I think wine is a waste of grapes.  I did however order an iced tea.  It was pretty good and tasted just like iced tea.  Price:  Food was reasonably priced.  Wine was a little expensive for what you get.  You can expect that from any place that has pour lines on their glasses though.  If you are worried about the price maybe you should consider buying boxed wine and going to the park instead of coming here.    CONS/RECOMMENDATIONS:  This is Texas.  We drink tea with sugar.  Get rid of the California tea.  Also, put the tasting notes on the tasting menu.  If you are in the Fredericksburg area you should stop in.

reviews.author: Kathy H.
reviews.description: I live in the area and went by the winery to get a couple of bottles last week.  I didn't notice until I was home that they automatically charged me a 20% service fee, which for this was over $15!  I just talked to the manager and learned they automatically charge a 20% service for everything!  I won't be going back.  There are too many other wineries around here that give me value for my money!

reviews.author: Cindy B.
reviews.description: Amazing views-excellent Texas only wines!! Very knowledgeable staff! Would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Brandon G.
reviews.description: Such a good experience at Fiesta Winery 290. First, it was such a good price. $15 for wine tasting and a complimentary glass and our server, Gaynell, was such a hoot. She was friendly, charming and funny. I definitely felt that warm Texas welcome from her. I look forward to ordering some wine from their website because it was just that good.   When I come back to Austin, I definitely will make the drive to this place again.

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: Solid wine and fantastic crew working there. They were an easy going group of employees who did an excellent job walking us through the winds!  Would definitely recommend to anyone else coming through this area.

reviews.author: Sj G.
reviews.description: I recommend this place if it's a girl trip.  The men in our group was not impressed.  Lots of options mostly sweet.  Can't bring food and unsure if dog friendly.    I've been with a girlfriend before and had a different vibe.  Not much of food options and no food truck the day we went.  So we give 4 star cause not much of food provisions and the wine was just ok this last time.

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: The young Lady behind the bar today (December 20th 5pm) is a nightmare for the establishment. Sadly, a we were treated horribly for absolutely no reason. Of the places visited today, this was the one awful experience, the only one actually. It also takes me a lot to leave a negative review because I understand people have bad days, but we had 9 people all ready to order wine, and we all walked out due to her disrespectful attitude. Rolling eyes, clinching fists, etc. it was so bad it's almost funny.

reviews.author: Aida P.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our wine tasting at Fiesta Winery. My husband and I prefer sweet wines, so their wines are right up our alley! I think $20 per tasting is too high though. We are not in Napa Valley! However, if you buy 3 bottles, the tasting fee is waived. I appreciate that. Their wine bottle pricing is very good. Will go back and buy 3 bottles next time! Our server was outstanding!

reviews.author: Veronica S.
reviews.description: Fabulous time! The man behind the bar, Charles, really helped customize our experience here. I'm new to the wine scene, and he was very knowledgeable about all the selections and helped me choose which wines I should try, and answered all my questions. All the choices were delicious too, and very reasonable. I would highly recommend this winery and I will be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Sharon W.
reviews.description: This was defiantly not a party at Fiesta. We arrive half an hour before closing and we're treated like we had imposed on them rather than an opportunity to make a sale. We then were ushered to the tasing room offered no help  selecting a wine. When we finally chose one it was poured into a plastic cup. We knew we were  unwanted and left to sit outside where we saw the other couple left there drinking from glasses. Very disappointed and will never return.

reviews.author: Marianne C.
reviews.description: If sweet wines are your jam then this is the place for you. When it comes to wine I don't discriminate, I drink them all. Lol  Fiesta winery is located just off 290. They have a cute outside seating area for when the weather is nice and a fairly large inside/bar area for all the space for your wine drinking needs. Quirky, helpful "winetenders" who would love to chat with you if they aren't too busy with other costumers are always there. If you do their wine tasting for $15/pp, you get to take home a souvenir wine glass which is really a steal!   Pay a visit if you are a wine newbie, Like I said this place cater more to sweet wine palates :)

reviews.author: Kelly C.
reviews.description: We came to Fiesta Winery for a girl's trip summer escape. This was the first stop in our adventure and we're not sure that our next stops will compare! GayNell had superb customer service skills and set the tone for a fun, relaxed, enjoyable experience. If you're in town, you have to stop by for a wine tasting, some dark chocolate, and the perfect meat and cheese charchuterie platter. You will not be disappointed!!!!! I love you Gaynell, from your favorite Gemini!

reviews.author: Betsy E.
reviews.description: If you enjoy sweet Texan wine then Fiesta Winery is for you. That being said, I did enjoy their 2018 Sangiovese. It was very delicious with the perfect balance of fruit, tannins and acidity. Our server, GayNell, was the star of our visit. She was friendly and enjoyable. Really enjoyed her service.

reviews.author: Erika G.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed myself for my first visit. For $15 you can try (6) wine samples. And bring home the glass. The snack packs for $9 are perfect to go with it!! I needed something to help me cleanse my pallet but it was soooo good! It had cheeses meats, nuts, and chocolate. So good! They make it themselves! All the wines I tried were all interesting experiences. I would highly recommend and for sure return!

reviews.author: Maggie M.
reviews.description: 10/10 DO NOT recommend. Absolute trash. Our cheese board had hair in it. Complete waste of time and money. I'm not one to complain but this was not acceptable.

reviews.author: Farah I.
reviews.description: GAYNELL WAS AMAZING! Absolutely adored her and the atmosphere  great place ! They have a selection of sweet, dry, and bubbly drinks! I'm a sucker for dessert wines and they definitely satisfied my desire for it

reviews.author: E S.
reviews.description: We stopped in to hang out for a bit between tasting appointments and didn't have a great experience. We walked in and the person who helped was not very friendly or helpful. Seemed unhappy to be there. We ordered the "premium" cheese platter and it was so tiny in a plastic box. Not what we expected to get for $25. Really disappointing and will not be back.

reviews.author: Matt O.
reviews.description: They definitely were trying their best, but only two employees for everyone on a fairly busy afternoon made things pretty hectic. This also meant all the tastings had to be inside, which wasn't really what we wanted during COVID. They do have a nice outdoor patio but you can only use that if you are just having a glass/bottle.  The wines were a bit too sweet for my taste on a whole, but some of the drier ones I enjoyed. On the cheaper side too which is a plus.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Some darn good wine tasting! $15 and you get to sample 6 wines and keep the complimentary glass. That sounds pretty standard for the wineries in the area but Fiesta was a great place to go to right along the highway! A little easy to miss but you're sure to not be filled packed with a crowd or waiting for a long time here. I highly recommend Fiesta Winery

reviews.author: Kelicia C.
reviews.description: Wine slush.  Margarita wine.  Live music.  Wonderful interactions.   With so many wines and goodness to choose from, it's a wonder people make it out of here with less than a case to take home. Now, again, I'm Preggo...so there wasn't any heavy tasting going on. However, when my girls were tasting a margarita wine, I had to have a sip. (Don't at me bro, this is baby number 3, I'm Gucci) The small sip I took had me sitting on my back porch watching my babies play in the summer. This wine was good! So I purchased a bottle for after baby gets here. The ladies behind the bar told me how to store it for 7 months and were super sweet and helpful as I asked so many questions. I had a favorite winery here, but needless to say, this place got them beat this time around.

reviews.author: Brittany S.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and discuss our not-so-hot experiences as being either a.) passively unimpressive or b.) actively bad. Meaning either a.) they didn't seem to give a shit or b.) someone was aiming to piss in our Wheaties (very rare). Fiesta Winery happened to fall in the 'A' category: passively unimpressive (which is most often the result of lackluster service). Unfortunately, the young gentleman behind the counter had no interest in sharing any information with us about the vineyard or wines themselves. We would ask a question and his response would be somewhat perturbed and lacked any real information. My best winery and tasting experiences have occurred when the employees are enthusiastic about the product and eager to make the customer equally excited about their vineyard and wine.   The buildings that make up Fiesta Winery (and a few other tasting rooms) are very charming and located along the scenic 290 wine route. The Fiesta tasting room was very spacious and looked like it would be a good stop for bachelorette parties. The wine itself was okay. A little sweet for my liking. The rhinestone cowgirl tasted exactly what it sounds like - - sweet and strawberry-ish and interesting....  I think if we had a different server at the bar our whole experience would have been much more favorable. Here's to hoping he realizes the power of a smile. (bigger tips, yo!)

reviews.author: Joseph L.
reviews.description: So much to say about Fiesta Winery! As the first winery I ever visited, it will forever hold a special place in my heart. It also happens to be the first winer where I joined a Wine Club. The vibes and all around atmosphere at Fiesta are always so welcoming and happy! It really does feel like home when you're here. The staff, no matter who it is, what day it is, what time it is, always go above and beyond to ensure you feel like family. Becoming a part of the Fiesta Family was one of the best decisions I have ever made and I LIVE to stop by and do a tasting, no matter how many times I've had the wines.   Now for the recommendations! If you're looking for a nice, sweet red, I recommend Texas Summer Nights. This wine is sweet, without being TOO sweet, all while keeping the body of a true red. For a sweet blush, Savannah Rose hits the spot. It's very fruit-forward and has a strong strawberry flavor! Another sensational sweet blush is Rhinestone Cowgirl!   If I could change one thing about Fiesta, it's that I would be able to fake a Fiesta Family wine glass home with me to add to my collection.

reviews.author: Priyanka T.
reviews.description: The porch and patio were charming, and they're fairly dog friendly. (Porch and patio only - no pups in the tasting room. You are allowed to go in and out of the tasting room though, so still a spot I'd recommend on the day you bring the pup.)  Cody served our wine tasting - he was solid and very tolerant of all the back and forth.  I did feel as though their mid and sweeter wines were better than their dry wines. Might have just been the weekend, but I also preferred their blush wines to their reds. True to (my usual) form, I could have passed on the whites. Unlike my friend, I was the child who couldn't follow directions and just circle six, so I ended  up circling 12 and doing 2 tastings (and received 2 glasses for it).

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: Great mead!! I'm personally a huge fan of mead so I may be biased but this Twas excellent! A lot of choices so be prepared for that!  It's an quaint little place and the decor is super cool. Actually, my sister bought something off the wall. The employee Zach texted the owner how much it was even though she wasn't there and she responded quickly.  Such a cool little spot and once again have to mention our man Zach! He was great, funny, and very professional about the meads. He should definitely be recognized!  Again, awesome mead and great atmosphere there.  Glad we stopped and will definitely recommend to anyone coming through!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Cute spot to stop and taste. They offer a good amount of different wine options. They have tasting options, wine by the glass as well as bottle buying options. They also have cute items for sale. Their jalapeño shots are a MUST TRY. Barb offered great customer service! Thanks for your hospitality! I highly recommend

reviews.author: Jami S.
reviews.description: They only have sweet wines. That's cool, but it would be nice if they advertised that outside or on a website. Why waste the trip if you are looking for a "regular" glass of cab?  I get most people start off with sweets. But again, as travelers to Fredericksburg I would appreciate knowing it is only sweet before I headed there.

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.description: Six shooter cellars is absolutely amazing with the most friendly staff and amazing sweet wines when you go ask for barb she's very friendly

reviews.author: Jeremy C.
reviews.description: Don't go here if you want "Regular Wine" that's what we were told by the young lady helping us.  Apparently they are Known for  sweet wine place is nice but the service could use an upgrade. We are not fans of the "Sweet Wine" so we got a tasting of the "Regular Wine" to go because "You Can't Sit Here"  maybe a bad day for this young lady. Plenty of places with smiling eager to help faces around Fredericksburg. Shop small shop Local

reviews.author: Robert K.
reviews.description: Best Jalapeño shots in town . Friendly staff as always. If your ever in town stop and try them, they are great

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: Amazing local winery with excellent service! They have a variety of different wines to try from various vineyards making it a unique tasting experience. My server, Barb, was absolutely fantastic. I would recommend this winery to anybody I know planning a trip to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Jala C.
reviews.description: Pretty good place.  Very touristy when we went but it is in the heart of wineries amongst Hill Country.  Would try again as there was a huge, loud group of people when we went.  We prefer more hidden gems but not a bad spot if doing wine hopping.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn G.
reviews.description: We loved this winery because it offered us something from wineries all around the US. Barb recommended several local wineries and gave us insight to allow us to have the best trip possible. We valued her honesty and authenticity throughout our tasting. We just knew she wasn't trying to feed us information or good reviews for the sake of Six Shooter or anywhere around- and her straight forward recommendations  allowed us to choose wisely in our tastings and get the most out of our trip. We would definitely come back and definitely recommend you come here!

reviews.author: Taylor A.
reviews.description: Love this place! It is my number one favorite for a wine tasting. Owner operated and always a great time. Even during the pandemic it did not disappoint and all precautions were being taken to make a safety a top priority.

reviews.author: Megan D.
reviews.description: So so so good! We loved every single option they offered.  The staff was knowledgeable but so easy and fun to chat with as well! You will love all of their offerings.... I promise! They also have some very nice merchandise, like witty wine glasses and goat milk soaps. Honestly, their logo is just so cool a tshirt or hat would be awesome too. So happy we popped in here!

reviews.author: Cody K.
reviews.description: Six Shooters is a must stop on your Fredericksburg trip. The staff is friendly, the wine is outstanding, and atmosphere is fun.   Make sure to ask for Barb when you are visiting this establishment. She will lead you in the right direction with what to taste and make sure you are enjoying yourself.   The wine selection ranges from sweet to dry. Everyone will find something they would like to try. Also, I would recommend getting the cheese board. The service is quick and the food is a high point of the visit.

reviews.author: Joseph L.
reviews.description: BEST. CELLAR. IN. FREDRICKSBURG. I am so into this place and will be coming back. Barbra is the best person I have ever met and I love her so much. Because of her, and these banging drinks, I will be back so many times. Seriously. Barbra is great. Like. Wow.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our time there Saturday.  The 3 guys working were very helpful. Cheese plates were a great addition.  Definitely be back next year.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Six Shooters is a tasting room offering wines from 6 Texas wineries. According to one of the staff members you would have to travel 1,200 miles to visit each of the wineries, so save some gas and still get a unique experience at their tasting room. They opened on May 24th 2013 showcasing wines from Cowtown Winery, Clear Creek Vineyards, Yepez Vineyard, Cross Timbers Winery and Retreat Hill. The six shooter will be Blazing Barrels but they are still working on getting their bottles in the tasting room. The building reeks of history as it is located in a historical school and they relocated an 1800s Kentucky tobacco bar inside the center of the building.  The tasting room is next door to The Pink Pig restaurant and the newly opened Fiesta Winery tasting room off of 290. Wine tastings are $10 for 6 pours and you can keep the glass. Honestly I burn out on Texas wines pretty easily but their wines, especially the reds, are excellent. I tried Cowtown Republic Red, Cross Timber Tempranillo, Clear Creek Reserve Zinfandel, Yepez Gran Mezcla and Black Bart Blackberry infused wine. I liked all the reds (5 out of the 6 wines tasted). The Tempranillo was light, the Zinfandel bold and spicy, the Republic Red a decent Malbec and the Gran Mezcla unique. The blackberry infused wine was not too sweet and reminded me of wines you would find in Door County, WI. We bought a bottle of the Zinfandel for ourselves and the blackberry infused wine as a gift.  What impressed me most was the staff. They enjoyed talking about the history of the space, the wineries and were friendly. When I called and asked if their outside is dog friendly they replied if your dog is friendly they are welcome inside.

reviews.author: samara h.
reviews.description: No sign on door saying there is a private party  Can't get served during normal hours. Super rude service

reviews.author: Jaison S.
reviews.description: Six-shooter is one of those sort of laid-back spots with large selections of wine for tasting. The building was cool and the staff was great but I was there to drink wine. Unfortunately, that's where things took a wrong turn. I found most wines to be too young (they needed longer to open up), too sweet (even the dry wines), or too different (the Meade is a fun twist but not my thing). On top of this, it was $15 for 6 tastes (most comparable wineries in the area provide higher value wines for $10). This winery can be skipped.

reviews.author: Amy B.
reviews.description: They have good wine and the girl who served us was super sweet and relatable. And by relatable I mean not uppity and didn't act better than. That's what we wanted. Just a good day drinking wine and enjoying each other's company and she helped make our day enjoyable. She was very knowledgeable yet not pushy whatsoever. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Almost S.
reviews.description: Get the frozen wine drink....better than fatass winery by far....on saturdays they have 2 music acts...more shade and scenery than fatass also....yes...just yes....becker is always my first but this replaces fatass as my second... oh yeah

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Six shooters is a tasting room that highlights 5 Texas wine makers (Legato, Cowtown, Cross Timbers, Yepez, and Clear Creek).  It is located in the historic Rocky Hill complex next to Fiesta Winery 290.    I love how they have created a space in which new meets old world country.  The tasting room is located in what was an old Tabaco barn from Kentucky, and is surrounded by a modern exterior which is the gift shop and seating area.  This place has a fun vibe, and is definitely not the place to go if you are a serious wine connoisseur interested in the 411 on the wine maker and wine making process. The staffs were extremely friendly, but had only limited knowledge.  It was crowded the day that I came and one staff member tried to keep up at the register, while the other was running around pouring wine.  It was clear they were short staffed, and later I learned that someone had called in sick.  I waited patiently to be helped, and I was welcomed warmly and provided a tasting menu and list.  You can have 6 tastes for $10 and keep the souvenir glass.  With 5 wine makers the selection to choose from is large.  It is nice that they provide some high level tasting notes for all the possible selections to choose from that day.  I stayed away from the Legato options as I have tasted them in the past and found them to be too fruit forward, and weak. From what I tried, I found the selection to be hit or miss. From the selection of wineries, there wasn't anything that WOW'd me.  Overall, they were the typical fruity weak to average Texan wine.  I have a wide palette and do appreciate sweet wines.  The one wine that stood out for me was the Cowtown  Stockyard Peach.  I have had several peach wines in the past, and this is one of the best I have had to date. For comparison, I liked it even better than the Fat Ass Winery Peach offering, which I enjoy (but they are always sold out of).  I will definitely come back, as it could very easily be that from the large menu, I just chose the weaker options.

reviews.author: April G.
reviews.description: Amazing experience! The owners are wonderful people! Hospitality was like none that I've known! We set and talked like we came for dinner and we're extended family! We plan on  coming back April 5th for another good time!

reviews.author: Rhiannon W.
reviews.description: Really cute place. Air conditioned rooms. Great staff. Lots of wine selection. Loved this place.

reviews.author: Jens B.
reviews.description: Still a great location and a quaint cottage is the way to go.  On this occasion we couldn't hang at our usual spot, the Weber House so our first two nights were in the Alamo.  The remaining night we we able to go to the mother ship.  Getting to the Alamo meant a fairly steep climb up 20 or so steps, bear that in mind.  The room itself was large, with a bathtub and shower, two bathrooms curiously.  Bear in mind that all the rooms or cottages we have stayed in the past are simply constructed, unfinished wood planks and distressed wood finishes.  I will admit, the couch was well worn and infamous problematic TV on how to operate it was still there.  I often wonder why they never provide a guide of some sort.  There is a Gideon Bible tho.  Pretty solid guide in some circles.  If it seems silly to mention the amenities, bare in mind, some of us like to just chill rather than walk the street's and wineries.
