Also, it is mandatory for a day of recovery when enjoying said wineries... ahem.  Weber House is lovely, could definitely use a new couch, it's a sleeper sofa and I can understand that perhaps they have been ordered and are still awaiting arrive.  I'm still waiting on a bed we ordered many months ago.  My only wish here is that the would replace the commode seat.  I had mentioned this in my first review.  Can catch you unawares, so having a seat is definitely a recommend for dudes.  Staff are always wonderful and we enjoy a frequent return discount and they also knocked off a couple of bucks for the construction which was pounding at 8.30ish the morning of the 8th.

reviews.author: Sheryl F.
reviews.description: We had reservations for two nights.  Overpriced for what you get.  Amenities of the past no longer exist.  No freshly baked cookies to greet us, as shown in their ads, because of contactless check-in.  Library and common area not properly set up to be accommodating.  Minimal breakfast left at your door (no fresh juice).  The grounds looks run down and the staff seem overworked and there was trash and empty drink cans from previous guests left sitting around outside.  The fountain outside our room was dirty and not properly cared for.  Check-in is supposed to be 3pm, however, another couple in our party had to wait until 3:40pm because their cabin was not ready.  Then we noticed cat throw up from a stray cat on the porch and dirty mop bucket water being tossed right in the dirt in front of the entry to their door.  So we had to go get someone to clean it up.  This was their 30th wedding anniversary getaway, so we were all disappointed.   The cabins were okay, but not worthy of the $230.00 a night that we were charged. Will not stay again.

reviews.author: Juliet T.
reviews.description: Hoffman Haus is truly the only real good game in town for rooms that are both equal comfort (hey now feather pillows!) and well appointed (hey now, nothing that feels tasteless or, like, faux country chic.)   Breakfast is served daily to your door in a picnic basket at 9AM. And it's great. Super simple but really delicious and better than any stateside continental breakfast I've had in a long time. The scone even tasted like a real life Bri'ish version.    The check-in is super simple once you get the hang of it. Check your email for the code to your room. Locate your room via the map they send to you/ or the map they post in the great hall.   All and all, it's the best and most comfortable hotel in Fredericksburg. It's also minimally invasive, i.e., you will not have rando people talking to you all of the time. You're on your own. And I like it that way.   Lastly, it's a really short jaunt to town if you want to get those steps in.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: We have been here three years in a row during December. We brought friend who are new to Texas. I have to say our other visits we better and were pre-pandemic. Our biggest issue was no room cleaning. It just was not the same as our other visits. I know it is difficult to keep hospitality business NORMAL during the pandemic. Hopefully this place will be back to its previous standards soon!

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Had some mixed feelings about this place. I think I would stay again but, would definitely make sure to pick one of the stand-alone cabins. We stayed in one attached to the great hall, which was fine since it was a week night. I imagine during the weekend it might get kind of loud.  We checked in super late and didn't realize that the last 4 digits of your phone number are the key to your door. It wasn't stated in the email (if it was, I guess we missed it but, neither my boyfriend or I saw it). We struggled to get in but, once we called they immediately answered and assisted us in accessing our room.   The room was cute and had a modern rustic feel too it. They give you tea and water bottles and provide a small refrigerator and dishes. The soap was also very high quality and smelt great.  The breakfast is delivered promptly at 9:00 am. It will wake you up as they knock on the door 2-3 times to let you know it's there. If you like to sleep in, be aware of this. The breakfast itself was decent quality and as expected. It would be nice to have a little bit of sauce options (ketchup, hot sauce, etc.) but, it's just nice they deliver it to your room and is a cute feature of the BandB.   The drawbacks were if you get a room by the great hall it only comes with a stand up shower! So if you want that claw foot tub make sure to book a suite/stand alone cabin. The shower in our room had a drainage issue and turned into a mini bath for our feet, which was gross and a big turnoff.   Additionally, we were greeted to our room by a dead squirrel. It was just laying there across from the door to our room. Thankfully, my boyfriend and I have a sense of humor and realized it was probably one of the many cats on the property that left us this little gift. We did check in very late at night and the white cat was out causing trouble. Obviously, it's not the fault of Hoffman Haus but, was still kind of a gruesome welcome. On the plus side, the black and white cat was friendly and let us pet him.   With that being said, giving 4 stars. I would try a different room upon returning and go based off both experiences.

reviews.author: Hunter L.
reviews.description: Wife and I planned a last second  babymoon. We were thrilled to find they had a cabin available. The room was clean and adorable! The soaps were awesome! And the breakfast provided the next day was absolutely delicious. Some of the best French toast I've had. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I took my husband here for a a surprise bday getaway, and Hoffman Haus has patrons for life! This was such a charming BandB. All of the safety protocols were in place.  The staff was extremely great to work with, and they had all of my requests (champagne, charcuterie, and flowers) in place waiting for us. We chose a standalone cottage, and it was extremely spacious and private while still giving us the BandB experience. The location is also great because it is super close to Main Street (walkable to most of the main attractions depending on how ambitious you are).

reviews.author: Kate B.
reviews.description: Loved it. Great part of town for walking to everything but still quiet. Adorable hotel cat and a delivered breakfast. What's not to love? They had water in the mini fridge and our room has two balconies for sharing a glass of wine (H‑E‑B is just around the corner or bring your own. They have a wine opener).   Only complaint is that the room needs USB plugs. Maybe one of those alarm clocks with a USB plug or something else. We'll be back!

reviews.author: ashley h.
reviews.description: My husband and I did a last minute birthday trip here and booked a cabin during the weekday. I loved everything about this place! The room itself was very clean and had a nice selection of soap, lotion, and hot tea which I really appreciated. The location is great just a block away from main street with many places we wanted to visit nearby. The grounds are beautiful and I wish i would have brought my camera stand to do some couoles photos. I live the little pond my the outdoor wedding arch. The property cat was so cute and provided entertainment looking for frogs or fish in the pond. The breakfast delivered to our room was honestly one of the best meals we had in fredericksburg. A perfect quiche with a warm scone and fresh fruit. Great chef on property. I cant wait to come back to stay here again.

reviews.author: Lori B.
reviews.description: We absolutely LOVED our stay!! We were upgraded to a suite and breakfast was amazing!! Sitting on the porch listening to the fountain was perfect! Bed was comfortable and cozy! There were just enough dishes for us to use and coffee, with creamer went perfect with our delicious breakfast.  It was so quiet and relaxing.  Even the toiletries were awesome!!  Highly recommended!!

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: Our recent stay at the Hoffman Haus was magical.  We stayed in the Basse House, which is a stone house dating back to 1871. It's a gorgeous house. The beds were super comfortable and the daily breakfast was divine. Took one star away for cleanliness and amenities. The floors were so dirty that after only 30 seconds of walking around your feet/socks started to turn black. Also, the kitchen was a bit lacking. There was no cutting knife, no spatula, no small pot, no strainer, also the electric tea kettle had not been cleaned out after last use. Also, there were no laundry bags, which would have been a nice touch. We thought one room had them, but it turned out to be a previous guests garment bag that they had left behind. Would stay there again, but might try one of the newer houses.

reviews.author: Itzel B.
reviews.description: What a wonderful place to stay at. We had a one day stay over. Room was clean and cozy. Great customer service. The breakfast basket was such a treat and delivered at 9am like clockwork.  Hope to come back and stay In their Victorian 2 floor house on the property. Despite covid restrictions this place would be a real gem for a celebration of any sort!

reviews.author: Jesus G.
reviews.description: This past weekend was our first time visiting the HH. Everything was amazing! The staff helped me organize my proposal out in the garden area and it was an unforgettable moment that we will always cherish! Amy was very helpful every time I would call and ask any questions prior to our arrival. We will for sure be returning soon in the future.

reviews.author: Claire W.
reviews.description: This is a lovely property and our first night was fine, but I would not stay in any room attached to the great hall again. There was a dinner event that turned into a party with loud music and drunk people on the patio outside until at least midnight. The only access we had to after hours assistance was phone numbers on the doors of the great hall which meant I would have had to walk through the patio party to call someone to ask them to quiet down and I chose not to do that. Party goers staying across from us continued to be loud afterwards. Next time we will probably try somewhere else.

reviews.author: Helina M.
reviews.description: I can't believe it's taken me over a year to review this adorable historical Fredricksburg gem. My first experience here was for our first anniversary. We had a blast!  The Hoffman Haus is part bed and bedfast, part event venue.  It's situated in the center of this historic tiny German town among wineries and shops. And the fact that it's a close walking distance to everything makes it a convenient choice for your stay.   Every room is different. Ours was cozy, charming and spacious. We had a private deck with rocking chairs, a large bath garden bath tub, a living room and simple but comfortable bedroom. In the mornings, we were served a fresh breakfast in an adorable vintage picnic basket that arrived outside our door. Quiche and fruit, anyone? The service was warm and friendly, and made us feel right at home.   I loved the little thoughtful touches throughout. For example,  they had a guest book in our room for us to sign and share our experience. It was cool to read notes from other couples who shared the same experience. If you go, look for ours! :)

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: I decided to visit Fredericksburg one weekend and found, through internet research, that this BandB was one of the very best.  I arrived after their scheduled check-in time but called a week prior to give them notice and was given alternate procedures for check-in which was great.  Upon arrival to the room (Texas Bunkhouse), which was cozy and the largest room for my particular price point, I would describe it as upscale rustic.  It seemed to have a majority of the basic amenities you would find in a hotel room.  It had a mixture of modern and antique furnishings and of course polished concrete floors.  This is in a newish building, so you have the rustic atmosphere without the rustic smell.  For an upscale BandB, I thought the room should of had the following items:  - Laundry bag - Slippers (for walking on cold flooring on cold winter nights).   - Soaking tub (only had a stand up shower) - Better shower head with more than just a single setting (and better water pressure) - Consistent, faster internet  One thing I wasn't really fond of were the flies. Maybe there are a lot in the hill country or this particular town, not sure.  There were at least 3 in the room when first arriving and I managed to kill two of them before leaving, but they are annoying and landed on everything.  BREAKFAST Saturday morning breakfast was brought to the door shortly before 9am as promised.  I didn't think this particular breakfast was all that.  It was simple to say the least, compared to the website which seems to portray a more gourmet experience using local ingredients when possible.  There is nothing special about scrambled eggs lightly seasoned with pepper, sausage links that tasted just like frozen jimmy dean from the grocery store, an apple struedel in a bowl, a slice of orange and a strawberry.  Sunday morning was a little better but still keeping it simple.  They gave you a lot of patty sausage, a fruit cup, egg casserole, and a homemade blueberry muffin.    I liked the layout and size of my particular room, but Id be open to try other rooms if I ever returned.  I tried to pick out some movies from their library in the great room but found most all movies are older (2008 and earlier).  This is 2018, they could use a little updating of their collection for sure, to cater to the younger crowd.

reviews.author: Elaine B.
reviews.description: We absolutely loved our stay here!! Perfect, quiet location tucked behind Main Street. We would always walk to dinner on Main Street. Our cottage was spacious, clean, and cute. The soaps in the shower and bathroom were also a highlight- made by the local Hummingbird Farms. Breakfast was served in a basket and delivered to your door each morning at 9am! It was sooo good! We would definitely return.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Outstanding home away from home. A gorgeous, friendly, comfortable space. All the amenities to boot. You can just chill here on your visit to Fredericksburg, wine country, and Enchanted Rock. Plus, get a massage, take advantage of Gabby and her team for a spa moment!!! We did a deep tissue def one of our ATF (all time favorites) on the planet. Soooo goooood. Thank you HH for the great stay and amenities and overall vibe. Incredible.

reviews.author: Crystal E.
reviews.description: Wow...is all I can say. If you are looking for a quiet, peaceful, and serene getaway... this is a good place to start. The Hoffmans Haus is rated as the top Bed and Breakfast in Texas and I can see why. The people are down to earth with complete southern hospitality. The accommodations to the choice of room was beyond customer service.  I could not have been more happier. I loved every aspect. The aromatherapy shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion, the unbelievably comfortable beds, and we can't forget the breakfast in bed. You are surrounded by wine vineyards and German restaurants for those seeking something different. - Happy Traveling

reviews.author: Melissa A.
reviews.description: Loved our stay!!! The room was perfectly wonderful. Private and cozy. Breakfast was good. I loved the sausages, everything else was good. I had a wonderful massage while there. Would love to stay here again and definitely recommend it

reviews.author: Lindsey B.
reviews.description: My husband I set up a car service for a Saturday to have a nice, relaxed, chauffeured drive around to wineries for our Anniversary getaway.  We were able to book about a month and a half out and Patrick was very easy to set things up with.  After a little confusion regarding cars and schedule Saturday morning our driver, John, arrived.  He was extremely courteous, gave a few suggestions regarding wineries and the basic plan for the day and was very nice to spend the day with.  Patrick was obviously concerned with making sure we were getting the service we wanted and very friendly when we ending up running in to him at one  of the wineries.    All in all, this is a great service.  They care about their customers having a good time and enjoying their trip.  I would recommend them and use their service again in the future!  Thanks Hill Country Express!

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: Julie was amazing! Awesome family experience!  We'll definitely come back! Left with a six pack of wine and awesome memories. The cherry jam was my jam!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Right on Main St. Very good customer service... ask for Denise..Really sweet and knowledgeable.  Good selection of wines from across Texas, not just Fredericksburg area. Try Texas Vineyards very own Peach Wine. It was surprisingly good. For the wine snobs out there don't think of it as something you would sip while dining a fine meal, but rather pour over frozen peaches and enjoy while sunbathing on your yacht. ;-)  $1 per taste...decent pour.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: I was not impressed with our recent visit this past weekend. We were in town for the afternoon and had a great time walking around the historic Main Street. We saw this little shop and wanted to check it out.   I saw a beautiful cross made out of wine corks and wanted to take a picture to send to my mom. Before I could snap the photo, my hubby pointed out that there was a no photo sign. I turned off my camera on my iPhone, but just as I did the woman behind the counter screamed at me, 'NO PHOTOS!'  My hubby and I explained that we had just seen the sign and had not taken a picture. She screamed again, 'PUT YOUR PHONE AWAY!'   What? Really? I was so embarrassed and I didn't even take a photo. I wish she would have approached the situation differently instead of shaming me.   I will not return because of the way I was treated, and many of the other customers followed me out of the store and commented on how rude she was.

reviews.author: Jeffrey J.
reviews.description: This by far is in of the studlllexperiences I've ever had! I'm a quite but adventurous traveler and I've never had a woman in all of the 28 countries I've been to be so rude. I don't know if she thought I was someone else but she treated my wife, my sister in law, and I horrible! Also this is my first 1 star rating and I've done several ratings

reviews.author: Heather W.
reviews.description: Very rude customer service! There are so many other tasting rooms to choose from that have very friendly people behind the counter. Take your business somewhere else!  I am not sure what Charles P is saying below? This is what I am talking about the most disrespectful customer service. I never ordered 24 servings for 2 people I am not sure if you are getting m confused with someone else?

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: Love this spot. It is my favorite place to go while I'm in Fredericksburg. Although Fredericksburg has a lot of places to offer this place is where I go to restock my wine stash. The owners are awesome...And even though they see so many people throughout the year they alsways remember us and it makes us feel like we are just at a friend's house. I have seen the negative comments yet NEVER experienced it. So maybe it was yall just sayin.They even offer to hold our wine for us so we do t have to carry it around.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: We stopped in for a few tastings. The women who served us was very rude and short with us. She didn't offer suggestions and seemed like she would rather be anywhere else. I asked her a few questions and she barely grunted a response. Avoid this place there is charm to be found elsewhere.

reviews.author: Holly H.
reviews.description: Babes favorite wine.... Texas south wine raspberry! Lots to choose from. $1 tastes are hard to beat!!! The lady working was kinda crabby tho :-/

reviews.author: Juniper S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are Fredericksburg locals and this has become our "Cheers".  Chuck and Denise are very knowledgeable and eager to please.  This was the first tasting room I had ever visited many years ago and I was treated with such respect and courtesy that I kept coming back!!

reviews.author: Greg Z.
reviews.description: besides the lady behind the counter being a crab the wines they had were tasty.     good size dollar samples here.  no hours of operation on yelp or even posted at the front door.  i even called and no one picked up and the answering machine didnt even gice hours of operation .  oh well.  at least they had one of my favorite texas wines.  the red raspberry mmmmm

reviews.author: Val T.
reviews.description: When we go wine tasting, we prefer to go to Fredericksburg or Gruene, where the wine shops tend to specialize in local wineries. We had an excellent time at Texas Vineyards and Beyond when Thomas took me to Fredericksburg for my birthday.  They are great folks, willing to take the extra time to talk to new visitors and educate them about their offerings.  They often have tastings with the wine makers, and carry a wide variety of local mead, wine, and other fine products, including some amazing port.  I do like good port.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: We stopped in here after having the worst/rudest service ever at Fredericksburg Winery and Texas Vineyards and Beyond was wonderful!  They were explained everything so nice and friendly!  I will recommend this place to everyone!  And the wine was good...especially their Peach wine! Loved this place!

reviews.author: Aida P.
reviews.description: Great experience! Our server was friendly and great to talk with! We are sweet wine drinkers and he made sure we found a wine we liked! Our tasting fee was waived when we bought some wine. That's always a plus! We also enjoyed music by Hunter Billingsley on the patio. We will return!

reviews.author: Fox E.
reviews.description: Not to be confused with Lost Peanuts Ranch, which is where I always end up losing peanuts.  We've enjoyed their wines on a couple of occasions, once because they were cheap on sale, and the second time because we liked it so much the first time.  We haven't been to the actual location, but their products are available at various stores here in Texas, and they're better than most of the Texan ones if you want me to be honest.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: The wine selection here is very generous and delicious!   Buy Texas wines, best in the world!

reviews.author: Julio G.
reviews.description: This place is such a hidden gem. Our server, (Lawrence) was such a joy to all talk too. This place is comparible to fat a**, but is definitely marginally better. The wines are more consistent and definitely deserver more praise. You will not regret coming here!

reviews.author: Mario P.
reviews.description: First time in Fredrickaburg. This place is the real deal. We wanted a more authentic taste of the region's wines and this place did not disappoint. Both staff members proved knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Great wines. This place is easily missed and right off highway 290. Do yourself a solid and pull over and try them out. Their tasting prices are also very reasonable.

reviews.author: Emily-Mae B.
reviews.description: Really great tasting experience. John was very knowledgeable about the wine we tasted as well as the wine that grows in this region. Definitely a great stop on any wine tour.

reviews.author: Jennifer P.
reviews.description: Great winery! Great service, great wines. Went here for my best friend's birthday and enjoyed every minute. Lawrence was a great host, can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Sebastian P.
reviews.description: Great wine and very personable team, Phillip was great. Discussion and tasting was great.  Looking for great wines. This is the place to go. Whites, reds, blends and ports. All great tasting. Small vineyard, good quality.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: Our first visit to Los Pinos was on point! Drew was amazing. She was extremely informative about their wines and Vineyard. All the wines we tasted were very good. The Texican and their Texas Cab were superb. Will definitely revisit Los Pinos Vineyards!

reviews.author: Jessi B.
reviews.description: We were winery hopping in Fredericksburg on a Sunday and happened upon Los Pinos. The service was awesome, the atmosphere was great, and the wines are actually really good! Definitely coming back next time!

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: We had a great time at our tasting at Los Pinos! Our faves were the Texican and the Blanco Grande. Lawrence was a fantastic wine tender. We can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Gaylene L.
reviews.description: We stumbled on Andreucci after they were open just a few weeks and continue to come back. We joined the wine club and love it. This is a great spot for a glass of wine or to bring a group of friends. We just went there to celebrate a friend's birthday and set everything up with Laurie. She was great to work with and we had an amazing time. We visited a few other winery this weekend and nothing compared to the wine or the hospitality we received from Andreucci. My husband and I have also been fortunate enough to attend a cooking class at Andreucci and can not wait for the next one. Thank you all so much for a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Georgiy P.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been coming here for three years . Today was a last straw . Some of the wines were  corked. There was only 1 person behind the counter , who was incapable of paying attention to detail and attempted to pour me the same wine twice ( in the span of 45 seconds). Also , who pours Prosecco into the glass that just had red wine in it ? If your are proud of your wines have a decency to wash the glass .

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: If you know wine, please avoid.  If you consider their 7 course meal paired with wine, please avoid.  It is of laughable quality.  I could go into details but it's not worth it. Staff was very polite though!

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: Bad, 2-day-old vinegary wine, no service, demoralizing.  Hands down, top 5 worst winery experience of my life. Keep walking down the street to a different wine tasting room. The staff, though interactions were few and far between, were rude and careless. We were invisible. 15 minutes upon sitting until we were greeted. It took another 25 minutes to get a glass of wine, then it was another 92 minutes before we were visited again.   The wine (Nero) was bad like the bottle was left open from 2 days ago and nobody had ordered it since. We just sat there without any options - like being trapped in a timeshare. Finally we had to tell a staff member we needed the check because they clearly had no interest in checking on their tables. There are only 6 tables in the place so I was amazed at how absent the service was. We couldn't get out quick enough.   There are 20+ other places to take your business, so please save yourself the time, stress, anxiety, and go somewhere else in town.

reviews.author: Bud Y.
reviews.description: Awful service. Been there 3 times. The first time was 5 stars.  4 staff and very good. Second time and third time was absolutely awful. My party waited over twenty minutes and we were never served and left. There was 1 staff and she was overwhelmed.  During that period, I saw over 50 people come in, checked out the situation and then left. Whoever runs this place should be fired. If the owners in Italy knew how much business they're losing, I would assume they would make changes...maybe they don't care!

reviews.author: Kristina G.
reviews.description: Top of the WIN list!!   FYI: not a Texas wine  Red Winer lovers, this place is a must!  But white wine drinkers will be equally happy!!  If you've missed it my WIN list is Wineries I Need (WIN) if you only have 1 day in this wine wonderland we call Fredericksburg.  Located on the corner of Main Street and Washington, this tasting room is fun place to enjoy a glass of wine and people watch!    The first time I entered Andreucci Wine Room I was lucky enough to be there when the winemaker himself, Flavio Andreucci, was present.  I seized the moment and had him pick my wines for my tasting!  At Andreucci's you are able to pick any 6 wines (red, white, sparkling or sweet).  Flavio chose the following 5 (I should have let him choose my 6th, my mistake): Prosecco Chardonnay Costavecchia (lalaLOVE) Regale Montepulciano D'Abruzzo (my choice, my least favorite) Regale Black Label  Just like Rosé, I'm usually not a fan of Prosecco, but this one is a winner, winner, chicken dinner!  It is made from 1/3 of each variety of: glera, chardonnay, and peeled pinot noir white grapes.  The result is this sparkling deliciousness!   The Chardonnay is an easy drinking, subtle and smooth white.    Costavecchia is by far my favorite.  I've already returned more than 4 times to have a glass and to purchase bottles!  All the staff are amazingly friendly and knowledgeable about the wine!  They also remember you when you return, which I am a huge fan of with small businesses!!  Insider Tip:  Upgrade for a $10 up charge for a taste of their Premium Reds: Regale Gold Label.  It comes with a to-die-for chocolate truffle.  It is 50% cabernet and 50% sangiovese; aged 1 year individually and then 2 years together.  It's a blend of epic proportions!

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: New comer to Main Street and a welcome addition to wine country. I love the selection of wines and the atmosphere and cool vibe in this place. What a wonderful place to get out of the crowd and be around people who appreciate great wine.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I absolutely hated this place! We came in there was only one person serving everyone. They give you a list to check which wines you'd like to try. My friend did not get the ones she chose. After the second tasting we decided to leave. Their glasses were dirty. The bartender was definitely not happy to be there. We paid for one full tasting when we only received 4 out of the 6. She even had the audacity to check in front of you if you tipped her. Tipped her for her rudeness and lack of customer service? You're darn tootin' you received a $0 tip. I shouldn't have even paid for the tasting but we wanted to get the hell out there. RUN AWAY. GO ELSEWHERE. Take this review as a sign to run far away!! I hope this helps.

reviews.author: Robert L.
reviews.description: Andreucci is by far my favorite winery. I've really come to enjoy Italian wines, and their selection here is top notch. I have to stop and get a couple of bottles everytime I'm in town.

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: Went tonight for a private dinner w wine pairing.  I can not say enough of how fabulous the food and wine were let alone the service.  If you don't try this you are missing out in life experiences.

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: I stopped in for my first visit a week ago.  It was a nice break to try something new by tasting a variety of wines from Italy versus the routine Texas wines which I  do enjoy.  I am a Red's only fan and was pleased to have enough selections that the Wife and I were able to pick some different selections (~10-12) and get to try almost all of their non-premium Reds.  I really enjoyed several and thought the members prices were reasonable.  Unfortunately the price point for non-members is not competitive with other wines of similar quality and price point available online or at other retailers in my opinion.  Would definitely consider a return trip for a tasting, but that's about it.  Unfortunately, I already have 4 wine memberships and have told the Misses we are not doing, and there are none she was willing to drop so otherwise this one could be a possibility.   I can say, I would have purchased a few bottles of big bold reds (e.g., Primitivo, Regale, and Cab Franc) to take home had I had a member friend with me to get their prices.

reviews.author: Kathy C.
reviews.description: Sunday I attended the first Wine Club pick up party. I cannot tell you what a wonderful tasting room this is.  Andreucci  wines are just wonderful!  They are so good. you can taste the love they are made with.I have not had one I did not enjoy.  The customer service is perfect. Everyone is very very friendly and welcoming. The food they serve is excellent. It is small, cozy and very friendly.  I highly recomend visiting this tasting room and also joining their Wine Club!

reviews.author: Shel D.
reviews.description: This place is simply amazing! The wine is all imported from a small family vineyard in Tuscany. You can tell immediately that they have high quality standard levels there. It's nothing like your experience from the very thin and weak Texas and produced wines. Also, they do dinners on Saturday night and the food is out rages! Usually someone from the family in Tuscany is there cooking and it is authentic as it gets. We had an amazing six course meal last Saturday that was the "best dining experience that I have ever had!" This is a unique, Italian oasis in the middle of Central Texas. You've got to go!

reviews.author: Dennis K.
reviews.description: I know, I know, all great reviews, but... Went there today, a Wednesday, three of us in our 40's-50's.  All business owners from Austin.  Not obnoxious and had not been drinking.  Just wanted to taste some Italian type wines.  Walked in around 1pm.  No other customers there.  Coldly greeted by a female with an extremely heavy accent (I'm assuming Italian but hard to tell).  Gave us a list to check off and basically ignored us.  We gave her the list and she asked us some questions. None of us are hard of hearing, but we could not understand ONE WORD of what she was saying.  Plus whatever she was saying was with an extremely unfriendly attitude.  We walked out.  Went across the street to Cross Mountain, another Italian wine vineyard, and had a great time.  Lady there was super friendly, understandable, with no airs or pretenses.  Stayed for several tastings and walked out buying close to $500 of wine.  We could care less about Andreucci or their wine as the experience was unacceptable.  Will never be back.

reviews.author: Timothy W.
reviews.description: Italian wines are my favorite and Andreucci does not disappoint... brilliant to have an Italian tasting room in the middle of Texas "wine country" since most TX wines don't quite push past good and into the category of great! Highly recommend this for anyone who truly loves fantastic wine.

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place!!  Can't say enough good about Andreucci.  Took my wife and kids as well as in-laws.  Fantastic wines.  I am somewhat of a Brunello connoisseur and I was very impressed.  Tony is a great guy!!  Unbelievable service by Maurizio!!  A little slice of Toscana in Fredericksburg, Texas!!!!!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, adorable dog named Sterling who made friends with our dog. Great wine!   We chose to sit outside and were able to see the cows and horses grazing from the outdoor seating. They even keep a bag of horse treats on a table outside so that you can give the horses treats!  Definitely recommend coming here for a tasting. 6 for $20! Great deal.

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I got off the hop-on-hop-off wine bus because we heard there were actual longhorns to see. We get off, and the longhorns are nowhere to be seen. No where. We did get a glass of wine here, but nothing super exciting. Cute decor, and wine was good, though.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: No wine trail passes on the weekend??? Come on man! Bunch of chinchey bastages! Wine is fair but beware of their BS.

reviews.author: Linda G.
reviews.description: Just wanted to share a great experience we had at Longhorn Cellars today. Tremendous service from our "wine  master" Ken - great service and knowledge of the wines served.  He's a keeper!   And re: wines  -  wonderful!  We especially loved the Mourvèdre and Sangiovese (and petit Verdot!).  You'll not regret the experience!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: I was in Fredericksburg today to pick up wine from one of the 5 wineries I belong to (don't judge me because I am a "wino".  Fortunately I took some backroads back to San Antonio and happened to see Longhorn Cellars.  Wow, a hidden gem off of the beaten 290 path.  Unfortunately COVID prevented us from stopping in and enjoying the tasting room, BUT, the number on the door allowed me to text and order my wine.  What is awesome about Longhorn is that I could look at their website and see what I wanted and was able to text my order in while I was sitting in the parking lot.    I was greeted by the owner who was sooo happy to tell me about the wines and even shared her favorites so that I could come back and sample when life returns to somewhat normal.  We picked up 2 bottles to try and I am impressed, PLUS, the bottles are much more reasonable than other wineries in the area.  I am looking forward to trying a port wine once they produce it.   If you get a chance, stop by and visit one of the newer wineries in Fredericksburg as I think you will be pleasantly surprised.  I AM!  Oh, the bonus is that they have indoor seating which will be nice during the hot Texas summer.

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: What a great place. Friendly and welcoming, plenty of space to stretch out, nice scenery, great wine, and most importantly great service!  Their indoor tasting room is large and  outdoors they also distance the areas well.   Dog friendly, our host (Nicole?) took great care of us, and her dog Sterling hung out with us and our dog most of the time we were there. We of course did our tasting outdoors as our pup was with us.   We enjoyed the wines on the tasting, brought a few bottles home, and enjoyed hanging out outdoors.   Appreciated that they sold chips and salsa to put a bit of something in our systems while doing the tasting.   We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Rachel L.
reviews.description: The wine is great and we had a nice waiter, but the inside smells like dog. I'm a big dog person, but they put the dog on top of the bar which is a little much for me. Make sure you sit outside.

reviews.author: Cindy K.
reviews.description: Overall, there's better wineries based on the knowledge of the staff we had and the type of wines that they had. I don't think I would go back unless I hear news that things have changed.   Winery: This is a very new winery that has been open for the last couple of years. It's part of the 290 Wine Shuttle Route.   Longhorns: I came here on a Saturday morning  right when they opened. Their iconic amulet is the "longhorn". We were told there were longhorns here that we can see, but when we got here and finished our tasting, it was hard to see any longhorns. There was probably one at the furthest end of the field, which was disappointing since my boyfriend and I are UT Longhorn fans. The only great longhorn we saw was the one in the front where we got a photo opt. Perhaps it was too early in the day for us to see real ones.   Tasting: You have the option to do shared or individual wine tasting. I think for one person it was $20 for 6 wines. There's other discounts if you end up buying bottles of wines. There's mixed menu or all red menu.   Wines: I did not like the wine selections here compared to other wineries I have been to. Nothing really stood out to me. Out of the 6 wines from the mixed tasting menu, I think my favorite was the Carlito ( red blend of petite sirah, souzao, aglianico, montepulciano)  Atmosphere: As expected, the ambience was southern, rustic, barn decor with longhorn paintings hanging. There's a bar at the very center of the room when you first enter.  Knowledge: This place is new, but has opened for almost 2 years. We had a new person that served us. She wasn't able to give us alot of details about the wine to further the experience. When we asked questions, it was clear she wasn't fully aware of the answer or had to ask someone else. Anyone new working should be paired with an experienced persons, so this doesn't happen.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Good wine and great promise as they age!  We like several of their wines and they show great promise for amazing wines to come!  We look forward to many times revisiting Longhorn Cellars in months and years to come!  It was great to talk with Deanna and Michael Dickey, the owners, and our two servers, Sian and Vinny were knowledgeable and friendly, and made our experience memorable.  This first visit, our faves were the Syrah, the Alicante Bouschet, and the Viognier.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Wines are decent. The employees were somewhat knowledgeable but it was all very unorganized and overall not my favorite place so far.

reviews.author: Claudette P.
reviews.description: This place is class and cute and we especially loved sterling. Defo recommend this place! Nicole is the best.

reviews.author: Lynne P.
reviews.description: What a great find!  The tasting room is lovely with cowhide chairs and decor. They have a nice selection of their own wines, with interesting combinations of grapes. Having visited many wineries including those along 290, have to say Longhorn Cellars are really good. Don't bother stopping at some of the bigger, better known wineries along the route, you won't find a better ref for the price. Their wine club only Syrah stands up to others in the area that have a higher price point. And don't forget to check out the longhorns and Carlito the white donkey who they named a wine after.

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: Owners Dr. Michael and Deanna Dickey are no strangers to wine.  Having spent some quality time in Napa Valley, the dream of having a vineyard and winery of their own was something they turned into reality. Mike Dickey completed courses with the Texas Tech Enology program and along with the guidance of Dr. Bob Young of Bending Branch, he has been producing his own wines. Located at the former location of Rancho Ponte, the Dickey's have breathed new life into this place with their own inside décor and outside vineyard. In addition to their estate vineyard, they also have vineyards near Hye and Pontotoc for sourcing Texas Hill Country AVA grapes.  Since opening just over a year ago, Mike and Deanna started serving some Bending Branch wines and wines made from California grapes, they have been slowly making the transition to Texas High Plains AVA sourced grapes and are now gearing up for more Hill Country sourced wines. They have a few flight selections to choose from currently on their menu. For this visited, we opted for the mixed flight, featuring a little bit of everything! For the whites, we started with the 2017 Viognier. Sourced from the Texas High Plains of Reddy Vineyards, this aromatic wine is fresh with some buttery notes and bright acids.  We moved on to the 2018 Twilight Rosé. A blend of 92% Mourvedré and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon from Pontotoc, this off-dry Rosé is quite refreshing for the infamous hot summer Texas days!  For the reds, we sampled the NV Tannat which is a product of the Russian River Valley. This red was a rich wine with a lovely bouquet and a fine smoky finish!  The NV Texas High Plains Syrah has 25% Petite Syrah added to it to help round out that leathery, smoky, and tantalizing full mouth feel. Lastly, we enjoyed the 2014 Carlito's Cuvée. A blend of Souzao, Aglianico, Montepulciano, and Petite Syrah. This California sourced wine has great balance, moderate acidity, and a relatively smooth finish.  We also got to sip the 2018 Viognier, as well.  This release is Texas Hill Country sourced and its profile is completely different than that of the High Plains Viognier. A great treat to test "battle of the Viogniers"!   They are also working on a Tempranillo they plan to release in the future, so it is worth your valuable wine stopping time to stop by and taste not only what is currently on the menu but see if anything new has been released yet.  There are additionally plans for a great blend from the Mourvedre, Malbec and Merlot from their estate vineyard. This newest Texas Hill Country boutique winery is a fine addition to the area, and we look forward to stopping by again in the future to see how their menu and wines continue to evolve. The servers are also quite knowledgeable on wine and will provide quality professional service during your tasting session. They are off to a great start in their initial year. Cheers!

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: Decent wine. Gary is a great kid! Helpful! Not a great place to visit if you want knowledge of the wines, though. Love the "pay it forward" board. Great idea! Stop in for a laid back wine tasting but don't expect to learn much about the wine making.

reviews.author: Karen L.
reviews.description: Great wine tasting experience. Server was very knowledgeable about the wines that we tasted. Many of the wines are made from Texas grapes and the quality is excellent. For the first time ever, my husband and I found a dry rosè that we both loved.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Great communication and good service. Driver David was awesome. Car was nice and the trip was well planned. Would use again for sure!

reviews.author: Joshua D.
reviews.description: This Company is great! I used them to book a group wine tour for my wife's 30th birthday party and will definitely be using them again! All of my interactions with Aaron were delightful. He was very responsive, answered all my question and we had an awesome time! He even made time to introduce himself at one of our stops to make sure things were going smoothly.  Our driver Carlos helped us along the tour and was awesome as well. He picked us up from San Antonio , drove safe, and made sure we got to every winery on time. He checked us in when we got there and would follow up with us occasionally at each winery to make sure that all our needs were met.   If anyone is looking for a Company to plan a wine tour event I would highly recommend Aaron and Off the Vine. They were very professional and took care of everything for us once we booked.

reviews.author: Paige F.
reviews.description: I only have wonderful things to say about this tour company!  Our driver Allen was a DELIGHT! He was so professional and still a great time, we enjoyed his stories and he truly cared about making sure our day was perfect. Our car was clean and the driving was safe. He made sure we had everything we needed at each vineyard we visited.   Aaron, the owner, hand picked our vineyards that fit us and were still fun during COVID. He was nice enough to introduce himself and check in on our group at one of the stops.  They also provided a meat and cheese board which was a nice treat after all the wine. Well recommended!

reviews.author: Melissa R.
reviews.description: If I could leave less I would. DO NOT BOOK HERE!!! They didn't make reservations at any of the wineries I requested and instead just tried to do walk up tours to random places. We could have just done that ourselves or actually made the reservations of the places we wanted to go. Don't waste your money. We had them take us back and went ourselves and had a great time. This company is a complete scam. Also it's not even wine tours they just drive you. $400 later and the owner was not even responsive let alone apologetic. TOTALLY UNPROFESSIONAL.

reviews.author: Victoria D.
reviews.description: Our tour with David was nothing short of amazing. He picked us up on time, and made sure we made it to each of our wine stops accordingly. Everything was done for us from scheduling to checking in at each winery. He had great hospitality and made sure we enjoyed ourselves at each stop.  Fredricksburg has many great winery's, our favorite being Barron creek. If you come here to tour, make sure you book with Off the Vine to ease the hassle of driving and picking out where to go. If i could put 10 stars I would, cannot recommend David enough!

reviews.author: Julia N.
reviews.description: We used this company a few years back and had a wonderful experience. So we planned a bachelorette party a few months ago, we decided to use them again. However, this time, our driver was unprofessional, showed up late, there was no ice in the cooler for us and the air conditioning didn't work. It was such a disappointing experience, that when we told Aaron about it, he offered us a "huge discount" next time we'd come back and use them again. We tried to take him up on this for an upcoming weekend. He didn't remember and despite reminding him of the situation, he kept trying to quote us the normal prices. He finally offered it slightly discounted and we agreed to book it, but when we paid the invoice a couple of days later, he cancelled and said we had needed to pay that day if we wanted it, even though he failed to mention that before cancelling. The whole experience was unprofessional and we are highly disappointed in his lack of communication.

reviews.author: Kelsey K.
reviews.description: We hired Aaron to take our family on a tour the day after Christmas. We confirmed twice over text message, but when the time came for our tour, he never picked us up and didn't reply to calls or texts messages. We called the wineries he'd (supposedly) scheduled for us and they informed us that they had no reservations under this tour group. We finally drove ourselves.   Not sure if he's running a scam or is just unreliable, but unless you're willing to roll the dice, stay far away!

reviews.author: Ismael O.
reviews.description: Off the Vine made our tour a memorable one.  My wife and I were very much pleased.  Aaron picked some awesome wineries, each one of them were unique in their own way.  A big thanks to Allan our driver, he was on time, a true country gentlemen, and knowledgeable of the area! We can't wait to come back and use them again.

reviews.author: Geraldin G.
reviews.description: We enjoyed our day at the different wineries very much! Our driver was on time, personable,  and very accommodating! Loved that it was a private tour which meant we could take our time and enjoy the wineries we really loved. A few hiccups got in the way but were quickly remedied.  The price is a tad bit high but keep in mind it's a private tour. It was tons of fun!!

reviews.author: Megan F.
reviews.description: Overall my husband and I had a great experience! When booking, Off the Vine was lacking a bit in the communication and the process was a little sketchy in that they had my name down wrong, did not make me pay a deposit when my sister did the weekend before, and do not send out confirmation emails or anything like that. But when the driver picked us up, the van was air conditioned well, transportation was smooth, a meat and cheese board was provided, and overall it was a great day! I recommend, but would definitely call to confirm your reservation the day before since the booking process is a bit unorganized.

reviews.author: Jackie T.
reviews.description: Be careful, the price quoted by this company is NOT the price they will charge your card. The driver was extremely good and nice however the owner proceeded to charge a $385 tip for (supposedly) the driver and would not refund it even though we had given the driver a cash tip. $385 is extremely excessive for a tip! Also until I fought for it the owner did not honor my $100 deposit and over charged me for this. He does all this after they have taken you to four wineries so you are not in your best mind to fight it! Van/bus was sub par and nothing nice. The only good thing was the driver

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: Aaron was a great host, we loved all 4 wineries. We definitely will use off the vine when we return back back to Fedricksburg. Thanks for a great day!

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: Aaron was a great host to our bachelorette party of 14 people. He picked us up at our BandB, took us to 3 great wineries, and returned us...even stopping at a convenience store for us on the way back home. He was extremely gracious and accommodating and I couldn't recommend him highly enough!

reviews.author: kate a.
reviews.description: David was a fabulous host for our wine tour! He was informative and very flexible. Had a fun time!

reviews.author: Victoria H.
reviews.description: I called twice and was promised a call back, once as soon as he got back to the office, and the next day, in five minutes. He never called back and seemed very frazzled. I'm glad he's NOT driving me around!

reviews.author: Brett H.
reviews.description: We had a tour with Aaron, great guy. Right on time and he was nicely talkative and interested in learning about us. Everything worked out perfectly throughout the day. Would tour with this company again, in fact my GF is recommending him for an upcoming bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Karissima N.
reviews.description: Aaron was a great help as we organized a shuttle to transport guests between two locations at our wedding venue.  Not only was he open to something outside of the usual tour routine, but he also provided a great price, planned to be there early, and ultimately was amazingly flexible when our plans changed.  Having such a responsive and personal touch is not something to be taken for granted!

reviews.author: Kristy K.
reviews.description: Awesome tour company!!! Great experience from the first time I spoke to Aaron on the phone. He is very knowledgeable of the area, and different wineries in the area. It was our first time to Fredericksburg, and weren't quite sure where to go. We went ahead and let Aaron take control of our tour. We toured 4 different wineries, all of which we had great experiences.

reviews.author: Chelsea F.
reviews.description: We used this tour company for my friend's bachelorette party a few months ago and we could not have had a better time or service!  Eric picked my group up at our BandB house right on time, met us with mimosas (it's a bachelorette party after all!), was energetic and made everyone excited to start the day, and was very professional as we hopped around from winery to winery.  There's a variety of different packages to choose from and special pricing available for different occasions.  We loved that we had a variety of wineries to choose from to customize our day.  Eric handled all of the logistics and we got to enjoy the ride.  I would highly recommend this company for any occasion or group!

reviews.author: Emilee P.
reviews.description: Aaron took great care of us on our tour. The selection of wineries was great! We had a great experience.

name: Hill Country Wine and Music Festival

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Just to compare....AUSTIN Wine and Music Festival is $30 (advance)/ $35 (door), but includes 10 wine samples and a keepsake wine glass instead of 4. Also, their site www.austinwineandmusicfestival.com lists specifically what you get. I felt Hill Country was being a little sneaky about what they meant by "sampling" (i.e. only 4 samples).

reviews.author: Courtney D.
reviews.description: Never would have paid to go if I would have known ahead of time what all, or should I say little, you received for the amount you paid.  The measly four samples weren't even really enough to temp you to buy a bottle.  I have gotten more at FREE wine tastings.  I maybe would have enjoyed it more if I could HEAR the music from inside the barn.  The advertisement was misleading and I won't go again.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: Love this cute little place! Richard was especially knowledgeable and friendly. We will be back soon for amazing customer service!

reviews.author: Stephy B.
reviews.description: This was a very nice elegant winery, the man was very knowledgeable on al the wines. The wine was really good and loved the cute names. The staff was friendly as well. We also had lunch here and it was really good

reviews.author: Betsy E.
reviews.description: Wedding Oak may be a small tasting room but the wines are phenomenal! Our Wine Sommelier, Mike, was not only friendly but very knowledgeable. There is a wine for everyone (whites, reds, semi-sweet). Amazing that the grapes are grown in Texas. It was definitely an incredible experience.  Thanks Mike!

reviews.author: Lizzy P.
reviews.description: I was SO IMPRESSED! The wine was wonderful, especially for the price! Highly recommend. Will be doing a wine membership here, every wine we had from the tasting menu was amazing.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Beautiful location closer to the town of Fredericksburg.  Good wine but pretty expensive for what you get.  There is nothing fabulous about the wine and it is pretty much like everyone else's in the hill country area.  Nice stop because it was new, but not worth a second stop.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Wedding Oak Winery opened a second tasting room location at Wildseed Farms.  It's a perfect partnership.  The tasting room space is located at the back of the central building area.  There is a spacious covered patio with tables to enjoy a glass of wine outside.  The tasting room area is small, and has a bar that you can stand and enjoy a tasting at.  You can select from different tasting flights dependent on the style of wine you prefer.  The staff were friendly and informative.    Wedding Oak Winery utilizes 100% Texas grown grapes.  They are sourced from their estate winery and other local growers.  The winery is named after a 400 yr old tree that is located 2.5 miles from their winery in San Saba.  They opened their historic downtown tasting room in San Saba in 2012.  The wine maker is Texas wine legend Penny Adams.  She was the first Texas female wine Master back in the early 80's.  She was a pioneer and played a key role in getting Texas wines on the map.  Her wines are typically blends, and her typical style is to use minimal oak aging.  She has an amazing story of how she fell in love with wine and has been involved in the field since.  The wines here are Texas Terroir focused and made ready to drink now.  I found all the wines I tasted to be approachable and easy to drink.  The wines were well rounded and structured.  There wasn't anything I didn't like, and a few stood out better for my palate for different reasons.  A couple of favorites were Bridal Bliss their sparkling white wine (I like a nice bubbly), and 2014 Sangiovese, and their Albarino.  I plan to visit the San Saba location and would definitely come back for a future visit.

reviews.author: Sharon S.
reviews.description: Great staff, wine and ambiance. Get the story and enjoy!! Excellent presentation, paring foods with wines was delicious.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: I'm not a white wine person but enjoyed it. Wait. I can't remember the name of the wine I liked because I'm hammered.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Wedding Oak Winery opened a tasting room inside the Wildseed Farms making the stop to see the fields of wildflowers that much more enjoyable. They are located at the back of the center of the building and it has both a gorgeous indoor tasting room and nice patio with comfortable furniture and a fire place. They welcome you to "sip and stroll" at this breathtaking property.  I have now visited the tasting room 3 times in the past month as I love the wines and couldn't resist stopping back in after my first visit a few weeks ago. You cannot find their wines in stores so you can either buy on premise (their first winery location is in San Saba), buy online or join the wine club. I had the pleasure of meeting the wine maker and the owner. The wine maker/viticulturist is one talented person who grew her first grapes in the 70s. There is so much more to share about Penny Adams but I will let the wines speak for themselves. There are 13 wines to choose from at the tasting room so there is something for everyone.   Two of my favorite bottles are the Rose 2014 Dry Dolcetto and the and the Tioja 2013 which is a Tempranillo, Tannat and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. The Tioja is not currently available online so there is more reason to visit the winery.

reviews.author: Shelby C.
reviews.description: Spectacular wines and pairings. They put on a wonderful tasting for our group and truly outdid themselves. Their wines are excellent and they have many different varieties for the different palates and preferences. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Ivy L.
reviews.description: Wedding Oak Winery drew me in because of the fields of wild flowers they had on site and driving by the vivid colors of the Texas Bluebonnets and the Indian Paintbrushes drew me in - I made the bf turn around so I can walk through the fields and grab some pictures!  This place was pretty unique - there was a small winery and tasting room on one side and the Wildseed Farms on the other - you can buy plants or walk through the gardens with fields that were just straight blue with Bluebonnets or red with the Indian Paintbrushes. A lot of the area is blocked off so you can't walk and trample the flowers, but there was an open area where you can walk through and take photos.  This place has a huge parking lot but apparently tour buses come through here as well cause the parking lot was packed and there were a ton of people! Nice stop for a photo but didn't try the wine.  I think they have areas to rent as a venue as well but not positive.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: I had a bit of a lame experience on my first trip here.  At 5:32pm I wanted to do a wine tasting when the tasting room was set to close at 6pm.  The lady pouring the wine was slightly apologetic but refused to sell me a tasting, even though I was willing to rush through it.  I tasted the boldest red they had, and I wasn't too impressed; it was pretty uninspiring.  I bought a glass of rose, since she would only sell me a glass at 5:32pm, and for the price, $14 a glass, it was underwhelming.  I pass by this place a lot on my frequent visits to Fredericksburg, and basically they lost a potential repeat customer based on this first experience.  If their wine was more to my liking, I'd probably give it a second shot, but there was nothing impressive here, least of all the customer service.

reviews.author: Rusty W.
reviews.description: Excellent and knowledgeable staff! Great and super friendly people in a beautiful setting!  I love the heritage behind the name and their take on Texas wine is second to none!

reviews.author: Danyelle A.
reviews.description: Located inside Wildseed Farms, this small tasting room is a delight.  It is a rather small venue and can get crowded quickly. The staff was delightful and conversational. They were very willing to give you an extra tasting if you asked questions.  The wines I tasted were all rather good. There was one I was very impressed with - a white when I normally drink red!   I would've given this wine tasting room five stars; however, while we were there a patron brought in a dog. Although everyone kept making comments, management allowed the dog to stay. Given they were serving drinks, this should be against the health code. I am not a fan of bringing a dog indoors while you are serving refreshments!

reviews.author: John O.
reviews.description: Probably our least favorite establishment in the area.   The staff was very abrupt.  Had a very 'assembly line' feel to the tasting.   The gift shop was nice, but I would stay away from the wine.  The staff is abrupt, and the wine is quite overpriced. Very pretentious feel to the place. Again- our least favorite experience.  Will not return.

reviews.author: Chelsey D.
reviews.description: This was one of our favorite wineries on our 290 winery visit! Loved how small it was and we enjoyed a lot of the wines we tasted. Plus the abundant flowers nearby make great photo ops! Looking forward to coming here again.

reviews.author: Trisha T.
reviews.description: A large group of us went to do wine tastings in Fredericksburg for a bridal shower. It was a memorable experience except for the poor treatment we received at Wedding Oak Winery.  One of the associates soured the festivities by condescendingly and loudly accusing one of our guests of being too inebriated to do a tasting at this winery based on her (the guest's) confusion on the setup of the wine tasting menu, which was different from the other wineries we had visited that day. He (the employee, an older man) assumed she was drunk (she had little to drink that day and has an extraordinarily high tolerance for alcohol) and asked the group if a DD was present and continued to interrogate us.   A lot of assumptions were made by this unprofessional individual. I get it...a boisterous loud group of women walk in who look young but are actually successful professionals in their mid to late 30s....still, this guy should not be in a position involving guest interaction. While he did proceed to serve us, members of our group refrained from joining the tasting and/or buying anything at this winery due to his rudeness and overall lack of people skills. On a positive, the manager was very kind, apologized, and said she would follow up. Not sure what that means though.  I do not recommend this place as there are so many other wineries in Fredericksburg that have both great wine AND great service. Innwood and Messina Hof to name a few.

reviews.author: Brenda S.
reviews.description: My husband and, I along with another couple visited this winery this past week.  We went in on a Thursday afternoon before the weekend rush and had a tasting and enjoyed a glass of wine on the patio.  Lisa was a great hostess.  She told us about the wines and where their grapes come from and answered any other questions we had.  It was a very pleasant experience and were invited back the next day for anniversary cake.  We came back, bought wine and enjoyed the cake. The wines were good, but the people there were exceptional.  That is a big part of the wine enjoyment experience. Kudos to them.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: My friends and I were celebrating her birthday with some wine tours in the Fredericksburg area on Tuesday, July 11th around noon. We walk into a charming little shop then made our way back to the wine tasting area. There was a guy behind the bar who didn't even say "Hello," or any other kind of pleasantries. He just kind of shoved wine menus in our direction as we stood there wondering what we had done to deserve rude customer service... There was no place to sit and drink your wine, unless you were a wine club member (which is ridiculous to begin with, considering their completely empty outdoor patio) My friends and I spoke about his rudeness and decided to take our business elsewhere, right down the road to Fiesta Wineries, who were awesome! I suggest not going here unless you expect to be treated like garbage and not even spoken to.

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: Sorry to be a Debbie Downer, but our experience at Wedding Oak Winery was not as great as that of other Yelpers.  The facility and staff are fine, quite nice actually!  It's just that the wines are not on par with the higher end competitors just down the road.  Now don't get me wrong.  None of these wines was "bad".  But, they just weren't that good.  This could come from differences in palates.  These wines tended to be simplistic and fruit forward with little depth and very light tannins.  They would likely appeal to a novice wine drinker and are probably a good starting point to learning about wine.  If you're new to wine, you will probably enjoy this place, so give it a shot.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: First time trying Italian wines.  We were not disappointed. Great place to visit. We are definitely fans of the Italian wines. Heck planning a trip to Italy now!!!

reviews.author: Kathy C.
reviews.description: My one of 2 favorite tasting rooms in Fredericksburg.  The wine is very very good - the service is wonderful. Everyone is so nice. The crepes they were serving this afternoon were to die for . Just an excellent experience.

reviews.author: M. Suzanne H.
reviews.description: I wish I could give this guy 10 stars.  I arranged this party bus as a birthday gift for my boyfriend; he was suggested to me by a friend who said that he knew Larry personally and that he would be the best guy for the job.  I am glad I listened to my friend because Larry definitely was!  Going into this, I had never been on a wine tour.  I didn't know where to go or what to expect.  All I had to do was tell him that and he was able to arrange a kick-ass evening/morning for my boyfriend and our 19 friends.    This guy definitely knows his stuff (and texas wine country!) and it really comes through when he's helping you plan your route.   He was kind and patient and most importantly, he was prompt!  (Even though my boyfriend was running late because he didn't know about the surprise waiting for him on the bus.)    Many many MANY cheers to Larry and Mike's Luxury Transports.  I will definitely be recommending them to everyone I know in the future (and using them again!)

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: Tour BUST! The guy could not drive and nearly drove us in front of traffic several times. His wife intruded on our private event and followed us around and even participated in the wine tour! The winery he took us to for lunch wasn't serving food that day so we had to wait two hours for sandwiches, which we still had to pay for! It's supposed to be a luxury bus and it was more like a school bus. The refreshments provided were flat. The tasting and lunch weren't included in the fee so we had to tote our purses around everywhere. It was overall a terrible experience. He was the only one who could get us in at such short notice and I absolutely know why now. Just AWFUL.

reviews.author: Noel V.
reviews.description: BEST CHOICE!!! We had a one of the owners, Larry, as our driver; Such a nice and personable man. He got in on our conversations when prompted but didn't butt in or intrude. He knew all the great places to go and helped us decide. I had a list of 7 places and asked for him to help us narrow down. He talked with me and we nixed a few and replaced a couple with newer or better ones. They are a much better rate than all the other tours. Everyone else was charging around $150 per person for a choice of 5 vineyards to be visited on a set schedule. I wanted freedom to go where ever we chose, leave when we wanted or stay as long as we wanted. Larry gave us a flat hourly rate regardless of the number of people and NOT including our wine tasting fees. The reason this is GOOD is because when you visit a bunch of vineyards within 4-6 hours, you may want to share tastings with another person. My boyfriend and I did our own tastings for the first two vineyards, then we started sharing the tastings after that. If we had gone with one of the other tour companies, they would have charged each person for the tasting with no option of sharing. (Note: we visited 6 places and all the tastings were $10 per tasting and all allowed sharing)  For 14 people, a tour company would have charge $150pp = $2100 and only included 5 vineyards and on a set schedule.  For Mikes Luxury Transports the price was $110 per hour for a 14 passenger bus and were free to go to as many places as we wanted (6 in our case) We got 6 hours = $660. Because some of us shared tastings some of the times, the total tasting cost ranged from $420-840. SO, this means at the MOST (if everyone got their own $10 tasting at every single vineyard) the total was still a $600 savings...we saved about $900 b/c most of us starting sharing tastings by the 2nd or 3rd vineyard.   And as to Jennifer L.'s poor review, if she would have done her research she would know that almost all the vineyards don't serve food...just little pre-made snacks. There were a couple that have FOOD TRUCKS at the vineyard, but it is not the vineyards fault, nor the drivers fault, if the food truck doesn't show up that day. And they knew in advance that the tasting fees were not included in the hourly rate, therefore, they should have been prepared with cash in pockets if they didn't want to tote their purses around. And why in the world would she expect a driver to pay for lunch for them? Seems like she simply didn't do even the basic of research on the area.

reviews.author: Rebekah S.
reviews.description: I can't give enough compliments to Mike's Luxury Transports.  We rented a 14 passenger coach bus to tour the Texas Hill Country wineries.  Driver was very knowledgeable about the area and offered great recommendations.  Pricing is very reasonable and entire experience was a great time!

reviews.author: Erica L.
reviews.description: I loved this experience! Rennetta was amazing and very knowledgeable. Made the trip about our experience and took us to winery's that accommodated our taste. The vineyards we went to were beautiful, great scenery, great wine, and great service. Good for all ages! Whether you want a casual laid back experience or a girls trip Texas grapes wine tours accommodates for it all!

reviews.author: Nathan M.
reviews.description: We went on a wine tour this afternoon and it was awesome!  Rennetta was great, and the wineries we went to were excellent.    I'm not a wine guy and wanted to go on this trip to make our anniversary special for my wife and she had an amazing time!

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: Best limo wine tour in Fredericksburg!!! The staff and drivers are professional and easy going at the same time. The prices are better than most other wine tours even for small parties.  Tour = I suggest 3 wineries because 4 takes to long and you'll group will be too drunk to enjoy the rest of the day/night. Go to sister creek winery first in Sisterdale to have a nice scenic drive/ visit luchenback on your way back (20 min drive/8 tastings at sistercreek)  Limo = very clean, great air conditioning and bluetooth hookup for your phone to play music (bring a USB cable just in case the bluetooth doesn't work) water and snacks provided plus free wine glass at end.  Staff and drivers = The company works with 2 other wine tours and will help each other out if they can not accommodate your group (must be good people if they help others) They are just normal people who will go out of their way to accommodate you. They will even stay in contact with you through text prior to pick up and during the tour. Ask for Kim to drive your group!  Lunch = lots of options but we went with the chipotle chicken wrap which was great (comes with chips and a large cookie)  Payment = will accept any form and you typically pay after the last winery.   Highly recommend this TOUR!

reviews.author: Shelley E.
reviews.description: We had such an AMAZING experience! Rennetta was THE best! This is my 2nd time to Fredericksburg and I will absolutely choose Texas Grapes Wine Tours any time I come back! We had such a fun time and learned a lot about the history of this part of Texas all while touring the wineries. THANK YOU for making our experience unforgettable!!

reviews.author: Claudia A.
reviews.description: Amazing experience! Thank y'all so much for making my best friends bachelorette experience wonderful! Would def. recommend to anyone!

reviews.author: April H.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this company for those desiring a wine tour. Family owned, very efficient, great experience! You definitely get your money's worth. 3 wineries in 4 hours. We loved our sweet driver also!

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: the wine tour overall was okay. the driver was very nice but we wineries we went to were just okay good wines but not very much information about them. we were already done by 2:30pm when we were told the tour was going to go on till 4-5pm. also was never asked if i wanted any change back at the end of the tour. just a bit disappointing.

reviews.author: Gemma A.
reviews.description: Just returned from a tour with Mr Steve from Texas Grapes Wine Tours. We've had a brilliant day, so much more than a wine tour, more like a Texas Hill Country guide and more! Took us to a great range of wineries, so much local knowledge and what a great character! Kept us interested and entertained all day! You can make this tour whatever you want it to be, choose your wineries or leave it to them (we did). We will be return customers.

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: Somehow I made it 40 years as a native Texan without ever visiting Fredericksburg...until this past weekend, that is. We had friends who had recently used Texas Grapes Wine Tours and they came highly recommended. Thomas took my reservation by phone, his wife followed up with confirming our tastes and reservations, and her dad picked us up for the tour. I love that this is a family run operation! Steve, our driver, was such a great guy. One of the men in our group expressed his preference for beer over wine and Steve took us to Pedernales Brewing for a taste in between wineries. It was such a fun day made even nicer since all we had to do was sit back, drink and be driven around. Thanks Texas Grapes!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This company is fantastic. It is evident they have cultivated relationships with winery's throughout the town - tell them what you like and they will take you there. I will recommend this place to all friends and family, Thomas is knowledgable and friendly. Next time we visit we will use this company!

reviews.author: Amber R.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today with Annalisa!  She was knowledgeable, fun, and very accommodating!   She made recommendations along the way and made sure we were taken care of at all stops!  I would highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: N L.
reviews.description: We had the best time on our tour! We had just gotten engaged the night before and our tour guide was so sweet and welcoming. The B and B we were staying at that weekend had a huge dip in the alley that the limo hit which ended up causing the limo to break down a few minutes later. Like a superhero, the guide masterfully guided the limo into a winery parking lot as it was breaking down (it was absolutely beautiful). She was beyondddd sweet and i could tell she felt really bad but none of us cared! It ended up being completely amazing because we got another winery stop that day. :-)

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: We had the stretch Navigator for 12 people. We had door-to-door service which included 3 pre-arranged wine tastings. Our driver Steve was very friendly and welcoming, arrived on time and had everything ready for us. Highly recommend them for a group outing.

reviews.author: Jenessa O.
reviews.description: I would hands down say this was the best wine tour!! They were so welcoming and had great recommendations on where to go!

reviews.author: Kirstin D.
