reviews.description: We had an amazing time, we will use Texas Grapes Wine Tours again!

name: The Edge Wedding and Event Venue

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: New Years Day...noon hour...Marjan and I spied the stone gate opening to the grounds of The Edge, one of the newest wine venues outside Fredericksburg. First imagined as an upscale location for weddings and parties, it has been transformed, and is now also a very serious entry to the burgeoning wine industry in the area.  The main building sits not on the shoulders of HWY 290 as many wine houses, but rather a short drive up a gentle rise to the site. What meets the eye is an expansive structure with a 5 story tower to the left.  The building is impressive in scale, think Agustin Vin, or Grapecreek, or Becker Vineyards scale.  Entering beneath the stone colonnaded portico first see the wine bar area, left of that are rows of tables for patrons, and right of the bar area, spacing devoid of seating:  perhaps a dance floor?  The ceilings soar at least three stories, more likely four, and beyond the wine bar, complete, unobstructed access to the patio given a very, VERY open design.  Beyond the patio are terraced grounds with additional tented seating,  some widely spaced on the grounds.  We counted at least two stone water features, the sound of water cascading down the man made waterfalls adding more pleasure to the day. Beyond that, there is a drop of maybe 60 feet,  leading to 100 acres of frontage on the meandering Pedernales River.  The  river and the surrounding oaked countryside make for a breathtaking visual treat.   And to add spice to the scene, we noticed a fly fisherman plying his skills along the banks.  Picturesque!       Of the tower to the left, the structure is designed as a multi level observation tower, complete with wine bar service, that will be available to wine club members.  The fifth floor will serve as a type of "corporate hospitality floor" reserved for the highest level of wine club members.  The views of the river and countryside are remarkable from each level!      As we munched from our charcuterie board, we sampled several of the wine offerings: delicious dry whites, but we particularly enjoyed the cabernet sauvignon.  Of the wines, grapes are grown in East Texas (Lubbock area?), a consequence of association with English Newsom Cellars.  We have found that individual tastes vary widely for wine lovers, but suffice it to say that we enjoyed the offerings so much that Marjan immediately decided membership.  The quality of the wines, the impressive physical plant, the expansive grounds and the beauty of the acreage and river....well, membership was just too much to pass up.       We have visited a number of winerys in the area, and frankly, we consider The Edge second to none for the mentioned features.  When you happen to visit Fredericksburg, take the short drive east of town to this winery.  We think you will enjoy! Be safe!!

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: How absolutely beautiful this new venue/winery is! It was our first stop on our 290 wine tour and not many people got off. BIG MISTAKE!! While this venue is still going through the last of some minor renovations, this amazing, scenic venue will not only leave you speechless, but it will also leave you with some amazing pictures throughout your visit.  All wines are made and grown in Lubbock. Suttle tasting wines that are perfect for a relaxing visit to enjoy the view and everything this place has to offer.  We decided to go for the wine tasting. Luis was our wine connoisseur who was extremely knowledgeable and genuinely had a passion for wine. He was very attentive with an all-around likeable personality. Definitely made us feel comfortable! $25 each for wine tasting experience and believe we had 5 samples. I can definitely see this place becoming very popular. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Christina A.
reviews.description: This winery/tasting room and venue is both beautiful and quite full of great wines to enjoy. The atmosphere and grounds are quite stunning with 360 picturesque views of the Hill Country. However, this review is solely based on service and a shortage of staffing which is a national problem, I'm aware. However, when a consumer is charged a mandatory 20% service charge that's where I feel like I'm entitled to review something that I was forced to support monetarily. I did a tasting, it took almost an hour at the bar which kept me from my group and enjoying the views outside. It was half full of patrons during latter part of day, a slow Saturday compared to many others I've experienced in Fredericksburg. My poor server Bailey was great, but, she was helping so many others and making boxes that there was no way she could help us through the tasting. So another took over (didn't explain the wine). I decided to not even try the last sample because by then I was infuriated. I asked the guy to just pour the last sample of the current #4 sample and a glass of that wine I'm buying so I could just close out. He said no he'd rather pour the sample then the glass. Fine, he left again of course helping another patron and I waited again. The glasses were $14/15 ea. My friend and I left thirty something cash on bar and asked for the glass of wine so we could after an hour go outside. "I need to ring you up" "uhhhh ok, it's cash here" he said "no it's $38 for the two glasses and 20% tip". (Fine, here is the mandated tip for the service I did not receive on top of your pay.)  Look, I'm in hospitality and client based services. I know that I would never require someone to tip me if I performed poorly. Gorgeous place and good wine but highly unjustified mandatory service charge when the service was complete crap. The other two vineyards had service (go to Signor) so on point I would have given 10% on top of the 20%. I'll be back, maybe...

reviews.author: Crystal C.
reviews.description: Such a nice new spot in Fredericksburg! This place is so beautifully built and designed, I couldn't stop looking around and admiring it. If you go here, book a wine tasting and spend some time outside - it's beautiful

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I have spent so much time trying to find the perfect wedding venue and everywhere in South and Central Texas just did not check all of our boxes. Until we found The Edge wedding venue.. it is PERFECT. It's absolutely gorgeous and so romantic! They truly went above and beyond with every last detail to provide everything you will need and want on your wedding day. They are also so easy to work with and obviously want to make your special day magical. I can't wait to post a review with pictures after my wedding day!!

reviews.author: Jessica T.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem sitting on the most gorgeous, serene plot of land. The architecture is jaw-dropping with its juxtaposition of the land, they worked with the land rather than trying to make the building compete with the scenery; I can't wait to see how the pictures come out. As the sun begins to set and the lights are shining, it's breathtaking. The staff themselves are the among the kindest and most accommodating, they made sure we were happy with every detail before moving forward! The on-site lodging, honestly I could move into them they are so beautifully decorated. We couldn't be happier with our decision to have our dream wedding at our dream venue, The Edge!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: From the drop dead gorgeous views, to the beautifully crafted venue, this venue has it ALL! I've been following them build from the ground up and I just had to see the venue for myself when I found myself narrowing down my choices. Nothing compares to this venue. From the professionalism of the staff, to the beauty of the property from beginning to end, I'm excited to have my wedding at The Edge!

reviews.author: Ali G.
reviews.description: This was an amazing tour for our group of 5 friends visiting the wineries in Fredericksburg! Not only because of the amazing service and pricing, but also for the flexibility of locations! Most other wine shuttles had restrictions on certain wineries and times, but Lucian was super accommodating with our scheduled wine tastings and was able to drive us anywhere we wanted! He picked us up directly from our Airbnb, dropped us right off at our destinations and was available as soon as we were ready to head back to town. He had waters, music and even surprised us with birthday balloons and party tiaras/hats for my 2 friends celebrating their birthday (we wore them all day!!) I couldn't recommend Texas Tour Co enough for your touring needs in and around Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Shawndra W.
reviews.description: I highly recommend Texas Tours for your transportation needs in Fredericksburg.  We had a large group in town for a weekend and Lucian picked us up where we were staying.  He had waters for our group which was great.  He was so flexible and took us to multiple locations throughout the day.  He was so nice and friendly and offered great recommendations for places to visit.  He is extremely affordable and we will definitely use his shuttle the next time we are in town.  Thank you Lucian for making our visit stress free!!!

reviews.author: Beth H.
reviews.description: We had a great experience with Absolute Charm Wine Tour.  They took us to Slate Mill, Bingham, and Signor.  Barry had it all pre arranged and everything was perfect!  Barry was a great driver and guide.  Highly Recommend!  Beth

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: After attempting to call and going to voicemail, I walked to their office and booked a tour same day in person. The woman who helped me was very kind. I was told the van would pick us up at our hotel (owned by the same owner). 30 minutes after pick-up time I called back and no one answered. I tried texting the number which was mentioned by their answering machine, and received a text back that they forgot to add us to the pickup. They did not call or mention rescheduling. It seems like there may be poor communication between their booking, tour coordinator, and driver. I'd recommend finding another tour.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Update: Finally heard back and was told they would give 50% refund. We were happy to get any back...stupid Covid!   First, Barry was AWESOME!! We had such a great time and he did an excellent job giving us info on the town, restaurants, etc.  However, we had one person in our group have to cancel due to COVID and were told we could get a refund for her tour.  Was told I would get an email with refund details.  I have called each day for 4 days straight, emailed and texted and have gotten no responses.  Great tour but you better hope you dont have to cancel... I will be happy to amend this review if I ever hear back from company.

reviews.author: Raul J.
reviews.description: We went on a Thursday so it wasn't really too busy so we got the driver, Barry's, full attention and he was fantastic. We are new at wine tasting and it was our first time in Fredericksburg but he made us feel comfortable and welcome every step of the way. The wineries were great too and they pick you up in a stylish and comfortable van so the whole experience was a great one!

reviews.author: Charla R.
reviews.description: Courtesy service but recommend they improve their vineyard list now that more are opening up.  Met the nicest couple in our group so that was a pleasant bonus!

reviews.author: Wes S.
reviews.description: At this time I have to rate this as a negative experience. I have been waiting 40 days for a refund even though the cancellation fell within the companies policy. If I get a refund I will amend this  Update: I'll leave me review as my CC refunded me once I got them involved.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: Good tour. Definitely nice to have everything set up for you, and we visited some great wineries. Purchased many bottles! Our driver didn't have much to say during the tour, however. We were hoping for a little history of the town/explanation of the wineries etc. Overall fun, but room for improvement.

reviews.author: Tami S.
reviews.description: Best wine tour in town! Barry was great and customer service was the best!!!highly recommend enjoying the wineries they had select for you

reviews.author: Gretchen P.
reviews.description: This was our first ever wine tour and we had a blast. We shared a Mercedes Sprinter van with two other couples and spent the afternoon at three wineries: Hilmy, Bingham and Lost Creek. Our driver, Barry, was both informing as well as solicitous of our needs. All couples made purchases at all three wineries and Barry helped us store all our packages. All in all, an excellent day.

reviews.author: Tarah H.
reviews.description: One of our favorite wine tours to date was with Absolute Charm.  The driver Barry was prompt and a pleasure to be around.  We enjoyed everyone on the tour with us and felt that it was worth every penny!  Highly recommend Absolute Charm properties paired with their wine tour!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I planned my best friends bachelorette in Fredericksburg and chose Absolute Charm for our wine tour.  The van picked us up right in front our our house and took us to several wineries.  It was a great experience, the van was very nice and the driver was great.  I will be using Absolute Charm again!

reviews.author: Crissy A.
reviews.description: I can't begin to describe how wonderful the accommodations were from Absolute Charm! The arrival packet was left for our convenience after business hours and the drop off was just as convenient and seamless. Wow! They've got the process perfected! I booked us a wine tour through AC, and a driver picked us up and dropped us back off at our rental's front door! Talk about great service! We were taken to several wineries and stayed a generous amount of time until we were ready and just able to stay on track to visit the ones he recommended. I've been to Fredericksburg several times though never to any of the wonderful wineries we visited this trip, and the atmosphere and experience was impeccable at each. We were very happy that we booked with Absolute Charm, and I recommend their rental accommodations and their wine tours to everyone I know who's visiting or plans to visit Fredericksburg. They've earned a repeat customer in me!

reviews.author: Maddi B.
reviews.description: I had such an incredible experience on this wine tour...the vehicle was so clean and easy accessible. Barry is very kind and so accommodating. There taste was impeccable and I really feel like we hit the best spots....I recommend this place 100%. Try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Shaley J.
reviews.description: I had an amazing time on this wine tour! You will fall in LOVE with Barry. He is the best tour guide there is! Highly recommend this tour :)

reviews.author: Courtney K.
reviews.description: My husband and I used George 290 wine tours a few years ago and had a great experience with George and recommended him to our friends and family. Fast forward to the past weekend where I attended my sisters bachelorette party. Our driver was very unprofessional. We were rushed at our wineries and we didn't  get to finish our tasting at the 1st winery. Then he got into it with our wine guide at the 3rd winery when our guide asked him to take our wine to the van. We were later informed our driver has a bad reputation at some of the wineries in town. Overall we were very disappointed and will not be using this company in the future or recommending them again. I also reached out to the owner and was told I would get a call but never did.

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: 10/10 Wine Tour company in Fredericksburg! Everything from the planning process to saying our good byes with Rick (tour guide and driver) was above expectations. If you are looking for great wine, beautiful views, and a worry free experience, George's 290 Wine Tours is the way to go! With our tour (about 4 hours), we visited 3 wineries, tasted about 12 wines, had lunch and snacks, and pick up and drop off transportation accommodations (at no extra charge)! I would HIGHLY recommend George to anyone looking to do a wine tour in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Landa P.
reviews.description: Outstanding tour! George was very responsive prior to our arrival making sure he knew all of our likes and desires of where to visit. First he picked us up in his Excursion limo stocked with water and stemware. Went to Calais Winery first. Ben the young French-American vintner lead the tasting. He's very knowledgeable. Great boutique winery and vineyard. Then we headed to William-Chris which was larger but a fabulous spot. Tara led our tasting and it was great. Last we went to Becker. It's beautiful and lots of shopping. Got a nice tour of the processing room, bottling area and barrel room.   I highly recommend George Burns and his team. We will be back!!

reviews.author: Joaa K.
reviews.description: Mike seems like family after spending a wine tour day with him. Service with a smile and courteous manners. I highly recommend this tour with George 290 and team. And after he unloaded and left he texted us a nice thank you. Yep, family.

reviews.author: Hana Y.
reviews.description: Had the most exceptional experience for a bachelorette party. It's been a little while, but this company really made an impression. First of all, our driver was like family. He was right on the spot whenever we needed him. And even when it got unseasonably cold, he got blankets from the car and made sure we were all taken care of. This is 100% the way to go for wine tours of the hill country. Not only is it safe, but every little need you can think of is catered to.

reviews.author: Hayley W.
reviews.description: Best wine tour in Fredricksburg!!!  Our driver Mike was so great. We were treated like VIPs at  every winery and even at lunch because  George's has the best  reputation in town!  We were told this  multiple times. Ask for Mike!!

reviews.author: Brandy D.
reviews.description: This was my second time riding with George and he did not disappoint! You get a fabulous ride, he knows all the history, and if you are his customer you get taken very good care of at the wineries! You can't do any better than George!

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: This tour was AMAZING! Our tour driver was Mike, and he went above and beyond to make our trip unforgettable. George was very helpful in getting everything organized and made sure we had was we wanted for lunch and figuring out which wineries we would enjoy. We did the tour just before New Year's and Mike was awesome at making sure we were warm enough by getting us blankets and stuff at the winery and generally that we were comfortable. The whole thing definitely exceeded expectations! He even texted the next to wish us a happy new year and rest of our stay in Fredericksburg. Highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Amy B.
reviews.description: This was the best part of our trip! A group of 10 ladies from my neighborhood traveled to Fredericksburg to celebrate Mother's Day and we chose George's 290 Wine Tours. George chauffeured is himself and we couldn't have been taken better care of. He arrived promptly and immediately asked to take our picture. He gave us a synopsis of what our day was going to look like and told us a little bit about each winery. We piled comfortably into his 15 passenger limo-style van and headed off. He gave us access to the radio so we could sing along to our own playlist. It was a little chilly this weekend so he was so gracious to bring us blankets and jackets from the van when requested. He is obviously well-respected in the 3 wineries we visited. He took care of everything from checking us in and making sure we left in adequate time to arrive at our next destination. He was the perfect gentleman. (A few of the ladies overheard him taking a call from his wife and were so impressed that he treated her with dignity and respect as well. We were so impressed we asked if he could give our husbands lessons!) If you are looking for a fabulous experience you are in for a treat with George's 290 Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Niki V.
reviews.description: I recently was part of a plot to get one of my good friends and roommates engaged, and her boyfriend decided that on the last leg of a wine tour of Fredericksburg would be the perfect place to pop the question!  I looked at a lot of reviews and finally chose George's 290 Wine Tours and I couldn't be more happy!  I decided to go for the private limo tour and we were treated like royalty!  George had arranged everything and had some very interesting history to go along with all of our stops!  He chose some of the smaller wineries on the 290 Wine Road and they all knew George and I feel that they treated us better because we were with him (though if you want less crowds go on a Sunday)!    The proposal plan went off without a hitch and when I needed to get just a bit more time for the boyfriend to get set up at the last winery George sprung for an extra beer tasting at our lunch spot.  I would recommend George to anybody looking to tour the wineries in Fredericksburg.  He knows everybody, he's got great knowledge of wine and the industry, and he makes sure that you get the most out of every stop!

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.description: I initially called another Fredricksburg wine tour, and they were not available on the date we needed.  The owner of the tour suggested that I call George's 290.  She said they had a great reputation.  I decided that must be the best recommendation of all, and wow was I right.  The booking was very personal and easy.  We chose a Saturday, 3 winery tour with lunch.  Mike picked us up downtown Fredricksburg, and 2 others were already in the stretch SUV limo.  The limo was extremely nice.  We went to three wineries, the first was Kuhlman.  This had a wonderful food - wine pairing, which was awesome.  We then went to William Chris, which was our favorite.  The third was Hilmy (Dammit David was great here!).    The best part of the trip was Mike our guide.  I highly recommend you ask for Mike.  He was INCREDIBLE!!  Very attentive, informative and nice as can be.  We wished he could've just hung out and drank with us!   If you are going to Fredricksburg, Texas for a wine tour, call George's 290.  You will NOT be disappointed!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We had a fabulous tour with Rick! He was amazing! We visited 3 wineries and had a picnic lunch at one, which was also great! Would for sure recommend George's to friends!

reviews.author: stacy h.
reviews.description: Booked George for a wine tour with 7 friends from college for a getaway weekend.  Left all the planning to him and his choices in wineries didn't disappoint.  Would highly recommend him for your next trip to the wineries!

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: I would recommend George as a local wine guide to anyone traveling in the area! We didn't have to wait in any lines and it was clear that he has connections at the local wineries. People know him by name and as part of "George's group" there are some additional perks.   His pricing includes the tasting fees and he books appointments at the locations for you. We didn't know much about the local wineries so George chose locations for us, and he did a great job! He is also extremely knowledgable about the history of the land and business. I really enjoyed getting to hear some of the backstory to the places we visited. If you're looking to tour the local wine country, use George as your tour guide! You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Renee B.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg multiple times and this was my first time to use George's wine tour services. Beyond impressed with their professionalism, timeliness, and care. Andy was our driver and I would request him. He was like our personal body guard went with us everyone, made sure we were on time and helped get us checked out of wineries and carry stuff to the car. He was the best!! We were celebrating my best friends bachelorette party and they made it a perfect first wine trip for our bride and all her friends. Thank you so much George and Andy for all your help!! I can't wait to use y'all again in the future. HIGHLY RECOMMEND for any groups planning a wine trip!!

reviews.author: Amy J.
reviews.description: We had a private wine tour with another couple and George was awesome! He really took time to listen to what we liked and took us to some great vineyards, one of which I joined their wine club...great find. We had so much fun and George was so knowledgeable! We'll definitely go on more tours with his company while in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Erin M.
reviews.description: My experience with Creek Street Wine Tours was amazing! Booking with Stephen was very easy and professional with great communication. He answered any and every question I had. Our limo driver, Jordan, was above and beyond! Every girl on the bachelorette trip was incredibly impressed. We went on a Saturday and didn't have to wait at any winery we went to, even when they were very busy. Jordan also took all of our group pictures and took any bottles we purchased back to the limo so we wouldn't have to carry it around. The box lunch we had was delicious as well. We can't thank you enough for a great tour!

reviews.author: Tara S.
reviews.description: FANTASTIC!!! We visited 3 different wineries with different atmospheres and different taste options. I appreciated Stephen setting up the tour and arranging our lunches. Stephen was also super friendly and super knowledgeable.The attention to detail was awesome! It was a great way to spend a beautiful day in the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Alex K.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful experience with Creekstreet Wine Tours! Our driver Donald arrived early and was a wonderful driver and host of our wine tours. He's a former teacher at Fredericksburg High School and was very knowledgeable about the town and wineries. He was very sweet and friendly! We never felt rushed to move to the next winery and we had a blast listening to music in our limo. The limo was fully stocked with water and snacks. We will definitely use Creekstreet next time we are in Fredericksburg! Thank you for making our experience so fun and memorable!

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: Super easy to get our trip set up with Stephen. He picked out great options to visit for you group. The limo was super clean and spacious. Our group had a blast. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Donna P.
reviews.description: We love Steven!! A great tour, awesome wines, and he's so knowledgeable on the history of the area and each winery. The limo was nice clean and had multiple doors so getting in and out with our group of 6 was easy and we also were able to control the stereo! We'll be back!!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Steven and his team are very professional.  They will give you an excellent tour of the wineries in Fredericksburg.  His limo is very classy.  If you want to have a great time with family, friends, etc.  give them a call.

reviews.author: Lona R.
reviews.description: This is a great company to use for your wine tour if you're heading to Fredericksburg. The owner, Steven, was our contact start to finish and did a great job communicating with us prior to our trip as well as a great job the day of, to make sure everyone had what they needed and enjoyed themselves. The tour included a delicious lunch which was fresh, healthy and plenty of food. Steven chose 3 wineries that would give us a good variety of atmosphere and wine tasting. We were in a 15 passenger van with 2 other groups but it never felt crowded and the van was impeccably clean. Overall it was a super fun day and Steven/Creekstreet Wine tours did a fantastic job. Thank you, our group had a lot of fun!!

reviews.author: Morgan W.
reviews.description: We had a blast! This was our first wine tour and we definitely made the right choice. Stephen was a great conversationalist and very knowledgeable on the different wineries in the area. He also was nice enough to pick us up way out of the city for no trip charge! We will use him again.

reviews.author: Jordan R.
reviews.description: First time in Fredericksburg and our whole experience was awesome! So glad we choose to use Creekstreet Wine Tours and Stephen as our tour guide and driver. He was very knowledgeable on all the wineries and we enjoyed having him around. Lunch was included and everything was planned and ready for us when we got to each winery. He went the extra mile for us and I recommend to anybody wanting a memorable experience to use Stephen!

reviews.author: Chad S.
reviews.description: I was planning a getaway to Fredricksburg for my lady's birthday and called around to several limo services. Once I spoke with Steve from Creekstreet I was sold. The options that he presented coupled with his passion for going above and beyond even if she and I were the only two people in the limo was impeccable. He quoted 158 plus tax and grat. with no increase if we were alone. The other companies that I spoke with offered snacks and with that price we got lunch with an amazing menu to choose from. I had a huge Fiesta chicken salad and she had a huge turkey sandwich with her choice of pasta salad or chips. She chose chips and we shared each other's entrees and got to know Steve while he ate with us. There was also another couple that rode with us and we got along with them really well. We toured three wineries which Steve was very knowledgeable not only about the wineries that we were touring but a host of other places and things to do in Fredricksburg. We toured from 11:50 to after 5:00 You can feel not only his passion for customer service pertaining to his limo business. He's extremely passionate about wine and has a great rapport everyone at the wineries. The wineries that he choose were also amazing. Everyone there was really knowledgeable, friendly, and willing to go the extra mile to insure that you leave there with some knowledge about the various wines that they make. He took us to feed donkeys after our last tour which was totally unexpected. Then he took us to a place that made chocolate as another added bonus. Steve made our first experience in Fredricksburg one that we will never forget. We will definitely be back in Fredricksburg and will look forward to future tours with Steve and Creekstreet Tours. Thanks Steve for an amazing time and for going above and beyond for making this a memorable experience for us!

reviews.author: JoAnn H.
reviews.description: What a fun thing to do!  We had a great tour of four wineries in Fredericksburg. How convenient to be picked up at our hotel and dropped off after the tour to our hotel.  No worries about driving with too much wine onboard Our driver Raul was friendly and very informative. The van/limo was new and very comfortable A great day

reviews.author: Tristan V.
reviews.description: Jeff was a great driver/guide/chaperone for us on visiting some vineyards and wineries. Very knowledgeable and great service.

reviews.author: Molly M.
reviews.description: We had such a great experience. Darrel texted me a few days before to see what kind of wine we liked before choosing our wineries. He picked us up at our Airbnb right on time and the process was efficient and organized. Darrel was kind and accommodating, and our group was a hoot. Would definitely recommend. Pace yourselves - the wine sneaks up on you and we had dinner reservations at 7 we almost didn't make ;)

reviews.author: Charlize R.
reviews.description: This place is in downtown Fredericksburg. Looks more like a storefront than a winery. They had like 20 different wines that they serve. I learned a couple of different things from Fredericksburg Winery. It was very interesting. They also have different jellies and jams that were very delicious. That's how they get you. First you drink the wine then you eat the crackers with jelly. Not much to look at but fun place to come visit. So if you're in Fredericksburg make it a point to stop at Fredericksburg Winery. You won't regret it. Out of the 20-something wines that they have I'm sure they'll have one you'll like. Enjoy

reviews.author: Emily O.
reviews.description: We had a blast on our wine tour! Our limo driver's name was Andy and he was awesome! He literally wined and dined us the whole day! All the wineries we went to were unique and wonderful in their own way. It was also very helpful that Andy knew all the best places to go!

reviews.author: Kelly S.
reviews.description: What a great way to spend a Saturday!  I am a local.  I have lived in Fredericksburg for 20 years.  I had two girl friends come visit me last weekend and of course what did they want to do?   TAKE A WINE TOUR!!!!    I was kind of reluctant because this is something I thought only tourists would enjoy but boy was I wrong!  George has not only been doing this for about 17 years and is so much fun, he is also educational.   I learned so much about the wine, grapes and why this area has done so well with making wine.  Plus, George was born and raised here so he can make great recommendations for restaurants, etc.   What a treat.  He is professional and has a beautiful, clean, comfortable limo.  I HIGHLY recommend him to anyone looking for a unique wine tasting experience.  He even provides a wonderful lunch from the famous Peach Tree at of the wineries.  It's a must do!

reviews.author: Kristen M.
reviews.description: Daryl was awesome!  Great tour with a bachelorette party.  Daryl took great care of us and we had a blast!

reviews.author: Kim R.
reviews.description: We actually did not get to take our tour, but I would like to highly recommend these people. My husband and I had booked a tour with them and this past weekend our 4 year old son was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. I called yesterday and spoke with Randy (I believe) and without a single hesitation, he asked for my address and told me that although it had already been charged, he was putting a refund check in the mail right away. I appreciate the compassion that he showed and how quickly he was willing to help out. What a great company!

reviews.author: Bill C.
reviews.description: We had a recent reunion in Fredericksburg and booked three different tours with Fredericksburg Tours. Becky was incredibly helpful in arranging tours that fit our group's needs. We took a winery tour, a wildflower tour, and an LBJ Ranch/Luckenbach tour averaging 40 people per tour. On each tour FBG Tours went out of their way to ensure that the events were comfortable, informative, and memorable. Becky and her team provided us with an experience that far exceeded our expectations. Don't even consider anyone else!

reviews.author: Avery H.
reviews.description: We had an exceptional experience with Cole, the owner/driver. He answered all my questions, multiple calls, change of times, etc. etc. I hired him for two straight days. We stayed in Hunt, TX which is 45 minutes outside of Fredericksburg. We had a party of 6 first day and 10 the next. He brought a larger van for the second day which gave ample room for us and our "stuff". He was super sweet and got a stool out at every stop and helped everyone out of the van. Both days of driving were 8+ hours. We went all over the place! It was the best option for us, we designed our own itinerary and it was fantastic! Highly recommend IF you are a planner and can make your own itinerary. Service was exceptional.

reviews.author: Kate V.
reviews.description: The person who answers the phone doesn't do so professionally. We were picked up on time, but the van was over a decade old, with numerous stains on the seats, and bolts were holding the ceiling fabric up. Our first driver, David, could only drive with his seat reclined all the way. He was weaving in the lane multiple times, and joked that he was drunk. Because he was mumbling and erratically driving, I had to directly ask him "are you really drunk". That's a first.  This would have been a one star review but Driver Pam earned a whole star by herself.  Pam has a larger, much nicer van, and is very professional.   It's $20 per a person and they will take you anywhere except Grape Creek. I suggest you call ahead and get Pam. We won't use them again unless we can have Pam be our only driver.

reviews.author: Preston K.
reviews.description: Folks, I desperately want to warn you about this service. Or, at least the person who runs it. Every once in a while you come across a person so profoundly awful you wonder how they've made it this far in life with so little self-awareness. I was passing through Fredericksburg and stopped at a gas station. While I was at my pump, I heard someone yelling, "You a democrat?!" I looked up. He was yelling at me. "Are you a democrat?!"  "Who cares?" I responded. I should have said nothing.  This happened once or twice before he got to his pump. I looked on his van. "Stagecoach Shuttle Service, 290," followed by a phone number.  "All liberals are going to hell."  Oh, lord. "...What?"  I ask him to explain. He responds with something hateful, but I can't exactly remember what.  "That's not an argument." I responded.  "There's no argument. It's a fact. I'll be sitting front row, while the liberals burn in hell."  I see we're dealing with Texas's finest. Are we really still dealing with this in this day and age? The worst conservative stereotype, come to life. The kind that's made fun of on TV and in movies. The kind raise by hate. The worst kind of evil, the kind that has no idea it's evil.  I give him a couple lines about how God doesn't go around spreading hate. The exchange goes on while my car fills up. I try to appeal to his compassion, which I quickly find out doesn't exist. His pump finishes and he gets in the van.  Me: "Have a nice life."  Him: "Fuck you."  Just impossible to have any sort of conversation with. The lowest of the low.  He got in his van and pulled AROUND TO MY CAR and opened his door.  "You aren't gonna call the cops. You're afraid of me. Pussy."  Frustrated? Certainly. Annoyed? Profoundly. Afraid? No. I've dealt with this kind of scum before. The horrifying societal waste that gives good, ACTUAL Christians a bad name. I wasn't afraid for myself. I was afraid for the people he might shuttle around.  "Are you drunk?" I asked.  He closed his door and drove off.  I called the phone number on his van (I took down his plate number as well) expecting to get a boss or front desk to let them know that they've made a huge mistake hiring this absolute psychopath, but no, he picked up.  "Oh, you must be who I spoke to at the gas station."  I rolled my eyes and hung up. He called back and left a voicemail telling me not to bother with the cops, that they already know all about him, and telling me that I'm gonna burn in hell because I'm from Florida (he saw my license plate) and apparently we're trying to steal an election.  A few hours later he left another voicemail asking me to call him back.  I was going to stop in Fredericksburg because it looked nice, but this little encounter ruined any desire I had to stay there. Here's hoping the actual town is better than him.   (I will update this if he leaves any more voicemails).

reviews.author: Margaret S.
reviews.description: Stagecoach Shuttle is THE BEST way to get around Fredericksburg, TX. This is the second year we have used them and they are professional, reliable, affordable, flexible and knowledgeable about the area. Cole is the best driver! My husband even forgot his phone in the shuttle and Cole dropped it off at our hotel first thing the next morning (a holiday too!). They are a first class shuttle service!

reviews.author: Greg S.
reviews.description: Called to request scheduled pick up and drop off for a wedding and reception at a local winery.  "Ian" told me that he would be there at the scheduled time and would even call a few minutes before arriving.  I waited until the scheduled time to call him and he suddenly stopped answering his phone.  I called the alternative number and the lady there told me I had to call him directly.  Even though I left a message at both numbers, I never heard back, and my friends and I had to make last minute arrangements, which almost left us late for our commitment.  I still have not heard back from them.  I assumed there was a valid reason for this, but since no one ever bothered to call me back, I decided I would voice my displeasure here, for whatever it is worth.  I'd highly recommend Bluebonnet Taxi service instead.  Bluebonnet Taxi and Shuttle 1003 E Highway St #14 Fredericksburg, TX 78624 (830) 998-2886

reviews.author: Elyssa E.
reviews.description: I've used Stagecoach Shuttle Service twice and both times I've been impressed.   The first time was for my little sister's birthday. Everything went smoothly, so when that same sister got engaged and wanted her bachelorette party to be held in Fredericksburg, I gave Stagecoach a call.   Cole was great from start to finish. I'm a serious planner, and he helped me with winery suggestions, timing of the day, and dinner venues. He carted our things back and forth from the van and even went back to a winery when I thought I'd left my sweater on the chair.   Towards the end of the day, we received extremely bad news about a loss in the family. Cole was very understanding in our change of plans for the evening and called us a few days later with his condolences and to check in on our family.   All in all, I can't say enough great things about our experience. For such a hard day, he made it as easy as it could be. I'd highly recommend Stagecoach Shuttle Service. I know I'll be using them again in the future!

reviews.author: Ryan V.
reviews.description: I'd rather walk.  The owner/driver might be the most unprofessional person I've ever dealt with.  We originally booked Stagecoach for a party of 10 to take us to the wineries on 290.  Grape Creek was one of the places we wanted to visit and when we asked about this his told us he doesn't go there because they're "California Liberals" and called us idiots for wanting to go there before hanging up on my wife.   I called back to cancel the trip and he unleashed a tirade of foul language.  After ending the conversation and he called back three times leaving separate voice mails threatening to physically harm us.

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: We had a fine experience with this service.  Preston was our driver every time. He was very pleasant and appropriately talkative and his van was perfectly fine.  We never had to wait more than 5-10 mins for pickup and we did not have a particularly negative experience with dispatcher as the other reviews stated.   I would totally use this service again and would request Preston, for sure!

reviews.author: Richard W.
reviews.description: Shuttle arrived to pick us up on time and the drivers were very professional and kind. The only issue we had was toward the end of the day. They seemed to have gotten overwhelmed with customers and took a little over 20 minutes to pick us up. Other than that it was a great experience and a great value.

reviews.author: Haley L.
reviews.description: Marci is amazing! Thank you for being so nice and dealing with five of us girls! I think her being the one driving us around made our trip that much better. I think the only thing that kinda sucks is the fact that you can't go back to town. Once you go back to town your day is over as far as the $20 shuttle goes. Still would do it again! Thanks.

reviews.author: Gabriela J.
reviews.description: I booked their services for a bachelorette party. The trip started on the wrong foot when I was told by the driver that we would not get the shuttle that we asked for because the A.C. broke down. Not a big deal! We wanted to enjoy our day. We get two our second winery and the shuttle we were on broke down completely. I was told that they did not have anything else available, so we were going to be taken to the next place in two separate cars. These were obviously the owner's personal vehicles. The whole point of our trip was to spend the ride together, so when I brought up my concerns to the owner, he said "YOU NEED TO GROW UP." He said things like this happen all the time, and that i needed to get over it. I was highly offended by his comment, but when I told him if that is how he runs his business, he said he was done with me and that the tour was over. At the end he gave us a discount and took us in the two cars, but even after him allowing the tour to continue, I was appalled by his customer service. I was embarrassed with the rest of the party that I hired a company that would treat their customers this way.

name: Holiday Inn Express and Suites Fredericksburg

reviews.author: Doug C.
reviews.description: Great place to stay when in town. Not too busy just before Christmas but I can guess during summer many more guests. Great looking pool area (see photos) especially with colored lights at night. Very good choices for breakfast buffet before going sightseeing. Free wifi and easy to sign on. Only downside was exit from hotel onto Washington Street which is major road. It can be a challenge to exit to go into town with on-coming traffic.

reviews.author: Stephanie D.
reviews.description: Positive- decent hot breakfast in the morning. Nice pool/hot tub  Negative- during Covid, I expect a room to be immaculate; however I was greeted by a dead cockroach in the bathroom upon check in. The worst part was the front desk having an attitude about it "I'll get the roach but I'm not cleaning the bathroom". Staff "cleaned" the rooms every day (again.. during Covid? Isn't there supposed to be limited contact?) but did a lousy job- replacing the sheets with stained ones and leaving the toilet brush on the bathroom counter- near my toiletries. The fitness room was also filthy.Lastly, I was charged $56 more than what Travelocity quoted (who I booked through) and, again the front desk was not helpful, and I had to go several rounds to finally get the charge rectified

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.description: Crazy busy Black Friday weekend in Fredericksburg, and we were lucky to find this last minute room. Clean room, quiet, friendly staff, and a hot complimentary bkft (ordered through waitress) was ok. Not too far off the main strip so walkable I guess. The pool looked pretty nice...

reviews.author: Spike S.
reviews.description: Reviewed October 31, 2018  Clean, Quiet and Comfortable We were there after there was a big weekend celebration in Fredericksburg. The crowds were gone and the summer tourist season at end. The hotel was not crowded. We had a nice quiet two night stay. It is a nice clean hotel, with a good staff and a huge pool. Many of the rooms have a balcony overlooking the pool. The weather was perfect for using the balcony, sitting outside and enjoying the evening. Note: This review and photos were originally posted on Tripadvisor by Spike S.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: I came for 2 nights over a weekend in June 2020. Overall good place to stay, close to Main Street which is why I chose it. Unfortunately, I realized when I was there it didn't seem safe to walk as a solo person with the lack of sidewalks around that area.   Service was really nice upon checking in. The had decent options for individually wrapped items for breakfast and offering coffee (had to request from the breakfast attendant).   I did not have time to hang out by the pool, I wish I would have. It looked great!   My room was showing some wear but it was fine, I was gone most of the day and wasn't there to be in the room. My biggest problem came when I set the fire alarm off in my room when I was taking a shower. How is that possible? After rushing around to get clothes on I realized no one else was leaving the building and the alarm shut off. I hear the employees talking outside my door about sometimes the alarm goes off because of the shower steam. The smoke detector was not in the bathroom.   I just expect more for the price I paid for that room. Would I stay here again? Maybe and if I could a better rate.

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: Great location, extremely friendly and accommodating staff, outstanding facilities and amenities- the pool is fantastic.  Our stay at this hotel was great!

reviews.author: Kenneth G.
reviews.description: This place does not have a active hot tub working so if you are booking do not do this on this premise as it would be false advertisement.  The front desk said there is just one part missing for the hot tub and that's the reason it's now working but didn't say anything if they are even actively trying to even fix it. Customer service is just as disappointing here. If you are looking for somewhere to simply sleep and have a roof over your head this isn't like the typical holiday inn experience so do with that information what you want.

reviews.author: Elisa C.
reviews.description: Family and I stayed here for 2 nights. We had great service. Coffee in the mornings was hot and strong! Love it! Our room was nice and cleaned. Wish it was warmer to get in the pool but my kids did. They had fun. We left for the day to hike and when we got back our room was made up and cleaned again, what a lovely surprise! We will definitely book here again.

reviews.author: Shannon T.
reviews.description: I will start out with the good, this hotel was very clean, had plenty of parking and was in a great location, it also has a really great pool, which was one of the biggest reasons for booking our stay here.  If everything had gone as planned I could have easily given it 5 stars with no question BUT this is why I didn't. Like I said before, we booked this hotel primarily for the awesome pool, and it was awesome. I booked a room with a pool view (hoping we could upgrade to a balcony pool view when we arrived) specifically and two queen beds for our family, we arrive and go to check in and there were two ladies at the desk, one was really friendly, the other was mad that she was alive that day or maybe she was mad I was alive that day and bothering her, who knows.  I give her my name and she did her thing and gave us a key, we head to the room and open the door to our pool view with one king size bed in it, sooo we head back to the front desk and I tell her that I booked a room with two beds (we have our 13 yr old son) she sighs heavily, looks at the computer, and tells me it says a king size room, so I pull out my printed confirmation and tell her is says I had two queens,  pool view, to which she accusingly says to me "you must have booked online, this is what happens" well yes I did book online because it is 2020 and that's what everyone in the entire world does but I digress, then she gets up with an "aye yi yi" and walks off to find the friendly lady.  The friendly lady comes back and says she has to do some switching around but she will find us a room.  Great, we are so excited to get to our room, and get settled in.   She comes over brings me a key and tells me how to get there but this time we have the bed but no pool view, which was the entire reason I specifically booked a room with a POOL VIEW.  We were thankful to get our sleeping situation settled and I got over the fact that we didn't have a pool view by the second day, well, in all honesty I was still a little salty about it but we had a great view of some really cute houses so that was nice but what I haven't gotten over was the fact that this lady treated me like it was my fault the system didn't get the reservation right and didn't try to hide it at all. I would def recommend the place but I paid for a room with a view and at the end of the day that is really all I wanted.

reviews.author: Leon R.
reviews.description: Our experience with this hotel had mixed emotions. We enjoyed the beautiful pool and friendly staff. Unfortunately considering the 4 out of 5 rating on hotels.com. It fell far from that for us. Our room showed signs of poor housekeeping. From the crumbs on the sleeper couch and surrounding chairs and tables, to the poorly vacuumed floor. Our A/C thermostat was also unreliable, it was either too cold or too warm. The Worst thing we experienced were the multiple roaches we had to kill around our room. This really put a damper on our comfortable stay at this hotel. Overall our stay wasn't as Great as we expected considering the high rating.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: I am a IHG member and have stayed I. A IHG brand hotel 178 days so far in the year 2020, thru all the pandemic.  I have had no issues it's any IHG Let me start off but this is or was my anniversary weekend and I had book the nicest room the hotel had with a in room jacuzzi. Paying a lot out of pocket for the extras!   Once I arrived at the front desk to check in I was told the room overbooked.  Great.  We ended up getting a king  that overlooked the pool. Who cares.  But the toilet ran all night and no sleep due to the toilets   Check out time is 11 am.   We had cleaning people walk into our room at 10.12 am with no knocking  our not disturb sign was on the door.   We then called the front desk and asked for a 12:00 check out which was granted and  the front desk started calling 11:03 am asking if we was going to extend our stay if not get out.        Stay away from this overbooked  prices to high hotel.

reviews.author: Lacey F.
reviews.description: My family stayed with this branch 3/8/20, and upon arrival which was late in the evening the first room we went to was dirty, the second a couple was sleeping in and finally third times the charm and 45 minutes later we were able to get a room. We paid $225.99 total. We stayed less than 12 hours. Assistant Manager Jeanie was less than hospitable when I relayed the errors that occurred. She did offer us points back, but she was unable to credit back for any of the cost of the room. I will not be staying at this branch ever again. She said I should be happy because typically their rooms are $250/night. So if you expect them to make things right when they fumble, don't stay here. If you don't care if your room is dirty or you barge in on a couple sleeping then this is your place!

reviews.author: J M.
reviews.description: Doesn't really look like a nice hotel when you go by, but once your inside it is very nice. The reception have good attitudes and care for their customers. The lobby is very well cared for and clean. The guest rooms are very clean and provide many accommodations for your satisfaction. The pool is perfect for the family, having slides and a mini lazy river. The hot tub is very massaging and relaxing. The 6 inch sections of the pool are great for toddlers and young children. I do recommend this hotel for families staying in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Neferiatiti H.
reviews.description: Jeanie did a great job navigating us through the city! It was awesome. I wouldn't recommend someone to come to room 123 it's noisy! If you are a light sleeper stay away! 2nd floor is much better. Love the city!

reviews.author: Deb E.
reviews.description: I'm an IHG member, so I always try and stay at one of their properties. I can honestly say that this is by far one of the better Holiday Inn Express' that I've ever stayed in! It's immaculate, the pool is LOVELY and having a pool view room made our stay even better. My husband loved the free cookies lol and I loved all the space we had plus the breakfast and mini fridge + microwave in the room. It's very close to Main St. and perfect proximity to the wineries. Will absolutely stay here again.

reviews.author: Vernon O.
reviews.description: Do not stay here if you plan on sleeping.  The walls are thin and the people above me are running through the room.  I have complained multiple times and still the same.  I am writing this as I lay here awake!!!   Long time aspire member that's considering never staying at Holiday Inn Again

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Another new HIE, another 5 star review. We really enjoy coming to Fredericksburg at Christmas time, and it's nice to have a new HIE to stay in.   The staff are courteous, efficient,  and professional. Everything is clean and well kept. We did not try the breakfast bar, but be area itself was spacious, attractive, ad neatly kept.   This is our 2nd time to stay here, and we would definitely recommend it to anyone.

reviews.author: Cody S.
reviews.description: I've been an IHG member for 16 years and stayed at a lot of Holiday Inn Express hotels, but this is by far the best one ever. The resort style pool, spa, and fire pits are incredible! We just laid out by the pool and swam for 4 hours before getting ready to go to dinner at Rathskeller on Main St. The bed was comfy and the room was spacious. Our room even had a relaxing balcony overlooking the awesome pool. We'll definitely be back and next time we might even bring the kids! ;)

reviews.author: Sean M.
reviews.description: Very clean place, pool is the best I've seen in a while  We will be back here for sure

reviews.author: Bunny G.
reviews.description: After driving 400 miles across Texas we ended up in the tiny German town of Fredericksburg, which is somewhere in between no-where and no-where.  A hidden gem, a lifesaver hotel that we found by recommendation of a friend and luckily took the last room in town. I've never been so thankful to find a room because there is nothing but roach motels in between this place and Carlsbad Caverns.  If you're going to stay in Fredricksburg stay here!   We were driving until midnight when we went out of our way to make this stop and although we didn't stay long we enjoyed the clean modern room, with nice amenities and friendly service.    The highlight was the fabulous spread they offered for breakfast.  Lots of hot food and drinks. Plenty of places to sit with nice views of the tropical pool. Pastries, yogurt, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, tea, coffee, juice, eggs, bacon, pancakes. Yum!  There's a Pacific war museum not far from the hotel and a quaint old town corridor with lots of antique shops and boutiques. Not to mention, this is "hill country" so you'll find wineries and lavender fields within an hour. Festivals, farmers markets and little eateries too. So its a definite touristy spot for those who are driving thru to stop and enjoy.

reviews.author: Kelly S.
reviews.description: We had the most amazing experience using 19th Hole Wine Tours!! We came for a girls weekend and Rex was so organized and made the day stress free! Rex picked us up at our Airbnb and reserved us tastings at 3 different wineries. He had great advice on which wineries we should visit and they were timed and spaced out great. He organized a boxed lunch for us before our first winery and provided water throughout the day. At the end of the trip, we already were wanting to plan our next trip out to Fredericksburg and use him again! Rex went above and beyond for us and was so personable!!! This was by far the best trip to Fredericksburg we have had thanks to Rex and 19th Hole Wine Tours!!

reviews.author: Lauren K.
reviews.description: We had a great time with Rex last Saturday who took great care of our group of 5!  We highly recommend Rex and his company for your wine tasting travel needs!

reviews.author: Dane B.
reviews.description: Last week we booked this trip with Rex an it was a great one. If you are looking for a company to bring you around to the wineries Rex is your guy. He made our Louisiana group feel right at home and we had a blast. Very clean van and Rex was ready to help out anyway he could. Thanks again Rex and we will be back.  The Bolin's/Savoie's

reviews.author: J B.
reviews.description: I honestly do not even know where to begin! Rex you are amazing! Caught him through a random google search and I'm glad I did. Rex went out of his way to not only go outside his normal pickup zone. Catered the wineries to make them lead back to our Airbnb. He let us drop our purchases back at the Airbnb and took us back into town on his way home to drop us off at a restaurant. Hands down one of the most delightful person to talk to as well. Rex you truly did go above and beyond for us 3 out of town guys doing some little wine tasting.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: Rex is awesome!!! I organized a tour for my sisters bachelorette party and he was incredible. The tour was priced better than all the other tours around, custom itinerary, took such great care of my sister and all her girls. Picked up at our vrbo and dropped off. Excellent customer service and even had goody bags with everyone's name on them. We would absolutely recommend him  to anyone looking for a personalized wine tour in Fredericksburg!!

reviews.author: E W.
reviews.description: Rex and 19th Hike Wine Tours is absolutely amazing!  This is our groups second time with Rex and I can't say enough wonderful things about him and his Texas hospitality! He made us feel like we were family and he went above and beyond in every way possible!  We also had the pleasure of meeting his amazing wife as well! I highly recommend Rex to everyone and we can't wait to see you next year!!!

reviews.author: Lexi M.
reviews.description: WOW just wow!!!! Rex is incredible and so GREAT for such a great price. So professional and helpful and KIND!! Do yourself a favor and book with him!

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Pretty good tour. Rex will arrange at a vineyard if you tell him ahead of time. We called in the morning and were touring an hour later. We liked his selection besides the one we chose.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour with Rex and 19th Hole Wine Tours for my baby sister's bachelorette party this past weekend.  There were 11 of us girls and everyone agreed the tour and Rex were fantastic!  From first contact Rex as helpful and professional.  He recommended wineries that were good for our size group and that would have great photo ops (a very important thing for our bride to be).  The sandwich shop Rex got us lunch from was delicious as well.  On the tour Rex was personable and full of information.  The tour bus was clean and professional inside and out.  I hadn't been to Fredericksburg in about 9 years and so much had changed.  The main street was bigger with more places to shop and eat and according to Rex, there were ten times the amount of wineries (from 6 to 60)!  We started with Pedernales, which is a personal favorite of mine because the wine is delicious and the place is calm and classy with a great porch area.  Here the tasting was fixed and we all tasted the same 8 wines. Rex secured us a private tasting room here and we got to keep the glasses which was nice.  Next we went to 4.0 Cellars (a Rex recommended stop) which had a bunch a great tasting options. I also learned that this winery gets wines from 3 different wine makers and changes its selection menus monthly.  We had lunch here in the beautiful outdoor space where there was live music.  The next stop at Southold Farm and Cellar was everyone's favorite by far though.  This was recommended by Rex for its spectacular views and it did not disappoint!  Located at the top of a high hill, this small single room tasting house had the best view and ambiance of any winery I have ever been to.  The tasting room had large windows on every wall giving great views during our tasting.  The wine maker's father did our tasting and told endearing stories about the family and the wine making.  The wines were not my cup of tea for the most part, but I always like to try new types of wine.  Oh and the dog there is amazing.  His name is Waldo and he was happy to pose for all the photos we wanted with him.  The back porch here has several porch swings faced toward the best views in Fredericksburg.  Southold is a must see!  Finally, we went Fat Ass Winery and Ranch, a selection of mine.  The wine here was not good in my opinion, but if you want a lively party this is the place to be!  The atmosphere is upbeat and full of life.  No sniffing the bouquet or wine spit buckets at Fat Ass.  No way!  I did like their frozen wine though.  Book a tour with Rex and 19th Hole Wine Tours and you cannot go wrong!

reviews.author: Debbie B.
reviews.description: We had a group of 9 women in town for Girls Trip 2019 and Rex knew just where to take us. Excellent hospitality and an amazing tour! We highly recommend 19th Hole Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Tammy P.
reviews.description: This was the most amazing wine tour!  So relaxing and enjoyable!  Rex (owner/operator) was such a great guide.  He took us to 4 locations. Picked us up and dropped us back off at our lodge.  A great (and I do mean great) picnic lunch.  We will definitely return for another tour!  This was wine touring at its finest!  Thank you Rex!

reviews.author: Kesley P.
reviews.description: Reserve Tours and STEVE were amazing!  I just got back from celebrating my bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg with all of best friends and the highlight of our trip was our tour day with Steve!  The bus was so perfect - clean, well stocked with snacks and cold water, and lots of A/C.  Steve was such a treat to have with us throughout the day!  I would highly recommend Reserve Tours and Steve.  Next time in town, I will be using them again!

reviews.author: Kandal S.
reviews.description: Leigh was extremely helpful in making our tour specific to our groups tastes. She was wonderful to work with planning and we were excited when she was a driver! Even though we ended up with a rainy day she went above and beyond to make it extra special. Loved the wineries and the fun atmosphere on the bus! Some of the group it was their first time in Fredericksburg and they were so impressed with Reserve tours. We will always be back! Thanks again Leigh for a fun day!!

reviews.author: Leslie M.
reviews.description: Steve was fantastic and made my sister's 40th Birthday and great time. Gov Abbot and Covid-19 were no match for Steve. He created a fabulous day even when everything was shut down.

reviews.author: Beach Lover 3.
reviews.description: We just came back from Fredericksburg after a girls weekend celebrating my 40th Birthday! Leigh was absolutely fantastic, everything was perfect and so organized. What a kind heart she has! She took pictures and had a great friendly fun attitude and explained so much to us. Party bus was clean and just perfect!

reviews.author: Kate L.
reviews.description: Steven d is the best driver ever!!!!!!!!!! Highly highly recommend for a bachelorette or anything he is so great and so professional and nice!

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: Austin is 100% as good as it gets. My fiancé thought there were not tours on weekdays, and he was wrong. IF YOU NEED WEEKDAY TOURS, AUSTIN IS YOUR GUY. I'm sure he is fantastic on the weekend as well, but he is definitely your go-to during the week.  We called him the day before, and he was able to meet our needs personally. He's incredibly knowledgable and friendly. I can't explain how much better he personally made the day. We are newbies to the area, and he had personal recommendations. He even knew where to get pairings at the last minute.  Once he found out I was a Cab drinker, he took us to a wine tasting he had not been to previously, and he was super positive and excited with us the whole way.   Everyone we interacted with seemed to know Austin, and I completely understand why.   His car was luxury at its finest. He let us choose our music station, had ample room for way more people (up to around 13, which we didn't need, but in case you do) and had snacks along the way. He offered to let us drink any wine we chose in the car as well.  His wife even had a hand-signed letter for us in the car, which was thoughtful and beautiful. I really could not have asked for more out of a tasting day. I would 100% recommend Austin and his service to anyone, and I can't wait to contact him the next time we are in town.  Also, on top of it all, Austin took photos of us, and plenty of them, even without us asking. He even convinced my fiancé to take some great ones, and these are memories I now have forever.   Austin, thanks for making our vacation that much more special. We'll see you again!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: Awesome experience.  Leigh, the owner was responsive and quickly made arrangements for my group of 13.  The luxury bus was awesome, great sound system and came with snacks. Chris, our concierge/driver was lovely, a real gentleman, and helped us navigate at each vineyard.   My guests and I had a terrific day.

reviews.author: Jessica D.
reviews.description: Reserve Tours has done it again! We had an incredible wine tasting for my husband's 50th. They recommended beautiful venues, took care of every detail, and were highly accommodating to our group. Our driver was friendly and attentive. Everything about Reserve Tours is classy and completely custom. Thank you for making our day special!

reviews.author: Allison D.
reviews.description: My friends and I used Reserve Tours for a bachelorette weekend and had a great experience! This was our second time using Reserve Tours. Leigh was wonderful in helping me to organize the tour and pick the best wineries to visit. The sprinter bus was very clean and had Bluetooth for us to play music from our phones. I will definitely use Reserve Tours again and recommend to family and friends!

reviews.author: Jess D.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved Reserve Tours! Austin is awesome! I absolutely loved that he's so genuine and sat to have lunch with us. He shared his life with us, which we admired so much about him. If you need a wine tour, go with this company!

reviews.author: Miranda C.
reviews.description: By far the BEST experience I've had with a personal driver. We were blessed with James, who had such an awesome personality and kind heart! He even drove back by the next day to drop something off we had left in the van Would highly recommend to anyone seeking a good time.

reviews.author: Kate G.
reviews.description: This was the best customer service I've ever had. James, our driver, was so fun and diligent. Got us where we needed to be when we needed to be there! HIGHLY RECOMMEND
